column2: 800+ upGrad learners make a successful career transition
column3: According to Forbes, AI will see 50 million new jobs by 2022. To enable professionals to transition into Machine Learning and AI, upGrad with IIIT-Bangalore offers a 11-month PG Diploma in Machine Learning & AI that includes 15+ case studies and 360-degree career support. Over 800 upGrad learners have made career transitions with salary hikes as high as 230%.

column2: 'Blade Runner' actor Rutger Hauer passes away at 75
column3: Hollywood actor Rutger Hauer, best known for his role in the 1982 film 'Blade Runner', passed away on July 19 aged 75 in the Netherlands after suffering from a brief illness. Dutch media said Hauer was buried at a private ceremony. Hauer had also starred in films including 'Nighthawks', 'Dracula 3D' and 'Batman Begins'.

column2: Andy Murray to team up with brother Jamie at Washington Open
column3: British tennis player Andy Murray will team up with his brother Jamie at Washington Open, reuniting the pairing that helped Great Britain win Davis Cup in 2015. Andy, who underwent hip surgery in January, made a victorious return to professional tennis in June, winning the doubles at Queen’s with Spain’s Feliciano Lopez. Washington Open starts on July 27.

column2: Sri Lankan fast bowler Kulasekara retires from international cricket
column3: Sri Lankan fast bowler Nuwan Kulasekara has announced his retirement from international cricket. The 37-year-old former world number one ODI bowler, will finish as Sri Lanka's fifth-highest ODI wicket-taker with 199 wickets in 184 matches. Kulasekara, who had made his ODI debut in 2003, had last played an ODI in 2017. He also played 21 Tests and 58 T20Is.

column2: This is ghar wapsi: BJP MLA after voting in favour of MP govt
column3: After BJP MLAs Narayan Tripathi and Sharad Kaul voted in favour of a legislation backed by the Congress government in Madhya Pradesh Assembly, Tripathi said, "This is my ghar wapsi (homecoming)." Both the BJP MLAs are former Congress leaders. This comes after BJP MLA Gopal Bhargava said the Congress government won't last 24 hours if BJP's top leadership ordered so.

column2: Doctors remove 1.5 kg jewellery, 90 coins from woman's stomach in WB
column3: Over 1.5 kg jewellery and coins were removed from a 26-year-old mentally unstable woman's stomach at a government hospital in West Bengal's Rampurhat on Wednesday, a doctor said. Around 90 coins of ₹5 and ₹10 denominations and ornaments like chains, earrings, bangles, and watches were found in her stomach. The ornaments were mostly made of copper and brass, he added.

column2: Rajiv Gandhi's killer, in jail for 28 years, gets a month's parole
column3: Nalini Sriharan, a life convict in the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case, has been released on a month's parole to make arrangements for her daughter's wedding. During the term of her parole, she cannot speak to politicians or media. Sriharan, who was granted a 12-hour parole in 2016 for her father's funeral, has been in jail for 28 years.

column2: Priti Patel becomes Britain's 1st Indian-origin Home Secretary
column3: Priti Patel on Wednesday took charge as Britain's first Indian-origin Home Secretary in the newly unveiled Boris Johnson-led Cabinet. The 47-year-old has replaced Pakistani-origin Sajid Javid, who has been moved to the Treasury department as the first ethnic minority Chancellor of the Exchequer. Patel previously served as Secretary of State for International Development, but was forced to resign in 2017.

column2: India may launch $10-billion global bond sale in October
column3: India is reportedly considering an option to raise $10 billion in one go from its first overseas bond sale in October. The government would prefer to sell yen or euro-denominated debt so as to offer lower yields, reports added. Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan recently warned that India's plan to issue bonds overseas has enormous risks but no real benefit.

column2: Atanu Chakraborty replaces SC Garg as Economic Affairs Secretary
column3: The government has appointed Atanu Chakraborty as the new Economic Affairs Secretary replacing Subhash Chandra Garg, who will be the new Power Secretary. Chakraborty, a 1985 batch Gujarat cadre IAS officer, was the Secretary, Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM). Anil Kumar Khachi will take over from Chakraborty as the secretary in charge of the disinvestment department.

column2: Oct 8 deadline set for Zimbabwe Cricket to reinstate governing body
column3: The ICC has set October 8 as the deadline for Zimbabwe Cricket (ZC) to reinstate its governing body that was elected by the government on June 14. ZC currently stands suspended and all funding from ICC has been stopped after it was found guilty by the ICC of political interference. Zimbabwe can lose membership if the deadline is not met.

column2: Facebook fined $100 mn by US SEC over Cambridge Analytica scandal
column3: Facebook was fined $100 million by the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) over misleading investors about the risks it faced from misuse of user data, particularly related to the Cambridge Analytica scandal. British political consultancy firm Cambridge Analytica had accessed 87 million users' data in 2014-15. Notably, Facebook was also fined a record $5 billion by the US FTC.

column2: Happiest while vacating office, worked sincerely: Kumaraswamy
column3: Karnataka caretaker CM HD Kumaraswamy said that he is the "happiest" person while vacating the office as he worked sincerely despite several kinds of disturbances. He added that he worked to uplift the state in the last 14 months. HD Kumaraswamy on Tuesday resigned as Karnataka Chief Minister after losing the trust vote in the Assembly.

column2: Kejriwal revengeful, hampering CCTV fitting: AAP MLA Lamba
column3: AAP MLA Alka Lamba accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of working with the intent to take revenge by hampering the CCTV installation work in her constituency. She added that this is affecting people's lives in her constituency and she won't let them be a victim of AAP's "vendetta politics". She said, she isn't afraid to fight for the people's rights.

column2: Telangana BJP launches 'BJP4TS' app as part of membership drive
column3: Telangana BJP has launched an app named "BJP4TS" as part of the membership drive in the state, party leader Bandaru Dattatreya said. He added that "primary members" can register themselves and become "active members" of the party through this app. Dattatreya said, if any active member provides 50 memberships through the app, then they'll be offered posts by the party.

column2: Cong equates BJP with 'Bakasur', calls it power-hungry party
column3: Maharashtra Congress President Balasaheb Thorat on Wednesday likened BJP with 'Bakasur', a mythological demon who always remained hungry. Thorat said this after the reports of BJP eyeing Madhya Pradesh after Karnataka came out. "Wherever there is opposition government in states, they are trying to destabilise them. BJP is such a power-hungry party," he said.

column2: WeWork looking to go public as early as September: Report
column3: Co-working space startup WeWork is reportedly looking to go public as early as September, earlier than previously assumed, and is expected to make its IPO paperwork public in August. The startup is also reportedly looking to raise $5-6 billion through a bond offering before the IPO. Founded in 2010, the SoftBank-backed startup was valued at $47 billion in January.

column2: 26 million-year-old species of vine snake found in Western Ghats
column3: Researchers have discovered a new vine snake species, believed to have evolved around 26 million years ago, in the southern Western Ghats. The species, 'Proahaetulla antiqua', was first discovered in 2011 and looked similar to 'Ahaetulla dispar', a small-sized vine snake with similar morphological characters. The new species faces no major extinction threats at the moment, researchers revealed.

column2: LeT militant carrying ₹5 lakh reward arrested in J&K
column3: In a joint operation, police and 26 Rashtriya Rifles arrested a Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) militant carrying ₹5 lakh reward on his head in Jammu and Kashmir. The police said, the militant had previously been injured in an encounter with the Army and was on the run since then. The police recovered an AK series rifle and a magazine from his possession.

column2: 6 arrested for illegal mining of coloured stones in Andhra
column3: Six persons were arrested by the forest department officials in connection with illegal mining of coloured stones in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam, police said. The police seized two crowbars, few nets for filtration and 21 coloured stones weighing 7.6 grams from their possession. A country-made weapon along with two bows and three arrows were also seized, the police added.

column2: All schools in Bihar to remain shut as flood situation worsens
column3: The Darbhanga District Magistrate Thiyagrajan SM has said that all schools will remain closed until further orders as the flood situation in Bihar worsened due to heavy rains in neighbouring Nepal. The order comes after at least 106 people have lost their lives in the floods. As per reports, over eight million people have been affected by the Bihar floods.

column2: Boeing posts its biggest-ever quarterly loss of $2.9 billion
column3: Boeing reported its biggest-ever quarterly loss of $2.9 billion for the June quarter, affected by lower plane deliveries due to worldwide 737 MAX groundings after two crashes killed 346 people. Boeing had a $2.2-billion profit in the year-ago period. Its revenue fell 35.1% to $15.8 billion, reduced by a $5.6-billion charge it took to compensate MAX customers.

column2: Woman can stick magnet on back, says surgeons left metal item in body
column3: A woman from Turkey said she is able to stick a magnet to her back after surgeons allegedly left a metal object inside her. She underwent surgery in 2013 to repair the slipped disks on her lower back at a hospital. She said University Medicine Faculty's Forensic Medicine department found a nine-centimetre-long metal item in her lower back.

column2: Video blogger eats poisonous centipedes, geckos on live stream; dies
column3: A 35-year-old Chinese video blogger died during a live stream after eating poisonous centipedes, geckos, mealworms, and drinking alcohol. He was found without vital signs in his apartment with his laptop in live-streaming mode. In his videos, he used to spin a wheel marked with items like centipedes, geckos, vinegar and eggs, and consume items at which the marker stopped.

column2: WC loss difficult to digest as we didn't make many mistakes: Kohli
column3: India captain Virat Kohli has said that 2019 World Cup semi-final defeat is very difficult to digest as Team India didn't make many mistakes to be knocked out. He added that acceptance becomes difficult as New Zealand outplayed them. "The worst setbacks have not only motivated me but also improved me as a person," he further said about the defeat.

column2: Surprised not to see Shubman, Rahane in ODI squad: Sourav Ganguly
column3: Ex-India captain Sourav Ganguly has said he was surprised not to see Shubman Gill and Ajinkya Rahane in India's ODI squad for West Indies tour. He suggested that players like Rahane and Shubman can play all formats. "Time has come for Indian selectors to pick same players in all formats of the game for rhythm and confidence," he added.

column2: Harsha praises Shubman for expressing disappointment at not being picked
column3: Commentator Harsha Bhogle has praised 19-year-old batsman Shubman Gill for expressing his disappointment at not being picked for at least one of the squads for India's tour of West Indies. "Shows hunger & ambition. Now he must channelise this positively by scoring more & not allow those who seed negative thoughts anywhere near him," Bhogle wrote.

column2: Tokyo 2020 Olympic medals made from recycled e-waste unveiled
column3: The medals for Tokyo 2020 Olympics were unveiled on Wednesday with exactly one year to go until the next year's Games. The medals are 85 millimetres in diameter and feature Greek goddess of victory Nike in their design along with the Olympic symbol. Further, the medals are made from recycled metals, collected from 6.21 million electronic devices donated across Japan.

column2: Bail lands on top of stump as batsman gets bowled, Sachin asks out or not
column3: Sachin Tendulkar shared a video of a batsman surviving getting bowled after the right-hand bail jumped out of its groove and sat on top of the right stump, while the left-hand bail remained intact. "Found it very unusual! What would your decision be if you were the umpire?" Sachin tweeted. "Batsman arrested but released on bail," a user tweeted.

column2: 19-yr-old Hungarian breaks Phelps' 200m butterfly record by 0.78 sec
column3: Hungary's 19-year-old swimmer Kristof Milak broke the men's 200m butterfly world record after winning the event in 1:50.73 seconds at FINA world championships in South Korea's Gwangju. The previous record was set by 23-time Olympic gold medallist Michael Phelps, who had clocked a timing of 1:51.51 seconds in 2009. "It's a tremendous honour," Milak said after setting the record.

column2: Sarfaraz shouldn't be Pakistan captain in any format: Shoaib Akhtar
column3: Ex-Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar has said that Sarfaraz Ahmed shouldn't be captain of Pakistan in any format. "Haris Sohail should be made the captain. He should captain the side in ODIs and T20Is. They should test Babar Azam as captain in Test cricket," he added. He further said Sarfaraz should be used only for his wicketkeeping and battings skills.

column2: Jonty Rhodes applies for India's fielding coach, says he loves India
column3: Ex-South African cricketer Jonty Rhodes has applied for Team India fielding coach position. "My wife and I love the country, and it has already given us so much. We've two children born in India," the 49-year-old, who represented South Africa in 245 ODIs and 52 Tests, said. Rhodes spent nine seasons as Mumbai Indians fielding coach from 2009 to 2017.

column2: Imam-ul-Haq accused of having multiple affairs, chats leaked
column3: Pakistan opener Imam-ul-Haq has been accused of having affairs with multiple women at the same time, with his WhatsApp chats with around four women being leaked on social media. The user who shared the screenshots of the chats, wrote, "Imam was lying, dating, using and manipulating seven and many more women at the same time."

column2: UAPA amendments 'anti-people', will give NIA policing power: TMC MP
column3: TMC MP Mahua Moitra criticised the amendments to the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) on Wednesday, calling the amendment bill as "anti-federalism, anti-constitutional and anti-people." Moitra said the bill gives policing powers to National Investigation Agency (NIA), as it can go to any state and arrest, seize and search properties, without the knowledge of the state DGP.

column2: Navjot Singh Sidhu meets supporters, says not quitting Congress
column3: Former Punjab minister Navjot Singh Sidhu on Tuesday met supporters at his residence and told them he would not leave the Congress. "Sidhu saab told us he has dedicated himself to Amritsar and the people of Punjab and will work for them while staying within the party. There is no question of him leaving," said Jatinder Singh Bhatia, a councillor.

column2: 2 BJP MLAs vote in favour of MP govt, CM Nath invites them to dinner
column3: BJP MLAs Narayan Tripathi and Sharad Kaul voted in favour of the Congress-led Madhya Pradesh government in the Assembly. The Congress reportedly moved them to an undisclosed location after it and invited them for dinner with CM Kamal Nath. This comes after BJP MLA Gopal Bhargava said the Congress government won't last 24 hours if BJP's top leadership ordered so.

column2: I pray top-most Cong leader is jailed for 10 months under UAPA: Owaisi
column3: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said in Parliament that he wishes and prays that a top-most Congress leader "goes under UAPA and spends at least 10 months" in jail so that the Congress can realise his pain. Owaisi said this during debate on Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Amendment Bill, blaming Congress for bringing the law when it was in power.

column2: Please be decent: Irani to BJP MP on sexual crimes against kids debate
column3: Union Minister Smriti Irani asked her own party's MP Harnath Singh Yadav to be decent during a Parliament debate on sexual crimes against children on Wednesday. "I'd heard of 'popcorn' but never 'porn'," Yadav said while recalling a friend who talked about pornography. "There are women here and this discussion is being viewed by the entire country," Irani said.

column2: PM Modi congratulates Boris Johnson on becoming UK's new PM
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday congratulated Boris Johnson on assuming office as the UK's Prime Minister. "I wish you success and look forward to working with you to further strengthen India-UK partnership in all spheres," PM Modi tweeted. Johnson took over as the UK's Prime Minister following his official appointment by the Queen.

column2: Rajya Sabha passes POCSO amendment bill with death penalty provision
column3: The Rajya Sabha on Wednesday passed a bill making amendments to the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act by including death penalty for aggravated sexual assault on children. The bill also provides for fines and imprisonment to curb child pornography. Union Minister for Women and Child Development Smriti Irani had introduced the bill in the Rajya Sabha.

column2: India to build buffer stock of 4 million tonnes of sugar
column3: The government said it will spend up to ₹1,674 crore to build a buffer stock of four million tonnes of sugar, for countering domestic surplus sugar. The stock will be created beginning August 1, for one year. A record sugar production this season had put pressure on prices, making it difficult for sugar mills to pay farmers.

column2: Bale scores, misses a penalty as Real Madrid beat Arsenal
column3: Real Madrid's Welsh winger Gareth Bale scored in 56th minute before missing his spot-kick in shootout as his team beat Arsenal 3-2 on penalties in International Champions Cup on Tuesday. Arsenal were leading in the first-half before Bale and Marco Asensio levelled the score for Madrid in the second half. Both the teams played with 10 men after first-half reds.

column2: Tottenham manager compares Son Heung-Min to David Beckham
column3: Tottenham Hotspur manager Mauricio Pochettino praised South Korean forward Son Heung-Min and said he compares Son to former Manchester United captain David Beckham. "We can see how people love Sonny in Asia, he is an icon," Pochettino added. The 27-year-old has scored 42 goals and registered 19 assists in 130 Premier League matches so far for Tottenham Hotspur.

column2: E-cigarette lobby calls for regulations instead of blanket ban
column3: An e-cigarette lobby group called Trade Representatives of ENDS (TRENDS) has asked the Indian government to propose regulations on e-cigarettes instead of a blanket ban. "Banning e-cigarettes while more harmful beedis and cigarettes are allowed...is contradictory," TRENDS convenor Praveen Rikhy said. The group recommended regulations like statutory warnings, taxes on products, among others.

column2: Heavy rain alert in Punjab, govt issues notice to authorities
column3: The Punjab government on Wednesday issued a notice to the District Magistrates asking them to stay prepared for heavy rains during the next three days. IMD Chandigarh has predicted heavy to very heavy rainfall at few places with extremely heavy rainfall at isolated places during the next two days. Extremely heavy rainfall is predicted in Hoshiarpur, Kapurthala, Jalandhar and Nawanshahr.

column2: FM rejects demand to remove new 10% import duty on newsprint
column3: Rejecting demands for removing 10% import duty on newsprint, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said it was intended to provide a level playing field to domestic manufacturers. She said despite their capacity, Indian producers can't find buyers as most of the newsprint is imported. Centre had imposed duty on newsprint, uncoated paper used for newspapers and lightweight coated paper for magazines.

column2: Forgot how stressful breastfeeding can be: Sameera Reddy
column3: Actress Sameera Reddy has shared a picture of herself with her newborn daughter 11 days after her delivery. She wrote, "Happiness galore with no sleep, colic and feeding round the clock! I think I forgot how stressful breastfeeding can be!!" "The pressure is quite real and the whole top feed balance after a C-sec is hectic!" she added.

column2: Almost dropped my phone: Singer Rihanna on pic of her lookalike
column3: Singer Rihanna has shared a picture of a young girl on Instagram and pointed out the resemblance between them. She wrote in the caption, "Almost [dropped] my phone. How?" Reacting to the photo, users wrote comments like "I thought Rihanna used the baby filter" and "They say we all have a twin somewhere! You just found yours".

column2: No one has ever proposed to me for marriage, I feel sad: Salman Khan
column3: Salman Khan revealed in an interview that no one has ever proposed to him for marriage. "I don't do candlelight dinners. I can't see what I'm eating in candlelight. But I feel sad that I haven't been approached yet," the 53-year-old actor said. Salman had earlier said that he doesn't believe in marriage and had called it a "dying institution".

column2: Sadhguru criticised for calling sprinter Hima Das 'golden shower'
column3: Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev has been criticised on Twitter for calling sprinter Hima Das 'a golden shower for India' while congratulating her for winning multiple gold medals in Europe. "Someone please tell him what golden shower means," a user wrote. Notably, golden shower is a slang for the practice of urinating on another person for sexual pleasure.

column2: US fines FB $5bn, Zuckerberg to lose sole control on privacy decisions
column3: Facebook will pay a record $5 billion fine to settle a government probe into its privacy practices, the US Federal Trade Commission (FTC) said today. Under the settlement, Facebook's board will create an independent privacy committee that removes "unfettered control by CEO Mark Zuckerberg over decisions affecting user privacy". The investigation relates to Cambridge Analytica scandal and other privacy breaches.

column2: A man ejaculated at my shorts in crowded bus when I was 13: O'Brien
column3: TMC MP Derek O'Brien, while speaking in Parliament on the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (Amendment) Bill, opened up about being sexually molested in a crowded bus as a 13-year-old boy. "After tennis practice, I was in short pants and t-shirt. It was reason enough for an unknown man to ejaculate at shorts of this boy," he stated.

column2: Jeweller receives stolen gold chains with apology note after 23 days
column3: A jeweller in Rajasthan's Alwar on July 18 received a courier with two stolen chains and an apology note, 23 days after they were stolen. The jeweller had told police that three people came to his shop to buy a silver chhatra, paid ₹5,600, and slipped away with gold chains. The note's writer said the chains were taken by mistake.

column2: TMC leaders meet PM asking him to change West Bengal's name to Bangla
column3: A 12-member TMC parliamentary delegation on Wednesday met Prime Minister Narendra Modi to request him to bring a Constitutional amendment bill to change the name of West Bengal to 'Bangla' in the ongoing monsoon session of Parliament. They informed the Prime Minister that the West Bengal Assembly had passed the bill for changing the name of the state last year.

column2: 28-year-old engineer shot dead 100 metres away from home in Lucknow
column3: A 28-year-old bike-borne software engineer was shot dead barely 100 metres away from his house in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow on Tuesday night. Two assailants, who were also on a motorcycle, chased the victim and shot him from behind. "The victim's family members have not spoken of any motive but our initial probe hints at personal enmity," police said.

column2: Malaysia ex-King divorces ex-Miss Moscow by triple talaq: Reports
column3: Malaysia's former king Sultan Muhammad V who gave away his throne in January after marrying former Miss Moscow Rihana Oksana Voevodina has divorced her by 'triple talaq', reports quoting his lawyer claimed. Sultan is said to have raised doubts over the parentage of their two-month-old son. Rihana has reportedly challenged Muhammad to take a DNA test over the claim.

column2: Boris Johnson becomes UK PM after official appointment by Queen
column3: Boris Johnson took over as the UK's Prime Minister on Wednesday following his official appointment by Queen Elizabeth II. His appointment came minutes after his predecessor Theresa May submitted her resignation to the Queen. Johnson defeated fellow Conservative Party member Jeremy Hunt to become the party leader and the UK's next Prime Minister.

column2: North Korea seizes Russian vessel with 17 crew members on board
column3: North Korea last week seized a Russian fishing vessel with 17 crew members on board, the Russian Embassy in North Korea said on Wednesday. North Korea said the crew was detained for "violating the rules of entry and stay in [its] territory". Among the crew members detained, 15 are Russian and two are South Korean.

column2: Woman smashes laptop on boyfriend’s head on plane in US, video viral
column3: A video of a woman smashing a laptop on her boyfriend's head, claiming that he was looking at other women on an American Airlines flight from Miami to Los Angeles, has gone viral on the internet. When she was warned that she will be charged with assault, she replied, "Fine, whatever." Both the passengers were removed from the aircraft.

column2: Trump told staff to falsify records in Russia meddling probe: Mueller
column3: Former US Special Counsel Robert Mueller said on Wednesday that US President Donald Trump had asked his staff to falsify records relevant to the investigation into alleged Russian meddling in 2016 US presidential election. While testifying before the House of Representatives, Mueller added that Trump wanted him fired because he was investigating the US President for obstruction of justice.

column2: Tribunal dismisses HSBC Daisy's contempt plea against Anil Ambani
column3: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has dismissed a contempt petition filed by HSBC Daisy Investments (Mauritius) against Reliance Communications (RCom) Chairman Anil Ambani. HSBC Daisy moved the tribunal alleging that RCom subsidiary Reliance Infratel had not paid ₹230 crore under an agreement to settle a dispute. HSBC Daisy is a minority investor in Reliance Infratel.

column2: Top panel clears ₹3,050 cr fine on Airtel, Vodafone Idea in Jio case
column3: The Digital Communications Commission (DCC) has approved TRAI's recommendation to levy a penalty of ₹3,050 crore on Airtel and Vodafone Idea for allegedly denying points of interconnection to Jio in 2016. Jio had then complained that a large number of calls on its network were failing because of this. DCC is the highest decision-making body of the Department of Telecommunications.

column2: Huawei fires over 600 US employees over getting blacklisted
column3: Huawei has fired over 600 employees out of a total of about 850 employees from its US research subsidiary Futurewei Technologies, representing an over 70% reduction of workforce. The Chinese smartphone maker said this was in response to the "curtailment of business operations" by the US government's trade blacklisting. The US had blacklisted Huawei over alleged espionage concerns.

column2: Awaiting orders from Delhi: Yeddyurappa on K'taka govt formation
column3: Karnataka BJP President BS Yeddyurappa on Wednesday said he was awaiting instructions from BJP's central leadership in Delhi on forming a government in the state. "I can call legislature party meeting any time and go to Raj Bhavan (to stake claim). I'm waiting for it," he added. The Congress-JDS government in Karnataka collapsed on Tuesday after losing the trust vote.

column2: Mumbai's Haptik acquihires LA-based chatbot startup Convrg
column3: Mumbai-based AI chatbot startup Haptik has acquihired Los Angeles-based conversational AI startup Convrg for an undisclosed amount to expand its technical expertise, team and business overseas. This comes months after the Mumbai-based startup raised $100 million from Reliance Industries, which acquired a majority stake of 87% in it. Haptik was founded in 2013 by Aakrit Vaish and Swapan Rajdev.

column2: 1,905 women officers serving in IAF as of July 1: Govt
column3: Minister of State for Defence Shripad Naik on Wednesday said that there are 1,905 women officers currently serving in the Indian Air Force (IAF) as on July 1, 2019. "Of these, eight are Fighter Pilots and 17 are Navigators," he said. Naik further asserted that the IAF is adequately equipped to cater to the threat environment that exists.

column2: Transgender beaten to death over suspicion of child lifting in WB
column3: A transgender was beaten to death on suspicion of being a child lifter in West Bengal's Jalpaiguri district, police said. "We managed to rescue the victim but the person died on the way to the hospital," Sub-Divisional Police Officer said. He added that it was just a rumour spread by people and no incident of child kidnapping had taken place.

column2: Got 2 bids for acquiring half of promoters' stake: Zee CEO
column3: Zee Entertainment, flagship media firm of Subhash Chandra-led Essel Group, has received two bids from foreign entities to acquire half of its promoters' stake, said CEO Punit Goenka. While one bidder has submitted a binding bid, discussions were on with the second bidder for the same, he added. If finalised, the transactions would help promoters reduce their nearly ₹13,000-crore debt.

column2: Lower 25% corporate tax may soon apply to all companies: FM
column3: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said the government will likely extend the reduced corporate tax rate of 25% to all companies soon. In Budget 2019-20, she had announced the reduction of the corporate tax rate to 25% for firms with up to ₹400 crore annual turnover, covering 99.3% companies. She said, "Hardly any are left behind...We shall cover them sooner."

column2: If Censor Board allows, films like 'Kabir Singh' can be made: Rajkummar
column3: Actor Rajkummar Rao, while speaking about Shahid Kapoor starrer 'Kabir Singh' which has been accused of glorifying toxic masculinity, said, "It depends on the kind of person making it...If the Censor Board is allowing them, they can make it." "Then it's up to us if we want to watch it or not...It depends on your personal ideologies," he added.

column2: You'll find someone worthier: Madhavan on 18-yr-old's marriage proposal
column3: Actor R Madhavan has responded to a female fan who commented on one of his pictures on Instagram and wrote that she wants to get married to him. "Is it wrong that I am 18 and wanna get married to you," the fan wrote. "Ha ha ha God bless you...You will find someone way...worthier," Madhavan replied to her.

column2: England get all out for 85 vs Ireland in Test 10 days after winning WC
column3: England were dismissed for 85 runs in the first innings in one-off Test against Ireland at Lord's on Wednesday, 10 days after winning the 2019 World Cup at the same venue. Ireland pacer Tim Murtagh registered figures of 9-2-13-5, helping his team dismiss England for their fifth-shortest innings by overs (23.4). Only three of England's batsmen scored in double digits.

column2: 28-year-old Russian boxer suffers brain injury in ring, dies
column3: Russian boxer Maxim Dadashev died in a US hospital due to brain injury he sustained in the fight against Puerto Rico's Subriel Matias last Friday. The 28-year-old was hospitalised shortly after the match, which had to be stopped by his trainer Buddy McGirt in the 11th round. Footage from the match showed McGirt begging Dadashev to stop the fight.

column2: IIT team only Asian finalist at SpaceX Hyperloop Pod contest
column3: Avishkar Hyperloop, the student team from IIT Madras' Centre For Innovation (CFI), was the only Asian team to enter final round of the 'SpaceX Hyperloop Pod Competition 2019'. IIT Madras revealed a total of 22 teams had reached the final round, which was held in Los Angeles on July 21. The team met with SpaceX Founder and CEO Elon Musk.

column2: Freshworks planning to go public by 2021, list on Nasdaq: Report
column3: California-based software unicorn Freshworks is reportedly planning to go public and is expected to be listed on New York-headquartered stock exchange Nasdaq. Founded by Girish Mathrubootham and Shan Krishnasamy in 2010, the startup has raised about $250 million to date and has made 10 acquisitions. It will reportedly become the first Nasdaq-listed software-based product firm from India.

column2: Sachin Bansal's BACQ invests ₹50cr in startup Kissht: Report
column3: BAC Acquisitions, a fund co-founded by Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal, has reportedly invested about ₹50 crore in debt in Mumbai-based fintech startup Kissht. Founded in 2015 by former McKinsey consultants Krishnan Vishwanathan and Ranvir Singh, Kissht allows consumers to pay for online orders in instalments without a credit card. It has raised about ₹340 crore to date, as per Crunchbase.

column2: Talks with Pak won't be only on Kashmir, but also PoK: Rajnath Singh
column3: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Wednesday said in the Parliament that if there would be talks with Pakistan on the Kashmir issue, it would also include a discussion on Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Singh rejected US President Donald Trump's claim that PM Narendra Modi had asked him to mediate on the Kashmir issue with Pakistan. Earlier, MEA had also rejected Trump's claim.

column2: AIADMK Rajya Sabha MP Maitreyan breaks down during farewell speech
column3: AIADMK Rajya Sabha member V Maitreyan broke down in the Parliament on Wednesday while giving his farewell speech, remembering late Tamil Nadu CM Jayalalithaa. "At this juncture, I place on record a deep sense of gratitude towards my beloved leader, Amma for...sending me to this House for three terms. My unalloyed loyalty to her will always be there," Maitreyan said.

column2: Rise above party politics: Amit Shah on anti-terror amendment bill
column3: Amid debate over amendments to the Unlawful Activities Prevention (Amendment) Bill on Wednesday, Home Minister Amit Shah said, "When it comes to an anti-terror fight, we should rise above party politics." The anti-terror bill seeks to designate a person suspected to have terror links as a "terrorist", which the opposition leaders say has a large scope for misuse.

column2: Woman withdraws rape case against ex-SP minister Gayatri Prajapati
column3: A woman, who had accused former Samajwadi Party (SP) minister Gayatri Prajapati of gang-raping her and trying to molest her minor daughter, withdrew her statement in a court on Tuesday. She said Prajapati didn't rape her, but his two aides did. She had earlier claimed Prajapati and his aides raped her in 2014 when she met him seeking a job.

column2: Pakistan extends Hafiz Saeed's judicial remand for 14 days
column3: A Pakistani court on Wednesday extended Jamaat-ud-Dawa (JuD) chief and 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks mastermind Hafiz Saeed's judicial remand for 14 days. Saeed and his aides were arrested in connection with a terrorism financing case last week. Saeed and other JuD leaders have been booked in over 20 cases related to terrorism financing and money laundering.

column2: UK sent mediator to Iran to free seized tanker: Iranian official
column3: The UK has sent a mediator to Iran seeking the release of the seized UK-flagged oil tanker, Mohammad Mohammadi-Golpayegani, the head of the Supreme Leader's office said. Iran had seized the oil tanker in the Strait of Hormuz last week. Eighteen among the 23 crew members on board the seized tanker are Indian nationals.

column2: 8 lynched in B'desh on rumours of human sacrifice for building bridge
column3: Eight people were lynched in Bangladesh last week over rumours of children being kidnapped for human sacrifice for the construction of the Padma Bridge. More than 30 people have been attacked in similar cases. As many as 103 people have been arrested in 31 cases filed in connection with these incidents, police officials said.

column2: They call him 'Britain Trump': Donald Trump on new UK PM Johnson
column3: Praising the UK's new Prime Minister Boris Johnson, US President Donald Trump said, "He's tough and he's smart. They call him 'Britain Trump' and people are saying that's a good thing." "They like me over there. That's what they wanted. That's what they need. He'll get it done. Boris is good. He's gonna do a good job," Trump added.

column2: JPMorgan helped Amrapali divert funds overseas: Supreme Court
column3: A JPMorgan unit violated foreign investment rules and helped Amrapali divert funds overseas, the Supreme Court said. JPMorgan invested around ₹85 crore in an Amrapali company's shares and later sold them to an office boy and nephew of the auditor for ₹140 crore. "The shares were overvalued for making payment to JPMorgan," the court added, agreeing with the forensic auditor.

column2: Amrapali diverted homebuyers' money to firms tied to Dhoni, wife: SC
column3: The Supreme Court on Tuesday observed that Amrapali Group entered into "sham agreements" with firms linked to MS Dhoni and his wife Sakshi to divert homebuyers' money. The group paid ₹42.22 crore to Rhiti Sports Management between 2009 and 2015, a forensic audit found. Amrapali Mahi Developers, in which Sakshi was a director, received share capital and expenses in cash.

column2: Never seen this kind of horse-trading in life: Gowda on K'taka
column3: After the Congress-JD(S) coalition government lost the trust vote in Karnataka, former PM HD Deve Gowda said that he had never seen in his life the type of horse-trading the BJP leadership allowed. He added that the JD(S) doesn't regret the last coalition government. Gowda further said, "We are not accusing anyone, including the former CM and other senior ministers."

column2: MHA revises security cover for Kamal Nath, ISRO Chairman
column3: In a full-scale review of security cover for VIPs, the Home Ministry has downgraded security cover of Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath and withdrawn security cover for ISRO Chairman K Sivan. Security of politicians like RJD leader Lalu Prasad Yadav, BJP MP Rajiv Pratap Rudy, has also been downgraded. Security cover for 130 VIPs has been reviewed by the Ministry.

column2: Rahul, Cong behave like Pak PM's cheerleaders: Giriraj Singh
column3: Amid the Opposition's uproar over US President Donald Trump's remark on Kashmir, Union Minister Giriraj Singh on Wednesday said that the Congress and its leader Rahul Gandhi behave like Pakistan PM Imran Khan's cheerleaders. He added, "Imran does not know his worth, he should stop harping on referendum and Kashmir, and start preparing to handover PoK to India."

column2: MP govt won't last 24 hrs once we get top leaders' orders: BJP MLA
column3: BJP MLA Gopal Bhargava on Wednesday said Congress government in MP won't last for 24 hours once they get orders from party's top leadership. "If we get orders from our number one or number two, [MP] government won't last for 24 hours," he added. This comes after the Congress-JD(S) government in Karnataka fell on Tuesday after losing the trust vote.

column2: Black chapter in history of democracy: Mayawati on Karnataka
column3: After HD Kumaraswamy-led government failed to prove majority in Karnataka Assembly, BSP supremo Mayawati said that the manner in which the BJP pulled down the coalition government will be registered as a "black chapter" in the history of democracy. She alleged that the BJP kept all constitutional norms aside and used "money and power" to pull down the coalition government.

column2: Uttarakhand CM announces new bridge in place of Laxman Jhula
column3: Uttarakhand CM Trivendra Singh Rawat on Wednesday announced the construction of a new bridge in place of the iconic suspension bridge, Laxman Jhula. "The new bridge will be constructed in a modern and high-tech manner and it'll be a tourist attraction," Rawat said. Laxman Jhula was closed down after a report suggested that it was not fit for use.

column2: Jet Airways' HQ owner moves NCLT for vacation of premises
column3: The owner of debt-laden Jet Airways' Mumbai headquarters, Luckystar, has approached NCLT for the property to be vacated. It said Jet and its Resolution Professional (RP) can't occupy the property as it doesn't belong to the carrier, which was admitted for insolvency after the lease's cancellation in June. Luckystar also sought pending rental dues for April and May from Jet.

column2: 49 celebrities write letter to PM Modi over rising lynching cases
column3: Forty-nine celebrities, including directors Anurag Kashyap, Mani Ratnam and actress Konkona Sensharma have written a letter to PM Narendra Modi, expressing concern over rising lynching cases in the country. They wrote, "You've criticised...lynchings in Parliament, but that is not enough! What action has actually been taken?" "Regrettably 'Jai Shri Ram' has become a...'war-cry' today," the letter reads.

column2: It was traumatic, didn't have strength to come back: Rishi on mom's death
column3: Speaking about his mother Krishna Raj Kapoor's demise in India while he was in US for cancer treatment, Rishi Kapoor said, "That...was traumatic for me...I didn't have the stamina or strength to come back." "I left...on September 29, and my mother passed away on October 1...My brother [said] by the time I'd get back, it'd be too late," he added.

column2: Culture of scolding isn't even there in dressing room now: Kohli
column3: On being asked if he has to be harsh with youngsters sometimes, India captain Virat Kohli said the culture of scolding isn't even there in the dressing room now. "The atmosphere is such that anyone can say anything to anyone," Virat added. "I tell [the youngsters], 'Listen, I've committed these mistakes, make sure you don’t do them'," he further said.

column2: Centre runs troll armies to attack Opposition: TMC MP Mahua Moitra
column3: TMC MP Mahua Moitra on Wednesday accused the Centre of running "propaganda machinery" and "troll armies" to attack the Opposition, which she said runs the risk of being called "anti-national" whenever it disagrees with the government. Speaking on the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Amendment Bill, 2019, Moitra said it sought to designate individuals as terrorists without due process.

column2: BJP MLA dances with supporters after Cong-JD(S) govt falls in K'taka
column3: After the Congress-JD(S) coalition government in Karnataka failed the floor test in the Assembly on Tuesday, BJP MLA MP Renukacharya was seen dancing with his supporters outside Ramada Hotel in Bengaluru. There were fireworks outside the hotel as well. Renukacharya was at the hotel to attend a legislature party meeting, hours after he voted against the coalition.

column2: Chhattisgarh municipality sets up cafe, to give free food for plastic
column3: Ambikapur Municipal Corporation in Chhattisgarh has set up a 'Garbage Cafe' to provide food to citizens in exchange for plastic waste. "We're providing free food to those who bring 1 kg of plastic to us, it'll help us in keeping the city clean," Mayor Ajay Tirkey said. Free breakfast will be offered for those collecting 500 grams of plastic.

column2: Super 30's Anand Kumar to take virtual classes in Delhi govt schools
column3: Delhi Education Minister Manish Sisodia on Wednesday said that Super 30 Founder Anand Kumar will conduct one class every month for Delhi government school students. "This will be an online, virtual classroom for Class 11, 12 students of our schools," Sisodia said. The announcement was made after Anand Kumar visited a Delhi government school with Sisodia on Wednesday.

column2: No problem in preparing food inside toilet: MP Minister Imarti Devi
column3: Madhya Pradesh Minister Imarti Devi said that there is no problem in cooking food inside a toilet if a partition exists between the toilet-seat and stove. "Utensils can be kept on the bathroom seat," she added. This comes after reports claimed that a toilet in an Anganwadi centre in Karera was being used for preparing food for children.

column2: 3 men reach Kolkata hospital claiming to be newborn girl's father
column3: A pregnant woman was admitted to a Kolkata hospital last week and a man accompanying her addressed himself as her husband. Soon another man came there, claiming to be her husband and newborn girl's father. Later, a third man claimed to be the newborn's father, but the woman confirmed that the second man is the newborn's father and her husband.

column2: 'Pakistan still has 30,000-40,000 terrorists,' PM Imran Khan admits
column3: During his visit to US, Pakistan PM Imran Khan revealed his country still has about 30,000-40,000 militants "who have been trained and fought in some part of Afghanistan or Kashmir". He further said that until his Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf government came into power, the governments (in Pakistan) did not have the "political will" to disarm militant groups operating on their soil.

column2: Russia expressed deep regret for airspace intrusion: South Korea
column3: A Russian official has expressed "deep regret" after one of the country's military aircraft intruded into South Korean airspace, South Korea's presidential office said. The Russian official added that the intrusion was not intentional and blamed a device malfunction for the incident. The Russian military aircraft had entered airspace over an island claimed by both South Korea and Japan.

column2: 29-yr-old postpones $4.5 mn lunch with Buffett due to kidney stones
column3: Chinese cryptocurrency entrepreneur Justin Sun postponed his $4.57 million charity lunch with Warren Buffett after falling ill with kidney stones. The 29-year-old, who founded Tron cryptocurrency, denied reports that he was involved in illegal fundraising and money laundering. Sun added a report by a Chinese publication stating he had been barred from leaving the country was "completely false".

column2: Banks, authorities colluded with Amrapali to divert funds: SC
column3: The Supreme Court on Tuesday said banks and local authorities colluded with Amrapali Group in the misappropriation of loans and homebuyers' funds meant for housing projects. "Banks failed to monitor utilisation of the borrowed funds and they acted as mute spectators to the diversion of funds," it said. A forensic audit revealed that Amrapali diverted ₹3,500 crore of homebuyers' money.

column2: Prannoy knocks Srikanth out of Japan Open in first round
column3: World number 10 shuttler Kidambi Srikanth crashed out of Japan Open after losing to compatriot and world number 34 HS Prannoy in the first round on Wednesday. Srikanth lost with a scoreline of 21-13, 11-21, 20-22 in 59 minutes. Meanwhile, world number five women's singles player PV Sindhu will begin her Japan Open campaign today against China's Han Yue.

column2: WhatsApp head to visit India; may meet IT Ministry, RBI officials
column3: WhatsApp's global head Will Cathcart will visit India this week and is reportedly expected to meet officials from the IT Ministry and Reserve Bank of India (RBI). This comes amid regulatory challenges Facebook is facing over the rollout of WhatsApp's payments service WhatsApp Pay. Facebook had also announced it won't launch its cryptocurrency Libra in India over local restrictions.

column2: Apple hires engineer who led design of Tesla's car interiors
column3: Apple has hired Steve MacManus, former Vice President of Engineering at Tesla who had led the interior designing for the electric carmaker from 2015, as a Senior Director. Prior to working for Tesla, MacManus had worked for Aston Martin, Bentley Motors and Jaguar & Land Rover. Apple is reportedly working on its own self-driving electric car under its 'Project Titan'.

column2: Biswabhusan Harichandan takes oath as Andhra Pradesh Guv
column3: Biswabhusan Harichandan took oath as the Governor of Andhra Pradesh at a function held at the temporary Raj Bhavan, Vijayawada. Acting Chief Justice of the state High Court C Praveen Kumar administered the oath of office to Harichandan. The swearing-in ceremony took place in the presence of CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy, TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu and other dignitaries.

column2: One day BJP will discover not everything can be bought: Priyanka
column3: After the Congress-JD(S) government lost the trust vote in Karnataka Assembly, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi criticised the BJP saying that one day they'll discover that "everything cannot be bought". She added that until then, the people will have to "endure their unbridled corruption". Priyanka said, one day they'll realise that everyone cannot be bullied and every lie is "eventually exposed".

column2: Congress-JD(S) misrule ended, people happy: Sadananda Gowda
column3: After the Congress-JD(S) government lost the trust vote in Karnataka, Union Minister Sadananda Gowda said that the misrule of the coalition has ended and the state people are "very happy". He added that the BJP showed solidarity without taking assistance from the rebel MLAs in the House. Gowda said that the Karnataka BJP should form the government at the earliest.

column2: TikTok acquires UK-based AI music startup Jukedeck: Report
column3: Lip-syncing video platform TikTok's parent ByteDance has reportedly acquired UK-based startup Jukedeck which uses AI to automatically generate music. The startup's Co-founder and CEO Ed Newton-Rex has updated his LinkedIn to reflect he is now the AI Labs Director for ByteDance. Founded in 2012 by Newton-Rex and Patrick Stobbs, Jukedeck has raised £2.5 million to date, as per Crunchbase.

column2: Lightning strikes kill at least 32 in last 24 hours in Bihar
column3: At least 32 people died and over a dozen were injured in the last 24 hours due to incidents of lightning strikes across Bihar, an official said. The state government has announced a compensation of ₹4 lakh each to the kin of dead, a Disaster Management Department official said. In Jamui, eight people died, while seven people died in Aurangabad.

column2: 11 arrested, 500 kg of cannabis worth ₹50 L seized in Vizag
column3: Police along with Prohibition and Excise Department officials on Tuesday arrested 11 people and seized 500 kg of cannabis worth ₹50 lakh in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam. A jeep used in the transportation of the drug was also seized by the team. On Sunday, one person was arrested and cannabis worth ₹25 lakh was seized from his car in the district.

column2: Mark Esper sworn in as US Defence Secretary
column3: Army veteran Mark Esper was sworn in as the US' Defence Secretary on Tuesday following confirmation by the Senate. Esper succeeds James Mattis, who resigned in December last year following differences with US President Donald Trump over the withdrawal of American troops from Syria. Esper has also worked as a lobbyist for the military contractor firm Raytheon.

column2: Protinex starts #DontMissOut campaign for muscle health awareness
column3: According to a recent study conducted by Protinex, 6 out of 10 Indians suffer from poor muscle health and fatigue, preventing them from enjoying quality moments with family while giving their 100% at work. Protinex conducted a sensitization initiative among 1 lakh corporates to educate them about the importance of daily protein intake and exercise regime for good muscle health.

column2: Previous Pak govts lied to US, we had 40 militant groups: Imran Khan
column3: Pakistan PM Imran Khan has said his country was fighting the US' war on terror and had "nothing to do with 9/11" but things went wrong as previous Pakistani governments didn't tell the truth to US. "There were 40 different militant groups operating within Pakistan." Khan earlier admitted his country knew about al-Qaeda chief Osama bin Laden's presence in Pakistan.

column2: 11 years since Messi got no. 10 from Ronaldinho at Barcelona
column3: Forward Lionel Messi wore the number 10 jersey for the first time for Barcelona on July 24, 2008, in a preseason friendly against Scottish side Hibernian. Barcelona legend Ronaldinho Gaúcho had departed Barcelona a week earlier, freeing up the number 10 shirt. Messi donned the number 19 jersey for Barcelona before switching to the number 10 jersey.

column2: Amitabh Bachchan donates ₹51 lakh for Assam flood victims
column3: Amitabh Bachchan has donated ₹51 lakh to the Chief Minister's Relief Fund for Assam flood victims. CM Sarbananda Sonowal took to Twitter to thank the actor for the donation and wrote, "This is a great gesture & show of care for the people." Earlier, Akshay Kumar had donated ₹1 crore each for the flood-affected people and for Kaziranga Park rescue.

column2: Lost 6 months as I couldn't remember anything: Disha on head injury
column3: Actress Disha Patani, in an interview with Mid-Day, revealed that she once lost her memory after falling on her head while she was training on concrete floors. "I lost six months of my life because I couldn't remember anything," she said. Disha, who practises gymnastics and MMA, added, "[Only when] you break your bones and knees do you reach somewhere."

column2: After Bihar, UP, Rajasthan, 'Super 30' declared tax-free in Gujarat
column3: Hrithik Roshan starrer 'Super 30' has been declared tax-free in Gujarat, making it the fourth state where the film is now tax-free. Previously, the film had been declared tax-free in the states of Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh and Bihar. Thanking Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani, Hrithik tweeted, "Team Super 30 is deeply overwhelmed by your kind gesture."

column2: Getting to play Test at Lord's special thing for Ireland: Porterfield
column3: Talking about Ireland's upcoming Test match against England at Lord's, Ireland captain William Porterfield said that having the opportunity to play at the 'The Home of Cricket' is a pretty special thing. "We had a taste of it a couple of years ago with the one-dayer here...It's going to be a pretty special moment," he added.

column2: BCCI formally recognises Indian Cricketers' Association for ex-players
column3: The BCCI has officially recognised the Indian Cricketers' Association (ICA), the body formed as per the board's new constitution. The BCCI stated that the ICA is a non-profit company and is aimed at conserving and advancing the welfare of former players. Kapil Dev, Ajit Agarkar and Shantha Rangaswamy are ICA's directors and will hold their positions until elections are held.

column2: Democracy, honesty & people of K'taka lost: Rahul on govt collapse
column3: Reacting to collapse of Congress-JD(S) government in Karnataka, Rahul Gandhi said, "From its first day, the Cong-JDS alliance in Karnataka was a target for vested interests, both within & outside." He added the "vested interests" saw the alliance as a threat to their path to power. "Their greed won today. Democracy, honesty & the people of Karnataka lost," he stated.

column2: Don't blame BJP if MP govt falls due to Cong infighting: Shivraj Singh
column3: Former Madhya Pradesh CM and BJP leader Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday said his party cannot be blamed if the state government falls because of internal conflicts within the Congress and its coalition partners SP and BSP. Chouhan added BJP will not cause the fall of Madhya Pradesh government. He blamed the Congress leaders for the fall of state governments.

column2: Party that banned cattle auctions conducted one in K'taka: Tharoor
column3: After Congress-JD(S) coalition government lost the trust vote in Karnataka, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor tweeted, "So the party that banned cattle auctions has successfully conducted one in Karnataka!" Taking a dig at rebel MLAs, Tharoor added, "My admiration for the courage & principle shown by D.K.Shivakumar & those [Congress] MLAs who were neither cajoled nor cudgelled into changing their allegiance."

column2: President doesn't make things up: Trump’s advisor on Kashmir remark
column3: On being asked by reporters about US President Donald Trump's remark on Kashmir mediation, Trump's Chief Economic Advisor Larry Kudlow said, "The President does not make things up." He further called the question "rude", adding, "I'm going to stay out of that...It's for Mr (National Security Advisor John) Bolton...and President, so I'm not going to comment on that."

column2: Man cheats Railways twice by claiming lizard found in food, caught
column3: A senior citizen who cheated the Indian Railways for compensation by claiming that lizard was found in his food from the Railway caterers, at two different occasions, was caught by Andhra Pradesh's Guntakal officials on Tuesday. In another incident, he had complained about a blade in the idli. He confessed he was using a fish for his lizard tricks.

column2: Dude! We are going to energise the country: New UK PM Boris Johnson
column3: Addressing Conservative Party members following his election as their new leader and the UK's next Prime Minister, Boris Johnson said, "Dude, we are going to energise the country." He further vowed to deliver Brexit, unite the country and defeat Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn. "(W)e are once again going to believe in ourselves and what we can achieve," he added.

column2: Lakshmi Mittal's brother arrested in Bosnia, faces up to 45 yrs jail
column3: Indian businessman Pramod Mittal, younger brother of steel magnate Lakshmi Mittal, was arrested in Bosnia on suspicion of organised crime and abuse of office. Mittal heads the supervisory board at Bosnian coke producer GIKIL. Prosecutors said he could get a jail sentence of up to 45 years if found guilty of the alleged crimes, which reportedly include embezzling $2.8 million.

column2: RBI names Kanungo to run monetary policy after Viral Acharya quits
column3: The RBI has assigned Deputy Governor BP Kanungo to run the monetary policy portfolio after the resignation of fellow Deputy Governor Viral Acharya. Kanungo, who will retain his currency management portfolio, would become the sixth member of the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC). Acharya, who is also a professor at New York University’s Stern School of Business, left RBI on Tuesday.

column2: Average data breach cost rises to ₹12.8 crore in India: IBM
column3: Average cost of data breach in India has risen to about ₹12.8 crore from around ₹11.9 crore last year, representing a hike of over 7% on a year-over-year basis, as per IBM's 'Cost of a Data Breach' report. About 51% of the breaches occurred due to malicious or criminal attacks, the report revealed. It analysed 8 years of Indian data.

column2: Swaraj India releases 1st list of 10 candidates for Haryana polls
column3: Ahead of the upcoming Haryana Assembly polls, Swaraj India party on Tuesday released its first list of 10 candidates, including three women. Party founder Yogendra Yadav said, all the 10 candidates come from "simple and ordinary families" and are committed to public welfare. Yadav said, he'll not contest the Assembly polls and instead work for the success of his candidates.

column2: Mamata offers land to Press Club, approves pension for 69 journos
column3: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday announced sanctioning of land to Kolkata Press Club for its permanent building. Mamata also announced the list of 69 retired journalists and approved monthly pension of ₹2,500 for them. She expressed concern over retrenchment of working journalists and said the state would come up with statutory law to ensure job guarantee for them.

column2: NRI voting very much a focus for us: Election Commissioner
column3: Election Commissioner Sushil Chandra on Tuesday said that Non-Resident Indians' (NRI) voting is "very much a focus" for the commission because their voice must be heard. He added that it's their constitutional right to participate in the elections. His comment came ahead of provisions being put in place for either proxy voting or voting through embassies and missions for NRIs.

column2: Pune exam preparation platform Pariksha raises ₹4 crore
column3: Pune-based exam preparation platform Pariksha has raised ₹4 crore in a pre-Series A funding round led by incubator and accelerator platform Venture Catalysts. Founded in 2014, Pariksha is an online vernacular test preparation platform helping candidates to prepare for various government examinations. It operates across seven states in languages including Hindi, Marathi, Tamil, Bengali and English.

column2: Fintech startup Zeta gets funding from Sodexo at $300M valuation
column3: Bengaluru-based fintech startup Zeta has raised reportedly about $60 million in a Series C funding round at a valuation of around $300 million from French food services and facilities management company Sodexo. This marked the startup's first-ever external funding. Zeta has been funded by Co-founders Bhavin Turakhia and Ramki Gaddipati, who have collectively invested $40 million to date.

column2: UP woman throws ill 3-month-old from 4th floor of hospital
column3: A woman was arrested for throwing her ailing three-month-old son from a hospital's fourth floor in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. In the police complaint, the woman's husband said she was distressed due to their son's continuous medical treatment for liver ailment and jaundice. The incident came to light after the woman claimed that her child had gone missing from the ward.

column2: 3 Hizbul Mujahideen militants arrested in Srinagar: Police
column3: Three newly-recruited Hizbul Mujahideen militants were arrested from Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar, police said on Tuesday. The overground workers were allegedly involved in lobbing a grenade at a Jammu bus stand in December 2018 and shooting a Special Police Officer in Srinagar's Barzulla. One grenade, 15 rounds of AK-47 rifle, two pistol rounds and a flag were recovered, police said.

column2: RIL talks on refinery stake sale to Aramco stalled: Reports
column3: Reliance Industries' (RIL) discussions with the world's largest oil producer Saudi Arabian Oil (Aramco) to sell a minority stake in its refinery business have reportedly stalled due to differences over the deal structure. Reports said Aramco had concerns over RIL's proposal to shift some of its ₹2.8 lakh crore debt to the refinery business. The negotiations could reportedly still resume.

column2: Dhoni doesn't need anybody to tell him what to do: Munaf Patel
column3: Reacting to speculation around MS Dhoni's retirement, ex-India pacer Munaf Patel said that Dhoni doesn't need anybody to tell him what to do. "He has done so much for the country. What WI have achieved since 1975, Dhoni has done it in a few years. He has won us all trophies. You can't ignore him just like that," he added.

column2: Eoin Morgan plays cricket with Afghan family, Rashid calls him legend
column3: England's 2019 World Cup-winning captain Eoin Morgan took to Twitter to share a picture of himself with an Afghan family. "On the walk home from dinner this evening I was asked to play a game with this lovely Afghan family.. #ThePowerofsport," he wrote alongside the picture. Responding to Morgan's tweet, Afghanistan leg-spinner Rashid Khan tweeted, "Legend."

column2: Narine, Pollard back in West Indies squad for T20Is against India
column3: Sunil Narine and Kieron Pollard have been recalled to the West Indies T20I squad for the first two matches against India. Chris Gayle will not feature in the series as he will be participating in the Canada's Global T20 League. Wicketkeeper-batsman Anthony Bramble has earned a maiden call-up, while John Campbell and Khary Pierre also feature in the 14-member squad.

column2: I am not convinced with Prasad's explanation: Azharuddin on Rayudu
column3: Talking about Ambati Rayudu, former India captain Mohammed Azharuddin has said that since Rayudu was among the reserved players for World Cup, he should have been the first-choice as a replacement for an injured player. "Somehow, I am not convinced with the explanation of MSK Prasad (chairman of BCCI selection committee) that the team wanted an opener," he added.

column2: Chahal only person to represent India in both chess, cricket
column3: Indian leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who is celebrating his 29th birthday today, is the only person to represent India in both chess and cricket. Chahal, who is listed on the World Chess Federation's official site, was the U-12 national chess champion in 2002 and has represented India U-16 at the World Youth Chess Championship. Chahal has taken 130 international wickets.

column2: Names on Test jerseys will help spectators identify players: Bhogle
column3: After England unveiled their Test jerseys with names and numbers on them, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "I like the idea of having numbers and names on shirts in Test cricket." "Helps spectators identify players (as a kid...I was always asking people who a particular player was. Often they didn't know either) and takes nothing away from the game," he added.

column2: I was rudely questioned, humiliated at Manchester airport: Wasim Akram
column3: Ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram has claimed he was mistreated by authorities at Manchester airport over his insulin. "I felt very humiliated as I was rudely questioned & ordered publicly to take my insulin out of its travel cold-case & dumped in to a plastic bag," he added. Akram also shared the picture of his insulin in a plastic bag.

column2: I am the happiest person in the world: Karnataka CM after govt falls
column3: Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy, while he was on his way to submit resignation to Governor Vajubhai Vala, told reporters that he is "totally relieved now". "I am the happiest person in the world now," he added. Kumaraswamy resigned shortly after the ruling Congress-JD(S) coalition lost the confidence vote by a margin of six votes in the 225-member state assembly.

column2: Mayawati expels lone Karnataka BSP MLA for missing floor test
column3: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) chief Mayawati on Tuesday expelled lone Karnataka BSP MLA N Mahesh with immediate effect from the party after he did not attend the trust vote, which the Congress-JD(S) coalition lost 99-105. Mayawati said that Mahesh was asked to vote for the HD Kumaraswamy government and he violated party orders by not appearing in the floor test.

column2: DCW chief Swati Maliwal posts video of child sex abuse, criticised
column3: Delhi Commission for Women Chairperson Swati Maliwal on Tuesday tweeted a video which showed an old man sexually assaulting a toddler, tagging the Delhi Police's handle and asking them to take action. Many Twitter users criticised Maliwal for posting video of child sex abuse online. A journalist also pointed out that the video was from Hyderabad from March, not Delhi.

column2: Iran releases video of crew, including 18 Indians, on captured tanker
column3: Iran on Monday released a video of the 23 crew members, including 18 Indian nationals, of a British-flagged tanker that Iran seized on Friday. The crew can be seen talking in a meeting room, operating the ship's systems and cooking in the vessel's kitchen. Iran had earlier announced that all the crew members onboard are safe.

column2: Man crashes van with ₹965 cr drugs into police car in Aus, arrested
column3: A 26-year-old man was arrested by the New South Wales Police Force on Monday after he accidentally crashed a van with drugs worth over ₹965 crore into a patrol car outside a police station in Sydney. The driver sped off after the patrol car's bonnet was crushed. The police tracked him within an hour through CCTV footage and recovered drugs.

column2: Ex-Barcelona captain Andres Iniesta named La Liga Icon
column3: Former Barcelona captain Andres Iniesta has been named the latest La Liga Icon. The La Liga Icons initiative aims to expand La Liga brand through a strategy focused on digital dissemination, allowing La Liga to connect with fans globally. The former Spanish international who scored the team's winning goal in 2010 World Cup final is currently with Japan's J1 League.

column2: No rift in Indian team unless players bring it up: CoA
column3: The CoA has said as far as they are concerned, there's is no rift in Team India. "The CoA cannot be reacting to reports in the media. If the players have any issue, they can/should bring it up with us," the CoA added. This comes after a section of media reported a rift between Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma.

column2: Sehwag shares Chahal's viral pic, wishes him on birthday
column3: Former India cricketer Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to wish leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal on the occasion of his 29th birthday. Sharing Chahal's viral picture showing him relaxing near boundary during a World Cup match, Sehwag wrote, "Happy Birthday, Yuzvendra Chahal...Isi Attitude ke paise hain, baaki sab ek jaise hain!" Chahal has taken 84 wickets in 49 ODIs.

column2: Trescothick to join Eng’s coaching team for 1st 2 Ashes Tests
column3: Former cricketer Marcus Trescothick is set to join the England cricket team's coaching staff for the first two Tests of the upcoming Ashes series. According to reports, Trescothick, who played 76 Tests and averaged 43.79, will be with the team both in training sessions and at the team hotel, to support players during the series.

column2: Dhoni should play aggressively whenever he plays: Azharuddin
column3: Former India captain Mohammed Azharuddin has said that whenever MS Dhoni plays, he should play aggressively. "If he plays his natural game more, I feel that will be good for India," he added. "If his interest is still 100 per cent, I feel, he is good player and he should play," he further said amid speculation around Dhoni's retirement.

column2: If Hindus sever connections, Muslims will die of hunger: BJP MLA
column3: After Samajwadi Party MLA Nahid Hasan's 'boycott pro-BJP shopkeepers' remark, BJP MLA Surendra Singh on Tuesday said that if Hindus sever connections, Muslims will die of hunger. "This is not the right thing to do...no politician should try to divide society by giving such statements," he added. Earlier today, Hasan said that his words were misinterpreted by the media.

column2: New era of development will begin now: Yeddyurappa
column3: After the HD Kumaraswamy-led coalition government lost the confidence vote on Tuesday, BJP's Karnataka president BS Yeddyurappa said a new era of development will start from now onwards. "It's the victory of democracy. People were fed up with the Kumaraswamy government," he added. Yeddyurappa further said that his government's focus will be on farmers hit by drought and other problems.

column2: Congress to hold nationwide protests against BJP: Venugopal
column3: Karnataka Congress in-charge KC Venugopal on Tuesday announced that his party will hold nationwide protests against the 'immoral political destabilisation' of BJP. "The subversion of the coalition government...carried out by BJP is one of the most heinous political horse tradings," he said. Earlier today, the Congress-JD(S) alliance lost the trust vote in the state Assembly.

column2: Delhi vernacular gaming platform WinZO raises ₹35 crore
column3: Delhi-based vernacular gaming platform WinZO has raised around ₹35 crore in Series A funding round led by early-stage VC firm Kalaari Capital and messaging platform Hike. WinZO was founded in 2018 by IIM-Calcutta alumnus Paavan Nanda and Saumya Singh Rathore. It offers over 30 games, which it acquires from developers and studios across the world, in 10 languages.

column2: 272 foreigners, NRIs conferred Padma awards since 1954: Govt
column3: MoS for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai on Tuesday said that 272 foreigners, Non-Resident Indians, Overseas Citizens of India and Indian-origin people have been conferred with the Padma awards since 1954. "The award is presented...to those who...do extraordinary works and...become an example for...society," Rai said. Anyone without distinction of race, occupation, position or sex is eligible, Rai said.

column2: Working on compulsory retirement for lazy officials: Uttarakhand CM
column3: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Trivendra Singh Rawat on Monday said that the state government is working on a scheme to give compulsory retirement to officials who are lazy and avoid work. There are frequent complaints about officials being slothful and loathe to work, Rawat said. Rawat further said that changing the prevailing work culture among government officials is a necessity.

column2: Rise in govt borrowing can squeeze corporate sector: Viral Acharya
column3: Outgoing RBI Deputy Governor Viral Acharya criticised rising government borrowing saying it risks flooding debt market and makes borrowing more expensive for firms. He added India's borrowing has ranged from 67-85% relative to output since 2000, higher than many emerging markets including China. He also said India should cut back on subsidies and programs that are not delivering long-term growth.

column2: K'taka govt falls as Congress-JD(S) alliance fails to prove majority
column3: Congress-JD(S) alliance government in Karnataka failed to prove majority in the Assembly during the floor test on Tuesday. The Congress-JD(S) alliance received 99 votes against the BJP's 105. This comes after the Supreme Court said rebel MLAs can't be forced to attend the trust vote.

column2: Kumaraswamy resigns as Karnataka CM after Cong-JD(S) govt falls
column3: Amid the political crisis in the state, Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy on Tuesday resigned from the post after meeting Governor Vajubhai Vala. The resignation came after Kumaraswamy-led Congress-JD(S) government lost the trust vote in the Karnataka Assembly. Vala accepted Kumaraswamy's resignation and asked him to continue as the caretaker CM "until alternative arrangements are made".

column2: Deadline for filing Income Tax Returns extended to August 31
column3: The Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) on Tuesday extended the due date for filing Income Tax Returns for individuals for FY2018-19 from July 31 to August 31. Earlier, the deadline for employers to provide Form 16 to their employees was extended from June 15 to July 10. This extension had left only 21 days for employees to file returns.

column2: Rahul Bose charged ₹442 for two bananas at 5-star hotel, shares bill
column3: Actor Rahul Bose on Monday shared a video from JW Marriott hotel in Chandigarh, in which he said he was charged ₹442.50 for two bananas he ordered at the hotel's gym and even showed the bill. "They're just too good for me. Well done JW Marriott, Chandigarh," Bose said. "Who said fruit wasn’t harmful to your existence?" he added.

column2: Vin Diesel's stunt double falls 30 ft on his head while filming stunt
column3: Hollywood actor Vin Diesel's 'Fast & Furious 9' stunt double Joe Watts fell at least 30 feet on his head while performing a stunt. It is feared that a safety cable snapped as Joe leapt off a balcony and he suffered serious head injuries. Joe's fiancée wrote, "He's in an induced coma. He is stable and is being monitored closely."

column2: Test jerseys to have names, numbers for 1st time, England share pics
column3: For the first time in 142 years of Test cricket, cricketers will wear jerseys with names and numbers on them. England and Wales Cricket Board released the first look of England's Ashes Test jersey on Instagram, writing, "Happy to see names and numbers on the back of Test shirts?" The first Ashes Test will begin on August 1.

column2: TikTok deletes 60 lakh Indian videos for violating policy
column3: Bytedance-owned lip-syncing video platform TikTok has removed about 60 lakh video clips that violated its content protocol in India. The government had issued a notice to TikTok last week along with a set of questions, warning that a failure to answer and justify the queries could lead to a ban. The platform was accused of facilitating "anti-national" and obscene content.

column2: Game Of Karma: BJP after HD Kumaraswamy's govt falls in Karnataka
column3: After HD Kumaraswamy-led Congress-JD(S) alliance government in Karnataka failed to prove majority in the Karnataka Assembly, the official Twitter account of BJP Karnataka wrote, "Game Of Karma." "It’s the victory of people of Karnataka. It’s the end of an era of corrupt & unholy alliance. We promise a stable & able governance to the people of Karnataka," it further wrote.

column2: We have 105 MLAs, we will form a stable govt in Karnataka: BJP
column3: After the Congress-JD(S) coalition government failed to prove its majority in Karnataka Assembly on Tuesday, the BJP said that it has 105 MLAs and it will form a stable government in the state. BJP leader Jagadish Shettar said that rebel MLAs of the Congress-JD(s) alliance have to decide whether to join BJP or not after the Speaker accepts their resignations.

column2: Wholesale trade is a problem, not retail: Siddaramaiah on rebel MLAs
column3: Ex-Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah on Tuesday took a jibe at rebel Congress-JD(S) MLAs, saying that the wholesale trade is a problem. He added that the rebel MLAs who indulged in "wholesale trade" will be disqualified. "If there is retail trade of one or two members then it's not a problem," Siddaramaiah said. Notably, Karnataka's coalition government failed the floor test today.

column2: Chandrayaan-2 in good health, moving in right direction: ISRO
column3: Updating on the status of the nation's second Moon mission aimed at India's first soft landing on Moon, ISRO said the Chandrayaan-2 is in "good health" and moving in the "right direction". If successful, it'll make India the fourth country to accomplish a Moon landing, on September 7. India will also become the first-ever to land near Moon's south pole.

column2: Pakistan willing to give up nuclear weapons if India does: Pak PM
column3: When asked during an interview how would Pakistan respond if India said it was giving up its nuclear weapons, Pakistan PM Imran Khan said that his country would also be willing to give up its nuclear weapons. "Nuclear war is not an option. And between Pakistan and India, the idea of nuclear war is actually self-destruction", Khan added.

column2: Former Chinese Premier known as 'Butcher of Beijing' dies aged 90
column3: Former Chinese Premier Li Peng died of an illness on Monday at the age of 90, the state media reported. Peng was referred to as the "Butcher of Beijing" for his role in the Tiananmen Square crackdown on pro-democracy protesters in 1989. He served as China's fourth Premier from 1987 to 1998 and held several posts in the Communist Party.

column2: After World Bank, China-led development bank drops Amaravati funding
column3: China-backed Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB) has pulled $200 million of funding for Andhra Pradesh's new capital Amaravati. This comes after the World Bank withdrew $300 million of funding after the central government dropped support for the Amaravati project. The two were due to provide the majority of the $715 million cost of funding for transport, sanitation and water supply.

column2: India should ease law on hiring and firing workers: Panagariya
