column3: Former NITI Aayog Vice Chairman Arvind Panagariya has said India should ease norms for hiring and firing workers to make it easier for companies to do business. The government has proposed combining multiple laws governing workers to form four sets of labour codes. What's needed is the reform of labour laws and not just streamlining of existing ones, Panagariya added.

column2: IMF cuts India's 2019-20 GDP growth forecast to 7% from 7.3%
column3: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Tuesday revised downward India's growth forecast for 2019-20 to 7% from 7.3% due to "a weaker-than-expected outlook for domestic demand". The projection was slashed by 30 bps to 7.2% for the next financial year too. Notably, the World Bank forecast India's GDP to grow by 7.5% during the current and next two financial years.

column2: ICC bars four Zimbabwe women cricketers to play in England
column3: The ICC has barred four Zimbabwe women cricketers including national team's captain Mary-Anne Musonda from travelling to England to represent Women's Global Development Squad. This comes days after the ICC suspended Zimbabwe Cricket on grounds of political interference in its cricketing affairs. Coach Adam Chifo, who was set to accompany the players, was also barred from participating.

column2: Navdeep Saini should also be in India Test team: Munaf Patel
column3: Reacting to fast bowler Navdeep Saini being included in India's ODI and T20I teams, former fast bowler Munaf Patel said that the 26-year-old should be in Test team as well. "He is the only bowler who can bowl at 150 kmph," he added. Navdeep, who represents Delhi in the domestic circuit, has picked up 120 wickets in 43 first-class matches.

column2: Chelsea beat Barcelona 2-1 in pre-season friendly match
column3: Chelsea beat Barcelona 2-1 in the sides' pre-season friendly match on Tuesday. Barcelona fielded their new signing, French forward Antoine Griezmann, while Chelsea played Tammy Abraham, who scored in the first half of the match. Chelsea sealed the match in the 81st minute when Ross Barkley scored the winner from the edge of the area.

column2: FB removes fake accounts claiming to sell unreleased crypto Libra
column3: Facebook has removed several accounts, pages and groups posing to be official hubs offering its unreleased cryptocurrency Libra. "There's a deep irony...Facebook being used as the platform that could undermine trust in the currency Facebook is trying to build trust in," Cornell University Professor Eswar Prasad said. About a dozen fake hubs were spotted in total, including across Instagram.

column2: Allow only those with less than 3 kids to contest polls: Lok Sabha MP
column3: Lok Sabha MP Hanuman Beniwal has said that only those with less than three kids should be allowed to contest elections. Speaking on the bill to amend the Motor Vehicle Act, Beniwal said India’s rising population is one of the reasons for higher road accidents. India should adopt a three-child policy if not the two-child policy of China, Beniwal added.

column2: Former PayU India MD Jitendra Gupta joins BharatPe board
column3: Jitendra Gupta, former Managing Director of Naspers' fintech arm PayU's India unit, has been appointed to New Delhi-based fintech startup BharatPe's board. He will be joining BharatPe Co-founders Ashneer Grover and Shashvat Nakrani, Sequoia's Harshjit Sethi and Beenext's Teruhide Sato on the board. Gupta had co-founded Citrus Pay in 2011, which was later acquired by PayU India for $130 million.

column2: Terror incidents down by 86% in J&K in last decade: Govt
column3: MoS for Home Affairs G Kishan Reddy on Tuesday said the number of terror incidents in Jammu and Kashmir have reduced by 86% in the last decade from 23,290 to 3,187. Terrorist initiated incidents reduced by 28% and actions initiated by security forces increased by 59% in first half of 2019 as compared to first half of 2018, Reddy said.

column2: Vande Bharat completes test run from Delhi to Katra in 8 hrs
column3: India's fastest train Vande Bharat Express on Tuesday successfully completed its test run from New Delhi to Katra in eight hours. The train can run up to a maximum speed of 160 km per hour. Vande Bharat Express has features like Wi-Fi, bio-vacuum toilets, hot case, freezer and GPS-based passenger information system among other amenities.

column2: Trump accepts Imran Khan's invitation to visit Pakistan: PTI
column3: Pakistan's ruling Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) party has said that US President Donald Trump has accepted PM Imran Khan's offer to visit Pakistan. Khan extended the invitation to Trump during his first official trip to the US. "The two leaders had a one-on-one meeting, which was followed by delegation-level talks between the two sides," PTI said.

column2: IndiGo founders working towards a compromise deal: Reports
column3: IndiGo Co-Founders Rakesh Gangwal and Rahul Bhatia, involved in a dispute, are reportedly working towards a compromise. Reports said both parties are discussing the board's composition which will be expanded up to 10 members and a mechanism where related party transactions (RPT) would need independent directors' approval. Gangwal had accused Bhatia of entering into "questionable" RPTs with IndiGo.

column2: Section 144 imposed in B'luru for 48 hrs, wine shops shut till 25th
column3: Bengaluru Police Commissioner Alok Kumar on Tuesday said, "Today and tomorrow we're imposing Section 144 across the city." "All pubs, wine shops will be closed till 25th. If anyone is found violating these rules, they'll be punished," he added. The decision comes after Congress and BJP workers clashed at Race Course Road in Bengaluru ahead of the Karnataka trust vote.

column2: Stokes turns down 'New Zealander of the Year' nomination
column3: New Zealand-born England all-rounder Ben Stokes has said he's flattered to be nominated for 'New Zealander of the Year' award but it doesn't "sit right" with him. "I've helped England lift World Cup and my life is firmly established in UK [since I was 12]," he added. He further said that New Zealand captain Kane Williamson would be "worthy recipient".

column2: If there can be help, it'd be good: Farooq on Trump's offer to mediate
column3: National Conference President Farooq Abdullah has said if there can be some help in resolving Kashmir issue, it'd be good. This comes after US President Donald Trump claimed PM Narendra Modi asked him to help with the dispute. Abdullah added, "I congratulate Modiji, he too wants to use everything to solve this issue that's creating tensions between India and Pakistan."

column2: Anand Piramal invests in Snapdeal
column3: Gurugram-based e-commerce startup Snapdeal has raised an undisclosed amount of funding from Piramal Group's Executive Director Anand Piramal. The investment has been made by Anand Piramal in his personal capacity. Snapdeal recently said that its consolidated revenue rose by about 73% while losses fell nearly 71% year-on-year in FY19.

column2: ISRO to launch India's 1st solar mission in first half of 2020
column3: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) has announced the nation's first mission to the Sun, Aditya-L1, aimed at studying its corona. ISRO Chairman K Sivan had revealed the mission is planned to be launched in the first half of 2020. Aditya-L1 satellite will be inserted in a halo orbit around 'L1', 1.5 million kilometres away from the Earth.

column2: Only 7 IAS officers among 33 new joint secretaries appointed by govt
column3: The government has appointed 33 new joint secretaries in the Centre out of which only seven are from Indian Administrative Service (IAS) and four from Indian Revenue Service (IRS). The government brought officers from other services like Indian Railway Service of Mechanical Engineers, Indian Post and Telecommunication Accounts and Finance Service and Indian Defence Accounts Service, among others.

column2: Surprised by India's reaction to Trump's offer of mediation: Pak PM
column3: Pakistan's Prime Minister Imran Khan said on Tuesday that he was "surprised" by the reaction of India to US President Donald Trump's offer to mediate between India and Pakistan on the Kashmir issue. "Kashmir conflict...has held subcontinent hostage for 70 years. Generations of Kashmiris have suffered and are suffering daily and need conflict resolution," he further said in a tweet.

column2: Sad India is on top in deaths due to road accidents: Nitin Gadkari
column3: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday said that over five lakh road accidents occur in India annually in which about one lakh people die. "It's sad that India is on top in the number of deaths due to road accidents," Gadkari said, while taking up an amendment bill in the Parliament, seeking increased penalties for offences such as drunk driving.

column2: Baby visits PM Narendra Modi in Parliament, pictures go viral
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday shared two pictures of himself playing with a baby who, the Prime Minister said, came to meet him in the Parliament today. PM Modi called the baby "a very special friend" in his social media posts. The child pictured with PM Modi was identified as the grandchild of BJP MP Satyanarayan Jatiya.

column2: Who is Boris Johnson, the UK's new Prime Minister?
column3: Boris Johnson, the UK's new Prime Minister-designate, rose to prominence in public life when he was the Mayor of London from 2008 to 2016. Johnson has been a supporter of Brexit and vowed to withdraw the UK from the European Union on October 31. The 55-year-old worked as a journalist before entering politics.

column2: S Korea fired 360 shots at Russian plane that entered its airspace
column3: South Korean warplanes fired as many as 360 warning shots at a Russian military aircraft that entered South Korean airspace on Tuesday, an official at South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff (JCS) said. However, the Russian Defence Ministry said in a statement that no warning shots were fired from the South Korean warplanes.

column2: Afghanistan seeks clarification after Trump says could wipe it out
column3: Afghanistan has sought clarification from the US after President Donald Trump said he could wipe the country off the face of the Earth. "Afghanistan has not and will never allow any foreign power to determine its fate," Afghan presidential palace said. "If we wanted to fight a war in Afghanistan...I could win the war in a week," Trump had said.

column2: Panel proposes up to ₹25 cr fine, 10-year jail for cryptocurrency use
column3: A government panel has recommended a fine of up to ₹25 crore and imprisonment for up to 10 years for anyone who mines, generates, holds, sells, transfers or issues cryptocurrency. "There is no underlying intrinsic value of these private cryptocurrencies," the panel, headed by Finance Secretary SC Garg, said. It asked the government to consider launching an official digital currency.

column2: Rio champ Ledecky withdraws from 200m, 1,500m freestyle at WC
column3: American swimmer Katie Ledecky has withdrawn from the 200 metres freestyle and will miss her 1,500 metres title defence at the World Aquatics Championships due to illness. Ledecky, who had won Olympic gold in the 200m, 400m and 800m events at the Rio Olympics, had been feeling under the weather since arriving in South Korea last week.

column2: England include Jason Roy, Olly Stone for Test vs Ireland
column3: England have included Jason Roy and Olly Stone for the one-off four-day England-Ireland Test that is set to be held at Lord's. Roy and Stone will be making their Test debuts in the match ahead of the upcoming Ashes series. Joe Denly, who was dropped for the final 15-man squad for the World Cup, will also take the field.

column2: FINA warns Australian swimmer over podium snub to Chinese rival
column3: Swimming's international governing body FINA has issued a warning to Australian swimmer Mack Horton after his refusal to share the podium with Chinese rival Sun Yang at the World Aquatics Championships in South Korea on Sunday. The warning stated that athletes should not use FINA events to make personal statements or gestures.

column2: PM should clarify Trump's remark on Kashmir mediation: TMC
column3: TMC MP Derek O'Brien on Tuesday said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi should personally clarify US President Donald Trump's remark on Kashmir mediation. This comes after the External Affairs Ministry refuted Trump's claim, adding that all talks with Pakistan are discussed bilaterally. The Rajya Sabha was adjourned till 3 pm due to the ruckus created by lawmakers over Trump's remark.

column2: MHA removes CRPF cover for Lalu Yadav, Rajiv Pratap Rudy
column3: Union Home Ministry has downgraded the security cover of some politicians like RJD leader Lalu Prasad Yadav, BJP MP Rajiv Pratap Rudy, among others. The decision was taken after a comprehensive review of the VIP protectees, provided security by the Central Armed Police Forces. As per reports, Z+ security for Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav has also been withdrawn.

column2: BJP MLA condemns Cong minister's remark calling cow 'animal'
column3: BJP MLA Vasudev Devnani on Tuesday condemned Congress Minister Shanti Kumar Dhariwal's remark calling cow an 'animal' and hurting sentiments of the people. "Dhariwal's comment on cow...is condemnable. The cow is worshipped as a mother in this country," he said. Earlier, Dhariwal had said that cow is a 'highly useful animal' but there is no sense in worshipping it.

column2: 5 arrested for shooting 30-yr-old woman in Delhi: Police
column3: Five people, including two contract killers, have been arrested in connection with shooting a 30-year-old woman in Delhi's Dwarka, police said. According to the police, two contract killers were hired by the woman's acquaintances to kill her. The woman sustained injuries on her neck and is currently undergoing treatment in a hospital, the police added.

column2: 2 students held for thrashing junior over his friendship with girl
column3: Two college students were arrested for allegedly thrashing a junior student over his friendship with a girl in Maharashtra, police said. The girl was a friend of one of the accused but broke up with him sometime back, an official said. The police added that the two accused forcefully took the boy to a secluded place and beat him up.

column2: Kingpin of drugs trade in state yet to be identified: Goa CM
column3: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Tuesday said that the police has been making efforts to nab the kingpin of the drugs trade in the state. "We're yet to identify the main supplier...but are making all efforts to find him," he added. Sawant claimed that drugs like 'charas' and 'ganja' aren't cultivated in Goa and are being smuggled from neighbouring regions.

column2: 3 forced to eat excreta over suspected witchcraft in J'khand
column3: Three people, including two women, were allegedly thrashed and forced to consume human excreta over the suspicion of practicing witchcraft in Jharkhand's Giridih, police said on Tuesday. Police have arrested four persons in connection with the case while one accused is currently absconding. The accused reportedly suspected that the victims performed rituals that made people fall ill in the area.

column2: India in far better place than most major economies: RBI Guv
column3: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said India is currently in a far better position than most other major economies, and signs for economic growth recovery are looking good. "This year we've projected 7% [GDP growth]. There was uncertainty...but now monsoon outlook has improved...oil prices remain in $65-range," he added. RBI had cut its 2019-20 GDP growth forecast from 7.2% to 7%.

column2: Air India plans to revive all 17 grounded planes by October
column3: Debt-laden Air India is planning to bring all its 17 grounded planes back into operation by October-end for maximising revenue, Chairman Ashwani Lohani said. Of the 17 planes which were grounded for up to a year due to lack of maintenance and repair funds, eight would begin operations by August-end. The government recently said it's committed to Air India's disinvestment.

column2: JPMorgan to shut one of its Indian NBFCs, surrenders licence
column3: American financial services firm JPMorgan is shutting its non-banking financial company (NBFC) JPMorgan Advisors India. "We surrendered the licence as we aren't conducting any business in this firm and will move for closure," JPMorgan said. "We are not exiting our NBFC business. We continue to operate an NBFC in India known as JPMorgan Securities India," the company added.

column2: Boris Johnson elected UK Prime Minister
column3: Boris Johnson was on Tuesday elected as the leader of Britain's governing Conservative Party and the country's next Prime Minister. Johnson will formally take over as Prime Minister on Wednesday, succeeding Theresa May, who stepped down over her failure to get parliament to ratify her Brexit deal. Johnson has in the past served as UK foreign minister and London's Mayor.

column2: SC extends deadline to publish final Assam NRC list to August 31
column3: The Supreme Court on Tuesday extended the deadline to publish the final list of National Register of Citizens (NRC) in Assam from July 31 to August 31. This was after the state NRC coordinator Prateek Hajela had requested the extension, citing floods. The court, however, rejected the Centre's request to allow re-verification of names included in the NRC.

column2: Was stopped at US airport for over 3hrs due to Iranian roots: Actress
column3: 'Sacred Games' actress Elnaaz Norouzi has claimed she was stopped at Chicago airport and had to stay in immigration for over 3 hours and undergo lengthy interrogation due to her "Iranian roots". "Trump has put...ban on [Iranians]...they don't get ESTA anymore," Elnaaz, who holds a German passport, added. She claimed she missed her connecting flight due to the interrogation.

column2: Muslims hearing 'kabristan or Pakistan' for 70 years: Azam Khan
column3: Reacting to Samajwadi Party MLA Nahid Hasan's 'boycott pro-BJP shopkeepers' remark, party leader Azam Khan said, "It is a sad thing that such a situation arose. But...Who had started this?" "For the last 70 years, we (Muslims) have been hearing either 'go to kabristan (grave)' or 'go to Pakistan'. Who is responsible for it?" he asked.

column2: Lalu's son Tej dresses up as Lord Shiva to offer prayers, shares pics
column3: Former Bihar CM Lalu Prasad Yadav's son Tej Pratap Yadav on Monday dressed up as Lord Shiva to offer prayers at a Patna temple and shared his pictures on social media. He also shared a video of himself offering the prayers. Earlier this month, he warned he will "rip apart" those spreading rumours of rift with his brother Tejashwi Yadav.

column2: OYO Founder to get $2-billion loan from Japan's Nomura, Mizuho
column3: OYO Founder, 25-year-old Ritesh Agarwal, is receiving a $2-billion loan from three Japanese lenders including Nomura, Mizuho and an unknown bank, to purchase the Gurugram-based budget hospitality startup's shares. Agarwal is purchasing a $1.5-billion stake from early OYO investors Lightspeed Venture Partners and Sequoia India. He will be investing the rest $500 million in the startup.

column2: Sachin Bansal puts ₹25 cr in microfinance firm Chaitanya India
column3: Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal has invested ₹25 crore in microfinance firm Chaitanya India, run by Chaitanya Rural Intermediation Development Services, regulatory filings revealed. This comes months after a report said BAC Acquisitions, a fund co-founded by Bansal, was looking to acquire about 75% stake in Chaitanya India. Sachin Bansal could be Chaitanya's new CEO, the report had claimed.

column2: NASA replies after criticism over tweet congratulating ISRO
column3: NASA has responded after criticism for its tweet in which it congratulated ISRO for the successful launch of 'Chandrayaan-2'. After Twitter users claimed that NASA was "boasting about its own capabilities" in the congratulatory tweet, NASA replied, "We're proud to support international exploration missions & see what they learn. The principle of global cooperation is one of our guiding philosophies."

column2: 251-metre-tall Ram statue in Ayodhya to be world's tallest: UP CM
column3: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday said that a 251-metre-tall statue of Lord Ram will be built in Ayodhya, which he claimed will be the world's tallest statue. At 251 metres, it'll stand taller than the 182-metre-tall Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel statue (Statue of Unity) in Gujarat. Yogi Adityanath said the Ram statue would be installed on a 100-acre site.

column2: BJP leader, wife & son shot dead at their home in Jharkhand
column3: Local BJP leader, Mago Munda, along with his wife and son, was shot dead by unidentified assailants at his house in Jharkhand's Khunti district on Monday night. Munda was a member of the state working committee of the ST morcha of the party and the vice president of the Murhu block level 20-point programme implementation committee.

column2: Kashmir issue will never be resolved bilaterally: Pak PM Imran Khan
column3: Pakistan PM Imran Khan said in an interview that the issue of Kashmir will never be resolved bilaterally. Khan's statement came after US President Donald Trump offered to mediate on the Kashmir issue, claiming PM Narendra Modi had also requested him to. However, India has denied Trump's claim, reiterating that all issues with Pakistan are to be resolved bilaterally.

column2: India's crude oil output in June falls to lowest in four months
column3: India's crude oil production in June fell 6.8% from a year earlier to about 2.69 million tonnes, the lowest since February, government data showed. Further, Indian refiners processed 20.30 million tonnes of crude oil in June, down 7.1% from last year. Reliance Industries' Jamnagar refinery and Indian Oil's Barauni refinery were among the key refineries affected by shutdowns in June.

column2: Zimbabwe all-rounder Solomon Mire announces retirement
column3: Following the suspension of Zimbabwe Cricket by the ICC, Zimbabwe's all-rounder Solomon Mire has announced his retirement from cricket. Mire featured in 47 ODIs, nine T20Is and two Tests for Zimbabwe, scoring 955, 253 and 78 runs in the formats respectively. "Representing my country at the highest level for me has been the highest honour and service," Mire wrote.

column2: China's Boxing Federation names Mayweather as 'special adviser'
column3: According to the Chinese Boxing Federation, retired American boxer Floyd Mayweather has agreed to become a "special adviser" to the Chinese Olympic boxing team to help them prepare for the Tokyo Olympics in 2020. China had won four medals in boxing events at the 2016 Summer Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro.

column2: James Anderson ruled out of one-off Test vs Ireland
column3: English pacer James Anderson has been ruled out of the one-off England-Ireland four-day Test to be held at Lord's. Anderson has failed to recover from the injury sustained to his right leg when playing for his county Lancashire against Durham on July 2. Anderson will continue to be assessed ahead of the first Ashes Test at Edgbaston on August 1.

column2: Facebook admits Messenger Kids app bug let kids talk to strangers
column3: Facebook has admitted that a security flaw on its chat platform dedicated to children, Messenger Kids, could let them talk with strangers who hadn't been approved by their parents. The flaw let group chat admins add their approved contacts to the group, even if they weren't approved by other group member's parent. Facebook said it has closed affected chats.

column2: Andhra Pradesh Dy Speaker suspends 3 TDP MLAs from Assembly
column3: Andhra Pradesh Deputy Speaker Kona Raghupathi suspended three TDP MLAs from the Assembly for obstructing the proceedings of the House. The MLAs started protesting after not being satisfied with the explanation given by the YSRCP over its promise of granting a pension to minority communities' women over the age of 45. They were suspended for the rest of the session.

column2: It's time for Rahul, his young team to rebuild Cong: Digvijaya
column3: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh said that the time has come for party leader Rahul Gandhi and his "young team" to take over and rebuild the party. He added that the party has always encouraged young leadership and now the team should take BJP/RSS ideology head-on. He said the team should save the country from this "ideology of hate and violence".

column2: PM Modi-led govt fully corruption-free: Harsimrat Kaur
column3: Union Minister Harsimrat Kaur Badal on Tuesday said that PM Narendra Modi-led central government is fully "corruption-free". She added that the Ministry of Food Processing Industries registered zero cases of corruption due to strong steps taken against the menace by the Centre. She further said, "The Prime Minister had announced that 'na khaunga, na khane dunga'."

column2: Panchayat Raj officer caught taking bribe in Andhra Pradesh
column3: A Panchayat Raj officer was caught red-handed by the Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) while taking a bribe for a transfer order in Andhra Pradesh's Srikakulam. The officer had demanded ₹10,000 for the transfer of a senior assistant at the department and later finalised a deal for ₹5,000. The senior assistant informed the ACB, who caught the officer taking the money.

column2: Air Force officer alleges online fraud, says duped of ₹75,000
column3: An Indian Air Force official was allegedly duped of ₹75,000 by an online fraudster, who posed as an Army jawan. As per the FIR registered on Tuesday, Squadron Leader Ravinder Yadav got a call from a man regarding an advertisement by Yadav for sale of furniture. After the deal was finalised, the man allegedly defrauded ₹75,000 during the online payment.

column2: Woman accuses husband of giving triple talaq; seeks help from PM
column3: A woman named Rabiya Rao in Uttar Pradesh has accused her husband of giving her triple talaq in 2017 and forcing her to marry either his brother or his uncle. "I wrote...to PM Narendra Modi to seek help...I even met the UP CM....but I'm still struggling to get justice," she said. The police have registered an FIR in this matter.

column2: Slippers left after Scarlett Keeling's murder led to man's conviction
column3: A pair of orange slippers that beach shack worker Samson D'Souza left behind as he hurriedly abandoned British teenager Scarlett Keeling on Goa's Anjuna beach led to his conviction in the 11-year-old murder case. D'Souza was accused of drugging and sexually assaulting Keeling before leaving her to die. The Bombay High Court last week sentenced him to 10 years' imprisonment.

column2: Imran Khan admits Pak knew about Osama's presence on its soil
column3: In an interview during his visit to the US, Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan admitted that the country knew about the presence of al-Qaeda chief Osama bin Laden on its soil. Pakistan's spy agency ISI provided information to the CIA, which helped the US track down Osama, Khan claimed. Pakistan had previously denied having any knowledge of Osama's presence.

column2: Avatar maker congratulates Avengers on becoming top-grossing film
column3: 'Avatar' director James Cameron has congratulated 'Avengers: Endgame' makers after it surpassed the record of 'Avatar' to become the highest-grossing film of all time. "Congratulations to Avengers: Endgame on becoming the new box-office king," the text accompanying a picture of Iron Man with Pandora's creatures read. Cameron also congratulated Marvel when it broke the record of his other film 'Titanic'.

column2: Was waiting for announcement, disappointed at not being picked: Gill
column3: After failing to make it to Team India squads for West Indies tour, 19-year-old batsman Shubman Gill said he was expecting to be selected for at least one of the squads. "I was waiting for the team to be announced...It was disappointing not to get picked," he added. "I'm not going to spend time thinking over it," he further said.

column2: Ashwin takes wicket with unique action, video goes viral
column3: A video of Dindigul Dragons captain Ravichandran Ashwin taking a wicket with a unique action against Madurai Panthers in TNPL-4 has gone viral. Ashwin hid the ball behind his back till the last moment and delivered it while keeping his left hand almost motionless. The batsman was deceived by the slow flight of the ball and got caught at long-leg.

column2: Ronaldo to not face criminal charges in 10-year-old rape case
column3: Juventus forward Cristiano Ronaldo won't face criminal charges over allegations he raped a woman at a Las Vegas hotel in 2009, according to prosecutors. Clark County District Attorney Steve Wolfson said there isn't enough evidence to prove the allegations beyond reasonable doubt. Police said that the initial investigation was closed in 2009 after the woman did not reveal Ronaldo's identity.

column2: Apple in talks to buy Intel's modem biz for over $1 bn: Report
column3: Apple is in advanced talks to buy Intel's smartphone modem business for $1 billion or more, The Wall Street Journal reported. This comes weeks after a report had claimed the iPhone maker was in talks to acquire part of the chipmaker's modem business, Intel's "struggling" Germany unit. Notably, Apple has entered into a six-year licensing agreement with Intel-rival Qualcomm.

column2: SP MLA clarifies his 'boycott pro-BJP shopkeepers' remark
column3: Uttar Pradesh Samajwadi Party MLA Nahid Hasan claimed that different meaning was attached to his 'boycott pro-BJP shopkeepers' remark. He linked his remark to demolition of stalls of "poor vendors" due to development projects. "I had said 'the BJP shopkeepers' because the BJP is in power now and some of its leaders are involved in things like this," Hasan added.

column2: I was the reason MTB Nagaraj got a ticket: Congress' DK Shivakumar
column3: Congress leader DK Shivakumar has said in Karnataka Assembly that he was the reason MTB Nagaraj got a ticket from Congress. Shivakumar added, "Couldn't we have locked them (rebel MLAs) up? No, because we have trust in them. Bring them here, let them vote against this government." Notably, Speaker has ordered to complete the trust vote by 6 pm today.

column2: Impossible that PM Modi will ask anyone to mediate on Kashmir: Tharoor
column3: While taking a dig at US President Donald Trump over his recent claims that PM Narendra Modi asked him to mediate on the Kashmir issue, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said, "Trump doesn't know what's he saying." "Impossible that (PM) Modi will ask anyone else to mediate because it's our clear policy that we don't want a third-party mediation," he added.

column2: PM must tell nation what transpired: Rahul on Trump's mediation claim
column3: Talking about US President Donald Trump's remarks on Kashmir mediation, Congress President Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "Trump says PM (Narendra) Modi asked him to mediate between India & Pakistan on Kashmir!" "A weak Foreign Ministry denial won't do. PM must tell the nation what transpired in the meeting between him & [Trump]," he added, referring to their meeting amid G20 Summit.

column2: We're hungry: K'taka MLAs tell Speaker in order to delay trust vote
column3: As Karnataka Assembly session began at 11 am and continued till 10:30 pm, several JD(S)-Congress coalition MLAs told the Speaker to adjourn the House citing that they were all "very hungry". "I am willing to order food from a hotel, eat and continue," Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar said. Eventually, the Assembly was adjourned at 11:30 pm.

column2: AI research lab OpenAI raises $1 billion from Microsoft
column3: San Francisco-based AI research lab OpenAI has raised $1 billion from Microsoft. "Our ambition is to democratise AI, while always keeping AI safety front and centre, so everyone can benefit," Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella said. OpenAI was Co-founded by Elon Musk in 2015, who left its board and daily operations in 2018 to avoid a conflict of interest with Tesla.

column2: In no hurry to exit firms in India: SoftBank Vision Fund
column3: SoftBank Vision Fund's Managing Partner Munish Varma said the fund is in no hurry to list the Indian companies it has invested in. "Globally, we've had a number of companies that went public - Uber and Slack to name a few," Varma said. "As India grows, the plan is the same...We'll take them public when the time's right," he added.

column2: UP man hiding from dogs set on fire on being mistaken for thief; dies
column3: A 28-year-old man succumbed to his injuries at a Lucknow hospital four days after he was mistaken for a thief and stripped, thrashed and set on fire in UP's Barabanki. He was going to his in-laws' place on Thursday when stray dogs forced him to hide in a shed outside a house. Five people have been charged with his murder.

column2: Policeman jumps into Ganga to save drowning man; dept shares video
column3: Uttarakhand Police has shared a video of a policeman jumping into Ganga river to save a Haryana-based man from drowning. The man had gone for a dip when he slipped and fell into the river. He was being carried away by the current of the river when the policeman saw him and jumped in to save his life.

column2: Son, wife jailed for 2 yrs for illegally evicting mother from house
column3: A court in Telangana's Rangareddy has convicted a man and his wife for illegally evicting his mother out of her house and threatening and insulting her. The court sentenced the couple to two years of rigorous imprisonment and imposed a ₹10,000 penalty on each of them. The mother had approached police in 2015, accusing her elder son in the case.

column2: South Korea fires at Russian aircraft that entered its airspace
column3: The South Korean military fired warning shots at Russian military aircraft that entered South Korean airspace on Tuesday, the Ministry of National Defence in Seoul said. The South Korean government would lodge an official complaint with Russia, the Ministry added. It was the first time Russian military aircraft violated South Korean airspace, an official said.

column2: Afghanistan would be wiped off if US fights a war there: Trump
column3: US President Donald Trump has said if the US wanted to fight a war in Afghanistan and win it, the country could win it in a week. "Afghanistan would be wiped off the face of Earth...literally in 10 days," he added. However, he further said, "I just don't want to kill 10 million people...I don't want to go that route."

column2: Relations with Pak improved after we ended $1.3 billion aid: Trump
column3: During his meeting with Pakistan PM Imran Khan, US President Donald Trump said relations between the two countries improved after the US ended the $1.3 billion aid that it had been giving to Pakistan. "We were paying $1.3 billion...Pakistan was not doing anything for us," Trump added. US ended the aid after Pakistan failed to combat terrorism on its soil.

column2: Naxal, with ₹1 L reward, killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh
column3: A Naxal, carrying a reward of ₹1 lakh, was killed in an encounter with security forces in Chhattisgarh's Sukma, police said. It added that the encounter triggered when the security personnel were out on a counter-insurgency exercise and Naxals started firing. The Naxals soon fled the spot and the personnel recovered the body of the Naxal, the police said.

column2: IMD issues red alert for 2 Kerala districts, predicts heavy rains
column3: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert for Kerala's Kannur and Kasargod districts saying that the two districts are expected to receive 'extremely heavy' rains in the next 24 hours. It issued an orange alert for Kozhikode, Malappuram and Wayanad. Schools in Kannur, Kasargod and Malappuram have been closed for today in the view of IMD's warning.

column2: 2 Afghan nationals arrested with 50 kg heroin: Police
column3: The Delhi Police Special Cell arrested two Afghan nationals during a raid at a cold storage located in Haryana's Sonipat and seized around 50 kg of heroin from their possession. The police said that the consignment had reportedly entered India through Wagah-Attari Border. On Friday, the police arrested five people and seized 150 kg of Afghan-origin heroin worth ₹600 crore.

column2: 3 godowns gutted in fire in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi
column3: Three godowns were gutted in a fire on Tuesday in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi, officials said. A bike parked outside one of the buildings was destroyed in the fire and residents of nearby buildings said, they heard blasting noises from the buildings. A fire officer said that they faced problems reaching the spot due to bad roads.

column2: New bills on cyber security, crime against women soon: Govt
column3: G Kishan Reddy, MoS for Home Affairs, on Saturday said that the Centre would soon bring new bills on cybersecurity, cyber terrorism and also to check crimes against women and girls. "Protection of women is a state subject, we shall make amendments to IPC," he added. Reddy further said that the Ministry will have online connectivity with all police stations.

column2: US reverses Trump's offer to mediate, says Kashmir a bilateral issue
column3: Reversing US President Donald Trump's offer to mediate in the Kashmir dispute, US State Department's Acting Assistant Secretary for South and Central Asia Alice Wells said, "Kashmir is a bilateral issue." "Trump administration welcomes Pakistan and India sitting down and the US stands ready to assist," she added. Trump had claimed PM Narendra Modi asked him to mediate.

column2: US lawmaker apologises to Indian envoy for Trump's Kashmir claim
column3: US Congressman Brad Sherman has apologised to Indian Ambassador to the US Harsh V Shringla over President Donald Trump's claim that Prime Minister Narendra Modi had requested him to mediate on Kashmir issue with Pakistan. "Everyone knows PM Modi would never suggest such a thing. Trump's statement is amateurish and delusional. And embarrassing," Sherman tweeted.

column2: SC orders cancellation of registration of Amrapali group of companies
column3: The Supreme Court has ordered cancellation of registration of all Amrapali group of companies and directed Enforcement Directorate to conduct a detailed investigation against the group for diverting home-buyers' money. SC also directed the National Buildings Construction Corporation (NBCC) to complete Amrapali's unfinished housing projects in Noida and Greater Noida and handover these to home-buyers.

column2: PM Modi didn't request Trump to mediate on Kashmir issue: MEA
column3: Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Raveesh Kumar has refuted US President Donald Trump's claim that PM Narendra Modi requested him to mediate on Kashmir issue with Pakistan. "It has been India's consistent position that all outstanding issues with Pakistan are discussed only bilaterally," Kumar tweeted. "Any engagement with Pakistan would require an end to cross border terrorism," he added.

column2: OnePlus 7 now available at EMI offer of ₹1,600 per month
column3: With easy EMI options, the new OnePlus 7 is now available for ₹1600 per month, making it accessible for college students. The smartphone features the Snapdragon 855 for power while RAM boost makes sure your device intelligently adapts to your individual use. It also has a long-standing battery life featuring a 3700 mAh battery that comes with Fast Charge support.

column2: Alum of Great Learning’s PGP-DSE lands job at Fractal Analytics
column3: Sneha upskilled with Great Learning's PG Program in Data Science and landed a job at Fractal Analytics. The program is designed to help early-career professionals become proficient in data science with a curriculum designed by industry experts and taught by leading academicians. Learners get placement assistance and an average salary hike of 65% upon transitioning.

column2: Sex education should be introduced in schools: Sonakshi Sinha
column3: Actress Sonakshi Sinha, while speaking about her upcoming film 'Khandaani Shafakhana', said, "It talks about the importance of sex education, which should be introduced in schools." "We consider ourselves a modern society but we hesitate to talk about sex," she added. Sonakshi will be seen playing a character who is running a fertility clinic in the film.

column2: Ex-Indian Idol judge Anu Malik to return to TV post #MeToo row: Reports
column3: Singer-composer Anu Malik, who had earlier stepped down as the judge of 'Indian Idol' season 10 after being accused of sexual harassment, will return to television with the music reality show 'Superstar Singer', as per reports. "He will make an appearance along with lyricist Sameer in an episode dedicated to the songs composed and written by them," reports stated.

column2: Jofra Archer can succeed in Tests: James Anderson
column3: England pacer James Anderson has said that pacer Jofra Archer has got a great future ahead of him and that he can succeed in Tests. "To come into a World Cup final and deliver under that sort of pressure was amazing to see...especially for such a young guy," he added. Notably, Archer was England's highest wicket-taker in 2019 World Cup.

column2: IIT Madras students create 'agricopter' to spray pesticides in fields
column3: Students at the IIT Madras have developed a 'smart agricopter' to eliminate manual spraying of pesticides in agricultural fields and help identify crop health by using an imaging camera. The agricopter aims to spray pesticides ten times faster than manual spraying. The three students also filed a patent for the agricopter, the estimated cost of which is around ₹5.1 lakh.

column2: Give 4 weeks to appear: Rebel MLAs to Speaker on disqualification plea
column3: Around 13 rebel Karnataka MLAs have written to Assembly Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar seeking four weeks' time to respond to his summons on the disqualification petition moved against them by Congress leader Siddaramaiah. This comes after the Speaker summoned the rebel lawmakers to meet him on Tuesday. Around 16 Congress and JD(S) MLAs had submitted their resignations.

column2: Trust vote should be passed by 6 PM on Tuesday: K'taka Assembly Speaker
column3: Karnataka Assembly Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar unilaterally adjourned the assembly till 10 am on Tuesday after failing to conduct a floor test on Monday. He also set a deadline to complete all the proceedings regarding the floor test by 4 PM on Tuesday and added that the trust vote should be completed by 6 PM.

column2: Man dies of electrocution in Delhi, another dies saving him
column3: Two men were electrocuted after a high-tension overhead cable fell on a water-logged street in south Delhi's Fatehpur Beri on Sunday. A plumber died after the cable got entangled in the bike he was riding, while a 54-year-old carpenter was electrocuted when he rushed to save the plumber. A BSES official said their internal accidents committee is investigating the case.

column2: TN man transfused with HIV+ blood as baby compensated after 20 years
column3: A Chennai court has directed a hospital to pay a compensation of ₹20 lakh to a man who was infected with HIV-positive blood via transfusion as a toddler in 1999. The court also ordered the government to provide employment to the 21-year-old man. It further observed that the loss and physical and mental injury caused to the family is irretrievable.

column2: Resignation letter fake, someone forged my signatures: Karnataka CM
column3: After a letter claiming to be a resignation note by Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy went viral on social media, the Chief Minister said that the letter is fake. He alleged that the BJP created the letter and circulated it on internet. The letter had claimed that the Chief Minister was resigning due to personal reasons.

column2: I like Pakistani reporters much better than US reporters: Trump
column3: During his meeting with Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan in the White House, US President Donald Trump asked a reporter if he is from Pakistan. He further said, "I want a couple of Pakistani reporters. I like them much better than our [US] reporters." The US President has in the past called his country's media "fake" and "dishonest".

column2: Rahul Gandhi is and will be captain of Congress: Ashok Gehlot
column3: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Monday said that Rahul Gandhi is still the captain of the Congress and will remain so in future. "[Rahul] had the guts to take on the BJP and Prime Minister Narendra Modi," said Gehlot. Gehlot refused to comment on the Congress Working Committee's decision on appointing a new chief following Rahul Gandhi's public resignation.

column2: Kalraj Mishra takes oath as Governor of Himachal Pradesh
column3: Former Union Minister Kalraj Mishra on Monday took oath as the new Governor of Himachal Pradesh in Shimla. The 78-year-old succeeded Acharya Devvrat after Devvrat was appointed as the new Governor of Gujarat. Mishra resigned as Minister for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises in 2017 after crossing the age of 75, BJP's unofficial age limit for holding an elected post.

column2: 2 brothers of martyr rifleman Aurangzeb join Army
column3: The two younger brothers of martyred rifleman Aurangzeb joined the Army on Monday in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri. "After our training, we'll fight against terrorism and take revenge for our martyred brother," one of the brothers said. Martyred Aurangzeb was en route home to celebrate Eid when he was abducted and later shot dead by terrorists in June 2018.

column2: 11 CBI raids in WB, Bihar, Tripura, Delhi in chit fund case
column3: The CBI on Monday conducted raids in 11 places in West Bengal, Bihar's Patna, Tripura's Agartala and New Delhi as part of its ongoing probe in the chit fund case. Searches were conducted in connection with a case registered against Partha Chakraborty and others of Chakra Infrastructure Ltd over the allegations of cheating people of ₹87 crore.

column2: 8 held for killing 4 over suspicion of witchcraft in Jharkhand
column3: Eight people were arrested on Monday for killing four elderly people of three different families who allegedly practised witchcraft in Jharkhand's Gumla, police said. As per locals, 10-12 people with their faces covered, dragged the victims out of their homes and beat them to death on Sunday. "We are organising workshops to spread awareness against witchcraft," Superintendent of Police said.

column2: SBI restores net banking, YONO app after temporary glitch
column3: The State Bank of India (SBI) on Monday evening said it has restored its online banking portal and mobile banking app YONO, which were down since morning after a temporary glitch. Several users took to Twitter to complain that they were unable to carry out transactions on the platforms. SBI responded, "Our services have resumed. We apologise for the inconvenience."

column2: Gold prices hit all-time high of ₹35,970, silver rates rise
column3: Gold prices on Monday touched an all-time high with rates in Delhi rising by ₹100 to reach ₹35,970 per 10 gram gold of 99.9% purity, according to the All India Sarafa Association. The rise was driven by strong demand from local jewellers. Meanwhile, silver prices increased by ₹260 reaching ₹41,960 per kg on fresh demand from industrial units and coinmakers.

column2: Fan shares Akshay's autographed picture from 1997, actor responds
column3: Akshay Kumar has responded to a fan who shared an autographed picture of the actor that he had sent to the fan in 1997. "I had sent you the appreciation letter, and in return you sent me this photo. Hope you [remember] it," the fan wrote. "Of course I do...good old days of fan mail," Akshay replied.

column2: Lasith Malinga to end his 15-year ODI career on July 26
column3: Fast bowler Lasith Malinga will retire from ODI cricket after Sri Lanka's first ODI of the three-match series against Bangladesh on July 26. The 35-year-old, who made his ODI debut on July 17, 2004, has taken 335 wickets in 225 ODIs. Only Muttiah Muralitharan (523) and Chaminda Vaas (399) have taken more wickets than Malinga in ODIs for Sri Lanka.

column2: 17-yr-old shooter Manu Bhaker gets admission in Lady Shri Ram College
column3: CWG 2018 gold medallist shooter Manu Bhaker will pursue Political Science at the Lady Shri Ram College in Delhi. The 17-year-old will pursue the course under the sports quota. "Congratulations to our young #shooting champion. Our TOPS athlete has won gold medals at CWG and various World Cup and has earned quota for 2020 Olympics," Sports Authority of India tweeted.

column2: No point of having Saha around if Pant is keeper in Tests: Bhogle
column3: Talking about inclusion of both Rishabh Pant and Wriddhiman Saha in Test squad for West Indies tour, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "I hope selectors make it clear who the no. 1 keeper is." "Saha is clearly the better keeper...but if Pant's the keeper they want to go with, there's little to be gained by having Saha hanging around," he added.

column2: 'Anti-competitive' legal action: Pine Labs on Innoviti's lawsuit
column3: Payment solutions provider Pine Labs on Monday said it'll appear before the District Court in Bengaluru to refute allegations of patent infringement levelled by competitor Innoviti. "We'll defend against such frivolous and anti-competitive legal actions," Pine Labs said. Innoviti alleged Pine Labs infringed its patent for technology enabling Unified Payments Interface at point of sale terminals.

column2: NASA congratulates ISRO on successful Chandrayaan-2 launch
column3: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) on Monday congratulated the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) on the successful launch of 'Chandrayaan-2', India's second Moon mission. "We look forward to what you learn about the lunar south pole," NASA tweeted. Notably, 'Chandrayaan-2' is the world's first-ever mission aimed towards a soft landing on the Moon's south polar region.

column2: Trump meets Pak PM Imran Khan, offers to mediate on Kashmir issue
column3: US President Donald Trump met Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan at the White House on Monday where he offered to 'mediate Kashmir dispute between India and Pakistan', AFP said. "If I can help, I would love to be a mediator," Trump said. Trump also said that PM Narendra Modi had asked him to help with Kashmir issue, Reuters reported.

column2: 6 girls flee school after forced to clean toilets; school denies
column3: Six girls, students of Kasturba Gandhi residential school in Barabanki, who were found missing from the premises of the school were traced from a nearby village and brought back. The girls accused the warden of forcing them to clean toilets and utensils. The warden and the school denied the allegations, saying they were making such allegations because they were homesick.

column2: Police accidentally uses cat filter while streaming presser on murder
column3: The Royal Canadian Mounted Police in British Columbia accidentally used a cat filter while live streaming a press conference about a murdered couple. After being alerted by social media users, the force said that the cat filter was an "automatic setting" and apologised for the error. It later uploaded an unfiltered version of the conference to its Facebook account.

column2: Harbhajan Singh trolls Pakistan after Chandrayaan-2 launch
column3: Veteran Indian off-spinner Harbhajan Singh mocked Pakistan after ISRO successfully launched Chandrayaan-2 on Monday. The 39-year-old tweeted emojis of flags of several countries including Pakistan, writing, "Some countries have moon on their flags," and followed them with emojis of flags of USA, Russia, India and China, writing, "While some countries having their flags on moon."

column2: Smith is always on mission, hits a million balls daily: Paine
column3: Australia Test captain Tim Paine has praised ex-captain Steve Smith ahead of the Ashes, saying, "Smith is always on a mission. He's hit a million balls and our coach's arm is falling off already." Paine added that one doesn't become "one of the best players in the world" without having a mission. The Ashes series will begin on August 1.

column2: James Anderson can reclaim Test top spot in Ireland Test
column3: Pacer James Anderson has a chance to reclaim the top spot in the Test bowler rankings in the upcoming one-off England-Ireland Test that will begin at Lord's from Wednesday. Anderson was overtaken by South Africa's Kagiso Rabada in November last year before Australia's Pat Cummins took the top spot. Anderson will be competing with Cummins during the upcoming Ashes series.

column2: Shane Warne reveals his Aus XI, Eng XI ahead of Ashes 1st Test
column3: Former Australia leg spinner Shane Warne has revealed his Australia and England elevens ahead of the sides' first Ashes Test which starts on August 1. Warne included Travis Head, Matthew Wade and James Pattinson in his Australia eleven while choosing Zak Crawley and Ben Foakes in his England eleven for the first Test.

column2: Harmeet, Ayhika win gold in Commonwealth TT C'ship 2019
column3: Indian table tennis players Harmeet Desai and Ayhika Mukherjee won the men's and women's singles titles at the 21st Commonwealth Table Tennis Championships at Cuttack on Monday. India topped the medal tally with seven gold medals, five silver medals and three bronze medals, finishing ahead of England, who won two silver medals and three bronze medals.

column2: I find it quite fascinating: Tim Paine on concussion rule
column3: Australia Test captain Tim Paine has called the concussion substitute rule which will come into effect in international cricket from August 1 "quite fascinating". "You can replace a guy halfway through a game. It's going to be interesting," the 34-year-old added. Notably, Cricket Australia had become the first cricket governing body to adopt concussion substitutes in 2016.

column2: Yuvraj Singh trolls Ganguly after Brian Lara asks him 'what's dadagiri?'
column3: Yuvraj Singh trolled Sourav Ganguly after former West Indies captain Brian Lara commented on the former India captain's picture on Instagram asking, "What's Dadagiri?" Ganguly explained to Lara that Dadagiri is a reality game show he has been hosting for last seven years. Yuvraj mocked Ganguly, writing, "Basically he is a bully, he bullies youngsters."

column2: Apple to launch iPhones with gaming-centric displays in 2020: Report
column3: Apple is reportedly considering a gaming-centric switchable 60Hz/120Hz refresh rate screen for its 2020 line-up of iPhones. The company is said to be in discussions with Samsung and LG for the screens. Notably, all of Apple's 10.5-inch and 12.9-inch iPads released since 2017 have ultra-fast refresh rates.

column2: Congress credits Nehru, Manmohan for Chandrayaan-2 launch
column3: After the successful launch of Chandrayaan-2, Congress praised the contributions of former Prime Ministers Jawaharlal Nehru and Manmohan Singh in a tweet. Nehru had funded space research by setting up INCOSPAR in 1962 and Singh had sanctioned the Chandrayaan-2 project in 2008, the tweet read. The tweet was criticised by BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra for attempting to politicise the issue.

column2: My ancestors are not rishis: Kanimozhi on BJP MP's remark
column3: DMK MP Kanimozhi in the Lok Sabha rejected BJP MP Satya Pal Singh's claim of humans evolving from sages saying, her ancestors are not rishis. "My ancestors are homo sapiens, as science says, and my parents are shudras," Kanimozhi said. Kanimozhi further said, "They were not even born of any god, or part of any god. They were born outside."

column2: Man dies in police custody in UP; sub-inspector suspended
column3: A 20-year-old man died in police custody in Uttar Pradesh, following which a sub-inspector was suspended, police said on Monday. The deceased fell ill and was taken to the prison hospital but rushed to the district hospital when his condition worsened, where he was declared brought dead. Postmortem revealed he had 17 internal injuries and his liver was badly damaged.

column2: This year's Amarnath Yatra to conclude on August 15
column3: This year's Amarnath Yatra is set to conclude on August 15, coinciding with Raksha Bandhan, Shravan Purnima and the Independence Day. Till Sunday evening, as many as 2.72 lakh pilgrims had paid obeisance at the shrine. Officials revealed that the fresh batch comprising 3,178 pilgrims left in a convoy of 128 vehicles early on Monday.

column2: Death toll in Bihar floods rises to 102; 72 lakh affected
column3: Five more people were killed in the Bihar floods raising the death toll to 102 on Sunday, with over 72 lakh affected in 12 districts, Bihar's Disaster Management Department said. Nearly 1.15 lakh people have taken shelter in 133 relief centres set up across the districts. As many as 776 community kitchens are being run to feed the affected population.

column2: SC puts sale of Essar Steel to ArcelorMittal on hold
column3: The Supreme Court on Monday ordered status quo in debt-laden Essar Steel's insolvency case, on a plea by its creditors against NCLAT's order approving ArcelorMittal's ₹42,000-crore acquisition bid. The NCLAT had made changes in the distribution of claims from the bid amount between creditors. The SC ruled that NCLAT can't act like a resolution professional and distribute funds.

column2: Kotak Mahindra Bank profit rises 32.7% to ₹1,360 crore in Q1
column3: Kotak Mahindra Bank on Monday reported a 32.71% rise in its first-quarter profit at ₹1,360.2 crore from ₹1,024.94 crore in the year-ago period, slightly missing market estimates. The rise was driven by lower provisions and contingencies, which fell 32.55% year-on-year to ₹316.8 crore in June quarter. Its gross bad-loan ratio was 2.19% in June, from 2.14% in the previous quarter.

column2: Problem is people glorifying flawed characters: Taapsee on Kabir Singh
column3: Actress Taapsee Pannu, while speaking about Shahid Kapoor starrer 'Kabir Singh' allegedly glorifying misogyny, said, "The problem is not showing flawed characters...The problem is when you glorify them and make what they are doing seem heroic." "This character is so revered that whatever he does is not just accepted, it is celebrated," she added.

column2: My films may not have worked, but acting wasn't criticised: Sonakshi
column3: Actress Sonakshi Sinha has said her films may not have worked, but her performance in the films was never criticised. "I have always been appreciated for my performance which makes me happy and that is the validation that I need," she added. Sonakshi further said she never craved for box-office numbers.

column2: I will fix Pakistan cricket team, remember my words: Pak PM Imran
column3: Pakistan PM Imran Khan, while addressing a gathering of Pakistanis in US' Washington, said that he has decided to fix the Pakistan cricket team. "We'll fix the system and bring one in which best talent comes forward," he added. "The team you see in next World Cup, remember my words, that team will be a professional team," he further said.

column2: David Lloyd mocks Dhoni's decision to train with army, criticised
column3: Ex-England cricketer David Lloyd was criticised for mocking ex-India captain MS Dhoni's decision to train with his Army regiment by commenting on a news report with laughing emojis. "If you cannot respect what you should, you better stay away. Feel sorry for this person," a user wrote. "What's the joke? Please tell us, so we can also laugh," wrote another.

column2: Twitter to give more context to 'this tweet is unavailable' notices
column3: Twitter has said that it will soon begin providing more details on why certain tweets go unavailable in a conversation thread on the microblogging platform. The notice is usually seen due to deleted or protected tweets, or muted keywords. "The fact that the 'unavailable' message is showing with a placeholder row...is confusing. They should be hidden," Twitter's Product Lead said.

column2: I didn't eat biryani: Karnataka CM on viral pic with IMA scam accused
column3: Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy on Monday responded to the viral picture of him with IMA scam accused Mansoor Khan, and said, "I didn't eat biryani." "I was invited during Ramzan. I went there. I didn't eat biryani...I picked only two morsels of rice," Kumaraswamy said. Earlier, Karnataka BJP shared the picture and accused Kumaraswamy of having biryani with Khan.

column2: Videos of Sonbhadra massacre surface, hundreds seen fighting with sticks
column3: Two videos of the Sonbhadra massacre that left 10 tribals dead and around 28 injured on July 17 have surfaced online. In the videos, hundreds of people can be seen fighting with sticks. A group led by village headman Yagya Dutt can be seen attacking the tribals with sticks and guns. A group of women can be seen mourning deaths.

column2: RTI Amendment Bill passed in Lok Sabha amid Opposition protest
column3: The Right to Information (Amendment) Bill, 2019, proposing to give Centre the power to set tenure and salaries of Chief Information Commissioner and Information Commissioners was passed in Lok Sabha on Monday. As many as 218 members favoured the bill, while 79 were against it. The Opposition argued that the Bill will take away the independence of the RTI authorities.

column2: Scientists are our new celebrities: Mahindra on Chandrayaan-2 launch
column3: After ISRO's successful launch of India's second Moon mission Chandrayaan-2, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "Was waiting to see the ISRO folks hug each other before breathing normally again!" "I stand & salute our scientists. They are deservedly our new celebrities," he added. He called the mission a "validation of our cryogenic technology" and a "technological breakthrough".

column2: Govt panel recommends ban on private cryptocurrencies
column3: An inter-ministerial government committee on Monday recommended a ban on private cryptocurrencies and imposing fines and penalties on activities related to digital currencies. The panel cited "risks associated and volatility in the prices of private cryptocurrencies". This comes a day after MoS for Finance Anurag Thakur denied that government was considering a blanket ban on cryptocurrencies.

column2: Adam Peaty wins 100m breaststroke world title for 3rd time
column3: British swimmer Adam Peaty has won the 100m breaststroke world title for the third time with his victory at the World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea. Peaty's compatriot James Wilby finished in the second spot while Yan Zibei of China ended in the third place. Notably, Wilby's silver medal is his first World Championship medal.

column2: Australian swimmer Horton refuses to join China's Yang on podium
column3: Australian swimmer Mack Horton, who in the past labelled his Chinese rival Sun Yang as a "drug cheat", refused to take the podium with Yang at the World Aquatics Championships in South Korea on Sunday. Horton, who finished second behind Yang in 400m freestyle, had also declined to shake hands with Yang or pose for photos with him.

column2: 3 held for thrashing national level shooter in UP's Baghpat
column3: Three persons were arrested for thrashing Devansh Rana, a national level shooter, in Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat, police said. The player said that the accused started beating him when he was out for some work, saying he had threatened their friend. The player's father said that he learnt about the incident through the incident's viral video and then registered an FIR.

column2: Equifax to pay up to $700 mn to settle US data breach probes
column3: Credit reporting company Equifax will pay at least $575 million and up to $700 million, the largest ever US data breach settlement, to settle federal and state investigations into a 2017 data breach. The breach had compromised 143 million American consumers' sensitive information. Equifax will establish an up to $425-million compensation fund for victims and pay $275 million in penalties.

column2: Maharashtra's Kaas Plateau has over 850 species of flowering plants
column3: Maharashtra's 'Kaas Plateau', situated 25 kilometres west from Satara and a three-hour drive from Pune, has over 850 different species of flowers and even endemic butterflies. A UNESCO World Heritage site since 2012, it's commonly called 'Maharashtra's Valley of Flowers'. August to early October is the right time to visit the plateau as the maximum flowers bloom during this time.

column2: Impose President's rule or dismiss K'taka govt: Sena to Centre
column3: Ahead of the floor test in Karnataka Assembly, the Shiv Sena asked the Centre to either impose President's rule or dismiss the state Legislative Assembly. It added, "The country is watching that a CM is struggling to remain in his chair despite losing the majority." It said that CM HD Kumaraswamy should have resigned following the democratic and Parliamentary tradition.

column2: Will give ₹10L each to all 2,000 families in native village: KCR
column3: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao on Monday announced that the state government would give ₹10 lakh each to the 2,000 families residing in his native village Chintamadaka. Rao said that the families could use the money to purchase tractors, harvesting machines and farmlands. The TRS chief also sanctioned funds for sanitation, roads, temples and other civic amenities.

column2: Acharya Devvrat takes oath as Governor of Gujarat
column3: Acharya Devvrat was sworn in as the Governor of Gujarat on Monday at a function held at the Raj Bhavan, Gandhinagar. Devvrat was administered the oath of office by the acting Chief Justice of Gujarat High Court, Anant S Dave. He took the oath in Sanskrit in the presence of CM Vijay Rupani, Deputy CM Nitinbhai Patel and others.

column2: I-T notice to Durga Puja Committees insult to puja: Mamata
column3: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Monday condemned the Income Tax notice to the Durga Puja Committees Forum, calling it an insult to puja. "During the elections, [BJP] take Hindus along, and after the election, they do this," Mamata said. "Many political parties don't have to pay income tax for the funds they spend during the elections," she added.

column2: E-rickshaw provider SmartE raises ₹100 crore from Japan's Mitsui
column3: Electric rickshaw provider SmartE has raised ₹100 crore in Series B funding from Japanese conglomerate Mitsui & Co. SmartE operates a fleet of more than 1,000 e-rickshaws in Delhi-NCR. Founded in 2015, SmartE provides rides in all-electric vehicles to the first and last-mile transportation opportunity in urban cities.

column2: Maharashtra tops ATM frauds, Delhi and TN follow: RBI data
column3: As per RBI data, Maharashtra reported 233 cases of ATM frauds in 2018-19, followed by Delhi with 179 cases and Tamil Nadu with 147 cases. The loss reported from Maharashtra, Delhi and Tamil Nadu was ₹4.81 crore, ₹2.9 crore and ₹3.63 crore respectively. Notably, Assam, Arunachal Pradesh and Tripura were the only three states that didn’t report a single incident.

column2: Medical cannabis among top priorities for new Thai government
column3: Developing a medical cannabis industry is among top policy priorities for Thailand's new government, according to a document released before the formal announcement. "The study and technological development of marijuana, hemp, and other medicinal herbs should be sped up," the policy document said. Thailand legalised marijuana for medical use and research last year.

column2: Suzlon Energy given 'bad loan' tag by Union Bank: Reports
column3: State-run Union Bank of India has reportedly classified its loan to Suzlon Energy as a non-performing asset (NPA) after repayments were delayed by over 90 days and its other lenders might also do the same. Reports said the bank has over ₹70-crore exposure to Suzlon, which has over ₹11,000-crore debt. Recently, Suzlon Energy had defaulted on a ₹1,200-crore bond payment.

column2: Hard to say when the NBFC crisis will be over: RBI Governor
column3: It is difficult to say when the crisis in the non-banking finance company (NBFC) sector will be over, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said in an interview. He added RBI is making efforts to ensure there isn't a collapse of "another systematically important NBFC". The NBFC sector saw a liquidity crunch, sparked by IL&FS defaulting on its debt repayments last year.

column2: Massive fire at MTNL building in Mumbai, 100 feared trapped
column3: A level 4 fire has broken out at MTNL building in Bandra, Mumbai and 14 fire tenders are present at the spot. Fire fighting operations are underway. No injuries or casualties have been reported yet but as many as 100 people are feared trapped on the terrace of the building. More details on the incident are awaited.

column2: He was my only child: Dad of 14-yr-old actor who died in car crash
column3: Shivendra Singh, father of 14-year-old 'Sasural Simar Ka' fame child actor Shivlekh Singh who passed away recently in a car accident, said, "He was my only child." Speaking about the accident, Shivendra added, "My wife and I blanked out and when we woke up, we realised he was gone." They were returning to Raipur from Bilaspur when the accident happened.

column2: Koena Mitra gets 6 months in jail for cheque bouncing case
column3: Koena Mitra has been sentenced to six months imprisonment by a metropolitan magistrate's court in a cheque bouncing case. The complaint, filed by model Poonam Sethi in 2013, alleges that Koena borrowed ₹22 lakh over a period of time but at the time of repayment, she gave a cheque of ₹3 lakh which bounced. Koena has however denied the allegations.

column2: Ibrahim should make B'wood debut, he's better looking than me: Saif
column3: Saif Ali Khan, when asked if his son Ibrahim will make his Bollywood debut any time soon, said, "He should, he's looking good, better looking than I am!" "I definitely think all of my children would be interested in acting. We're an acting family," he added. However, Saif said he is keen on Ibrahim finishing his studies first.

column2: Stokes didn't ask us to not award 6 overthrows in WC final: Dharmasena
column3: After a section of British media claimed that all-rounder Ben Stokes wanted umpires to not award England 6 overthrows in the 2019 World Cup final, umpire Kumar Dharmasena has said that no such request was made. Dharmasena further revealed that he apologised to New Zealand captain Kane Williamson the moment he realised he had made a mistake.

column2: Team TUM wins SpaceX Hyperloop pod contest with 463 kmph top speed
column3: Technical University of Munich's Team TUM on Sunday won the annual SpaceX Hyperloop Pod Competition finals held at the Elon Musk-led space startup SpaceX's Hawthorne headquarters. Their pod achieved the top speed of 463.49 kmph (288 mph), highest among any team to run in the finals. TUM beat out three other finalist competitors - Delft Hyperloop, EPFL Hyperloop, and Swissloop.

column2: Facebook's prototype VR device squeezes, vibrates wrist while gaming
column3: Facebook's Reality Labs are developing a prototype Virtual Reality device called 'Tasbi' which uses a combination of squeezes and vibrations to mimic haptic feedback for virtual objects while playing a game. Tasbi is worn on each wrist. It allows users to get a sensation whenever they pick up objects, push buttons or touch a surface.

column2: Papers tell me where I work: Prashant on working with Aaditya Thackeray
column3: Taking a dig at news reports suggesting he was now working with Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray's son Aaditya ahead of Maharashtra Assembly elections, poll strategist Prashant Kishor tweeted, "Ironically, these days I get to know where all I am working only through newspapers!" Notably, Kishor had worked actively in then Gujarat CM Narendra Modi's campaign for 2014 general elections.

column2: Hotels body complains about OYO to CCI over broken promise
column3: The Federation of Hotel & Restaurant Associations of India (FHRAI) has filed a complaint with the Competition Commission of India against OYO. It alleged that three months after OYO promised partners an 18% interest on delayed payments, the issues continue to be unresolved. "Environment created by OYO has forced hoteliers to cut ties with it," FHRAI's honorary Joint Secretary said.

column2: Visa, others invest in B2B payments firm PayMate's $25 mn round
column3: Mumbai-based business-to-business digital payment solutions provider PayMate has raised $25 million in its Series D round from Visa, Japan's Recruit Strategic Partners and Brand Capital. Existing investor Mayfair 101 also participated in the round that will be completed by the next two months. Founded in 2006 by Ajay Adiseshann, PayMate's cloud-based platform allows enterprise and SMEs to digitise procurement-to-payment cycle.

column2: Why has ISRO named Chandrayaan 2's lander Vikram?
column3: ISRO has named Chandrayaan 2's lander Vikram after father of Indian Space Programme Dr Vikram A Sarabhai. Vikram has been designed to execute a soft landing on the lunar surface. After Vikram's landing, rover Pragyan will roll out and carry out experiments on lunar surface for a period of 1 lunar day which is equal to 14 Earth days.

column2: Bounced back with flying colours after technical snag: ISRO Chief
column3: After India's second Moon mission Chandrayaan-2's successful launch, ISRO Chief K Sivan said, ISRO bounced back with flying colours after fixing the technical snag. "It's the beginning of a historic journey of India towards Moon and to land at a place near south pole," he added. The mission, initially scheduled for July 15, was suspended due to a technical snag.

column2: PM Modi praises Chandrayaan-2, shares pics of himself watching launch
column3: PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter to share pictures of himself watching the launch proceedings of Chandrayaan-2. "The launch of #Chandrayaan2 illustrates the prowess of our scientists and determination of 130 crore Indians to scale new frontiers of science," he tweeted. "What would make every Indian overjoyed is the fact that #Chandrayaan2 is a fully indigenous mission," he further wrote.

column2: Iran captures 17 CIA spies, sentences some to death: Reports
column3: Iran has captured 17 spies working for the US' Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) and some have been sentenced to death, Iranian media reported on Monday. "The identified spies were employed in sensitive and vital private sector centres in the economic, nuclear, infrastructural, military and cyber areas...where they collected classified information," Iran's Intelligence Ministry reportedly said.

column2: Pirates steal cash, sailors' shoes in attack on S Korea-flagged ship
column3: Pirates attacked a South Korea-flagged cargo ship near the Singapore Strait on Monday, stealing thousands of dollars in cash and the sailors' shoes, South Korean authorities said. The pirates also took away belongings including mobile phones and clothes from the cargo ship's 22 crew members. Officials said the ship was sailing normally after the robbery.

column2: Shubhankar equals best finish at Major after ending tied 51st
column3: Shubhankar Sharma equalled his best performance in a Major, signing off tied 51st at the 148th Open Championship in Portrush. Sharma achieved the feat at the Open Championship on his 23rd birthday. "I am not used to doing much on my birthdays but the last two birthdays have been at The Open and they have been very special," Sharma said.

column2: CL winners Liverpool lose 1-2 to Sevilla in pre-season friendly
column3: Champions League winners Liverpool lost 1-2 to Sevilla in a pre-season friendly on Sunday following a 90th-minute goal from Spanish side's 20-year-old midfielder Alejandro Pozo. Liverpool forward Divock Origi, who scored both in semifinals and finals of Champions League, scored in the 44th minute. The match also saw Liverpool's 18-year-old Yasser Larouci being stretchered off in the 76th minute.

column2: ICC ran out of patience with Zimbabwe Cricket: Grant Flower
column3: Speaking about the suspension of the Zimbabwe Cricket board, former Zimbabwe cricketer Grant Flower has said that the ICC ran out of patience with Zimbabwe Cricket (ZC). "ICC have just been worn down by all the corruption, fraud, and the problems with Zimbabwe Cricket not being able to get its house in order," Flower added.

column2: BJP in hurry, using K'taka Guv to come to power: Shivakumar
column3: Ahead of the floor test of the Karnataka Congress-JD(S) coalition government, Congress leader DK Shivakumar said that the BJP is in a "hurry" for power and using the Governor for the same. His comment came after the Supreme Court refused to give an early hearing on a plea seeking a direction to conclude the floor test in the Assembly today.

column2: Spoke in fit of anger: J&K Guv on 'kill corrupts' advice to militants
column3: Jammu and Kashmir Governor Satya Pal Malik said that whatever he said on Sunday was in a "fit of anger" due to "rampant corruption" in the state. Yesterday, Malik stated that militants should "kill corrupt politicians who have looted the wealth" of the state rather than innocent people and security personnel. He said, as Governor, he shouldn't have said this.

column2: One party has access to 90% election funds: Ex-PM Manmohan Singh
column3: Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh on Sunday said that there is a need to discuss state funding for elections when only one party has access to 90% of the election funds. Speaking at former Union Minister Indrajit Gupta's Birth Centenary Memorial Meeting, Singh said, "[Indrajit Gupta] argued for the role of state funding in elections...such ideas need to be discussed."

column2: Pragya believes in class discrimination: Owaisi on toilet remark
column3: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Monday said that he wasn't surprised about BJP MP Pragya Thakur's 'toilet' remark, adding that she believes in the caste and class discrimination happening in the country. "She has openly opposed PM's [Swachh Bharat Abhiyan]," Owaisi said. Pragya had said that she wasn't elected to clean toilets or drains but would perform her actual duties.

column2: Miscreants force Muslim men to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' in Aurangabad
column3: Two Muslim men were allegedly threatened by a group of miscreants after they refused to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' in Maharashtra's Aurangabad on Sunday. The incident was caught on CCTV camera and heavy deployment of police is in place to maintain law and order. This is the second such incident reported from the city within a week.

column2: Will retaliate if US imposes sanctions over Russian S-400: Turkey
column3: Turkey would retaliate against what it called an unacceptable threat of US sanctions over the country's purchase of Russian S-400 missile defence system, Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlut Cavusoglu has said. "This is not a threat or a bluff," he added. However, Cavusoglu further said he thinks US President Donald Trump wants to avoid such measures.

column2: Govt wants antitrust review of 'Big 4' audit firms: Reports
column3: The government reportedly wants antitrust body Competition Commission of India (CCI) to assess whether the "Big Four" auditing firms and affiliates are hurting competition in India. CCI may have to check whether PwC, Deloitte, KPMG, and Ernst & Young are abusing their dominant market position, reports said. The four firms audit for nearly 60% of top 500 companies on NSE.

column2: NMIMS Global Access holds webinar on MBA in Business Analytics
