column3: NMIMS Global Access along with upGrad is holding a free online webinar on MBA Executive with specialisation in Business Analytics to empower learners with data analytics and business skills. The webinar gives learners an opportunity to interact with Mr Rajiv Shah, Director, NMIMS Global Access, Ronnie Screwvala, Co-founder (upGrad) and Mayank Kumar, Co-founder (upGrad).

column2: SC refuses to hear plea for conducting K'taka floor test today
column3: The Supreme Court has declined to hear a plea by two Independent MLAs for conducting floor test in Karnataka Assembly today. The SC said it may consider it for hearing on July 23. After the floor test didn't take place despite two deadlines set by Governor Vajubhai Vala, the two Independent MLAs, who withdrew support to Congress-JD(S) government, moved SC.

column2: Avengers beats Avatar's ₹19,250cr record to become top-grossing film
column3: With earnings of $2.790 billion (₹19,257 crore) 'Avengers: Endgame' beat 'Avatar' in its 13th weekend of release to become the highest-grossing film of all time. 'Avatar', which held the record for 10 years, had total earnings of $2.789 billion (₹19,250 crore). "Thank you to...fans around the world who lifted Avengers: Endgame to these historic heights," said Disney co-chairman Alan Horn.

column2: Muralitharan picked up 800th Test wicket on career's last ball
column3: Former Sri Lankan off-spinner Muttiah Muralitharan, the only player in Test cricket history to take 800 wickets, picked up his 800th wicket on the final ball of his Test career. Muralitharan dismissed India's Pragyan Ojha as his 800th Test wicket on July 22, 2010. Notably, Muralitharan is the fastest to pick 400, 500, 600, 700 and 800 Test wickets.

column2: Taapsee reacts to Rangoli calling her Kangana's 'sasti copy'
column3: Speaking about Kangana Ranaut's sister Rangoli calling her Kangana's 'sasti copy', Taapsee Pannu said, "I didn't want to engage in a word battle because I won't be able to match their language." "I didn't know there was a copyright on curly hair...and honest opinions...Kangana claims to be the highest-paid actress, so I guess I am the "sasti" version," she added.

column2: MSK Prasad reveals why Rayudu wasn't picked after injuries to players
column3: Chief selector MSK Prasad has revealed that injured opener Shikhar Dhawan was replaced by Rishabh Pant instead of Ambati Rayudu during 2019 World Cup as the team already had a reserve opener in KL Rahul and required a left-hander. He added that when all-rounder Vijay Shankar was injured, they called in Mayank Agarwal as the team needed a back-up opener.

column2: Dhoni still fit enough to play international cricket: Childhood coach
column3: Reacting to the speculation around MS Dhoni's retirement, the former India captain's childhood coach Keshav Banerjee said, "Dhoni still has cricket left in him. I know that. He is still fit enough to play international cricket." "I feel they (selectors) should talk to Dhoni and make things clear...To me, he had a good World Cup and looked sharp," he added.

column2: Grey sales of high-end phones causing ₹2,500 cr revenue loss: ICEA
column3: The sale of high-end mobile phones in the grey market is causing an estimated loss of ₹2,500 crore annually, mobile industry body India Cellular and Electronics Association (ICEA) has claimed. It suggested imposing a maximum customs duty of ₹4,000 on handsets priced above ₹20,000 to stop the practice. Currently, a basic customs duty of 20% is imposed on imported handsets.

column2: Narrate how BJP took you away forcefully: K'taka CM to rebel MLAs
column3: Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy has asked rebel MLAs to return from Mumbai and "narrate how the BJP took them away forcefully". "I want to make it amply clear that I am not trying to cling onto power. My only intention...is to let the entire country know how the BJP...is trying to subvert the very principles of democracy," Kumaraswamy added.

column2: Lightning strikes kill 32 in UP, CM Yogi announces ₹4L compensation
column3: As many as 32 people were killed in Uttar Pradesh due to lightning on Sunday, said officials. Thirteen others were injured due to lightning, the statement added. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has issued orders to the respective district magistrates to give a compensation of ₹4 lakh each to the families of the deceased.

column2: Yukiya Amano, chief of UN nuclear watchdog IAEA, dies aged 72
column3: Yukiya Amano, the Director General of UN nuclear watchdog International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), has passed away at the age of 72. Amano, a Japanese diplomat, was reappointed in 2017 to a third four-year term. Amano's health had declined since the IAEA announced last September that he had undergone an unspecified medical procedure.

column2: Won't allow AC, TV for Nawaz Sharif in jail: Pak PM in US speech
column3: During his speech at an indoor arena in the US, Pakistan PM Imran Khan said he won't allow AC and TV for former Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif in jail. "In a country where half the population has no AC or TV, what kind of punishment would this be?" Khan said. Sharif has been jailed over corruption charges.

column2: Protestors raise slogans during Pakistan PM's speech in US
column3: A video showing protestors raising slogans during Pakistan PM Imran Khan's speech in the US has surfaced online. The protestors raised slogans against Pakistan and in favour of an independent Balochistan during Khan's address. People from Balochistan living in the US have been raising their voice against alleged atrocities and human rights violations in Balochistan by Pakistani security forces.

column2: Bengali actress Rimjhim Mitra, two others join BJP
column3: Bengali film and television actress Rimjhim Mitra and two others joined the BJP in the presence of state BJP President Dilip Ghosh. Mitra said that it's the first time she is "openly supporting" a party as she felt "cornered" working under the "monopolistic approach" in the Bengali film and TV industry. On July 18, several Bengali actors joined the party.

column2: Woman delivers baby on NDRF rescue boat in flood-hit Bihar
column3: A woman delivered a baby girl on NDRF's rescue boat with the help of NDRF nursing assistant, ASHA workers and relatives in flood-hit Bihar, officials said. They added that the team was taking her to a health centre but decided to assess her on the boat after she reported severe labour pain. She was later admitted to the health centre.

column2: 3 IEDs planted by Naxals recovered in Chhattisgarh: Police
column3: Three Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs), weighing 15 kg, 9 kg and 5 kg and suspected to have been planted by Naxals, were recovered by security forces from Chhattisgarh's Bijapur, police said. The forces spotted the bombs during patrolling and a bomb disposal squad defused them immediately, the police added. Last week too, the police recovered three explosives from the area.

column2: 2 arrested for kidnapping and raping 11-yr-old in Hyderabad
column3: Two persons were arrested for allegedly kidnapping and raping an 11-year-old girl in Telangana's Hyderabad, police said. The two raped the girl at a secluded building after luring her in the name of taking her to a theatre to watch a movie, the police added. Both the accused were caught by the locals outside the building, the police said.

column2: 9 killed, several injured in road accident in UP's Hapur
column3: Nine people were killed and several others were injured after the vehicle in which they were travelling collided with an unknown vehicle, police said. The police added that the injured were shifted to a local hospital, while those in critical condition were transferred to Meerut. The victims were returning from a marriage when the accident took place, the police said.

column2: 4 held, 1,000 detonators, 5,000 gelatin rods seized in UP
column3: The Anti Terrorist Squad (ATS) of the Uttar Pradesh Police arrested four people and confiscated a huge cache of explosives including 1,000 detonators and 5,000 gelatin rods in Jhansi, Superintendent of Police said. He added that the ATS conducted the operation along with the local police. He further said that two vehicles have also been seized by the police.

column2: People beat up man for smuggling 30 cattle in MP: Police
column3: A man was beaten up by a group of people for smuggling 30 cattle in Madhya Pradesh's Katni, police said. In a video, the group of people can be seen freeing the cattle loaded in a truck and beating up the man with his hands tied with a rope. The police later arrested the man and seized the truck.

column2: Piramal raises ₹1,500 cr from StanChart via NCDs: Reports
column3: Ajay Piramal-led Piramal Enterprises (PEL) has reportedly raised ₹1,500 crore from Standard Chartered Bank through non-convertible debentures (NCDs). The funds will be utilised to meet PEL's working capital needs and upcoming debt-related payment obligations, reports said. Recently, the company had made principal and coupon payments on outstanding debt of reportedly around ₹1,700 crore.

column2: No blanket ban on crypto trading in India yet, says govt
column3: There is no blanket ban on cryptocurrency trading in India yet, Minister of State for Finance Anurag Thakur said. "Presently, there's no separate law for dealing with cryptocurrency-related issues. Hence, all concerned departments and law enforcement agencies...take action as per the relevant existing laws," he added. In 2018, RBI had barred banks from serving firms dealing with cryptocurrencies.

column2: Dhoni must be left free to play as long as he wants to: Harsha Bhogle
column3: Reacting to the speculation around MS Dhoni's retirement, commentator Harsha Bhogle said that Dhoni must be left free to play as long as he wants to. "It is the selectors who must take a call on his future as an India player. But this call must emerge from discussion with Dhoni. The greats command that respect," he added.

column2: Shubman Gill will have to wait for his turn: MSK Prasad
column3: Talking about 19-year-old Shubman Gill, who failed to make the cut in squads for West Indies tour, BCCI chief selector MSK Prasad has said that the batsman will have to wait for his turn. "He was given an opportunity when KL Rahul was out against New Zealand," he added. Gill had played two ODIs against New Zealand, scoring 16 runs.

column2: Seniors purposely didn't perform, laughed after defeats: Naib
column3: All-rounder Gulbadin Naib, who was Afghanistan's captain in 2019 World Cup, has claimed that his team's senior players didn't perform deliberately in the tournament. "They weren't giving attention to me. They laughed instead of being sad after defeats and didn't even look at me when asked to bowl," he added. Notably, Naib was removed from captaincy after the World Cup.

column2: Who is Rahul Chahar, 1999-born called up to India squad for 1st time?
column3: Leg-spinner Rahul Chahar, who has been called up to India squad for the first time, was born in Rajasthan's Bharatpur on August 4, 1999. The 19-year-old used to play with his cousin Deepak Chahar in Agra before both moved out to pursue cricket professionally. Rahul, who was bought by Mumbai Indians for ₹1.9 crore, took 13 wickets in IPL 2019.

column2: Getting call from Sachin dream come true: Hima after winning 5 golds
column3: India's 19-year-old sprinter Hima Das, who won five international golds within 19 days, took to Twitter to reveal Sachin Tendulkar called her to congratulate. "Today evening was like a dream come true for me, have got a call from the god of cricket and my inspiration @sachin_rt sir. Thank you sir for your good wishes and inspirational words," she wrote.

column2: A legend like MS Dhoni knows when to retire: Chief selector Prasad
column3: Talking about speculation surrounding MS Dhoni's retirement, chief selector MSK Prasad said that a legendary cricketer like Dhoni knows when to retire. "Retirement is purely individual...but as far as the future roadmap is considered, that is in the hands of the selectors," he added. Prasad added that the selection committee wants to groom Rishabh Pant.

column2: MS Dhoni's request to train with Army approved: Reports
column3: MS Dhoni's request to train with Indian Army has been approved by Army chief General Bipin Rawat, as per reports. The 38-year-old would train with Parachute Regiment battalion and some part of his training is also expected to take place in J&K, reports added. The Army won't allow Dhoni to be part of any active operation, reports further stated.

column2: He was like my son: Ram Vilas Paswan on younger brother's demise
column3: Union Minister Ram Vilas Paswan's brother Ram Chandra Paswan passed away aged 57 after suffering a heart attack. "He was like my son. Even though he was my dear younger brother, I never regarded him as one. He was more like a son to me," Ram Vilas Paswan said. Ram Chandra Paswan was Member of Lok Sabha from Bihar's Samastipur.

column2: Not a single girl was born in 132 villages of U'khand in last 3 months
column3: As per official data, no girls were born in the last three months in 132 villages in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district. A total of 216 children were born in the district in the time period. District Magistrate Ashish Chauhan said that a detailed survey and study will be conducted to identify the reason behind it.

column2: Pain of losing a mother cannot be erased: Sheila Dikshit's son
column3: After his mother's demise, son of former Delhi CM Sheila Dikshit said, "It's natural that I'll miss her. The pain of losing a mother cannot be erased." Sandeep Dikshit further said, "Whenever people will talk of new, modern and progressive Delhi, Sheila ji will always be remembered." Sheila Dikshit passed away on Saturday at the age of 81.

column2: 15-yr-old runs away, visits 10 cities in 18 days inspired by video game
column3: Inspired by Taxi Driver 2 game, a 15-year-old girl visited 10 cities, including Rishikesh and Pune, in 18 days after she went missing from her home in Uttarakhand's Udham Singh Nagar. The girl told the police that she decided to play the game's character in real life. A police patrol traced the girl at Delhi's Kamla Nagar market area.

column2: Swaraj responds to troll who said she will be remembered after death
column3: Ex-External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj responded to a troll who said that she would be missed after she passes away just like three-time Delhi CM Sheila Dikshit. "I thank you in anticipation of this kind thought," Swaraj wrote. The troll had commented on Swaraj's Twitter post, where she expressed her condolences over demise of ex-Delhi BJP chief Mange Ram Garg.

column2: Kane scores from near half-line to hand Spurs 3-2 win vs Juve
column3: Tottenham's Harry Kane scored from near the half-line in the 93rd minute to hand his side a 3-2 win over Juventus in their International Champions Cup 2019 match. For Juventus, former Real Madrid teammates Gonzalo Higuain and Cristiano Ronaldo were on target. "Good to be back," the England captain later tweeted after the end of the match.

column2: Only one Pandya but both Chahars in T20 squad, tweets user
column3: Following the announcement of the teams for the Windies tour, broadcaster Gaurav Kalra tweeted, "only one Pandya but both Chahars in T20 squad." Other users reacted with tweets like, "Lots of all-rounders in the squad. Straight shoot out between Krunal and Jadeja for when Hardik returns?" and "If an unfit Shikhar is picked why not an unfit Vijay Shankar."

column2: I'll be happy If I'm half as good as Michael Hussey: Carey
column3: Australia wicketkeeper-batsman Alex Carey termed former batsman Michael Hussey "an incredible player", adding, "If I'm half as good as him, I'll be happy." The 27-year-old stated that batting through different circumstances in the 2019 World Cup gave him "good learning experiences". "I'm just trying to make my mark currently," added Carey, who accumulated 375 runs in 2019 World Cup.

column2: Cried out of happiness after Barcelona move: Griezmann
column3: French forward Antoine Griezmann has revealed that he cried out of happiness after completing his move to Barcelona from Atletico Madrid. "I was with my friends, with my wife, with my children and it was an incredible moment," the 28-year-old revealed. Griezmann scored 133 goals in 257 appearances for Atletico since he joined them in 2014 from Real Sociedad.

column2: Central agencies threatening TMC leaders to join BJP: Mamata
column3: West Bengal Chief Minister and TMC supremo Mamata Banerjee on Sunday alleged that central agencies are threatening TMC leaders over chit fund scams if they don't join the BJP. "They are offering ₹2 crore and a petrol pump to our MLAs to switch," Mamata said. "Just like in Karnataka, the BJP is involved in horse-trading everywhere," Mamata further said.

column2: Most mob lynching cases are fake: Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi
column3: Union Minister for Minority Affairs Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Sunday said that most cases of mob lynching in the country are concocted and fake. Naqvi was responding to a question about Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan's statement of Muslims being punished for not migrating to Pakistan after 1947. Congress's Randeep Surjewala criticised Naqvi saying BJP is trying to shield culprits.

column2: Priyanka can lead Cong, non-Gandhi will cause split: Natwar
column3: Former External Affairs Minister Natwar Singh on Sunday said that the decision of becoming Congress President lies with Priyanka Gandhi, adding that a non-Gandhi chief will cause the party to split. Natwar further said, "Earlier, [Rahul Gandhi] had said that nobody from the Gandhi family will become the Congress president." Only the Gandhi family can reverse the decision, Natwar added.

column2: No one can touch Article 370 until Kashmir issue resolved: Farooq
column3: National Conference President Farooq Abdullah on Saturday said that until the issue of Kashmir is resolved, no power on earth can touch Article 370. He further said, "If Article 35-A is annulled, then all the successive presidential orders will get annulled automatically." "It was the then Maharaja who gave the state subject rights to its people in 1927," Abdullah added.

column2: 5 Bihar policemen arrested over bribe to release criminals
column3: Five policemen of Bihar's Beur police station have been arrested for allegedly accepting a bribe to release criminals caught with stolen coins worth over ₹18 lakh. The policemen were reportedly given ₹1.5 lakh to release the criminals' seized vehicle and give them free passage. The driver of the private vehicle has also been arrested in connection with the case.

column2: 12 Rohingya Muslims stopped from entering Tripura: BSF
column3: The Border Security Force (BSF) on Saturday said that at least 12 Rohingya Muslims were stopped from entering Indian territory through Tripura from Bangladesh. Officials seized biscuits and soft drinks from their possession which were provided at a refugee camp in Bangladesh. Over 250 Rohingya Muslims have reportedly been detained during the past year from different parts of the Northeast.

column2: 3 dead, 404 cases of dengue & malaria confirmed in Dakshina Kannada
column3: Three people have died and 404 cases of dengue and malaria have been confirmed in Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada district, an official said on Sunday. The district administration and health department have set up a command centre to reduce the breeding source of the dengue virus-carrying mosquito and to take measures to prevent human contact with the mosquito, added the official.

column2: LIC offers to lend ₹1.25 lakh cr by 2024 for highway project: Gadkari
column3: State-owned Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) has agreed to offer ₹1.25 lakh crore line of credit by 2024 to fund government's ₹8.41 lakh crore Bharatmala Project for constructing highways, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said. LIC has offered ₹25,000 crore in a year's time, he added. Project will be funded through toll revenue, market borrowings and insurance funds, among others, Gadkari said.

column2: ISRO wishes Akshay Kumar ahead of 'Mission Mangal' release
column3: Ahead of the release of Akshay Kumar starrer 'Mission Mangal', Indian Space Research Organisation took to Twitter to wish him. "As #ISRO prepares for landmark launch of #Chandrayaan2, #TeamISRO wishes @akshaykumar all the best for #MissionMangal and all his future endeavours," it tweeted. Inspired by India's 2013 Mars space programme Mangalyaan, the film also stars Vidya Balan and Taapsee Pannu.

column2: Why would I want to feel awkward: Katrina on equation with exes
column3: Actress Katrina Kaif, while speaking about her equation with her exes, said she doesn't feel awkward in the presence of her exes. She added, "Why would I want to feel awkward in anyone's presence? I would rather smile, laugh, have a good chat and keep it easy, instead of keeping a sad face. Simple!"

column2: Fans thought Ram was married to Sakshi, gave me weird looks: Wife
column3: Actor Ram Kapoor's wife Gautami Kapoor has revealed that during the days when her husband starred in 'Bade Acche Lagte Hai', fans thought he was married to the show's actress Sakshi Tanwar in real life. "When we'd travel abroad, people would give me weird looks," she added. "With social media, people thankfully know I'm his lawfully wedded wife," said Gautami.

column2: Going to work 10 times harder: Angelina on starring in Marvel film
column3: Angelina Jolie, who has joined the Marvel Cinematic Universe and will star in Marvel's upcoming film 'The Eternals', has said she's "going to work ten times harder". "We all know what the task is ahead, and we know what you deserve, and so we're all going to be working very hard. So I am in training and thrilled," she added.

column2: Umpire who gave England 6 overthrows in WC final admits it was a mistake
column3: Umpire Kumar Dharmasena has admitted that awarding England six overthrows instead of five in final over of 2019 World Cup final was a mistake. "I agree...there was a judgmental error when I see it on TV replays now. But we didn't have luxury of TV replays at the ground," he said. He further said that he'll never regret the decision.

column2: Really enjoyed it, it was timely: Chief selector on Rayudu's '3D' tweet
column3: Reacting to ex-India cricketer Ambati Rayudu's '3D glasses' tweet, BCCI chief selector MSK Prasad said he really enjoyed the ex-batsman's tweet. "It was a lovely tweet. That was sarcasm. It was timely," he said. Further, talking about not selecting Rayudu in 2019 World Cup squad, Prasad said, "Due to certain combinations, he wasn't picked. It doesn't make Selection Committee biased."

column2: PV Sindhu wins her first silver medal of the year at Indonesia Open
column3: World number five PV Sindhu won her first silver medal of the year after finishing second at the Indonesia Open on Sunday. The 24-year-old lost her first final of the year to world number four Akane Yamaguchi 15-21, 16-21 in 51 minutes. Sindhu will next play the Japan Open, which is scheduled to begin on July 23.

column2: Hongmeng OS not a replacement for Android, clarifies Huawei
column3: Chinese smartphone manufacturer Huawei's Senior Vice President Catherine Chen has denied the reports that speculated that the company's in-house platform Hongmeng OS is a replacement for Android on smartphones. Chen said that it's not designed for smartphones and the company plans to continue using Android. Chen added that the Hongmeng operating system is for industrial use.

column2: TikTok owner ByteDance to open local data centre for Indian users
column3: TikTok's Chinese owner ByteDance has announced plans to establish a local data centre in India. "We're now in the process of examining options for safe, secure and reliable services for our Indian users within India's borders," ByteDance said. As per a report, the local data centre will be part of $1 billion investment in India that ByteDance had announced earlier.

column2: We shouldn't compare startup ecosystems: Endiya Partners' MD
column3: Hyderabad-based tech-focused seed-stage venture capital firm Endiya Partners' Managing Director Sateesh Andra, when asked why is Hyderabad's startup ecosystem less vibrant than Bengaluru's, said, "We shouldn’t compare startup ecosystems." He admitted that Bengaluru has leapfrogged Hyderabad in those terms. However, he added that venture capitalists find good entrepreneurs irrespective of where they are.

column2: UP businessman pays ₹32,380 bail of 17 prisoners on his 73rd b'day
column3: Uttar Pradesh businessman Motilal Yadav on his 73rd birthday on Saturday deposited ₹32,380 bail money for 17 Agra prisoners who couldn't afford it. Yadav's son suggested him to do something for them after reading about a businessman who donated steel glasses to prisoners. "My younger son, an advocate, suggested I should pay the penalty amount of the inmates," Yadav added.

column2: British finance minister says he will resign if Boris becomes PM
column3: British finance minister Philip Hammond has said he will resign from the post if Boris Johnson becomes Prime Minister. "Assuming that Boris Johnson becomes Prime Minister, I understand that his conditions for serving in his government would include accepting a no-deal Brexit on the 31st of October. That is not something I could ever sign up to," Hammond added.

column2: UltraTech's Kumar Birla's remuneration fell 18.8% to ₹15.53cr in FY19
column3: UltraTech Cement's Chairman Kumar Mangalam Birla received an annual remuneration of ₹15.53 crore in FY 2018-19, down 18.82% over the year-ago period remuneration of ₹19.13 crore. In FY 2016-17, Birla had received a remuneration of ₹22.50 crore. However, in the financial year 2018-19, the median remuneration of employees was ₹7.65 lakh, an increase of 8.5%.

column2: Manny Pacquiao beats Keith Thurman by split decision
column3: Filipino senator Manny Pacquiao became the oldest welterweight champion in boxing history after he beat Keith Thurman on a split-decision victory on Saturday. Pacquiao, a world champion at eight weights, was fighting in the 71st bout of his career. "I think I will fight next year," the 40-year-old Filipino senator said after the match.

column2: Strict action against state units over overage athletes: AFI
column3: Speaking about athletes manipulating their age for athletics events, Athletics Federation of India's president, Adille Sumariwalla said, "We will suspend the secretaries of erring state units and form ad-hoc bodies." Notably, in the Youth National Championships at Vadodara last year, 27 entries out of a total of 602 were found overage.

column2: Bangladesh cricketers arrive in Sri Lanka under high security
column3: Bangladesh's cricket team arrived in Sri Lanka amid tight security on Saturday. Bangladesh is the first foreign sporting team to visit the island since the deadly Easter attacks earlier this year. "We have special security arrangements at match venues too," a police official said about the security arrangements made for the visiting team.

column2: PM Modi govt has changed India, brought 'achhe din': Nadda
column3: BJP working President JP Nadda on Sunday said that "achhe din" has arrived under PM Narendra Modi-led government and the country has changed in the last five years. He added that by saying 'Congress-mukt Bharat', the party means a country free of "corruption and commission". Nadda further said that PM Modi has changed the "political culture" of the country.

column2: BJP won LS polls by using EVMs, CRPF and EC: Mamata
column3: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee claimed that the BJP won the general elections by using EVMs, CRPF, Central Police and Election Commission. She alleged that the workers of the BJP are trying to capture TMC's offices and beating up workers. Mamata also accused the BJP of indulging in horse-trading by offering "₹2 crore and a petrol pump" to TMC MLAs.

column2: 1 killed,18 injured after tempo overturns in Thane: Police
column3: A labourer was killed and 18 others were injured after their tempo overturned on Saket bridge in Maharashtra's Thane, police said. The commuters of the tempo were contract workers, who were going to Mumbai to trim trees, the police added. A police official said that the tempo driver was drunk at the time of the incident.

column2: 1 dead, 1 injured in Mumbai's Churchill Chamber building fire
column3: One person was killed and another was injured after a fire broke out on the third floor of the four-storey Churchill Chamber building in Mumbai's Colaba on Sunday afternoon. At least 14 residents have been rescued and brought down safely by firefighters so far. The cause of the fire is yet to be ascertained, a BMC ward officer said.

column2: Over ₹5,800 cr sanctioned for cleaning 34 polluted rivers: Govt
column3: The Environment Ministry said that ₹5,870.55 crore has been sanctioned under the National River Conservation Plan for pollution abatement at 34 river stretches in 16 states across the country. The Centre has released its share of ₹2,522 crore to states, it added. In the last one year, ₹143 crore has been released to nine states for the same, it said.

column2: Agencies gave IL&FS good ratings despite stress flags: Audit
column3: A Grant Thornton audit into debt-laden IL&FS Group revealed that rating agencies despite flagging financial stress before its default, continued to give it and its units "consistently high" credit ratings. It said officials of agencies including ICRA, CARE, Brickwork and India Ratings, were possibly given gifts like smartwatches and overseas sports event tickets to influence the ratings.

column2: Pvt insurance firms paid ₹7 cr in claims to Railway passengers
column3: Private insurance firms have paid ₹7 crore in claims under IRCTC's optional travel insurance scheme in last two years, an RTI reply revealed. In comparison, they received about ₹46 crore premium from Indian Railways and its passengers, under the scheme launched in 2016 at ₹0.92 premium per passenger. Of the amount, Railways paid ₹38.89 crore, while passengers paid ₹7.29 crore.

column2: India squads for WI tour announced, Pant keeper in all 3 formats
column3: The BCCI on Sunday announced Team India squads for the upcoming tour of West Indies. Rishabh Pant has been named as the first-choice wicketkeeper in all three formats after limited-overs wicketkeeper-batsman MS Dhoni made himself unavailable on Saturday. Rohit Sharma returns to the Test side after December 2018. India are scheduled to play three T20Is, three ODIs and two Tests.

column2: Former Delhi CM Sheila Dikshit cremated with state honours
column3: Three-time Delhi Chief Minister Sheila Dikshit, who passed away on Saturday, was cremated with state honours at Nigam Bodh Ghat on Sunday. Her mortal remains were kept at the Congress headquarters for people to pay their final respects. Instead of a traditional pyre of wood, Dikshit was cremated in CNG machine as she had wished, her son Sandeep Dikshit said.

column2: Akhtar comments after Tharoor wrongly attributes shayari to Ghalib
column3: Javed Akhtar commented on a Twitter post by Shashi Tharoor wherein he had wrongly attributed a shayari to Mirza Ghalib. Akhtar wrote, "Shashi Ji, who ever has given you these lines should never be trusted again." Thanking Akhtar, Tharoor wrote, "It seems that whenever people like a shayari, they credit Ghalib for it! Apologies."

column2: Asthma patient Priyanka criticised after smoking pic goes viral
column3: Asthma patient Priyanka Chopra, who was the ambassador for an anti-cracker campaign on Diwali last year, was criticised by Twitter users after a picture of her smoking cigarette during her birthday celebrations went viral. The photo received comments like, "Good to see @priyankachopra's asthma has been cured overnight" and "Priyanka must tell the world how to cure asthma with smokes".

column2: Natalie Portman to play female Thor in 'Thor: Love and Thunder'
column3: Hollywood actress Natalie Portman will portray female Thor in the upcoming film of the franchise, titled 'Thor: Love and Thunder', the film's maker announced at San Diego Comic-Con. "That storyline is incredible, is full emotion, love and thunder and introduces for the first time female Thor," said director Taika Waititi. The film will also star Chris Hemsworth and Tessa Thompson.

column2: Replays to call front-foot no ball to be trialled in India: Report
column3: Replays to call front-foot no-balls will be trialled for the first time in India during the domestic season and could be extended to international matches to be hosted by the country, as per reports. The ICC took the decision reportedly after a request from the BCCI. If implemented, the third umpire will be constantly involved.

column2: Blizzard Co-founder Frank Pearce quits company after 28 years
column3: American video game developer Blizzard Entertainment's Co-founder Frank Pearce is leaving the company and his role as the Chief Development Officer. Pearce founded the company 28 years ago with Mike Morhaime and Allen Adham. Allen left in 2004 but came back in 2016 to oversee the development of new titles. Morhaime stepped down as President and CEO last year.

column2: Poco product head, Xiaomi global spokesperson quit
column3: Chinese smartphone manufacturer Xiaomi's global spokesperson Donovan Sung and sub-brand Poco's product head Jai Mani have quit the company. In a tweet, Sung wrote, "It is my last month at Xiaomi." Sung will be joining Google in Singapore to help with the advancement of their payment system Google Pay.

column2: Donald Trump becoming face of 'racism and exclusion': Siemens CEO
column3: German multinational conglomerate Siemens' CEO Joe Kaeser took to Twitter and said US President Donald Trump is becoming the face of 'racism and exclusion'. "I lived in the USA for many years and experienced freedom, tolerance and openness as never before," Kaeser said. This comes after Trump asked four female Democratic lawmakers to "go back" to where they came from.

column2: TikTok working on Instagram-like grid feed layout: Report
column3: Short video-sharing app TikTok is reportedly working on a grid feed layout which works like Instagram's Explore feed. The feature was spotted by reverse-engineering specialist Jane Manchun Wong, who shared screengrabs of the feature on Twitter. TikTok is also said to be working on more Instagram-like features including an account switcher and a Discover page.

column2: Former Delhi BJP chief Mange Ram Garg passes away aged 82
column3: Former Delhi BJP President Mange Ram Garg, who was undergoing treatment at a hospital after suffering brain haemorrhage last week, passed away aged 82 on Sunday. Garg was elected to the Delhi Legislative Assembly in 2003. Condoling his demise, BJP working President JP Nadda said that Garg's demise is an "irreparable loss" to the party.

column2: Over half a dozen unicorns created in India so far in 2019: Report
column3: Over half a dozen unicorns (startups valued at $1 billion or more) have been created in India so far this year, as per Venture Intelligence. These include Wipro's Azim Premji-backed Icertis, grocery startup BigBasket, logistics startups Rivigo and Delhivery, software firm Druva and fantasy gaming startup Dream11. IT healthcare firm CitiusTech and Ola's Ola Electric also became unicorns this year.

column2: 7 killed as suicide bomber strikes hospital in Pakistan
column3: A suicide bomber, believed to be a woman, killed at least 7 people and wounded several others in an attack outside a local civilian hospital in Pakistan on Sunday. Officials said the blast had damaged the emergency ward of the hospital. The attack in Dera Ismail Khan was claimed by Tehrik-e-Taliban Pakistan, also known as the Pakistan Taliban.

column2: Tata Motors MD draws ₹26.29cr salary, 2 times more than M&M's in FY19
column3: Tata Motors' Managing Director and CEO Guenter Butschek's remuneration was ₹26.29 crore in FY19, an increase of 1.57% from the previous year, as per the company's annual report. This was over twice of Mahindra & Mahindra Managing Director Pawan Goenka's total remuneration of ₹12.19 crore for FY19. Goenka's remuneration was at a marginal decline of 0.16% from the previous fiscal.

column2: Not more than 5,000 people in super-rich category: Sitharaman
column3: Explaining her decision to tax the super-rich in the Budget, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that not more than 5,000 people are in the super-rich category in the country. She said they should shoulder part of the government's responsibility in supporting the poor. She added that the tax isn't a highway robbery or done with the intention to affect business.

column2: Rajshahi Kings sign JP Duminy for Bangladesh Premier League
column3: South African cricketer JP Duminy, who recently announced his retirement from the ODI format, has been signed by Bangladesh Premier League side Rajshahi Kings. Duminy, who will be playing for the first time in BPL, has played in IPL and PSL as well. The 35-year-old had earlier expressed his desire to continue playing T20 cricket for South Africa.

column2: PM, Prez condole death of ex-Delhi BJP chief Mange Ram Garg
column3: PM Narendra Modi and President Ram Nath Kovind on Sunday condoled the death of former Delhi BJP chief Mange Ram Garg. The President said, "His service to the people, particularly in the national capital, will be cherished." Expressing grief, PM Modi said that Garg had a deep connect with Delhi and played a "pivotal role" in strengthening BJP in Delhi.

column2: Replace EVMs with ballot papers: WB CM Mamata Banerjee
column3: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Saturday demanded to replace Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) with ballot papers, adding that electoral reforms are needed in the country. "If we want to stop the use of black money in elections, save democracy and let political parties maintain transparency, you must go for electoral reforms," Mamata said.

column2: Lockheed Martin signs MoUs with three Indian startups
column3: US-based aerospace and defence company Lockheed Martin has signed MoUs with three Indian startups - Terero Mobility, Sastra Robotics, and NoPo Nanotechnologies. They will integrate with Lockheed's supply chain, and contribute to the evolution of aerospace and defence industry. The startups were identified through the India Innovation Growth Programme (IIGP).

column2: Tanzanian woman held for human trafficking in Hyderabad
column3: A Tanzanian woman was arrested and two others were rescued after police busted an international human trafficking racket in Hyderabad. The police said, the accused, along with her friend, used to arrange their friends from Tanzania and indulge them in sexual activities with the customers. They used to tempt customers by uploading victims' photographs on porn websites, the police added.

column2: UP woman tries to kidnap daughter for marrying against wishes
column3: A woman allegedly tried to abduct her own daughter from a local court when the latter came with her husband in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur on Saturday. The accused had opposed her daughter's marriage to the man and filed a molestation case against her son-in-law, police said. The couple was in court for a different matter when the incident took place.

column2: UP govt trying to protect accused in Sonbhadra firing: Cong
column3: Congress spokesperson Randeep Surjewala alleged that the Uttar Pradesh government is trying to protect the accused in Sonbhadra firing in which 10 tribals were killed. He said that instead of ensuring justice, CM Yogi Adityanath was targeting Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi, who was detained on her way to meet the victims. He added, "Adityanath has made Uttar Pradesh 'Apradh Pradesh'."

column2: 8-month-old killed, 5 injured in Himachal Pradesh landslide
column3: An eight-month-old girl was killed and five others sustained multiple injuries in a landslide in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra district on Saturday. The tourists were going from Bhagsu Nag temple towards Bhagsu Nag waterfall on foot when the incident occurred. The injured were initially taken to Dharamshala Civil Hospital and were later shifted to Dr Rajendra Prasad Medical College Kangra.

column2: 4 killed over suspicion of witchcraft in Jharkhand: Police
column3: Four people of three different families were killed by unidentified people allegedly over their involvement in witchcraft in Jharkhand's Gumla, police said. According to the locals, 10-12 people came with their faces covered, dragged the victims out of their houses and killed them. "The police are already running campaigns to spread awareness about these issues," Superintendent of Police said.

column2: Considering options to respond to Iran's seizure of tanker: Britain
column3: Britain is looking into a series of options to respond to Iran's seizure of a British-flagged tanker, junior defence minister Tobias Ellwood said on Sunday. "Our first and most important responsibility is to make sure that we get a solution to the issue, make sure other British-flagged ships are safe to operate in these waters," Ellwood added.

column2: IndiGo to seek shareholder nod for independent woman director
column3: IndiGo operator InterGlobe Aviation has said it will seek its shareholders' approval to appoint an independent woman board director, at its Annual General Meeting. Earlier, IndiGo Co-Founder Rakesh Gangwal had alleged airline's non-compliance with SEBI's regulations for not having an independent woman director on its board. InterGlobe said it was working on answering SEBI on Gangwal's grievances.

column2: Error on Amazon sells ₹9 lakh lens for ₹6,500; buyers thank Bezos
column3: An Amazon glitch on Prime Day in the US allowed camera gears from brands including Sony and Canon to be sold at a discount of over 99%. A nearly $13,000 (₹9 lakh) Canon camera lens was sold for about $95 (₹6,500). Some users said they received the gear and thanked Amazon Founder and CEO Jeff Bezos for the glitch.

column2: RGV tweets video of himself triple riding on bike to watch film; fined
column3: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma was fined for traffic violation after he tweeted a video of himself triple riding on a bike to watch a film. Varma and his other two friends were seen riding without helmets in the video. After he shared the video captioned 'Where is the police?', Cyberabad Traffic Police replied, "Thanks @RGVzoomin for reporting Traffic Violations."

column2: #NotMyDeepika trends as fans ask her not to work with #MeToo accused
column3: #NotMyDeepika was trending on Twitter on Saturday as fans of Deepika Padukone took to the site to urge her not to work with sexual harassment accused filmmaker Luv Ranjan. This came after Deepika was spotted leaving the filmmaker's office with Ranbir Kapoor. "Being the top actress of your country...it's YOUR responsibility to set the right example," a user tweeted.

column2: Indian-origin stand-up comedian dies while performing in Dubai
column3: Indian-origin stand-up comedian Manjunath Naidu died on stage while performing his act in Dubai. The 36-year-old suffered a cardiac arrest. A fellow comedian said that Naidu complained of high level of anxiety, sat down on the bench next to him and collapsed onto the floor. He added that the audience thought that it might be a part of his act.

column2: Talks of Dhoni's retirement even before WC looks like agenda: Manager
column3: MS Dhoni's manager and long-time friend Arun Pandey has said that it seemed there was some agenda after talks of Dhoni's retirement started even before the 2019 World Cup. "It was hurtful. These things don't bother him. There is no such plan. Where is the question of his retirement when he's playing? It'll be his decision," he added.

column2: Can't afford to hang on to World Cup win: James Anderson
column3: Following England's World Cup victory, pacer James Anderson has said that England cricketers can't afford to hang on to the World Cup win. "It's our job as English cricketers to try and carry that momentum on and hopefully an Ashes win will do that," he added. "It’s a really exciting time for English cricket," he further said.

column2: Man gets electricity bill of ₹128cr, loses connection for not paying
column3: Shamim, a resident of UP's Hapur has allegedly received an electricity bill of ₹128 crore and the electricity department has cut the connection after he failed to pay it. Shamim's wife said, "We use only fan and light. How can the amount be so high?" "This must be technical fault...We'll issue them an updated bill," said an assistant electrical engineer.

column2: Technical snag fixed, Chandrayaan-2 ready for launch: Ex-ISRO chief
column3: Former ISRO chairman AS Kiran Kumar on Saturday said that the technical snag which affected Chandrayaan-2's launch has been fixed and it's ready for launch on July 22. "We intend to move towards the moon on August 14 and land around September 6. All activities are in full swing and we're getting ready for the launch," he added.

column2: Britain writes to UN after Iran seizes oil tanker, calls it 'illegal'
column3: Britain has written to the UN Security Council after Iran seized a British-flagged oil tanker, saying the vessel was approached by Iranian forces when it was in Omani territorial waters. Britain said that Iran's action constitutes "illegal interference". "The ship was exercising the lawful right of transit passage in an international strait as provided for under international law," Britain wrote.

column2: Pakistan PM Imran Khan arrives in US, to meet Trump on Monday
column3: Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan arrived in the US on Saturday on a three-day official trip. Khan is scheduled to meet US President Donald Trump at the White House on Monday. The cricketer-turned-politician arrived aboard a commercial Qatar Airways flight and is staying at the official residence of the Pakistan's Ambassador to the US, Asad Majeed Khan.

column2: US-S Korea military exercise to proceed despite N Korea's warning
column3: The secretary for peace planning to South Korean President Moon Jae-in, Jong Kun Choi, has said a US-South Korean military exercise would go ahead as planned next month. This comes despite North Korea's warning that the exercise will put talks aimed at getting the country to abandon its nuclear weapons at risk. "The nature of exercise isn't offensive," Choi said.

column2: Iran releases video of British-flagged oil tanker's capture
column3: Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps has released a video showing British-flagged oil tanker Stena Impero's capture. The video shows speedboats pulling up alongside the tanker, and troops wearing ski masks and carrying machine guns being lowered onto its deck from a helicopter. The same tactics were used by British Royal Marines to seize an Iranian oil tanker two weeks ago.

column2: Boxer Shiva wins 1st gold for India at 2019 President's Cup
column3: Four-time Asian Championships medallist Shiva Thapa won India's first gold at 2019 President's Cup boxing tournament after getting a walkover in the final in Kazakhstan on Saturday. Thapa, who was making his international debut in 63 kg category, was scheduled to fight Kazakhstan's Zakir Safiullin, who pulled out due to injury. Meanwhile, 19-year-old Praveen won silver in 60 kg category.

column2: Tinder bypassing Google Play in-app billing to avoid 30% fee
column3: Online dating app Tinder is bypassing Google Play in-app billing on Android to avoid paying a 30% cut to Google. The platform has added a new default payment process, requiring users to enter their credit card details straight into Tinder's app. Tinder-parent Match declined to answer questions about whether the company was also investigating bypassing Apple's App Store, Bloomberg revealed.

column2: Google to pay $11 mn to settle job seekers' age-bias claims
column3: Technology giant Google has agreed to pay $11 million to settle a class-action lawsuit which accused it of age bias and discrimination against old-age applicants. The lawsuit had claimed the offers discriminated by an average payout of more than $35,000 for 227 people. Google said the applicants were found to be "Googley" enough but lacked required technical skills.

column2: Sheila Dikshit made Delhi better place for all: Sonia Gandhi
column3: UPA Chairperson Sonia Gandhi condoled the death of former Delhi CM Sheila Dikshit, saying she worked with such vision to transform Delhi to make it a better place to live in for all its citizen. Sonia added that Dikshit served the Congress party with courage and loyalty till the end. Sonia said that Dikshit brought "excellence" to everything she did.

column2: BJP enter WB when riots happen but detained TMC in UP: Mamata
column3: After a TMC delegation was detained on Saturday ahead of its visit to UP's Sonbhadra, TMC chief Mamata Banerjee claimed that BJP enters riot-affected areas in West Bengal but stopped them from visiting Sonbhadra. "They insistently enter affected places, they don't listen to us," she said. Earlier, Congress' Priyanka Gandhi Vadra was also detained while on her way to Sonbhadra.

column2: Sheila Dikshit was architect of modern Delhi: PC Chacko
column3: Delhi Congress in-charge PC Chacko condoled the death of former Delhi CM Sheila Dikshit and said that she was the architect of modern Delhi. He added, "Delhi people will remember her as the most outstanding administrator Delhi had seen." On Wednesday, Chacko authorised three working Presidents to work independently in Delhi, stating Delhi Congress chief Dikshit was "not keeping well".

column2: SoftBank Seoul unit raises $270 mn fund for early-stage startups
column3: Masayoshi Son-led Japanese conglomerate SoftBank's Seoul venture capital unit, focusing on early-stage investments, has raised a fund worth about $270 million. The fund will focus on early-stage startups globally with a focus on Asia, SoftBank revealed. The new fund aims to close in the next six months with investors including South Korea's National Pension Service.

column2: 4 Maoists held for allegedly killing 5 policemen in Jharkhand
column3: Police have arrested four Maoists who were allegedly involved in the killing of five policemen on June 14 in Jharkhand's Seraikela-Kharsawan. The police said that two motorcycles used in the crime and several mobile phones were also seized from their possession. "Raids are on to arrest other members of the bike-borne squad and masterminds," a police official said.

column2: Sanction ₹10,000 cr for flood-hit Bihar: Tejashwi urges Centre
column3: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav urged the Centre to declare Bihar floods as a ''national calamity'' and sanction financial assistance of ₹10,000 crore for the state. According to the state's disaster management department, 97 people have died due to floods in the state. Deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi said, 215 kitchens and 126 relief camps have been established for flood victims.

column2: Hotelier files defamation case against Esha over misconduct allegation
column3: Delhi-based hotelier Rohit Vig has filed a criminal defamation complaint against actress Esha Gupta after she accused him of sexually inappropriate behaviour at a restaurant. Sharing the alleged incident on social media earlier this month, Esha had said, "[Vig] was...raping me with his eyes...He was requested to behave thrice and then leave...Eventually two guards had to be around me."

column2: Cricket is not a sport, says Russian government
column3: The Russian government has refused to officially recognise cricket as a sport. Cricket will not be eligible for support from the Russian Sports Ministry, as per a memo. Footgolf, sports yoga, model plane flying, ice stock sport and korfball are among the disciplines that have found a place in Russia's "registry of sports". Thai boxing has also been denied recognition.

column2: OYO gets $10-billion valuation with Founder buying $2-billion stake
column3: India's most valuable private hotel chain, Gurugram-based OYO has gained a valuation of $10 billion after its 25-year-old Founder Ritesh Agarwal agreed to invest $2 billion to increase his stake. He is buying the shares from existing investors Lightspeed Venture Partners and Sequoia India, reportedly increasing his stake from 10% to 30%. Ritesh Agarwal founded OYO in 2013, aged 19.

column2: 2nd China space station destroyed via controlled re-entry to Earth
column3: Chinese space agency has confirmed the destruction of its 9-tonne experimental space station Tiangong-2 through a controlled re-entry to Earth which burned it up. A small amount of debris fell into a designated South Pacific Ocean security area. Tiangong-2 spent over 1,000 days in space, orbiting Earth 16,209 times. Notably, Tiangong-1 was destroyed in an uncontrolled re-entry in April 2018.

column2: Class 8 student kills self after losing monitor election to a girl
column3: A Class 8 student of a private school in Telangana committed suicide after losing the class monitor election to a girl. The 13-year-old boy, who was missing since Thursday evening, was found dead on a railway track in Ramannapet area on Friday. The boy was reportedly taunted by his classmates and teachers following his defeat to a girl.

column2: PM Modi pays tribute to three-time Delhi CM Sheila Dikshit
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid a visit to three-time Delhi Chief Minister and Congress leader Sheila Dikshit's residence on Saturday and condoled her demise. PM Modi, who was accompanied by Delhi BJP President Manoj Tiwari, said Dikshit made a noteworthy contribution to the development of the national capital. Dikshit died aged 81 after suffering a cardiac arrest today afternoon.

column2: India in touch with Iran for release of 18 Indians on seized ship
column3: Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Raveesh Kumar has said that the country is in touch with Iran to secure the early release and repatriation of 18 Indian nationals on board the seized British-flagged oil tanker. "We are ascertaining further details on the incident," Kumar added. Iran seized the oil tanker two weeks after Britain seized its ship in Gibraltar.

column2: Man who set fire to Japan studio played games non-stop: Neighbour
column3: The 41-year-old who set fire to a Japan animation studio, killing 34, lived alone in his apartment where he played games non-stop, according to his neighbour. He added music from video games blasted from Shinji Aoba's apartment at all hours. "I've never seen him go out during the day...I would regularly hear him go out around midnight," the neighbour added.

column2: Arvind Subramanian counters criticism through new GDP paper
column3: Ex-Chief Economic Adviser Arvind Subramanian has given further evidence that India's growth between 2011-12 and 2016-17 may have been overestimated by 2.5 percentage points. PM's Economic Advisory Council argued that Subramanian overlooked taxation data in his earlier analysis. In a follow-up paper, he argued real growth in direct taxes fell from 14.3% pre-2011 to 3.7% during the post-2011 period.

column2: Insolvency administrator invites resolution plans for Jet Airways
column3: Jet Airways resolution professional, Grant Thornton's Ashish Chhawchharia, has invited Expressions of Interest (EoIs) for the grounded airline by August 3. The final list of prospective applicants will be issued on August 14 and the resolution plans have to be submitted by September 5. Almost 17,000 creditors of the carrier have claimed ₹24,890 crore in dues.

column2: HDFC Bank profit rises 21% in June quarter to ₹5,568 crore
column3: India's largest private lender HDFC Bank registered a 21% net profit rise for the June quarter at ₹5,568 crore. The asset quality of the Mumbai-based bank, which mainly focuses on retail customers, remained stable with gross bad loan ratio standing at 1.4% compared to 1.33% last year. Overall, HDFC's total advances increased by 17% to ₹8.3 lakh crore.

column2: India may engage foreign lenders for loans to small firms
column3: The government is reportedly in talks with foreign lenders to provide as much as ₹1 lakh crore in credit to the country's small enterprises. It is in discussions with multiple foreign lenders, including Germany's state-owned development bank KfW Group, the World Bank and some Canadian institutions. World Bank has said the discussions with the government were in the early stages.

column2: Indian utilities' coal imports in 2019 first half rise over 53%
column3: Coal imports by Indian coal utilities during the first half of 2019 rose 53.4% from a year earlier to 35.47 million tonnes, government data showed. Imports for power plants at Gujarat's Mundra made up 42% of all imports by Indian utilities during the first six months. Imports by Adani Power's Mundra plant more than quadrupled to 9.01 million tonnes.

column2: Hope to see more Indians like Yuvraj play global T20 leagues: Kumble
column3: After BCCI gave Yuvraj Singh permission to play in Global T20, ex-India captain Anil Kumble said the BCCI should make way for more Indians to play in overseas T20 leagues. He added that having Indians in the leagues will be "an immense boost" not just for the growth of the leagues, but also for youngsters who play in those leagues.

column2: 46-yr-old Paes becomes oldest ATP Tour semi-finalist since 2006
column3: India's 46-year-old tennis player Leander Paes became the oldest ATP Tour semi-finalist since John McEnroe at 2006 San Jose. He achieved the feat after he and his partner Marcus Daniell from New Zealand saved three match points to reach doubles semi-finals at ATP Hall of Fame Open. The third-seeded pair defeated unseeded Robert Lindstedt and Matthew Ebden 6-4, 5-7, 14-12.

column2: We ain't got no better wicketkeepers, tweets user about Dhoni
column3: Following MS Dhoni's decision to take a two-month sabbatical from cricket to serve his Territorial Army regiment, a user reacted with a tweet that read, "we ain't got no better wicketkeepers!@msdhoni #WIvIND #WestIndiesTourOfIndia." "Man, The Amount of days i live on earth is directly proportional to my Respect for him!! @msdhoni," read a part of another user's tweet.

column2: Fake FaceApp challenge apps putting malware on devices: Kaspersky
column3: Cybersecurity firm Kaspersky has revealed fake clones of viral photo-editing app FaceApp, that lets users virtually look older, is installing malware such as 'MobiDash' adware on users' devices. Kaspersky added about 500 different users have faced the issue in two days, after first noticing the same on July 7. About 800 modifications of the 'MobiDash' module were identified, it added.

column2: Govt doing everything to provide relief: Assam CM on floods
column3: Sarbananda Sonowal on Saturday said his government is doing everything to provide relief to people affected by floods in the state. "I want to thank Central government and Jal Shakti Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat on behalf of the people of Assam for their help," he added. At least 59 people have died in the floods so far.

column2: Govt doing its best to curb mob lynching: MP Home Minister
column3: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Bala Bachhan on Saturday said that his government is doing its best to curb mob lynching in the state. "There shouldn't be any mob lynching incidents. In fact, the number of crimes has gone down," he added. This comes after two separate incidents of mob lynching reportedly took place in MP's Neemuch and Raisen on Friday.

column2: Sheila Dikshit will always be remembered for her works: Priyanka
column3: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Saturday said that former Delhi CM Sheila Dikshit will always be remembered for her works. "She was a big leader of the Congress and her contribution towards the party, politics...and especially to Delhi, is immense," she added. The three-time Delhi CM passed away at the age of 81 following a cardiac arrest on Saturday.

column2: Man running away from dogs mistaken as thief in UP; set on fire
column3: A man was thrashed and set ablaze allegedly by locals in UP after they mistook him for a thief as he tried hiding in a house on being chased by dogs. So far, two people have been arrested in the case, the police said. The man, identified as Sujit, is undergoing treatment and his condition is reported to be stable.

column2: ₹5 lakh ex-gratia for families of 10 killed in Sonbhadra firing
column3: The UP government on Saturday issued a compensation of ₹5 lakh each for the families of the 10 deceased in the Sonbhadra firing. "According to the instructions of CM (Yogi Adityanath), ₹5 lakh was made available to the families," Sonbhadra District Magistrate Ankit Agarwal said. "Disputed land matters will be looked into by a committee formed...in this matter," Agarwal added.

column2: Woman throws baby girl in drain in Haryana, two dogs rescue newborn
column3: A woman was captured on CCTV throwing a baby girl wrapped in plastic in a drain in Haryana's Kaithal. Alerted by the sound of the wailing baby, two stray dogs in the area started barking and rushed in the direction of the newborn. The dogs then pulled the child out of the drain. A case has been registered.

column2: Delhi to observe 2-day mourning over ex-CM Sheila Dikshit's death
column3: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has said Delhi will observe two-day state mourning over the demise of three-time CM Sheila Dikshit. The Congress leader was admitted to a hospital earlier today and passed away at 3:55 PM after suffering a cardiac arrest. Her mortal remains will be kept at her residence from 6 PM today to 11:30 AM tomorrow.

column2: Punjab CM Amarinder Singh accepts Navjot Singh Sidhu's resignation
column3: Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh has accepted Navjot Singh Sidhu's resignation as a state minister. Sidhu had also sent his resignation letter dated June 10 to then-Congress President Rahul Gandhi. Punjab CM had divested Sidhu of the Local Government and Tourism and Cultural Affairs Departments and allotted him the Power and New and Renewable Energy Sources portfolios last month.

column2: Lifelong Congresswoman: Congress on Sheila Dikshit's demise
column3: Following the demise of former Delhi Chief Minister Sheila Dikshit, Congress tweeted, "Lifelong Congresswoman and as three time CM of Delhi she transformed the face of Delhi." "Our condolences to her family and friends. Hope they find strength in this time of grief," the party added. The three-time Delhi CM passed away on Saturday at the age of 81.

column2: Sheila Dikshit was a fierce champion of the people: Gautam Gambhir
column3: Following the demise of three-time Delhi Chief Minister Sheila Dikshit, BJP MP Gautam Gambhir tweeted, "I'm deeply saddened to hear about the untimely death of Sheila Dixitji." He added, "A fierce champion of the people, she dedicated her life to better Delhi. A huge loss for the capital. My thoughts and prayers are with her family and friends."

column2: Sheila Dikshit beloved daughter of Cong, devastated on her demise: Rahul
column3: Following the demise of senior Congress leader and three-time Delhi Chief Minister Sheila Dikshit, former Congress President Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "I'm devastated to hear about the passing away of Sheila Dikshit Ji, a beloved daughter of the Congress Party, with whom I shared a close personal bond." He further said that Dikshit served selflessly as a three-term CM.

column2: Six states including Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal get new Governors
column3: Madhya Pradesh Governor Anandiben Patel has been appointed the new Governor of Uttar Pradesh, while Bihar Governor Lal Ji Tandon has been shifted to Madhya Pradesh. Phagu Chauhan will be the new Governor of Bihar. Jagdeep Dhankhar and Ramesh Bais have been appointed new Governors of West Bengal and Tripura respectively, while RN Ravi has been named Nagaland Governor.

column2: Last rites of former Delhi CM Sheila Dikshit to take place tomorrow
column3: The last rites of former Delhi Chief Minister Sheila Dikshit will take place at Delhi's Nigambodh Ghat at 2:30 PM on Sunday. The 81-year-old was admitted to the Fortis Escorts Heart Institute on Saturday following a cardiac arrest. Doctors said her condition stabilised temporarily, adding that she passed away at 3:55 PM after suffering another cardiac arrest.

column2: Amit Burman replaces cousin Anand Burman as Dabur India Chairman
column3: FMCG major Dabur India on Friday appointed Amit Burman as its Chairman, replacing cousin Anand Burman, who stepped down as a director and Chairman. Amit had been Dabur's Vice Chairman since 2007. The company further appointed Mohit Burman as Vice Chairman, and inducted Anand Burman’s son Aditya Burman as a non-executive additional director on the board.

column2: Mukesh Ambani's cousins on Reliance board were paid more than him
column3: Asia's richest man and Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani has kept his salary capped at ₹15 crore for the eleventh consecutive year in 2018-19. His cousins Hital Meswani and Nikhil Meswani, who are Executive Directors, received compensation of ₹20.57 crore each. Ambani's pay is set at ₹15 crore "to set a personal example for moderation in managerial compensation levels".

column2: Brookfield to invest ₹25,200 cr in Reliance's tower assets
column3: Canada's Brookfield has agreed to invest ₹25,215 crore in Reliance Industries-sponsored Tower Infrastructure Trust. The trust holds a 51% stake in Reliance Jio Infratel, to which the tower assets of Reliance Jio were transferred recently. Proceeds from the investment will be used by the trust to acquire the remaining 49% stake in Reliance Jio Infratel, currently held by Reliance Industries.

column2: Aditya Birla Payments Bank shuts down within 18 months of launch
column3: Aditya Birla Payments Bank, a joint venture between Grasim and Vodafone Idea, has announced it's shutting down just 18 months after it commenced operations. Payments banks cannot accept deposits of over ₹1 lakh from one account holder and are not allowed to lend. The company said it has made "full and complete arrangements" for the return of all deposits.

column2: Algeria beat Senegal to win Africa Cup of Nations
column3: Algeria won the Africa Cup of Nations for the second time after beating Senegal 1-0 in the final on Friday. The match's solitary goal came when Baghdad Bounedjah's shot took a deflection off Salif Sane and looped over the Senegalese goalkeeper Alfred Gomis and into the net. Notably, according to official statistics, Algeria committed 32 fouls.

column2: India’s mixed relay silver at Asiad 2018 to be upgraded to gold
column3: India's Asian Games 2018 silver in 4x400 mixed relay is set to be upgraded to gold after Bahrain's Kemi Adekoya was handed a four-year ban by the Athletics Integrity Unit (AIU) for failing a dope test. Adekoya had also won the 400m hurdles gold at the Asian Games with India's Anu Raghavan finishing fourth, who will be upgraded to bronze.

column2: Ibrahimovic scores hat-trick to help Galaxy beat rivals LAFC
column3: Former Manchester United forward Zlatan Ibrahimovic on Friday scored all three goals to power the LA Galaxy to a 3-2 victory over MLS rivals Los Angeles Football Club. This was the 37-year-old Swede's second hat-trick in Major League Soccer. Notably, there were a total of eight yellow cards handed out Friday, with five going to the Galaxy.

column2: Argentina's WC-winning coach Bilardo in serious condition
column3: Argentina's 1986 World Cup-winning coach Carlos Bilardo is in a serious condition in hospital following his brain surgery. The 81-year-old was taken into intensive care at the Argentine Institute of Diagnosis in Buenos Aires on July 4. Bilardo is suffering from Hakim-Adams syndrome, a neurodegenerative disease, for which he was twice hospitalized in 2018.

column2: Microsoft's 3D hologram can speak any language in users' voice
column3: Microsoft unveiled an AI-powered life-sized mixed reality human hologram, capable of speaking any language. In a demo, Microsoft executive Julia White's hologram delivered an English speech in Japanese. Microsoft revealed it did so by first translating the speech into Japanese and then using neural text-to-speech to convert the translated text into real speech, which also sounded like White.

column2: Sonbhadra firing case shouldn't be politicised: UP Deputy CM
column3: Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM Dinesh Sharma on Saturday accused Congress' Priyanka Gandhi Vadra of politicising the Sonbhadra incident and said no one should do politics on sensitive issues. "If you use the...incident to fulfil your political ambitions, it's incorrect," he added. Earlier today, Priyanka announced that Congress will give ₹10 lakh each to the relatives of those killed in Sonbhadra.

column2: UP govt imposed Section 144 in Sonbhadra to hide failures: Mayawati
column3: BSP chief Mayawati on Saturday alleged that BJP government in UP was using Section 144 to hide its shortcomings and not allowing anyone to visit Sonbhadra, where 10 were killed following a property dispute. Under Section 144, an assembly of more than four persons in an area is prohibited. "Government's laxity was the main reason for this massacre," Mayawati tweeted.

column2: We are not suitcase-carrying government: Nirmala Sitharaman
column3: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday said PM Narendra Modi-led government is not a suitcase-carrying government. "For Budget 2019, I didn't carry a suitcase...A suitcase denotes something else: suitcase-taking, suitcase-giving," she added while speaking at the International Business Conference of Nagarathars. Notably, Sitharaman brought the Budget for 2019-20 wrapped in a red cloth.

column2: California software startup Notion Labs to get $10 million
column3: California-based enterprise software-as-a-service (SaaS) startup Notion Labs is raising $10 million from angel investors including former Y Combinator Partner Daniel Gross, among others. "Notion...could've been a higher valuation but we wanted to remain under unicorn ($1 billion) valuation to avoid the hype," COO Akshay Kothari said. Former LinkedIn India head Kothari had joined Notion in 2018.

column2: 2 students injured after explosion in Odisha school
column3: At least two students were injured in an explosion inside a school in Odisha's Ganjam district on Saturday morning. As per reports, a student stumbled upon an unidentified object and threw it on the floor, causing the explosion. "Such unfortunate incidents have occurred as most of the schools have no boundary walls," School and Mass Education Minister Samir Dash said.

column2: J'khand man held for smoking on plane, faces jail or ₹1L fine
column3: A Jharkhand man was deplaned and arrested on Friday for allegedly smoking inside a plane lavatory and reportedly faces three months in jail or ₹1 lakh fine for the offence. The incident came to light when the smoke alarm inside the Ranchi-bound flight went off. The accused has not been charged under the non-bailable section for the offence so far.

column2: Huge loss for Delhi: Delhi CM Kejriwal on Sheila Dikshit's demise
column3: After the demise of three-time Delhi CM Sheila Dikshit, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal tweeted, "Just now got to know about extremely terrible news about the passing away of Mrs Sheila Dikshit ji." He added, "It's a huge loss for Delhi and her contribution will always be remembered. My heartfelt condolences to her family members. May her soul rest in peace."

column2: Taj Mahal security to be raised after Sena's 'aarti' threat
column3: Agra's district administration has agreed to increase security outside Taj Mahal after Shiv Sena's threat of performing 'aarti' at the monument on every Monday of the month of 'Sawan'. ASI authorities had requested more security, citing the Ancient Monuments and Archaeological Sites and Remains Act which prevents any kind of religious practice and beginning of new tradition at protected monuments.

column2: Dhoni makes himself unavailable for WI tour, to serve his regiment
column3: Ex-India captain MS Dhoni on Saturday made himself unavailable for the team's upcoming tour of West Indies. Dhoni, who holds an honorary rank of Lieutenant Colonel in Parachute Regiment of Territorial Army, will spend the next two months with his regiment, a senior BCCI official told PTI. The selection committee will pick the team for West Indies tour on Sunday.

column2: Three-time Delhi Chief Minister Sheila Dikshit passes away aged 81
column3: Senior Congress leader and former Delhi Chief Minister Sheila Dikshit passed away at the age of 81 on Saturday. She breathed her last at 3:55 PM at Delhi's Fortis Escorts Heart Institute after suffering a cardiac arrest at 3:15 PM. Dikshit was the longest serving Chief Minister of Delhi, serving for a period of 15 years from 1998 to 2013.

column2: Karan Patel quits 'Yeh Hai Mohabbatein'
column3: Television actor Karan Patel has quit the show 'Yeh Hai Mohabbatein' to participate in the reality show 'Khatron Ke Khiladi'. "We tried to work out dates to accommodate many commitments but because it didn't seem possible, we've chosen to end a memorable journey...The serial gave him so much love, for which he'll be grateful," a statement by his team read.

column2: Google may be fined ₹136cr for abuse of Android dominance in India
column3: India antitrust watchdog Competition Commission of India (CCI) is reportedly planning to impose a fine of more than ₹136 crore on Google over allegations of abuse of Android's market dominance. Google's restrictions on device manufacturers appeared to amount to 'unfair conditions' under Indian competition law, the CCI had found. The watchdog had reportedly started its probe on Google in April.

column2: Chrome, Firefox users' data leaked, for sale at ₹700: Researcher
column3: Extensions on Chrome and Firefox internet browsers leaked millions of users' data, including medical, credit card and tax returns information, cyber-security researcher Sam Jadali revealed. The data was leaked to a fee-based company Nacho Analytics, which gives unlimited access to any websites' analytics data, Jadali said. The data was reportedly put on sale for as little as $10 (nearly ₹700).

column2: Madras HC bans bike-taxi startup Rapido in Tamil Nadu
column3: The Madras High Court has banned the operations of Bengaluru-based bike-taxi startup Rapido in Tamil Nadu, which will be effective until the state government formulates new regulations. The HC has given four months' time to the Tamil Nadu government to come out with appropriate regulations for the bike taxi segment. Notably, Apple has removed Rapido's app from the App Store.

column2: Priyanka ends dharna, announces ₹10L for Sonbhadra victims' families
column3: Priyanka Gandhi on Saturday ended her dharna after meeting kin of those shot dead in land dispute in UP's Sonbhadra. She also announced a compensation of ₹10 lakh to the kin of each victim. "My objective has been served," Priyanka said. She was detained by UP police while she was on her way to visit the families of victims.

column2: PM Modi condoles Sheila Dikshit's death, says deeply saddened
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi condoled the demise of former Delhi Chief Minister Sheila Dikshit who passed away on Saturday at the age of 81. "Deeply saddened by the demise of Sheila Dikshit Ji. Blessed with a warm and affable personality, she made a noteworthy contribution to Delhi's development," PM Modi said. She was the longest serving Chief Minister of Delhi.

column2: We've been detained ahead of our visit to Sonbhadra: TMC leaders
column3: A Trinamool Congress (TMC) delegation was detained at the Varanasi airport on Saturday ahead of its visit to Sonbhadra, party MP Derek O'Brien said. The delegation arrived in Varanasi to meet the injured at the BHU Trauma Centre. They were further going to meet the families of the victims of the Sonbhadra massacre in which 10 people were killed.

column2: Nirbhaya rape convict's pic used on poll awareness poster in Punjab
column3: The District Election Office in Punjab's Hoshiarpur used a picture of Nirbhaya rape convict Mukesh Singh in its poster on poll awareness. "It must be a mistake as no one would have put it on purpose. We will conduct a probe to find out how it happened," Punjab Cabinet Minister Sham Arora said.

column2: Benjamin Netanyahu becomes longest-serving Israeli PM
column3: Benjamin Netanyahu has become Israel's longest-serving Prime Minister, surpassing the record set by the country's founding father and first leader David Ben-Gurion. As of Saturday, Netanyahu has spent 4,876 days – more than 13 years – in office. Netanyahu won his first election in 1996, becoming Israel's youngest-ever Prime Minister at the age of 46.

column2: Trump offers to help ease tensions in Japan-South Korea dispute
column3: US President Donald Trump on Friday offered to help ease tensions in the political and economic dispute between Japan and South Korea. "It's like a full-time job getting involved with Japan and South Korea. But I like leaders of both the countries," Trump said. The dispute threatens global supplies of memory chips and smartphones.

column2: Rajan confirms he didn't apply for Bank of England Governor post
column3: Ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan has confirmed in an interview to BBC that he didn't apply for the post of Bank of England Governor, saying central banking has become "much more political" in recent times. "It's best the country have somebody who understands the political structure within that country and how to navigate that...It's obvious I'm an outsider," said Rajan.

column2: Will work to free rapper A$AP Rocky from detention in Sweden: Trump
column3: US President Donald Trump has said he'll be working to free rapper A$AP Rocky, who's in police custody in Sweden. "I'll be calling the very talented Prime Minister of Sweden to see what we can do about helping Rocky," Trump tweeted. The rapper, whose real name is Rakim Mayers, was arrested over his alleged involvement in a fight in Stockholm.

column2: Humans are children of sages not monkeys: BJP MP
column3: BJP MP Satya Pal Singh on Friday said that humans are 'special manufacturing of nature' and are the children of Indian sages. "I don't want to hurt the sentiments of those who think they're the children of monkeys," he added. Earlier, Singh had dismissed Darwin's evolution theory by saying that no one has seen an ape turn into a man.

column2: BJP, Cong equally responsible for atrocities on tribals: Mayawati
column3: BSP's Mayawati on Friday targetted BJP and Congress on Sonbhadra firing incident and held both the parties equally responsible for the atrocities on tribals. "What needs to be stressed upon is that whoever is out of power among the two, sheds crocodile tears whenever there are (such) cases," she said. As many as 10 tribals were killed in the incident.

column2: Ex-BJP MLA held for 'blood of Kamal Nath' remark; gets bail later
column3: Former BJP MLA Surendra Nath Singh was arrested on Friday over his remark, "Blood will flow on the streets, and that blood will be of Kamal Nath". Singh was later released on bail and the state Assembly was adjourned twice as Congress MLAs protested the remark. "This just...show[s] the culture of the BJP," said Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Kamal Nath.

column2: SpaceX Starship could go to the Moon by 2021, says Elon Musk
column3: Billionaire Elon Musk said he thinks his aerospace startup SpaceX could land an unmanned Starship rocket on Moon in less than two years.
