"Maybe within a year or two of that, we could be sending crew," he added. "It may literally be easier to just land Starship on Moon than try to convince NASA that we can," Musk also said.

column2: Muslims being punished for not migrating to Pak: Azam Khan
column3: Samajwadi Party MP from Uttar Pradesh Azam Khan on Saturday said that the mob lynching incidents in the country are punishments Muslims are getting for not migrating to Pakistan after 1947. He further said that the reason why their ancestors didn't go to Pakistan was that Maulana Azad, Jawaharlal Nehru, Sardar Patel and Mahatma Gandhi had made promises to Muslims.

column2: 20 e-buses flagged off in Srinagar under FAME India scheme
column3: Jammu and Kashmir Governor Satya Pal Malik and Union Minister Arvind Sawant on Friday flagged off a fleet of 20 electric buses in Srinagar under Phase-II of FAME India scheme. Phase-II of the Faster Adoption and Manufacturing of Hybrid and Electric Vehicles in India scheme was implemented on April 1, 2019 with an outlay of ₹10,000 crore over three years.

column2: Pakistan violates ceasefire along LoC in J&K's Poonch
column3: Pakistan Army on Saturday violated ceasefire along the Line of Control (LoC) at three places in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district. The violation at all three places started within one hour, spokesperson said. This comes on the day of Defence Minister Rajnath Singh's visit to the state to review the security situation and inaugurate bridges in Kathua and Samba.

column2: US authorises deployment of troops, resources to Saudi Arabia
column3: Acting US Defence Secretary Richard Spencer has authorised the deployment of US military personnel and resources to Saudi Arabia, the Pentagon said on Friday. It added that the move would provide an "additional deterrent" in the face of "emergent, credible threats". Saudi previously said it had approved hosting US forces to boost regional security and stability.

column2: Toyota presents the all-new feature-packed hatchback Glanza
column3: The all-new Toyota Glanza offers two BS-VI compliant engine options — 1.2-litre petrol and 1.2-litre petrol with Smart Hybrid technology. Its stylish front-end is built around the 'liquid flow design' concept, and comes with LED projector headlamps along with LED DRLs. It also features a 7.0 inch touchscreen infotainment system called 'Smart Playcast', offering smartphone connectivity.

column2: NMIMS Global Access holds webinar on MBA in Business Analytics
column3: NMIMS Global Access along with upGrad is holding a free online webinar on MBA Executive with specialisation in Business Analytics to empower learners with data analytics and business skills. The webinar gives learners an opportunity to interact with Mr Rajiv Shah, Director, NMIMS Global Access, Ronnie Screwvala, Co-founder (upGrad) and Mayank Kumar, Co-founder (upGrad).

column2: Indians among crew members on British-flagged tanker seized by Iran
column3: Indian nationals are among the 23 crew members who were on board the British-flagged oil tanker seized by Iran. Other crew members are of Russian, Latvian and Filipino nationality. The ship was no longer under the control of its crew and uncontactable, after being approached by unidentified small crafts during transit of the Strait of Hormuz, the vessel's owner said.

column2: Iran seizes British-flagged oil tanker 2 weeks after its ship seized
column3: Iran on Friday seized British-flagged oil tanker Stena Impero while it was sailing in the Strait of Hormuz. The move comes two weeks after the British Royal Marines seized an Iranian ship in Gibraltar. Britain had claimed Iran seized two oil tankers, however, Iran said the second tanker had been allowed to continue its course after being given a warning.

column2: A footballer once helped end civil war in his country
column3: Ex-forward Didier Drogba appealed to the warring factions in Ivory Coast to end the civil war, just after the country qualified for 2006 FIFA World Cup. Drogba, who joined Chelsea on July 20, 2004, made the appeal on television from team's dressing room. The government and the opposing forces agreed to start peace talks, following which a ceasefire was announced.

column2: Our son has kept us bonded: Arbaaz on ties with Malaika after divorce
column3: Actor Arbaaz Khan has said that after his divorce with Malaika Arora, their 16-year-old son Arhaan has kept them bonded. "(W)hen he grows up everything will be better...He's a very good son, I love the way he's handled all this. Many times at this sensitive age, children are victims of bad influence, but he's a very positive kid," Arbaaz added.

column2: Not fair to have a result like that: Eoin Morgan on World Cup win
column3: Talking about his team winning 2019 World Cup final against New Zealand by virtue of scoring more boundaries, England captain Eoin Morgan said, "I don't think it's fair to have a result like that when there's very little between the sides." He added, "I'm not sure winning it makes it any easier. It'd be more difficult to lose, of course."

column2: Notice to PM after ex-BSF jawan challenges his election from Varanasi
column3: The Allahabad High Court has sent a notice to PM Narendra Modi over a petition filed by ex-BSF jawan Tej Bahadur Yadav, challenging his election from Varanasi. The Election Commission had cancelled Yadav's nomination as a candidate from Varanasi. Yadav claimed his nomination papers were wrongly rejected and requested to declare PM Modi's election as an MP null and void.

column2: Two-headed turtle found in Malaysia, dies days after discovery
column3: A rare two-headed green turtle was found on Monday in Malaysia, alongside over 90 other recently hatched turtles. "The right head seems to control the front right flipper, and the left head the front left...Yet they're capable of coordinating movements in order to walk and swim," biologists said. The two-headed turtle, however, only survived a few days after being discovered.

column2: Priyanka meets some Sonbhadra victims' relatives at guest house
column3: The families of the victims killed in Sonbhadra massacre came to meet Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Saturday at a guest house in Mirzapur where she's been detained. "Two relatives of victims have come here to meet me, 15 others are not being allowed to meet me," Priyanka said. She had refused to leave until she met the victims' families.

column2: 9 students killed as car crashes into truck on Pune-Solapur highway
column3: Nine students were killed after the car in which they were travelling crashed into a truck on Pune-Solapur highway on Saturday. "Those killed in the accident were returning from Raigad and heading to their hometown Yavat," a police official said. "Their bodies have been sent for post-mortem and the matter is being investigated," the official added.

column2: All toll plaza lanes to be prepaid FASTag lanes from December 1
column3: Ministry of Road Transport and Highways has decided to declare all lanes at toll plazas on national highways across the country as FASTag lanes from December 1. However, one 'hybrid lane' will be allowed at every toll plaza where FASTag and other modes of payment will be accepted. FASTag is a prepaid tag which enables automatic deduction of toll charges.

column2: US calls Hafiz Saeed's arrest by Pakistan 'window dressing'
column3: A senior US administration official has called Jamaat-ud-Dawa chief and 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks mastermind Hafiz Saeed's arrest by Pakistan "window dressing". "We've seen this happen in the past. And we have been looking for sustained and concrete steps," the official added. "The previous arrests of Hafiz Saeed haven't made a difference," the US official further said.

column2: César Pelli, the architect behind Petronas Towers, dies aged 92
column3: César Pelli, the Argentine designer behind the Petronas Twin Towers in Malaysia, has died aged 92. Pelli's other works include the World Financial Center in New York, Canary Wharf Tower in London and renovation work on New York's Museum of Modern Art. Pelli had served as the dean of Yale University's School of Architecture.

column2: Alia is a huge source of inspiration: Ananya
column3: Actress Ananya Panday has called Alia Bhatt a "huge source of inspiration". "(W)hat I've learned from Alia is that she never claimed to be perfect from the start. She was raw in her first film, and then, she grew from there and people could see the evolution," Ananya added. Ananya made her Bollywood debut with 'Student of the Year 2'.

column2: My most prized memories forever: Ishaan on Dhadak's release 1 yr ago
column3: Actor Ishaan Khatter took to Instagram as his movie 'Dhadak' marked a year of theatrical release. Producer Karan Johar, Director Shashank Khaitan and co-star Jahnvi Kapoor "have etched themselves into my life and my most prized memories forever", he added. He also thanked the movie's cast and crew, saying without them the "film's heart would not beat as it did".

column2: Who is 15-year-old Prithu Gupta, India's 64th Grandmaster?
column3: Prithu Gupta, who became India's 64th Grandmaster, is a Class X student of Modern School in Delhi's Vasant Vihar. The 15-year-old had started playing chess at the age of nine and had become an International Master last year before his 14th birthday. He had earlier said that he is "very superstitious" and "passionate" about subjects like Spanish.

column2: Chrome update to stop sites from checking for Incognito Mode
column3: Technology giant Google has said that at the end of July, its internet browser Chrome will "remedy" a loophole that has allowed sites to detect people who are browsing in Incognito Mode. It added it will also change any other methods of detecting Incognito over time. The release of Chrome 76 is scheduled for July 30, Google revealed.

column2: Australia's picturesque Hutt Lagoon is also known as the 'Pink lake'
column3: Australia's Hutt Lagoon located north of the Hutt River is also known as 'Pink lake', and is sometimes bright bubblegum pink, sometimes lilac, and occasionally even red in colour. It gets a pink hue due to carotenoid-producing algae, Dunaliella salina. It's a source of beta-carotene, used as a food-colouring agent and a source of vitamin A in cosmetics and supplements.

column2: Virgin Orbit to launch small satellites for UK military
column3: Virgin Orbit, the small satellite launching arm of billionaire Richard Branson's spaceflight firm Virgin Galactic, has signed an initial agreement to develop small satellite launch capabilities for the UK's Royal Air Force (RAF). Virgin Orbit aims to launch hardware provided by UK-based Surrey Satellites in a demo mission. The deal is part of RAF's Artemis mission.

column2: Maha man allegedly beaten up, forced to chant 'Jai Shri Ram'
column3: A man was allegedly beaten up and forced to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' by a group of unidentified persons in the early hours of Friday in Maharashtra's Aurangabad, police said. The victim, identified as Imran Ismail Patel, was returning home on a motorbike when the incident took place. Investigation is underway and the complaint is being verified, an official said.

column2: Pune student hangs himself to complete Blue Whale-like game
column3: A 20-year-old student hanged himself on Wednesday evening to complete a task in a Blue Whale-like online game in Pune, police said. A handwritten suicide note was recovered which read, "The black panther, which was in the cage, is free now...The End." The note also had a black panther drawing along with a line "sun will shine again", added police.

column2: Rajiv’s error will be repeated if triple talaq not criminalised: Arif
column3: Ex-Union Minister Arif Mohammad Khan on Friday said the Prime Minister Modi-led government will repeat the mistake committed by the Rajiv Gandhi-led government in the Shah Bano case if triple talaq is not criminalised. The Rajiv Gandhi government introduced a bill in 1986 reversing Supreme Court’s order saying triple talaq victim has the right to demand maintenance from her ex-husband.

column2: Bihar floods death toll rises to 92, nearly 67 lakh affected
column3: The death toll in the Bihar floods, which have affected nearly 67 lakh people across 12 districts, rose to 92 after 14 more casualties were reported on Friday. Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar kicked off a programme to provide financial aid to flood victims, in which ₹181.39 crore was transferred directly to 3.02 lakh families' accounts in the initial phase.

column2: 2 arrested for sexually assaulting African woman in Gurugram
column3: Two persons have been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting an African woman in Gurugram, police said. The incident occurred on Thursday night when the victim was returning from a party and hired an auto-rickshaw to go to Guru Dronacharya metro station. The auto-rickshaw driver and his friend instead drove the victim to their house and sexually assaulted her, police added.

column2: 300 child labourers rescued in July so far: Cyberabad Police
column3: Cyberabad Police have said that as many as 300 children, including 267 boys and 33 girls, have been rescued from child labour, begging and rag picking between July 1 and 18. A total of 282 children (251 boys and 31 girls) were sent to shelter homes and 18 children (16 boys and 2 girls) were handed over to their parents.

column2: Not sure if Federer is aware: Arbaaz on being called his lookalike
column3: Speaking about memes calling him tennis star Roger Federer's lookalike, Arbaaz Khan joked, "I'm aware of this similarity that's being drawn. Not sure if he's aware too." "I've come to know that he has a house in Dubai and when he plays the Dubai Open, he stays there. I plan to try and meet him during that time," he added.

column2: Ranbir forced me into aircraft and flew to NY with me: Rishi on cancer
column3: Speaking about his reaction to his cancer diagnosis, Rishi Kapoor said, "There was no time to react. I was shooting in Delhi...when my son (Ranbir)...came [and] spoke to my producers." "By evening, they got me to Mumbai and soon after, they flew me to New York...My son literally forced me into the aircraft and flew here with me," he added.

column2: Biggest shock: Ex-SA pacer Donald on being inducted into Hall of Fame
column3: Former South Africa fast bowler Allan Donald, who was inducted into the ICC Hall of Fame on Thursday, said, "The biggest shock when you open an e-mail like that." "It hits you, it hits you quite hard because it is a prestigious award and something that you can't take lightly. I thank the ICC for the huge honour," he added.

column2: MS Dhoni's manager responds to speculation around his retirement
column3: Responding to the speculation around MS Dhoni's retirement, the former India captain's manager Arun Pandey said that he has no immediate plans to retire. "Constant speculation over the future of a great player like him is unfortunate," he added. Pandey’s comments come ahead of Team India's selection for the West Indies tour which is scheduled for Sunday.

column2: Kohli to attend selection meet for WI tour on Sunday: Reports
column3: Team India captain Virat Kohli is set to attend the team selection meeting for the West Indies tour at the BCCI headquarters in Mumbai on Sunday. As per reports, Kohli will travel to West Indies and will feature in all the three formats. Earlier, reports had stated that Kohli and pacer Jasprit Bumrah will not feature in the limited-overs series.

column2: Extremely heartbreaking news for all Zimbabwe cricketers: Ashwin
column3: Reacting to Zimbabwe Cricket being suspended by ICC over governmental interference, off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin tweeted, "Extremely heartbreaking news for all Zim cricketers and their fans." "I pray the lovely cricket nation returns to its glory asap," he added. Ashwin was reacting to Zimbabwe all-rounder Sikandar Raza who had tweeted, "How one decision has made so many people unemployed."

column2: No govt interference in Zimbabwe Cricket: Zimbabwe sports minister
column3: Zimbabwe sports minister Kirsty Coventry on Friday denied that the government had been interfering in the running of the country’s cricket. Coventry, a former Olympic swimming champion, said in a tweet she was "devastated" by the effect on players of a decision by the International Cricket Council (ICC) to suspend Zimbabwe Cricket because of alleged political interference.

column2: Microsoft posts record Q4 results, shares hit all-time high
column3: Microsoft posted its Q4 FY19 earnings report revealing it made $33.7 billion in the quarter, 12% higher than the same quarter last year. The technology giant delivered a "record fiscal year" with a revenue of $125.8 billion, representing a 14% increase from the year before. Microsoft shares rose over 2.6% to record-high of above $140 in after-hours trading on Thursday.

column2: OYO Founder to buy back $2 billion worth stake in the startup
column3: OYO Founder Ritesh Agarwal has agreed to invest $2 billion to increase his stake in the SoftBank-backed hospitality startup. Current investors Lightspeed Venture Partners and Sequoia India are selling portions of their holdings to help the 25-year-old CEO increase his stake, the company said. The deal will raise Agarwal's stake in OYO to 30% from about 10% now, reports said.

column2: No trust vote in K'taka today as well, Assembly adjourned till Monday
column3: The Karnataka Assembly was adjourned on Friday without a floor test. The Assembly failed to hold a trust vote at 1.30 pm today after which Governor Vajubhai Vala wrote another letter to CM HD Kumaraswamy, asking him to hold a floor test by 6 pm, which also didn't happen. The trust vote will now be conducted on Monday.

column2: Our airspace safe for flight operations: Iran amid tensions with US
column3: Iran's embassy in India has said the country's airspace is safe for flight operations amid the recent tensions with the US. Iran added it is committed to providing necessary safety and security for international flights passing through its airspace. Several airline companies, including those from India, banned their flights through Iranian airspace after Iran shot down a US military drone.

column2: US city plays 'Baby Shark' on loop to keep away homeless people
column3: Officials in West Palm Beach, US, are playing children's songs, including 'Baby Shark' and 'Raining Tacos' on a loop, to keep away homeless people from sleeping outside a city-owned community building. The move has been "effective" and is a "temporary measure", an official said. This would get homeless people into shelters and houses, West Palm Beach Mayor, Keith James, said.

column2: Investors lose ₹3.8 lakh cr as Sensex falls 879 points in two days
column3: Indian equity investors suffered wealth erosion of nearly ₹3.8 lakh crore in two sessions, with market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies standing at ₹145.34 lakh crore. The benchmark equity index Sensex fell 879 points in two days. The markets witnessed sell-off after the government said that a new tax surcharge that also applies to foreign investors registered as trusts will stay.

column2: Jet Airways lenders approve interim funding for the airline
column3: Jet Airways lenders have agreed to provide some interim financing to the bankrupt airline to help it cover legal and other costs. The airline's bankruptcy resolution firm Grant Thornton didn't specify how much interim funding had been approved but reports said that lenders had agreed to provide $10 million. Jet's lenders had also approved the eligibility criteria for potential buyers.

column2: Do we just burn our kits and apply for jobs? Zimbabwe cricketer Raza
column3: After the ICC suspended Zimbabwe Cricket with immediate effect over governmental interference, Pakistan-born Zimbabwe all-rounder Sikandar Raza said the whole team's pretty heartbroken and shocked at the moment. "I don't know where we go as international cricketers. Do we just burn our kits and apply for jobs?" he added. "I don't know what is the way out," he further said.

column2: WNBA gives 10-game suspension to player for domestic violence
column3: The Women's National Basketball Association has given one of its biggest-ever suspensions after Los Angeles Sparks' Riquna Williams was suspended without pay for ten games as a result of a domestic violence incident. Williams was arrested on April 29, and charged with two felony counts, one involving the assault of an individual with whom she was in a relationship.

column2: Sri Lanka to sack coaches after World Cup failure: Officials
column3: Sri Lanka's Sports minister Harin Fernando has ordered the sacking of national cricket team coach Chandika Hathurusingha and his assistants following the team's performance at the 2019 World Cup, officials said on Friday. Fernando has ordered the coaches "should go after the Bangladesh tournament," an official said. Sri Lanka crashed out after losing four of their nine World Cup matches.

column2: Manchester United manager Solskjaer plays cricket in Perth
column3: Manchester United's manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer was seen playing cricket with United's players and supporting staff at WACA in Perth, where the team is as a part of its pre-season tour. A video shows Solskjaer asking to be bowled at after which he hits the ball straight to first-team coach Michael Carrick, who takes a single-handed catch.

column2: Govt to provide extra financial help for football: Rijiju
column3: Sports Minister Kiren Rijiju said the ministry "will provide extra financial help wherever possible" to help Indian Football move to the next level. "We have seen certain improvements in our men's as well as women's football in recent times," he added. The minister also praised the Indian Senior Women's Team for rising to 57 in the FIFA rankings.

column2: IFS officer Vivek Kumar appointed as Private Secretary to PM
column3: Indian Foreign Service (IFS) officer Vivek Kumar was appointed as Private Secretary to Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday. Kumar, a 2004 batch IFS officer, is currently working as a Director in the Prime Minister's Office. He will be succeeding Sanjeev Kumar Singla, who has been appointed India's ambassador to Israel.

column2: Priyanka's arrest is completely unconstitutional: Robert Vadra
column3: Businessman Robert Vadra on Friday targeted the UP government and said that arresting his wife and Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra is "completely unconstitutional". "No documents were produced for the arrest...This is a complete abuse of the law," he added. Priyanka was detained by UP police while she was on her way to visit the families of Sonbhadra firing victims.

column2: Man allegedly beaten to death after his bike hits woman
column3: A man was allegedly beaten to death in Rajasthan's Bhiwadi after his bike accidentally hit a woman. The man identified as Harish was allegedly beaten by the angry relatives of the woman on Tuesday after the accident, police said. "Harish was...referred to Delhi's Safdarjung Hospital where he succumbed to injuries on Friday," Anil Paris Deshmukh, Superintendent of Police Alwar said.

column2: People didn't take me seriously after father's death: T-Series MD
column3: Music label and film production company T-Series' MD Bhushan Kumar said people didn't take him seriously when he took over the company in 1997 after his father Gulshan Kumar was murdered. "They would say 'Your father was a genius in marketing, what can you do?' I had to convince them, literally with folded hands, to trust me," the 41-year-old added.

column2: What are the new rules introduced by ICC?
column3: The ICC has approved like-for-like concussion player replacements in all formats of men's and women's international cricket and first-class cricket. Captains won't be suspended for repeated or serious over-rate breaches. In case of slow over-rate breach, all players will be equally fined. A team will have two competition points deducted for each over it's behind in World Test Championship.

column2: Porn site users tracked by Google, FB even in incognito mode: Study
column3: An analysis of 22,484 pornography sites by researchers from Microsoft, Carnegie Mellon and Pennsylvania University has revealed technology giants including Google, Facebook and Oracle track users even in incognito mode. The study concluded that 93% of pages leak user data to a third party. Google and Facebook said data from these trackers isn't used to build marketing profiles of users.

column2: WeWork CEO gets $700 mn via stake sale, debt ahead of IPO: Report
column3: Adam Neumann, Co-founder and CEO of US-based co-working space startup WeWork, has reportedly taken loans against shares and sold a portion of his stake, receiving over $700 million in total. This comes ahead of WeWork's move to go public, which it had confidentially filed for in April. Neumann still remains the single largest shareholder in the company, the report claimed.

column2: Sachin Bansal's BACQ in talks to buy Essel Mutual Fund: Report
column3: BAC Acquisitions (BACQ), co-founded by Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal, is reportedly in advanced talks to acquire Essel Mutual Fund, owned by the Zee group. BACQ Co-founder Ankit Agarwal has been meeting with executives of the mutual fund to finalise the details, as per reports. Past reports had claimed Sachin Bansal was in talks to launch a new fintech venture.

column2: Man thrown 30 feet away as speeding Audi hits 2-wheeler in Jaipur
column3: A man was thrown 30 feet away after a speeding Audi rammed into his two-wheeler in Jaipur. The driver of the Audi, Siddharth Sharma, escaped after the collision but was later traced and detained for interrogation. The victim is undergoing treatment at trauma centre of SMS Hospital, police said. The accident took place at around 6:25 am on Friday.

column2: Thief loots shop, gets caught through Aadhaar card left behind
column3: A thief who looted a store in Dehradun was caught after police traced him through the Aadhaar card that he had left behind. The accused had entered the shop through the ceiling and his Aadhaar card was found there by the shop's owner. Police tracked him through informers as he wasn't found at the address mentioned on his Aadhaar card.

column2: CRPF constable killed as teen rams Mercedes into car in Delhi
column3: A CRPF constable was killed after Sanidhya Garg, a teenage son of a Noida businessman, rammed his Mercedes into a car occupied by three paramilitary personnel. The collision occurred just before midnight on Thursday in Delhi's Greater Kailash after the teenager jumped a traffic signal. Garg was arrested by the police and medically examined.

column2: Female lawyers behind Section 377 verdict come out as a couple
column3: Supreme Court lawyers Menaka Guruswamy and Arundhati Katju, who fought the case for the five original petitioners to scrap parts of Section 377 of the IPC which criminalised homosexuality, have come out as a couple. The duo made the revelation in an interview with CNN, saying the court victory was not just a professional benchmark but also a personal win.

column2: Netherlands 10% liable for Srebrenica massacre: Supreme Court
column3: The Netherlands' Supreme Court has ruled that the state is 10% liable for the deaths of 350 Bosnian Muslim men in the Srebrenica massacre in 1995. Dutch UN peacekeepers evacuated the men from their military base near Srebrenica despite knowing that they "were in serious jeopardy", the court said. Bosnian Serb forces killed 8,000 Muslim men in Srebrenica in 1995.

column2: IndiGo posts highest ever profit of ₹1,200 crore as Jet collapses
column3: India's largest airline IndiGo posted its highest-ever quarterly profit of ₹1,203 crore for the April-June period from ₹27 crore a year ago, benefiting from the collapse of Jet Airways. The company's revenue rose 45% to ₹9,420 crore. IndiGo expects available seat kilometres (ASK), a measure of its passenger carrying capacity, to grow 30% in the current financial year.

column2: Budweiser owner sells Australia unit for $11 bn to cut $106 bn debt
column3: Budweiser maker AB InBev, the world's largest brewer, is selling its Australian subsidiary Carlton & United Breweries to Japan's Asahi at an enterprise value of $11.3 billion. Most of the proceeds from the deal will be used to reduce its $106 billion debt. The transaction comes only a week after AB InBev shelved the IPO of its Asia-Pacific operations.

column2: US city renames 'manholes' in a bid to remove gendered language
column3: The American city of Berkeley has renamed 'manholes' as 'maintenance holes' under the plan to remove all gendered language from its municipal code. The terms 'men and women' have been replaced by 'people', while the terms 'brother' and 'sister' will be referred to as 'sibling'. "A male-centric municipal code doesn't reflect [Berkeley's] reality", City Council member Rigel Robinson said.

column2: Wanted to join Juventus even before chat with Ronaldo: De Ligt
column3: Dutch defender Matthijs de Ligt has revealed that he had made up his mind to join Serie A champions Juventus even before Cristiano Ronaldo asked him about a potential move to the club. Juventus announced the signing of the 19-year-old on Thursday for €75 million, making the teenager one of the most expensive defenders in the history of football.

column2: 96-year-old runs 42-min 5K to shatter age-group world record
column3: Roy Englert, 96, ran the 5000-metre with a timing of 42:30.23 to shatter the existing age-group world record mark by nearly eight minutes at the Cyclone Sports Complex in Ames, Iowa. "It's fun. It's not fun while you're doing it, but it's fun when you're finished. It's hard work, actually," Englert said about his feat.

column2: Google Photos flaw lets private photos be accessed publicly
column3: Security researcher Robert Wiblin has revealed a new flaw in Google Photos that lets privately-shared images become partially public. Users can access private photos or albums if they get access to the link of the shared content. Wiblin demonstrated in a video that a Google Photos image was accessible on a third-party Google account, even in the incognito mode.

column2: Talked to students about party ideology not membership: BJP MLA
column3: BJP MLA Sushil Singh rubbished the accusation of conducting a membership drive at a school in UP and said he went there to meet the students who were demanding a library in the school. "There was no membership drive. I had talked to the students about [BJP's] ideology...not membership," he added. Singh instead accused the opposition of politicising the event.

column2: CARS24 gets 6 notices over non-payment of rent: Report
column3: Gurugram-based used car buying startup CARS24 has reportedly received legal notices from half-a-dozen landlords in Delhi over alleged non-payment of rent for months. The platform has also reportedly been accused of violating lease agreements by shutting down outlets. "We are currently in the process of addressing anomalies observed with a few properties in our recent audit," CARS24 said.

column2: Over 75 engineering, technical colleges to shut down nationwide
column3: More than 75 engineering and technical colleges across India have opted not to admit students from this academic session and are preparing to shut down. The major reasons behind the closure are fewer takers for the courses or colleges and shortage of funds, an AICTE official said. Majority of the colleges opting for closure are based out of Uttar Pradesh.

column2: Assam, Arunachal Pradesh hit by 5.6-magnitude earthquake
column3: Arunachal Pradesh, Assam and several other northeastern states were hit by a 5.6-magnitude earthquake on Friday. The epicentre of the earthquake was located at a depth of 10 kilometres at East Kameng district in Arunachal Pradesh, the India Meteorological Department said. However, no reports of casualties have been reported till now, the IMD further said.

column2: Delhi Police arrests 5, seizes heroin worth ₹600 crore
column3: Five persons were arrested and heroin worth ₹600 crore was seized after Delhi Police Special Cell busted a narcotics drug haul. "(We) seized around 150 kilograms of Afghan origin heroin worth about ₹600 crores in the international market," Delhi Police Special Cell said. Two amongst the arrested were chemical experts hailing from Afghanistan.

column2: AIIMS to not introduce EWS reservation for students this year
column3: The All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) will not introduce the Economically Weaker Section (EWS) reservation for students in this academic session. As per reports, AIIMS' appeal to exempt EWS quota this year was accepted by the Centre. "AIIMS doesn't have enough hostels, lecture rooms...to fit students. In some regional centres, there isn't sufficient academic staff," an official said.

column2: Mumbai Police shares 'Mission Mangal' meme on road safety
column3: Mumbai Police tweeted a meme based on a still from the trailer of the upcoming Akshay Kumar starrer 'Mission Mangal' to spread awareness on road safety. It used the dialogue "The chances of this mission succeeding is less than 1%" to discourage drunk driving. "Poori duniya se kaho copy that! #MissionRoadSafety," police captioned the image, taking reference from another dialogue.

column2: Ram wants to become almost half the size he's now: Wife on weight loss
column3: Actor Ram Kapoor's wife, actress Gautami Kapoor, while speaking about his around 30 kg weight loss, said, "He hasn't undergone any surgery as people feel and has opted for the natural way." "Ram...will take another six months to achieve his goals and reduce more weight and become almost half the size that he is now," she added.

column2: Donate, stop tweeting 'it's so sad': Akshay Kumar on Assam floods
column3: During a press conference, Akshay Kumar urged people to donate for the relief of flood-affected people in Assam. "Do something. Donate as much as you can. Be it 25 paise or ₹25 crore. Stop tweeting about it and saying 'it is so sad', 'God bless everything' and all that," he said. Kumar has donated ₹1 crore for Assam flood-affected people.

column2: Karnataka Governor asks CM Kumaraswamy to prove majority by 6 PM
column3: Karnataka Governor Vajubhai Vala has sent a second letter to Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy on Friday, asking him to prove majority before 6 PM. The Assembly took up the confidence motion moved by CM Kumaraswamy after the session resumed on Friday. On Thursday, Vala had asked the ruling Congress-Janata Dal (Secular) coalition to prove its majority by 1:30 PM today.

column2: ShopClues fires about 50% workforce to cut costs: Reports
column3: E-commerce platform ShopClues has reportedly fired about 200 employees, reducing its workforce by nearly 50%. "The company is left with almost no money and that is why it didn't even pay the two months standard payout to employees," a report cited its sources as saying. A recent report had earlier claimed ShopClues lost an acquisition deal offered by Snapdeal.

column2: Goa man jailed for 10 years for murder of British teen in 2008
column3: The Bombay High Court on Friday sentenced a Goa man to 10 years in jail for the 2008 murder of British teenager Scarlett Keeling. In February 2008, Keeling was found dead on Goa's Anjuna beach. The court convicted Samson D'Souza under various sections of the IPC. A second man, Placido Carvalho, was acquitted by the court.

column2: Family forced to carry body on sling as Odisha hospital denies van
column3: A tribal family in the Kalahandi district of Odisha was forced to carry the body of their relative on a sling made of cloth after the hospital refused to provide a van. Nigidi Majhi had died in the hospital following a bout of fever. The medical officers reportedly claimed that the van was not run on Mondays.

column2: Viral pic of drowned 3-month-old not from Bihar floods, police clarify
column3: A photo of a 3-month-old infant's body has been going viral on social media, with the claim that he drowned as a result of the ongoing Bihar floods. However, the police clarified the baby died after his mother attempted to kill herself and her four children by jumping into a river in Muzaffarpur. The incident took place on July 16.

column2: Blast near Afghanistan university kills six, injures 27
column3: An explosion near the campus of Kabul University in the Afghan capital killed six people and injured at least 27 as students waited to take an examination on Friday, officials said. A police team defused a second bomb placed near the explosion site, Kabul police spokesman Faramarz Firdaws said. There was no immediate claim of responsibility for the blast.

column2: South Koreans boycott Japanese brands amid diplomatic tensions
column3: Over 200 South Korean supermarkets and grocery stores are boycotting Japanese products and services amid the diplomatic tensions between the two nations, a trade group said. The boycott impacted sales of several products and services, including beer and tourism. The tensions escalated after South Korea's top court ordered Japanese firms to compensate Koreans they used as forced labour in WWII.

column2: Man who set fire to Japan studio said firm stole his ideas: Reports
column3: The man suspected of setting fire to a Japanese animation studio was heard complaining that the studio had stolen his ideas, according to witnesses. The suspect, identified as Shinji Aoba, used large amounts of what appeared to be petrol, to set fire to the three-storey building. Thirty-three people were killed and over 30 others were injured in the arson attack.

column2: Jet Airways resolution professional gets claims of ₹25,000 crore
column3: The resolution professional handling Jet Airways' bankruptcy process has revealed creditor claims of nearly ₹25,000 crore. Of the 16,643 claims received from financial creditors, operational creditors, employees and other creditors, only 33  worth ₹8,462  crore  from  financial  creditors have been admitted so far. State Bank of India has claimed ₹1,644 crore and Yes Bank ₹1,084 crore.

column2: Release date of Shraddha, Prabhas starrer 'Saaho' postponed
column3: The release date of upcoming Prabhas and Shraddha Kapoor starrer 'Saaho' has been postponed to August 30. The film was originally scheduled to release on August 15 along with Akshay Kumar's 'Mission Mangal'. The makers of the film said, "We want to bring the best to the audience. For bringing finesse to the action sequences we need some more time."

column2: Delhi's Prithu Gupta becomes India’s 64th Grandmaster
column3: Delhi's Prithu Gupta has become India's 64th Grandmaster after crossing the Elo threshold of 2500 points after beating IM Lev Yankelevich in the fifth round of the Portuguese League 2019. "And we are complete. 64 th GM !! Welcome our newest GM Prithu Gupta !" India's Viswanathan Anand tweeted about Gupta's achievement.

column2: John Obi Mikel announces retirement from international football
column3: Nigeria captain John Obi Mikel on Thursday announced his retirement from international football after helping Nigeria reach the third place in the Africa Cup of Nations 2019. Mikel, retiring with 89 international caps and six goals to his name, had led Nigeria to win a bronze medal at the 2016 Rio Olympics in Brazil as one of the over-aged players.

column2: EU probes Amazon over abuse of merchant data to cut competition
column3: The European Union has launched a formal investigation on Amazon over concerns of potential abuse of merchant data that is accessible to it to cut down its own competition. "Based on the Commission's preliminary fact-finding, Amazon appears to use competitively sensitive information," the regulator noted. "We will cooperate fully with the European Commission," the e-commerce giant said.

column2: Instagram to warn if account faces risk of being disabled
column3: Instagram will now warn users if their accounts face a risk of getting disabled over violation of rules, through a notification process. The process will also offer the opportunity to appeal content deleted in certain cases, Instagram said. It added it will start removing accounts with a certain number of violations within a set window of time.

column2: There is a dessert museum located in Philippines
column3: The Dessert Museum located in Philippines' capital Manila comprises "eight mouthwatering rooms"- Donut, Marshmallow, Candy Cane, Ice Cream, Bubble Gum, Gummy Bear, Cotton Candy and Cake Pop. Visitors can try samples of desserts especially curated to fit the themed room. The museum also provides facts about each dessert to the visitors.

column2: DCW notice to Delhi Police over sexual assault of 3 minor boys
column3: The Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) on Thursday issued a notice to Delhi Police over sexual assault of three minor boys and sought details of the actions taken so far. "The accused persons are roaming free and [threatening] the survivors," the notice stated. The minors were allegedly lured by some boys to an isolated place and were then sexually assaulted.

column2: Father-son duo thrashed after son meets girlfriend in UP village
column3: A man and his son were allegedly tied to a tree and thrashed in the Auta village of Uttar Pradesh after the latter reportedly met his girlfriend there. The two were also forced to perform sit-ups. The local police rescued them and said that strict action would be taken against the culprits.

column2: NZ PM returns home on commercial flight as her plane breaks down
column3: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern was forced to fly home on a commercial flight on Friday after a technical snag hit her air force plane, following a two-day trip to Australia. In 2016, the then PM John Key had to delay a visit to India after his plane broke down on a refuelling stop in the north of Australia.

column2: UP govt adds SP leader Azam Khan's name on anti-land mafia portal
column3: The Uttar Pradesh government has put Samajwadi Party (SP) leader Azam Khan's name on government's anti-land mafia portal. Rampur District Magistrate Aunjaneya Singh said that Khan's name was added as he has 2 cases and around 13 FIRs lodged against him. The government will now directly monitor the cases against him and take legal action, Singh added.

column2: New TVS Ntorq 125 scooter features Bluetooth & smart connectivity
column3: The TVS Ntorq 125, India's first scooter comes with Bluetooth support and smart connectivity features. It takes you to places with Navigation Assist and keeps you connected all the time with Caller ID and SMS alerts. Featuring SmartXonnect technology and sporty design, TVS Ntorq 125's special edition will also feature a special 'Scooter of the Year' insignia on the front.

column2: ITC launches Fiama Scents Body Wash with touch activated fragrance
column3: Fiama Scents Body Wash has the most long lasting fragrance amongst top bodywashes in India, basis consumer study on fragrance retentivity by Kantar IMRB. Brand face, Sara Ali Khan, endorses the innovation. Fragrance retentivity studies under lab conditions validate its long-lasting fragrance delivery through skin-friendly micro fragrance capsules that burst on touch, for up to 8 hours after a bath.

column2: 65-yr-old driver nominated for Best Actor alongside Amitabh Bachchan
column3: Namdev Gaurav, a 65-year-old driver of producer Dheer Momaya, has been nominated in Best Actor category alongside Amitabh Bachchan, Manoj Bajpayee and others at Indian Film Festival of Melbourne. He was cast in 'Namdev Bhau: In Search of Silence' as the director was convinced he had "cinematic appeal", revealed Momaya. "It's like living a life I never...dreamt of," said Namdev.

column2: After Bihar, Hrithik Roshan's Super 30 made tax-free in Rajasthan
column3: Hrithik Roshan starrer 'Super 30', which is based on mathematician Anand Kumar's life, has been made tax-free in Rajasthan. CM Ashok Gehlot made the announcement by calling the film an "inspiration" and an "excellent example of exceptional willpower and determination", following which Hrithik thanked Gehlot on Twitter. This follows Bihar government's move of making the film tax-free in the state.

column2: England's Ben Stokes nominated for 'New Zealander of the Year' award
column3: New Zealand-born England all-rounder Ben Stokes, who was named Man of 2019 World Cup final against New Zealand, has been nominated for 'New Zealander of the Year' award. Stokes had moved to England when he was 12. "He might not have been playing for NZ but...there are a few Kiwis who think we can still claim him," an official said.

column2: Why was Sachin inducted into ICC Hall of Fame after Dravid, Kumble?
column3: Sachin Tendulkar was inducted into the ICC Hall of Fame on Thursday, a year after Rahul Dravid and four years after Anil Kumble were inducted. A cricketer becomes eligible for this award only after he completes five years of retirement. Dravid and Kumble had retired in 2012 and 2008 respectively, while Sachin had retired from international cricket in November 2013.

column2: Chennai man awarded ₹21 lakh for finding privacy bug in Instagram
column3: Chennai-based security researcher Laxman Muthiyah has won $30,000 (nearly ₹21 lakh) under a bug bounty programme for spotting a flaw in Facebook-owned Instagram. Muthiyah said the bug allowed him to "hack any Instagram account without consent". He revealed Facebook couldn't initially reproduce the vulnerability, but he convinced the platform with more information and a proof of concept video.

column2: Delhi Speaker sends defamation notice to MLA over 'Son of MLA' sticker
column3: Delhi Assembly Speaker Ram Niwas Goel on Thursday sent a defamation notice to Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) MLA Manjinder Singh Sirsa. Sirsa had shared a picture of a car on July 15 with a "Son of MLA" sticker on it and claimed that it belonged to Goel's son. The Speaker has sought a written apology within seven days from Sirsa.

column2: Person who can pressure me hasn't been born yet: K'taka Speaker
column3: After a Congress MLA asked Karnataka Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar not to feel pressurised and allow for a full debate ahead of the trust motion, Kumar responded, "There's no question of that. Such a person, who can pressure me, hasn't been born yet." The Governor had set a deadline of 1:30 pm for the motion.

column2: Disgusting: Rahul after sister Priyanka detained by police in UP
column3: Congress' Rahul Gandhi has reacted after his sister Priyanka Gandhi was detained by police in UP's Mirzapur while she was on her way to visit the families of 10 people shot dead in land dispute in Sonbhadra. "The illegal arrest of Priyanka...is disturbing. This arbitrary application of power...reveals the BJP Govt's increasing insecurity in UP," Rahul wrote in a tweet.

column2: Still ask God why he made me CM: Kumaraswamy ahead of trust vote
column3: Resuming the debate on the trust vote in the Karnataka Assembly on Friday, Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy said, "I'm still asking God why he made me the CM at such a time, under such circumstances. This is all about fate." He added, "I'll see how long you (BJP) will last here, after this effort you've put into coming to power."

column2: Pak lost ₹365 crore due to its airspace ban after Balakot strike
column3: Pakistan's aviation minister Ghulam Sarwar Khan has said his country suffered loss of over ₹365 crore from airspace restrictions it had imposed after Balakot strike in February. Pakistan reopened its airspace, which was closed for around 140 days, on Tuesday. The restrictions added flight time for passengers and fuel costs for airlines as they were forced to take long detours.

column2: 3 people beaten to death on suspicion of cattle theft in Bihar
column3: Three men were allegedly beaten to death by locals on the suspicion of cattle theft in Baniyapur area of Bihar's Saran on Friday. The incident reportedly took place when some villagers caught hold of the three men, who were moving around with a pick-up van carrying a cow. Police have launched an investigation into the case.

column2: India can't be world's refugee capital: Centre on Assam NRC
column3: The Centre on Friday asked the Supreme Court to extend the July 31 deadline for the National Register of Citizens (NRC) in Assam, stating that lakhs of people have been wrongly included in the draft list. Adding that illegal immigrants need to be removed from the list, the Centre said, "India cannot be the refugee capital of the world."

column2: Protesting villagers take herd of goats, sheep in Raj govt office
column3: Villagers in Rajasthan's Bharatpur took hundreds of goats and sheep inside a government office while protesting against the district administration, demanding the appointment of a deputy tehsildar. The protestors said that despite setting up a registry office, they were unable to avail any facility as no one has been appointed to the post of deputy tehsildar for two years.

column2: Haven't lost any drone, US shot down its own by mistake: Iran
column3: Iranian Deputy Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has denied US claims that it had shot down an Iranian drone in the Strait of Hormuz. "We have not lost any drone...[I am worried that US shot down its own drone] by mistake," Araghchi said. US President Donald Trump had said the drone had flown to within 1,000 yards of the USS Boxer.

column2: Pak installs biometric machines outside ministry toilets: Reports
column3: The Pakistani government has installed biometric recognition machines outside the washrooms of the Ministry of Industries and Production, in a bid to keep it accessible only for top-ranking officers, reports quoting sources said. The move has also been implemented for the convenience of same-ranking officers of other ministries who come to attend meetings over there, reports added.

column2: Jio overtakes Airtel to become India's 2nd largest operator by users
column3: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries' telecom unit Reliance Jio has overtaken rival Bharti Airtel to become India's second-largest operator by subscribers as of May. Jio ended the month with 32.3 crore wireless customers as against Airtel's 32.04 crore users, data from the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India showed. Vodafone Idea remained India's top operator with 38.76 crore customers.

column2: There is a café in Delhi which is run by specially-abled people
column3: Echoes café, located in Delhi's Satya Niketan and North Campus, is run by specially-abled people. The café provides customers with notepads to write down their orders on and each table has placards like 'Water Please', 'Menu Please' and 'Bill Please' for requests. All the tables have a light bulb which customers need to switch on to call the servers.

column2: BJP targeting my family: Mayawati as brother's Benami plot attached
column3: A day after the I-T Department attached a Benami plot worth ₹400 crore belonging to her brother and his wife, BSP supremo Mayawati accused the BJP of "targeting her family members." Mayawati also demanded an investigation into the wealth and income of BJP office-bearers. Further, she accused the BJP and RSS of being "the most casteist organisations in the country."

column2: Odisha hospital gives saplings to new parents post Cyclone Fani
column3: A government hospital in Odisha's Bhubaneswar has started handing out saplings to parents of newborn babies as part of an initiative called 'One Baby One Tree'. Capital Hospital's director Dr Ashok Pattnaik said, "We lost a lot of trees in the recent Cyclone Fani. We are taking up this unique initiative to revive the green cover in our beloved city."

column2: Sachin Tendulkar inducted into ICC Hall of Fame
column3: Ex-India batsman Sachin Tendulkar, ex-South Africa pacer Allan Donald and ex-Australia Women pacer Cathryn Fitzpatrick have been inducted into the ICC Hall of Fame. Sachin is the sixth Indian cricketer after Anil Kumble, Sunil Gavaskar, Bishan Singh Bedi, Kapil Dev and Rahul Dravid to be inducted into the ICC Hall of Fame. Sachin played 664 international matches, scoring 34,357 runs.

column2: Pak agrees to grant consular access to Jadhav after ICJ verdict
column3: Pakistan Foreign Ministry in an official statement on Thursday said it would grant consular access to Kulbhushan Jadhav in accordance with the country's laws. This follows the International Court of Justice's (ICJ) verdict. The ICJ had on Wednesday allowed India consular access to Jadhav and called on Pakistan to review and reconsider the death sentence accorded to him.

column2: Deliver verdict in Babri case within 9 months: SC to CBI judge
column3: The Supreme Court has asked special CBI judge SK Yadav to deliver the final verdict in the Babri Masjid demolition case within nine months. The case involves several Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leaders including LK Advani, Murli Manohar Joshi and Uma Bharti. The conspiracy charge against the BJP leaders was restored by the Supreme Court in April 2017.

column2: Xiaomi Redmi K20 Pro launched in India, to go on sale on July 22
column3: Xiaomi's flagship Redmi K20 Pro has been unveiled in India at a starting price of ₹27,999. It features an AMOLED display, a 3D curved glass back design, in-screen fingerprint sensor, the latest Snapdragon 855 chipset and comes with up to 8GB RAM and 256GB storage. Its first sale will be on July 22 on Mi.com, Mi Home and Flipkart.

column2: 'Sasural Simar Ka' fame child actor Shivlekh dies in car accident
column3: Child actor Shivlekh Singh, who had acted in TV serials including 'Sasural Simar Ka', was killed in a car accident on the outskirts of Chhattisgarh's Raipur on Thursday, police said. The 14-year-old's parents were injured in the accident. The victims were heading for Raipur from Bilaspur when their car hit an oncoming truck.

column2: I will be contesting for HCA president post: Mohammad Azharuddin
column3: Former India captain Mohammad Azharuddin on Thursday confirmed that he would contest for the post of president of Hyderabad Cricket Association (HCA) whenever the elections are held. The former captain’s nomination for the post of HCA president was not accepted in 2017. The Annual General Meeting (AGM) of the HCA is expected to deliberate the issue on July 21.

column2: $5 trillion economy not coming from heaven: Pranab Mukherjee
column3: While addressing a lecture on Thursday, former President Pranab Mukherjee said, "The Finance Minister can say that India will become a $5 trillion economy by 2024 because of the strong foundation laid previously. It's not coming out of heaven." He added, "Those who criticise Congress rule for 55 years forget from where we began and where we have come."

column2: Karnataka Dy CM arranges food for BJP MLAs on overnight dharna
column3: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister G Parameshwara arranged for food for the BJP MLAs holding an overnight dharna in state Assembly premises amid the political crisis. Parameshwara said, "It is our duty to arrange food and other things for them. Some of them have diabetes and blood pressure conditions... Beyond politics, we are friends. It is the beauty of democracy."

column2: Priyanka detained on way to meet kin of shooting victims in Sonbhadra
column3: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has been detained by police in Uttar Pradesh's Mirzapur while she was on her way to visit the families of 10 people shot dead in land dispute in Sonbhadra. "I don't know where are they (police) taking me...we are ready to go anywhere," Priyanka said. Administration has imposed Section 144 in the region.

column2: Karnataka BJP chief sleeps on Assembly floor during overnight dharna
column3: Former CM and Karnataka BJP chief BS Yeddyurappa, along with other BJP MLAs, slept in the state Assembly during the overnight dharna staged by them, seeking an immediate trust vote. Yeddyurappa and some other leaders slept after setting up their beddings on the Assembly floor. Some leaders also went for a morning walk in the Vidhana Soudha premises on Friday.

column2: US Navy shoots down Iranian drone in Strait of Hormuz
column3: US President Donald Trump on Thursday said that a US Navy ship had "destroyed" an Iranian drone in the Strait of Hormuz after the aircraft threatened the vessel. He added that the drone had flown to within 1,000 yards of the ship and had ignored "multiple calls to stand down". Iran in June shot down a US military surveillance drone.

column2: Hiranandani to invest ₹1,000 crore to set up first data centre
column3: Hiranandani Group has said it plans to invest ₹1,000 crore to develop its first data centre park at Panvel in Navi Mumbai under the brand Yotta. The data centre will come up by this December at an integrated township that the company is currently developing. H-Energy, the group's energy arm, will provide the power requirements to operate the data centre.

column2: Rajinikanth's daughter Aishwaryaa backs yoga startup Sarva
column3: Mumbai-based fitness and yoga startup Sarva has raised an undisclosed amount of funding from Tamil superstar Rajinikanth's daughter Aishwaryaa R Dhanush. She will lead Sarva's yoga wellness arm Diva Yoga's growth in South India. Founded in 2016, Sarva had recently raised funding from celebrities including Malaika Arora, Jennifer Lopez, Alex Rodriguez, Shahid Kapoor and Mira Kapoor.

column2: Atari Co-founder launches ₹2,800 board game powered by Alexa
column3: X2 Games, created by arcade games firm Atari's Co-founder Nolan Bushnell and Hollywood creative director Zai Ortiz, has released an Alexa-powered board game 'St Noire'. The murder mystery game features immersive background sounds and over 2,500 lines of dialogue performed by actors portraying 12 different characters. Available on Amazon for about ₹2,800, it doesn't include the Alexa device itself.

column2: BJP MLA brings bed sheet, pillow to Assembly as party stages dharna
column3: BJP MLA Prabhu Chavan arrived at the Assembly with a bed sheet and pillow as BJP decided to stage an overnight dharna. The House was adjourned after the Congress-JD(S) members accused BJP of kidnapping its MLAs and started shouting slogans. In protest, BJP members declared they would stay in the House overnight till the time the trust vote is decided.

column2: Ratan Tata-backed Teabox gets funding from NB Ventures, others
column3: Bengaluru-based premium tea-selling platform Teabox has raised undisclosed funding from Dubai-based NB Ventures, family office of Neelesh Bhatnagar, among others. Teabox has raised a total of $10 million as part of its Series A and B rounds from investors including Accel, JAFCO Asia and others. Ratan Tata, the Chairman Emeritus of Tata Sons, had backed Teabox in 2016.

column2: Rajasthan govt launches 'police training' for school students
column3: The Rajasthan government has launched a training program for class 8 and 9 students to make them aware of basic laws and legal procedures. Students would be trained as Student Police Cadets under this program jointly initiated by the state education board and police departments. The training further aims to curb rising adolescent delinquency and strengthen teenagers mentally and physically.

column2: Several Bengali film and TV actors join BJP in Delhi
column3: Several Bengali film and TV actors, including Parno Mittra, joined BJP at its Delhi headquarters on Thursday in the presence of the party's West Bengal chief Dilip Ghosh. Rishi Kaushik, Kanchana Moitra and Rupanjana Mitra were among the actors who joined the party. This comes after actors-turned-politicians Mimi Chakraborty and Nusrat Jahan won recently-held Lok Sabha elections on TMC tickets.

column2: Fan names newborn after England captain over WC win, Morgan responds
column3: A fan named James Bridgland, who was blessed with a baby boy on July 17, named his newborn after England's 2019 World Cup-winning captain Eoin Morgan. "Eoin, please meet Henry Eoin Morgan-Bridgland...Just to ensure Sunday's events are remembered even more often!" the fan tweeted. Morgan responded to the fan, saying, "That's very cool. Congratulations."

column2: Vijender challenges Amir for bout, says he should stop fighting kids
column3: Indian boxer Vijender Singh has challenged Pakistani-origin British boxer Amir Khan for a bout after winning his 11th straight pro match. "Stop fighting children, I am ready for a bout," Vijender Singh said. "I can reduce my weight a little and he can increase it and we can agree on a mid point. He has done it before," he added.

column2: Dhoni India's best captain only as per statistics: Gautam Gambhir
column3: Former India cricketer Gautam Gambhir has said that MS Dhoni is India's best captain only as per statistics. "But that doesn't mean that other captains have done badly. Sourav Ganguly has done good captaincy; we have won outside under him. Under Virat Kohli's captaincy, we have won ODI series in South Africa and Test series in Australia," he added.

column2: I didn't know there'd be Super Over in case of tie in WC final: Boult
column3: New Zealand pacer Trent Boult, who bowled Super Over for New Zealand in 2019 World Cup final against England, has admitted he didn't know there was going to be a Super Over in the final. "When I saw three off two that's when umpires said to us there would be a Super Over [in case of a tie]," he added.

column2: Juventus sign defender Matthijs de Ligt from Ajax in ₹580 crore
column3: Serie A champions Juventus have completed the £67.5 million (₹580 crore) signing of 19-year-old Dutch defender Matthijs de Ligt from Ajax. De Ligt had made his debut for Ajax in 2016 and became their youngest captain in March 2018. He has signed a five-year contract with Juventus. De Ligt had helped Ajax reach the Champions League semi-finals last season.

column2: Hima Das wins her fourth international gold medal in 15 days
column3: Sprinter Hima Das clinched her fourth gold medal in 15 days after winning the 200m race at Tabor Athletics Meet in Czech Republic. The 19-year-old clocked 23.25 seconds. She had clocked 23.65 seconds to win her first competitive race on July 2. She won Kutno Athletics Meet and Kladno Athletics Meet with time of 23.97 seconds and 23.43 seconds respectively.

column2: Selectors must tell Dhoni he's not India's 1st choice keeper: Sehwag
column3: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has said that the duty of the selectors is to reach out to MS Dhoni and inform him that he is no more being seen as India's first choice wicketkeeper-batsman going forward. "I wish the selectors had asked me as well about my plans so I would also have been able to inform them," he added.

column2: 1975 video of woman kissing cricketer goes viral over #SareeTwitter
column3: A video of a woman in saree sprinting towards the pitch and kissing the then 22-year-old batsman Brijesh Patel during an India-West Indies Test in 1975 went viral. A user shared the video as part of the #SareeTwitter challenge, writing, "Sorry this #SareeTwitter cannot be beaten." "She definitely wasn't saree about what she did," a user tweeted reacting to it.

column2: Karnataka Governor asks Kumaraswamy govt to prove majority on Friday
column3: Karnataka Governor Vajubhai Vala wrote a letter to Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy on Thursday, asking him to prove his coalition government's majority on the floor of the House by 1:30 pm on Friday. This comes after the Karnataka Assembly was adjourned without trust vote today. Notably, Vala had asked the Speaker to complete the floor test proceedings on Thursday itself.

column2: Driver stops Mumbai local train, urinates in front of it; video viral
column3: A video of a driver of a Mumbai local train stopping the train and urinating in front of it has gone viral. In the video, the motorman can be seen urinating even as another train passes by on the other track. The train was stopped between Ulhasnagar and Vithalwadi railway stations. The Central Railway said it would investigate the incident.

column2: US President Trump criticised over tweet on Hafiz Saeed
column3: US President Donald Trump has been criticised after he said in a tweet that Jamaat-ud-Dawa chief and 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks mastermind Hafiz Saeed was arrested in Pakistan after a 10-year search. "FYI Pakistan wasn't searching for [Saeed] for 10 years. He's been living freely", the US House Foreign Affairs Committee said in response to Trump.

column2: Man claims he found pic of his amputated leg on cigarette packets
column3: A man in France claimed he found a picture of his amputated leg being used on cigarette packets as a warning against smoking without his consent. His son had discovered the picture, which bore recognisable burns and scars when he bought cigarettes last year in Luxembourg, according to reports. The man had lost his leg in an attack in Albania.

column2: Trump was involved in talks to pay pornstar to hide affair: FBI
column3: US President Donald Trump was directly involved in the talks to pay pornstar Stormy Daniels to hide their alleged affair, the FBI has said. Trump's then-campaign Press Secretary Hope Hicks was also involved in the talks. Daniels had claimed that she was paid $130,000 by Trump's former lawyer Michael Cohen during the 2016 election campaign to maintain her silence.

column2: Boeing to pay ₹340 crore to 737 MAX crash victims' families
column3: US planemaker Boeing on Wednesday said it will dedicate $50 million (more than ₹340 crore) of the $100 million fund it created after two crashes of its 737 MAX planes to provide payments to families of those killed. The crashes killed 346 people. The world's largest planemaker has hired veteran US compensation expert Ken Feinberg to oversee the distribution.

column2: Knew Neymar wanted to leave before Copa: PSG manager Tuchel
column3: French side Paris Saint-Germain manager Thomas Tuchel said he was aware that Neymar "wanted to leave" the club before Copa America. "I am always disappointed when a player turns up late but it's clear between us, now it's between the club and Neymar," Tuchel added. This comes amid reports of Neymar being linked with a return to former club, Barcelona.

column2: Tata Chemicals may produce Li-ion batteries for EVs: Reports
column3: Tata Chemicals is reportedly planning to set up a factory to manufacture lithium-ion batteries, mainly for the electric vehicle (EV) segment in India. Reports said the firm has already acquired land in Dholera town of Gujarat to build the factory. Tata Chemicals will reportedly play a key role in Tata Motors' plan to devise an EV ecosystem in India

column2: Software unicorn Druva buys data protection startup CloudLanes
column3: US-based cloud backup and data protection unicorn Druva has acquired data protection startup CloudLanes for an undisclosed amount. Founded in the year 2015, CloudLanes introduced a secondary storage platform built on public clouds with a hybrid cloud approach. Sequoia-backed Druva had achieved its unicorn or billion-dollar status in a $130-million funding led by Viking Global Investors in June.

column2: Revenue from toll plazas during 2018-19 is ₹9,187cr: Gadkari
column3: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Thursday said that the toll revenue generated during 2018-19 amounted to ₹9,187. "In 2016-17, a total of ₹6,937 crore, in 2017-18, ₹8,630 crore...was the total revenue generated from the 549 operational toll plazas across the country," he added. Gadkari said this in the Lok Sabha while responding to a question by a BJP leader.

column2: Pakistan under global gaze in Jadhav's case: Arun Jaitley
column3: BJP's Arun Jaitley on Thursday said ICJ's verdict in Kulbhushan Jadhav's case has put Pakistan under a 'global gaze' as to what direction it will follow. "ICJ has given Pakistan an opportunity to comply with the rule of law...Will Pakistan use this opportunity or squander it?" he added. The ICJ on Wednesday directed Pakistan to review Jadhav's death sentence.

column2: Allahabad Bank reports ₹688.3 cr fraud by SEL Manufacturing
column3: State-run Allahabad Bank on Wednesday said it has reported a fraud of nearly ₹688.3 crore by textile firm SEL Manufacturing (SELM) to the RBI. It added the fraud by SELM, a non-performing asset account, is being heard by the National Company Law Tribunal. Earlier, Allahabad Bank had reported a fraud of ₹1,775 crore by bankrupt steelmaker Bhushan Power and Steel.

column2: FPIs can register as companies to avoid tax surcharge: FM
column3: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) can register as companies to avoid the new tax surcharge. The government in Budget imposed 25% tax surcharge on those with ₹2-5 crore taxable income and 37% surcharge on taxable income above ₹5 crore, that will also cover trusts. About 40% of roughly 9,400 FPIs are reportedly registered as trusts.

column2: What do Indians mean by non-stop honking: Mercedes-Benz India CEO
column3: Mercedes-Benz India CEO Martin Schwenk, who moved to Pune last year, said he doesn't understand what people "mean by the incessant honking". When asked which aspect of India took the most time adjusting to, Schwenk said, "The Indian 'head bob' did take me some time to get used to." He added he finds Indians to be very friendly and competent.

column2: Ex-Bigg Boss contestant Ajaz held for posting communal TikTok video
column3: Former Bigg Boss contestant and actor Ajaz Khan was arrested in Mumbai on Thursday for uploading a TikTok video with objectionable content promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion. "The video created hatred among public at large," police said. A case has been registered against him and further investigation is on by the Cyber Crime Police Station, Mumbai.

column2: People help rescue whales stranded on US beach; video goes viral
column3: Dozens of people helped push a pod of pilot whales back into deeper water after they came close to the shore on Saint Simons Island's East Beach in Georgia, US. The rescuers were able to push back six pilot whales, while three died. Onlookers captured a video of the incident, which has gone viral on social media.

column2: Bluetooth flaw exposes user locations; Android devices safe
column3: Boston University researchers have found a flaw in Bluetooth that could let hackers track user locations, using a third-party algorithm. The flaw was found to be present across platforms including Apple's iOS and Windows 10, with the exception of Android, researchers revealed. "The algorithm does not require message decryption or breaking Bluetooth security in any way," researchers said.

column2: Consider trust vote to end by today: Karnataka Governor to Speaker
column3: Karnataka Governor Vajubhai Vala on Thursday asked Assembly Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar to complete the process of vote of confidence moved by Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy by the end of the day. Vala's message to Kumar came after a BJP delegation called on him and requested him to direct the Speaker to conduct the vote of confidence on Thursday itself.

column2: K'taka Assembly adjourned till tomorrow, BJP to protest overnight
column3: Karnataka Deputy Speaker Krishna Reddy deferred the trust vote proceedings in the House and adjourned the Assembly till 11 am on Friday. BJP state chief BS Yeddyurappa, however, said BJP MLAs will hold an all-night protest inside the House till the confidence vote is taken up. This comes after Karnataka Governor asked the Speaker to complete the floor test today.

column2: Cong protests in K'taka Assembly with photos of its 'missing' MLA
column3: Congress MLAs on Thursday protested in Karnataka Assembly with pictures of fellow MLA Shrimant Patil, who had gone incommunicado and was later found to be admitted at a hospital in Mumbai. Congress further blamed the BJP of poaching its MLAs during the trust vote debate. Karnataka Assembly has been adjourned till 11 am on Friday by Deputy Speaker Krishna Reddy.

column2: Telangana minister's grandson makes TikTok video atop govt vehicle
column3: A TikTok video of Telangana Home Minister Mahmood Ali's grandson Furqan Ahmed, in which he can be seen sitting on top of a government vehicle and lip-syncing to a movie dialogue, has gone viral. He enacted the argument of someone with the Inspector General of Police. Reports said the video was shot outside a hall where Ali attended an event.

column2: Felt him collapse in arms: Woman loses sons in Mumbai building collapse
column3: A 28-year-old woman from Uttar Pradesh lost both her sons in Dongri building collapse on Tuesday. Alima and her sons Shehzad and Arbaaz were in Mumbai, where her husband works as a tailor, and were supposed to return to their village this month. "I kept shouting, no one heard me. I felt my son collapse in my arms," said Alima.

column2: Tiger caught resting on bed at home to escape Assam floods; pic viral
column3: A tiger was spotted resting on a bed inside a house in Assam after it escaped from the flooded Kaziranga National Park, which has around 95% of its area submerged under water. The image of the tiger shared by Wildlife Trust of India is being widely shared on social media. The WTI also sent a team to rescue the tiger.

column2: UK woman fined ₹73L for behaviour that lead RAF jets to escort plane
column3: A UK woman has been fined £85,000 (over ₹73 lakh) by the airline Jet2 over "abusive and dangerous behaviour" on a flight in June. Her behaviour had prompted the Turkey-bound plane to be escorted back to the UK by two Royal Air Force (RAF) Typhoon fighter jets. Chloe Haines had tried to open the aircraft door and storm the cockpit.

column2: Iran says it seized foreign tanker smuggling 1 million litres of oil
column3: Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps has seized a foreign oil tanker, claiming it was carrying one million litres of smuggled fuel, Iran's state media said. Iran had earlier provided assistance to the same tanker as had it suffered a technical glitch. Iran's move comes after one of its tankers was seized in Gibraltar for allegedly transferring oil to Syria illegally.

column2: Woman loses kid's custody after bikini pics shown to judge in Saudi
column3: Bethany Vierra, an American woman living in Saudi Arabia, lost custody of four-year-old daughter after her ex-husband showed her bikini photos to judge as evidence to prove Vierra is unfit to look after their child. Vierra said the bikini photos were taken in the United States. She lost her daughter's custody despite submitting a video showing her ex-husband doing drugs.

column2: China's debt tops 300% of GDP, now 15% of global total: IIF
column3: China's total corporate, household and government debt rose to 303% of GDP in the first quarter of 2019, according to the Institute of International Finance (IIF). This is up from 297% in the same period a year earlier and makes up about 15% of all global debt. China's economic growth slowed to a 27-year-low of 6.2% in the second quarter.

column2: GoAir names former Airbus executive Miranda Mills as COO
column3: Wadia Group-run budget carrier GoAir on Wednesday said it has hired former Airbus executive Miranda Mills as the Chief Operating Officer (COO). She will be reporting to the airline's Managing Director Jeh Wadia. Before joining GoAir, Mills worked with British aircraft engine maker Rolls-Royce as Chief Digital Officer and Director (Transformation), of the company's civil aviation vertical.

column2: Author of 50-yr-old note in bottle that washed up on shore found
column3: The author of a 50-year-old note in a bottle that washed up on shore in Australia has been found. The note, written by Paul Gilmore when he was 13-years-old in 1969, was recently found by a father-son duo during a fishing trip on a South Australian beach. Gilmore's sister said that he's currently on a cruise in the Baltic Sea.

column2: Congress, NCP MLAs to join BJP soon: Maharashtra BJP chief
column3: Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil on Thursday claimed that some Congress and NCP MLAs will resign and join the BJP within a week or 10 days. Patil, however, refrained from revealing names of the opposition legislators likely to join the saffron party. "The fun of life lies in the uncertainty. So, let it remain that way," he said.

column2: Former Yahoo executives' startup Travelstop gets $3 million
column3: Singapore-based corporate travel startup Travelstop has raised $3 million in a pre-Series A round of funding led by Accel. The investment also saw participation from Strive and existing investor SeedPlus. Launched in 2018 by former Yahoo executives Prashant Kirtane, Vijay Aggarwal and Altaf Dhamani, Travelstop had raised seed funding of $1.2 million led by SeedPlus in August 2018.

column2: Tamil Nadu announces 2 new districts, total reaches 35
column3: Tamil Nadu CM K Palaniswami on Thursday announced that two new districts, Tenkasi and Chengalpattu, would be carved out of Tirunelveli and Kancheepuram respectively. With these two, the total number of districts in the state has reached 35. "The bifurcation is done for administrative convenience following representations from Ministers, MLAs and the general public," the CM said.

column2: RIL completes ₹585 cr purchase of 259-yr-old toymaker Hamleys
column3: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries (RIL) on Thursday said its subsidiary Reliance Brands has completed the acquisition of 259-year-old British toy retailer Hamleys for nearly ₹585 crore in an all-cash deal. It acquired Hamleys from Chinese fashion retailer C.banner through a special purpose vehicle set up in the UK. The toy retailer has 167 stores across 18 countries

column2: CARE sends CEO on leave citing anonymous complaint to SEBI
column3: Credit rating agency CARE Ratings on Wednesday said it has sent its CEO and Managing Director Rajesh Mokashi on leave, pending investigation into an anonymous complaint received by regulator SEBI. It has appointed TN Arun Kumar, Executive Director (Ratings), as the interim CEO. Earlier, rating agency Moody's India unit ICRA had sent its CEO and MD Naresh Takkar on leave.

column2: Kannada TV actress among 5 killed in car accident
column3: Kannada TV actress Shobha, who was seen in the show 'Magalu Janaki', died in a road accident on Wednesday. Shobha's car rammed into a truck on National Highway 4 on the outskirts of Chitradurga, Karnataka. Eight people were travelling in the car and along with Shobha, 4 other people lost their lives in the accident while 3 were injured.

column2: Stitches hurt like mad, says Sameera 5 days after delivering daughter
column3: Actress Sameera Reddy has shared a picture of herself 5 days after delivering her daughter. "It's...hard on the body when it's a C section because the stitches hurt like mad," she wrote. "Nothing can ready you for the sleepless nights of endless feeding and your body just feels so out of whack it can really get you down," Sameera added.

column2: Hard Kaur supports Khalistani group, backs pro-Khalistan referendum
column3: Weeks after being booked for sedition, rapper Hard Kaur shared a video in which she extended her support to pro-Khalistan group Sikhs for Justice (SFJ) and their demand for a separate homeland for Sikhs in Punjab. Kaur is seen supporting their 'Referendum 2020' and urging people to vote for Khalistan. India banned SFJ for its alleged anti-national activities last week.

column2: 4 days after winning World Cup, Bayliss appointed SRH head coach
column3: Four days after leading England to 2019 World Cup victory, Trevor Bayliss has been appointed as SunRisers Hyderabad head coach. The 56-year-old Australian's tenure with England will come to an end after the Ashes.
