It will be Bayliss' second stint in the Indian Premier League, having already led KKR to two IPL titles during his tenure from 2012 to 2015.

column2: Former Gujarat Congress MLAs Alpesh Thakor, Dhavalsinh Zala join BJP
column3: OBC leader Alpesh Thakor, who recently quit as Congress MLA after casting his vote for BJP candidates in Rajya Sabha by-poll in Gujarat, on Thursday joined BJP in presence of Gujarat party chief Jitu Vaghani. Thakor's close aide and former Congress MLA Dhavalsinh Zala also joined BJP. "We were always deceived after joining Congress party," Thakor had earlier said.

column2: Uber glitch charges people 100 times the normal fare for trips in US
column3: An Uber glitch on Wednesday charged riders in several US cities 100 times their normal fare for short trips. Riders in cities including Washington and San Diego took to social media to post about the hiked rates. Uber said the glitch was fixed and the fare would be corrected so riders are charged only the amount for their actual trip.

column2: Crime Branch may drop Homigo fraud case after K'taka HC order
column3: Following Karnataka High Court's order that a fraud case of reportedly about ₹20 crore against Bengaluru-based co-living startup Homigo was a civil dispute, the Central Crime Branch is set to drop its investigation, Inc42 revealed. The HC had put an interim stay on the investigation. Tenants alleged Homigo Founders, IIT-Kanpur graduates Nikunj Batheja, Jatin Mitruka and Aakash Verma, were missing.

column2: This drama has happened 8 times: India on Saeed's arrest in Pak
column3: Speaking on JuD chief and 26/11 Mumbai attacks mastermind Hafiz Saeed's arrest in Pakistan, External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Raveesh Kumar said, "This drama, to my count, has happened over eight times since 2001." "It's been happening for a long time...arrest-release. After every major terror incident [Saeed] perpetrates in India, he's been arrested and released on some grounds," Kumar added.

column2: Mumbai sex racket involving BSE-listed company busted, Founder held
column3: The Mumbai Police has busted a sex racket involving Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE)-listed firm Rajnish Wellness, which sells sexual wellness products. The company's Founder Rajnish Singh was arrested, who allegedly ran sex racket under the name of spas and body massage parlours. The Crime Branch of Mumbai Police rescued three women allegedly involved in flesh trade from a three-star hotel.

column2: Never stop: Ex-BSF officer who qualified for IAS on 5th attempt
column3: Harpreet Singh, a former BSF officer, qualified for the Indian Administrative Service on his 5th attempt and made it to the top 20. "I utilised all my time for studying my notes and since I had a clear target in mind, nothing deterred me," said Harpreet, who hails from Punjab. "Never stop chasing your dream...Keep trying," the 27-year-old added.

column2: Once MBBS aspirant, one of Rajasthan's most wanted man arrested
column3: Twenty-eight-year-old Virendra Khinchar, once an MBBS aspirant and now one of the most wanted criminals of Jodhpur range in Rajasthan, was arrested this week. He's in police custody for allegedly kidnapping and killing another alleged criminal. Khinchar scored 80% marks in Class 12 board exams and had cleared the national entrance test for MBBS course and a nursing entrance test.

column2: Jadhav's family has shown exemplary courage: Jaishankar
column3: After the International Court of Justice ruled in favour of retired Indian Navy officer Kulbhushan Jadhav, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said, "Jadhav's family has shown exemplary courage in difficult circumstances." Stating India has made untiring efforts in seeking Jadhav's release and will continue doing so, Jaishankar called on Pakistan to release and repatriate the retired officer.

column2: Video shows girl dancing to Haryanvi song in DTC bus; driver suspended
column3: A video has surfaced online showing a girl dancing to a Haryanvi song in a Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) bus with driver and two other staffers. The staffers reportedly stopped the bus near Janakpuri, where they made the video on July 12. Meanwhile, the driver has been suspended and the conductor has been served show-cause notice for termination.

column2: Man says 'you die' as he sets fire to Japan animation studio, 30 dead
column3: A man screaming "you die" set fire to an animation studio in Kyoto, Japan on Thursday, and at least 30 people were feared dead in the arson attack. The perpetrator had shouted as he poured what appeared to be petrol around the three-storey building, Japan's public broadcaster said. Around 70 people were in the building when the fire started.

column2: Airline bans pics as man posts handwritten menu, later scraps ban
column3: Indonesia's flag carrier Garuda banned taking in-flight photos and videos after a popular travel blogger's photo showing a handwritten business class menu went viral. Following a backlash, the airline said customers can still take photos for personal use such as selfies. The blogger said both he and his fiancée were reported to police for alleged defamation over the post.

column2: Yes Bank Co-Founder's wealth falls from $1.4 bn to $377 mn in a year
column3: Yes Bank Co-Founder and ex-CEO Rana Kapoor has become $1 billion poorer since August 2018 following a 78% drop in the lender's shares. His net worth has fallen to $377 million from $1.4 billion, according to Bloomberg. The 61-year-old, who owns just over 10% of Yes Bank, had pledged to never sell his shares because they were like diamonds.

column2: Centre empowering minorities without appeasement: Naqvi
column3: Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said that the Centre believes in empowering the minorities "without appeasement". He added that the minorities meant six centrally notified minority communities and not Muslims alone. He said ₹1071.10 crore has been allocated for the 'PMJVK', under which various facilities including 21 residential schools were constructed in minority-dominated areas.

column2: Prisoner allegedly commits suicide in Bihar jail: Police
column3: A 30-year-old prisoner, lodged at a divisional jail in Bihar, allegedly committed suicide by hanging himself from the ceiling, police said. The police have registered a case of unnatural death and have started an investigation into the matter. The police informed that the two brothers of the deceased are also lodged in the same jail.

column2: Maoists kill 2 tribals in Andhra Pradesh: Police
column3: According to the police, Maoists killed two tribals in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam after branding them as police informers in an act of revenge. The police also recovered a note in which the Maoists claimed that they killed the two as they were involved in the killing of their fellow Maoists. "Police should take responsibility for these killings," the note read.

column2: Dawood's nephew arrested from airport while trying to escape India
column3: The Mumbai Police on Wednesday arrested Rizwan Kaskar, the nephew of underworld don Dawood Ibrahim, in connection with an extortion case. Kaskar was arrested from the Mumbai airport while trying to escape the country, an official said. His name had cropped up in an extortion case after the police arrested a close aide of Ibrahim's gang member Fahim Machmach.

column2: 28 people killed in Assam floods; 2 killed in landslide
column3: The Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA) on Thursday said the death toll due to flood in Assam has increased to 28 with 10 bodies recovered in the last 24 hours. Apart from this, two more people lost their lives in a landslide, the authority added. According to ASDMA, over one lakh people have been shifted to 427 relief camps.

column2: Residents of unauthorised colonies to get ownership rights: Delhi CM
column3: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that the residents of unauthorised colonies in Delhi will soon get ownership rights of their land. He added that the Centre has given a positive response to the Cabinet's proposal on the same. He said the Centre has asked few questions and after answering them the government will soon begin registration for these colonies.

column2: Wipro profit rises 12.6% to ₹2,387 crore in first quarter
column3: IT services firm Wipro on Wednesday reported a 12.6% rise in its profit at ₹2,387 crore in the June quarter from ₹2,121 crore in the year-ago period, driven by strong demand across its business segments. However, the profit, which met market estimates, fell 3.9% from ₹2,483 crore in the previous quarter. Wipro's first-quarter revenue grew 5.3% year-on-year to ₹14,716 crore.

column2: Ex-Pakistani PM Abbasi arrested in ₹9,500 crore corruption case
column3: Former Pakistani PM Shahid Khaqan Abbasi was arrested on Thursday in a nearly ₹9,500-crore corruption case related to the awarding of a contract to a liquefied natural gas firm. Abbasi had granted a 15-year contract to a company in which he was a shareholder himself. He'd awarded the contract when he was the Petroleum Minister under ex-PM Nawaz Sharif's rule.

column2: Arjun Rampal, girlfriend Gabriella blessed with baby boy
column3: Actor Arjun Rampal and his girlfriend Gabriella Demetriades were blessed with a baby boy on Thursday. Gabriella was admitted to Hinduja Hospital in Mumbai and her parents also arrived in the city from South Africa to welcome the child. Arjun is already father to two daughters with his ex-wife Mehr Jesia.

column2: Smriti Irani shares pic from 'Kyunki Saas Bhi...' for FaceApp challenge
column3: Union Minister and former actress Smriti Irani on Thursday shared a picture of herself from her show 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi', showing her as a much older character when the show took a time leap. She wrote in the caption, "When @ektaravikapoor gets to you before the #faceappchallenge #tbt." The show was produced by Ekta Kapoor.

column2: I am sure my dog won't be too angry at me: Boult on WC final defeat
column3: New Zealand pacer Trent Boult, who bowled the final over and Super Over in 2019 World Cup final, said he'll walk his dog along the beach to cope with the defeat. "I'm sure my dog won't be too angry at me," he added. "[The defeat] is...going to be hard to swallow for next couple of years," he further said.

column2: Neesham's childhood coach died during World Cup final Super Over
column3: New Zealand all-rounder Jimmy Neesham's childhood coach David James Gordon passed away during the 2019 World Cup final Super Over. The former Auckland Grammar School teacher breathed his last, moments after the cricketer hit a six on the bowling of England's Jofra Archer. "How appropriate you held on until just after such a match. Hope you were proud," Neesham tweeted.

column2: K'taka minister HD Revanna goes barefoot to Assembly for trust vote
column3: HD Revanna, Karnataka minister and son of former Prime Minister HD Deve Gowda, went barefoot to the state Assembly in Bengaluru for trust vote debate on Thursday. JD(S) leader and Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy's coalition government with Congress faces a floor test in the Assembly today. Notably, rebel JD(S)-Congress MLAs have refused to withdraw their resignations or attend the Assembly.

column2: 'Uncle Nelson' told me to join politics: Priyanka Gandhi
column3: On the 101st birth anniversary of Nobel Peace Prize winner late Nelson Mandela, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra today posted a picture of herself with Mandela. "To me, he was Uncle Nelson (who told me I ought to be in politics long before anyone else did!)," she wrote. "The world misses men like #NelsonMandela more than ever today," she added.

column2: eBay to buy 5.5% Paytm Mall shares reportedly at $3 bn valuation
column3: US-based online marketplace giant eBay has agreed to buy a 5.5% stake in Paytm's e-commerce unit Paytm Mall, reportedly for $170-200 million at a valuation of about $3 billion. This will mark eBay's third investment in Indian e-commerce space. It had invested about $133 million in Snapdeal in 2014 and had sold its 6.55% Flipkart stake after Walmart acquired it.

column2: Delhi govt plans to put a cap on number of guests at weddings
column3: Delhi minister Satyendar Jain on Wednesday said the government has finalised a draft policy to cap the number of guests at social functions, like weddings, in order to reduce traffic congestion. He, however, clarified that the guidelines won't cover all banquet halls and wedding venues across the city, but farmhouses and Low Density Residential Areas located primarily in Outer Delhi.

column2: I-T dept attaches ₹400cr Benami plot belonging to Mayawati's brother
column3: The Income Tax Department has attached a Benami plot worth ₹400 crore in Noida belonging to Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) supremo Mayawati's brother and his wife. An official provisional order for the attachment of the seven-acre plot, beneficially owned by Anand Kumar and his wife Vichiter Lata, was issued by the Delhi-based Benami Prohibition Unit of the department.

column2: Deposit ₹250cr to remove waste from landfills: NGT to Delhi govt, MCD
column3: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) on Wednesday directed the Delhi government and municipal corporations to deposit ₹250 crore in order to facilitate removal of waste from the landfill sites in the national capital. The leachate from the sites has been contaminating groundwater, the panel observed. The work of clearing waste from landfills must start from October 1, it added.

column2: 23-yr-old man falls to death from 3rd floor while on phone in Noida
column3: A 23-year-old man fell to his death from the third floor of a Noida building on Wednesday while he was talking on phone. Jitendra Kumar was a cook at a sweetshop and lived in a leased flat on the third floor of the four-storey building. He got married only a month ago and his wife was in his home town.

column2: US judge suspended over 'close your legs' remark to rape victim
column3: A US judge, John F Russo Jr, has been suspended after he told an alleged rape victim she could've "closed her legs" to prevent the sexual assault in 2016. He faces a hearing to determine whether he's fit for the bench. Meanwhile, a judge, who recommended leniency for a rape-accused as he came from a 'good family', has also resigned.

column2: US removes Turkey from F-35 programme as it buys Russia's S-400
column3: The US has removed Turkey from its F-35 fighter jets programme after it received the first parts of the Russian S-400 air defence system. "The F-35 cannot coexist with a Russian intelligence collection platform that will be used to learn about its advanced capabilities," the White House said. The US had earlier stopped training Turkish pilots on F-35 jets.

column2: Google removes 7 Play Store apps over risk of spying on user
column3: Google has removed seven apps from Play Store over risks of their ability to track user location and access contacts, SMS and call history. The apps were detected by antivirus firm Avast, which claimed all of the seven apps were likely designed by a Russian developer. The apps have been installed a combined 1.3 lakh times, Avast said.

column2: Instagram to hide number of 'Likes' in 6 more countries
column3: Facebook-owned photo-sharing platform Instagram is expanding its test to hide the visibility of the number of 'Likes' on other users' posts to six more countries. This includes Ireland, Italy, Japan, Brazil, Australia and New Zealand. Instagram said the test is "because [it wants] your followers to focus on the photos and videos you share, not how many likes they get."

column2: Spain's La Sagrada Familia church is under construction for 137 yrs
column3: Spain's La Sagrada Familia church is under construction since 1882, longer than it took to build the Egyptian Pyramids, and is expected to be completed in 2026. Despite being under construction, over three million visitors visit it every year. Currently, it's the largest unfinished Roman Catholic church in Barcelona, but it's expected to be the tallest church worldwide on completion.

column2: I have self-respect, need to clarify: K'taka CM ahead of floor test
column3: While addressing the Karnataka Assembly during a debate on the trust vote on Thursday, CM HD Kumaraswamy said, "I have self-respect and so do my ministers." Stating that doubts had been created about the Congress-JD(S) coalition government, Kumaraswamy added, "We have to tell the truth...I have to make some clarifications." He also asked, "Who is responsible for destabilising this government?"

column2: Huge cache of explosives, illicit liquor seized in Manipur
column3: Assam Rifles has seized a huge cache of explosives and 145 cartons of illicit liquor from a man during a raid at a village in Manipur, a Defence release said. According to the release, 190 explosive sticks and 62 detonators were seized during the raid from the man. He was later handed over to the Churachandpur Police for further investigation.

column2: ICJ's verdict positive, hope Pak will return Jadhav: VK Singh
column3: Speaking on the ICJ's verdict on Kulbhushan Jadhav, Union Minister General (retired) VK Singh said that the "judgement is positive". He added that hopefully, Pakistan will realise its mistake and will return Jadhav to India. On Wednesday, the ICJ extended the stay on the death sentence awarded to Jadhav by Pakistan and asked it to review the conviction.

column2: We will fight till Jadhav is back home: Pilot on ICJ ruling
column3: After the International Court of Justice ruled in favour of retired Indian Naval officer Kulbhushan Jadhav, Rajasthan Deputy CM Sachin Pilot tweeted, "All of India stands united with you, we will fight till you are back home." Stating that the ruling brings hope, Pilot added, "My prayers and that of India are with you and your family."

column2: Men claim to be policemen, loot ₹20L from Iraqi men in Noida
column3: The police have registered a case after two Iraqi nationals alleged that some men stole $30,000 (over ₹20 lakh) from them after claiming to be policemen in Noida. The Iraqi nationals' translator claimed the accused fled with the money after checking their bags. The incident took place outside a hospital where their brother has been admitted for a liver transplant.

column2: Chandrayaan-2 launch rescheduled to July 22, days after being aborted
column3: Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) has announced that India's second Moon mission 'Chandrayaan-2' launch, which was called off due to a technical snag on July 15, is now rescheduled at 2:43 pm on July 22. It will be launched from Andhra Pradesh's Sriharikota. Earlier, the mission was aborted just 56 minutes before the scheduled launch time.

column2: Only Pak ICJ judge voted against India in 15-1 verdict in Jadhav case
column3: The International Court of Justice ruled in favour of India in the Kulbhushan Jadhav case and voted 15-1, with the only judge to dissent being former Chief Justice of Pakistan Tassaduq Hussain Jillani. Jillani, who's an ad-hoc judge, agreed with the rest on only one point that the ICJ has jurisdiction to hear India's plea against Pakistan over Jadhav.

column2: Saravana owner Rajagopal dies days after surrendering in murder case
column3: Saravana Bhavan owner P Rajagopal passed away on Thursday aged 72 after suffering a heart attack. Rajagopal had surrendered in court in a murder case on July 9 wearing oxygen mask. He had sought time to surrender stating ill health but the court had denied him more time following which he was taken into custody to serve life imprisonment.

column2: Prepare for jobs of the future with Great Learning’s AI program
column3: Tech professionals can future-proof their jobs with the Artificial Intelligence program offered by Great Learning in collaboration with UT Austin and Great Lakes. Rated 4.7 stars by 500+ learners, the program helps learners to improve skills with 12+ hands-on projects to build their Github repository and e-portfolio. Learners also participate in industry-sponsored hackathons to showcase their expertise.

column2: Will proceed as per law: Pak PM 'appreciates' ICJ's Jadhav verdict
column3: After the International Court of Justice ruled in favour of India in the Kulbhushan Jadhav case and stayed his death penalty, Pakistan PM Imran Khan tweeted that the country will proceed further "as per law". "Appreciate ICJ's decision not to acquit, release & return Commander Kulbhushan Jadhav to India. He's guilty of crimes against the people of Pakistan," he added.

column2: Prosecutors drop case accusing Spacey of sexually assaulting man
column3: Prosecutors on Wednesday dropped a case accusing actor Kevin Spacey of groping an 18-year-old man at a bar in 2016 after the accuser refused to testify about a missing phone, which the defence said could prove Spacey's innocence. The man's mother alleged in 2017 that Spacey got her son drunk and sexually assaulted him. Spacey has faced several other accusations.

column2: Stallone hails Salman's video of specially-abled fan making his portrait
column3: Hollywood actor Sylvester Stallone has commented on a video shared by Salman Khan, which shows a specially-abled fan making Salman's portrait. Praising the video, Stallone wrote, "That is love and devotion." While sharing the video, Salman had written in the caption, "God bless...can't reciprocate the love but prayers and much love!!!"

column2: Will withdraw resignation: Rebel K'taka MLA ahead of trust vote
column3: Rebel Karnataka MLA and Congress leader Ramalinga Reddy has announced he would withdraw his resignation and vote in favour of Congress-JD(S) government in the state during the floor test on Thursday. Adding that he had been with the party for 45 years, Reddy said, "I had only resigned as an MLA but I never said I'd move away from Congress."

column2: Neil Armstrong's Apollo 11 spacesuit goes on display after 13 yrs
column3: Smithsonian National Air and Space Museum in Washington has put the spacesuit worn by Neil Armstrong, the first man to step on Moon during the Apollo 11 mission, on display after 13 years. Armstrong's son Rick unveiled the display on July 16, marking the 50th anniversary of Apollo 11 mission's launch. Neil Armstrong had passed away on August 25, 2012.

column2: Pak spent crores in Kulbhushan Jadhav case, Indian lawyer charged ₹1
column3: Senior advocate Harish Salve charged ₹1 as his fee to represent India during the public hearing in Kulbhushan Jadhav case in ICJ. Pakistan, on the other hand, spent crores on lawyers. The Pakistan government, in its budget document presented last year, said that it paid Rs 20 crore to UK-based barrister Khawar Qureshi, who represented the country.

column2: Not your fault, ICJ verdict given in English: Giriraj Singh mocks Pak
column3: After Pakistan government called the International Court of Justice's verdict in Kulbhushan Jadhav case a 'Big win for Pakistan', Union Minister Giriraj Singh tweeted, "Not your fault...judgment delivered in English." The UN court on Wednesday delivered the verdict in favour of India and found Pakistan guilty of violating Vienna Convention, thereby staying the death penalty to Jadhav by Pakistan.

column2: Tamil Nadu man posts beef festival invite on FB, arrested
column3: A 33-year-old man named S Ezhilan was arrested on Wednesday for posting a Facebook invitation for a beef festival in Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu. A police officer said that Ezhilan had invited several people and promised to give them "foremost respect" if they showed up. A case was filed following a complaint by Kallappuliyur Village Administrative Officer Sudara Rajan.

column2: My thoughts are with Jadhav, he's alone in a cell in Pak: Rahul
column3: After ICJ ruled in favour of retired Indian Naval officer Kulbhushan Jadhav, Congress' Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "My thoughts tonight are with Kulbhushan Jadhav, alone in a prison cell in Pakistan." Rahul said the verdict brings Jadhav's family a "rare moment of relief, joy & renewed hope, that he will one day be free to return to his home in India."

column2: L&T chief AM Naik appointed as Mindtree Chairman
column3: Larsen and Toubro (L&T) Group Chairman AM Naik has been appointed as the Non-Executive Chairman of mid-sized IT services firm Mindtree on Wednesday. The move follows L&T's acquisition of a controlling stake in the Bengaluru-based company. Mindtree CEO Rostow Ravanan, Executive Chairman Krishnakumar Natarajan and Executive Vice Chairman NS Parthasarathy had resigned earlier this month.

column2: China search engine project 'Dragonfly' terminated: Google
column3: Karan Bhatia, Google's Global Government Affairs and Public Policy VP, has revealed the technology giant has "terminated" its controversial Chinese search engine project 'Dragonfly'. Google had repeatedly faced heavy criticism over its decision to create a censored search engine to comply with Chinese laws. Google CEO Sundar Pichai, in late 2018, had said work on the project was "limited".

column2: Indonesia ride-hailing unicorn Go-Jek gets funding from Visa
column3: Global payments technology provider Visa has invested an undisclosed amount in Indonesian ride-hailing and logistics unicorn Go-Jek's ongoing Series F round of funding. Go-Jek and Visa will be partnering together to offer payment solutions to Southeast Asian Go-Jek users. Founded in 2010, Go-Jek offers on-demand motorbikes and taxis, along with services like grocery delivery and mobile payments.

column2: 5 held for duping people through 49 fake websites in Aligarh
column3: Five people were arrested for allegedly duping people through 49 fake financial websites in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh, Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) said. The SSP added that around ₹1.09 lakh cash, two laptops, 16 cell phones and other items were seized from their possession. He further said that a Special Investigation Team (SIT) has been formed to investigate the matter.

column2: Noida Authority to clean commercial areas at night: CEO
column3: The Noida Authority CEO said that the city's commercial areas will be cleaned at night as sanitary workers find it difficult to sweep the areas during the day. She also directed officials to ensure the elimination of open dumping spots by August 31. Thanking the CEO, Sector 18 Market Association President said, markets also need dustbins at various spots.

column2: 4 policemen suspended for assaulting journo in UP's Mathura
column3: Four policemen were suspended after a three-member committee found them guilty of assaulting a journalist in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura, police said. He was assaulted after he had asked the policemen to not park their vehicle in the middle of the road, the police added. The police have also sent a letter to higher authorities for their out of zone transfer.

column2: Over 2,900 building collapse cases in Mumbai in 6 yrs; 242 killed
column3: In response to an RTI, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said at least 242 people were killed in over 2,900 incidents of building collapse in Mumbai between 2013 and 2018. BMC added that 818 were injured in these incidents. BMC further said that 499 buildings have been listed as 'unfit/dangerous' for habitat this year and these need be vacated and demolished.

column2: Coimbatore Traffic Police get 70 body-worn cams for surveillance
column3: The Coimbatore Traffic Police on Wednesday received 70 body-worn cameras designed to capture traffic violations, a police official said. The cameras can be used to stream live visuals to the police control room as well as record the visuals in the device at the same time, he added. He said this will bring transparency in the work of police personnel.

column2: Pregnant woman shot dead over water dispute in UP, 1 arrested
column3: A 25-year-old pregnant woman was shot dead over a water dispute in Etah on Wednesday, said the Uttar Pradesh police. Samaur village head Bhanu Pratap said that the three to four men who shot at the woman had fought several times with other villagers in the past. The main accused, Santosh, has been arrested.

column2: Rabri Devi urges PM to declare Bihar floods as national disaster
column3: Former Bihar CM Rabri Devi urged PM Narendra Modi to declare Bihar floods as a national disaster and send financial assistance to the flood-affected state. According to the state disaster management department, as many as 67 people have died due to floods so far. Officials said, 26 teams of NDRF and SDRF are carrying out rescue operations in the state.

column2: Boy dies after blood bank allegedly refuses to give blood in MP
column3: An eight-year-old boy, who was admitted to a district hospital in Madhya Pradesh, died allegedly after the blood bank in the hospital refused to give him blood. A relative of the boy said that the boy's mother went to people for blood but no one helped. An official at the hospital said, the boy was critical and had severe anaemia.

column2: My wife doesn't let our son watch GoT: Sonali Bendre's husband
column3: Actress Sonali Bendre's husband Goldie Behl has revealed that she doesn't let their son watch 'Game of Thrones'. "I said yes, but my wife (Sonali) didn't allow him. So, he didn't see it," said Goldie. "I am okay with him seeing it at the age of 13-14, in a couple of years he will see anyway," he added.

column2: Abdul Razzaq reveals he has had 5-6 affairs after marriage
column3: Former Pakistan all-rounder Abdul Razzaq, during a TV programme, said that he has had "five-six affairs that also had a validity of 1-1.5 years". He further said that all those affairs happened after he got married. "How do people laugh and clap at such statements? Won't be laughing when they're at [the] receiving end," a user tweeted reacting to it.

column2: I won't say I have redeemed myself, I am paid to play: Ben Stokes
column3: England all-rounder Ben Stokes, who was arrested in 2017 for a street brawl and later found not guilty, has said that the 2019 World Cup win was not his redemption. "I won't look back and say I redeemed myself. I am an athlete and a cricketer and it's what we are paid to do, to win trophies," he added.

column2: I never want to be involved in a Super Over ever again: Ben Stokes
column3: England all-rounder Ben Stokes, who was named Man of the 2019 World Cup final, has said he never wants to be involved in a Super Over ever again. The 28-year-old hit eight runs in Super Over against New Zealand. He further revealed he had suggested captain Eoin Morgan to send Jos Buttler and Jason Roy to play the Super Over.

column2: Manchester City players to decide new captain, says Pep Guardiola
column3: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has said that he will let his players decide who will captain the Premier League champions next season following the departure of long-time skipper Vincent Kompany. Kompany left Manchester City at the end of last season after 11 years to take up a player-coach role at Anderlecht, the club at which he started his career.

column2: If I travel with players, we won't have another Sindhu: Gopichand
column3: Talking about not travelling with players like PV Sindhu on the international circuit, national badminton coach Pullela Gopichand said, "If I was just travelling, what happens to the next batch, we would never have a Sindhu come out then." He further said that he needs more coaches as he can't do it alone. "Everybody needs personal attention," he stated.

column2: India drawn with Qatar in World Cup 2022 Asian Qualifiers draw
column3: The Indian football team has been grouped with 2022 FIFA World Cup hosts Qatar in Group E of Asian Qualifiers for the 2022 World Cup and the 2023 AFC Asian Cup. Along with Qatar, India will also play against Bangladesh and Afghanistan in Group E. India will begin their campaign at home against Oman on September 5.

column2: Juventus to be called Piemonte Calcio in FIFA after signing PES deal
column3: Juventus will be known as 'Piemonte Calcio' in the next FIFA game after signing a naming rights deal with FIFA's rival Pro Evolution Soccer. Piemonte Calcio will have its own badge and kit, designed by EA Sports. This is the first time in 25 years that FIFA will not hold the licence for the Italian first division champions.

column2: India has potential to win 100 Olympic medals by 2032: Rajyavardhan
column3: Ex-Sports Minister Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore has said that with various steps taken by government for promotion of sports and its infrastructure in the country in last five years, India has the potential to win 100 Olympic medals by 2032. Rathore added that the 'Khelo India' campaign initiated by PM Modi government has changed the attitude of the country towards sports.

column2: Privacy concerns raised over photo app FaceApp, company responds
column3: The Russian company behind the viral photo-editing app 'FaceApp', that lets users virtually look older, responded to the privacy concerns over the users' photos. "Most images are deleted from our servers within 48 hours," FaceApp said. "We might store an uploaded photo in the cloud...We want to make sure users don't upload the photo repeatedly for every edit," it added.

column2: Working presidents to work on their own: Chacko to Sheila Dikshit
column3: Delhi Congress in-charge PC Chacko on Tuesday wrote to Delhi Congress chief Sheila Dikshit, saying that the Delhi Pradesh Congress Committee was constituted with the order that three working presidents will work independently. Chacko added that since Dikshit is "not keeping well", he has authorised the working presidents to hold meetings of district and block committee heads and take decisions.

column2: ICJ's landmark judgement on Jadhav validates India's position: MEA
column3: The Ministry of External Affairs has issued a statement on the International Court of Justice's verdict in favour of India in the case related to retired Indian Navy officer Kulbhushan Jadhav. It said that the "landmark judgement validated India's position". It added Pakistan is expected to immediately inform Jadhav of his rights and allow Indian consular officers access to Jadhav.

column2: Court withdraws order to distribute Quran for bail over communal post
column3: A Jharkhand court has modified its earlier order which had mandated a student, accused of writing a communal post on social media, to distribute five copies of the Holy Quran for bail. The court withdrew the order after the police filed an application saying it was difficult to implement the condition. Notably, the student had refused to obey the order.

column2: Pakistan's conduct is under watch: Salve after ICJ verdict on Jadhav
column3: Responding to ICJ's verdict on Kulbhushan Jadhav, senior lawyer Harish Salve, who had represented him, said, "Pakistan's conduct is under watch and if what they do is another farcical attempt, we'll be back in the [world] court." "We expect Pakistan to do whatever it has to do including appropriate legislative measures to guarantee a fair trial [for Jadhav]," he added.

column2: 3 TN SRM Institute students kill themselves in same manner in 60 days
column3: A 21-year-old student killed himself at Tamil Nadu's SRM Institute of Science and Technology's Kattankulathur campus on Monday, the third such incident there in a span of 60 days using the same method. The police said it has been understood that the victim had multiple arrears in his exam. In May, two students killed themselves inside the same campus.

column2: US' Ebix to acquire Indian travel company Yatra for ₹2,320 crore
column3: US-based software firm Ebix has agreed to acquire Indian travel services company Yatra through a merger at an enterprise value of $337.8 million (₹2,320 crore). Yatra will become part of Ebix's travel portfolio EbixCash alongside Via and Mercury and will continue to serve customers under the Yatra brand. Ebix has invested nearly $700 million in India through EbixCash since 2017.

column2: 18-yr-old defender Gahlot becomes India's 2nd youngest goalscorer
column3: India's 18-year-old defender Narender Gahlot on Tuesday became the second youngest footballer to score a goal for the national team. Gahlot achieved the feat after his 51st-minute header in India's last league match of 2019 Intercontinental Cup against Syria. Jerry Zirsanga, who scored aged 16 in May 2004, is the youngest footballer to score for India.

column2: Delhi govt releases ₹109cr to MCDs to fight dengue, chikungunya
column3: The Delhi government has released ₹109 crore to all three MCDs in the national capital for dealing with dengue and chikungunya in the ongoing monsoon season. The funds have been released to the urban development department following the direction of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. Kejriwal directed the department to ensure proper utilisation of funds for carrying out necessary preventive steps.

column2: L&T Infotech to buy Lymbyc in 5th acquisition since listing
column3: IT services company L&T Infotech (LTI) has signed an agreement to acquire Bengaluru-based advanced analytics startup Lymbyc Solutions for ₹38 crore. This would be LTI's fifth acquisition since its listing in 2016, after having acquired India-based Ruletronics, AugmentIQ, and European firms Nielsen Partner and Syncordis. The company has committed over ₹340 crore across these acquisitions.

column2: Heroin worth ₹93,000 seized in Goa, 2 arrested
column3: The Goa Police on Tuesday arrested a man and a woman for possessing heroin worth ₹93,000. The Calangute Police team seized 31 grams of heroin worth ₹93,000 from their possession besides ₹43,600 during a raid. This is the 30th case filed this year in the state under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act.

column2: Yes Bank profit falls 91% to ₹113.8 crore in first quarter
column3: Yes Bank on Wednesday reported its profit fell by 91% to ₹113.8 crore in the first quarter from ₹1,260.4 crore in the year-ago period, driven by higher bad loan provisioning. The bank's gross bad loan ratio was 5.01% in the June quarter compared to 3.22% in the previous quarter. Its provisions for bad loans rose 185.2% year-on-year to ₹1,784 crore.

column2: Vakrangee to set up EV charging stations across India
column3: Vakrangee on Tuesday said it will set up electric vehicle (EV) charging stations across India through its 'Nextgen Vakrangee Kendra' outlets. It aims to expand its presence from 3,504 outlets across 19 states to at least 75,000 outlets by 2021-22 and 3 lakh by 2024-25. This follows government announcing ₹1.5-lakh income tax deduction on loan interest for purchasing EVs.

column2: Inshorts is hiring Content Managers & Specialists for regional news
column3: Inshorts is looking to hire Content Managers & Content Specialists for Gujarati, Telugu, Bengali, Marathi, Tamil, Malayalam, and Kannada. Eligibility criteria include bachelors/masters in Mass Communication with an experience of 1-5 years for Content Specialists and 5-8 years for Content Managers in the media industry. Swipe left to read the full description and to apply.

column2: Why are leaked sex scenes not being spread under actor's name: Radhika
column3: Actress Radhika Apte, while talking about her sex scenes with Dev Patel from 'The Wedding Guest' getting leaked, said, "The scenes are being spread in my name. Why are people not spreading them under the male actor's name?" "[The film] has many other beautiful sequences...That one particular sex scene got leaked because of the psychotic mentality of society," she added.

column2: ICC mock WC final Super Over by showing England players as aged men
column3: The ICC took to Instagram to mock 2019 World Cup Super Over by showing England cricketers Eoin Morgan, Jofra Archer, Jonny Bairstow and Joe Root as elderly men holding the trophy. "That's what a Super Over will do to you!" the ICC captioned the picture. "They will not be holding that when they're that old," a user wrote.

column2: Who would have won WC final had both teams hit equal boundaries?
column3: If England and New Zealand had hit equal boundaries both in Super Over and the match in World Cup final, a count-back from Super Over's final ball would've decided the winner. The team with the higher scoring delivery would've been declared the winner. England would've won as they hit a four on the last ball, while New Zealand scored one.

column2: Shubman should be groomed for India's no. 4 batting spot: Whatmore
column3: Former Sri Lanka coach Dav Whatmore has said that batsman Shubman Gill should be groomed for Team India's number four batting position. "He has got the technique to be a number four...I am sure he will have a long career," he added. The 19-year-old Shubman was the player of the tournament in 2018 Under-19 World Cup.

column2: Twitter gets trolled after unveiling redesigned desktop site
column3: Micro-blogging platform Twitter was trolled on Twitter after it unveiled a redesigned layout for its website. The platform has added new dark mode options and shifted the top navigation bar to the left sidebar, which contains a new ‘explore’ tab. “Twitter will redesign the entire site and make it ugly, but won’t give us an edit button,” a user said.

column2: Good: Elizabeth Warren on Peter Thiel saying she is 'dangerous'
column3: US politician Elizabeth Warren shared an article on Twitter that revealed PayPal Co-founder Peter Thiel called her the most "dangerous" Democratic presidential candidate and responded saying, "Good." "I think she's the one who's actually talking about the economy, which is the only thing...I think matters by far the most," Thiel said. "All the others are almost equally unimpressive," he added.

column2: Kerala IPS officer Merin Joseph brings child rape accused from Saudi
column3: A team led by Kollam Police Commissioner Merin Joseph arrested a man accused of raping a 13-year-old Kerala girl from Saudi Arabia and brought him to India on Tuesday. The accused, a Kollam native who works in Saudi Arabia, allegedly raped his friend's niece for three months in 2017. The child and her uncle later committed suicide.

column2: Cleric invited home to teach Quran to 9-yr-old girl molests her, held
column3: Uttar Pradesh Police on Wednesday arrested a cleric for allegedly sexually harassing a nine-year-old girl in Aligarh. The girl's mother alleged that the cleric who is associated with an Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) mosque was invited to their home to teach her daughter Quran but he molested her. The accused said, "Padhane jaata tha sir, to thoda-bahut chhedkhani ho gayi."

column2: Telangana govt employees shoot TikTok videos at work; transferred
column3: Several employees of the Telangana government's Khammam Municipal Corporation (KMC) were transferred and their wages were reduced after a series of their TikTok videos shot at work went viral on the internet. In the videos, they can be seen singing, dancing and playing pranks during office hours. According to KMC officials, 11 outsourced employees were found involved in the activity.

column2: Mexican drug lord 'El Chapo' sentenced to life in prison in US
column3: Mexican drug lord Joaquín 'El Chapo' Guzmán was on Wednesday sentenced to life in prison plus 30 years, in the US. The 62-year-old was convicted in February on all 10 counts he faced, including drug trafficking, money laundering and engaging in murder conspiracies. He was earlier ordered to forfeit $12.6 billion (over ₹86,700 crore).

column2: Trump reacts to Mumbai attacks mastermind Hafiz Saeed's arrest in Pak
column3: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday reacted to Jamaat-ud-Dawa chief and 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks mastermind Hafiz Saeed's arrest in Pakistan. "Great pressure has been exerted over the last two years to find him!" Trump said about Saeed in a tweet. Saeed, who's been designated a terrorist by the US, was arrested on terror financing charges.

column2: Indian drugmaker dumped key files in 200L drum in scrapyard: US
column3: A US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) investigator found that India's Strides Pharma Science dumped batch records for US drug products in a 200-litre drum in the scrapyard of its Puducherry plant. Strides, which sells numerous drugs in the US, was also caught attempting to shred quality-control documents. Ibuprofen is among the drugs the company makes at the Puducherry plant.

column2: Sindhu enters Indonesia Open 2nd round, Prannoy loses on b'day
column3: Indian shuttler PV Sindhu came from a set behind to beat Japan’s Aya Ohori 11-21, 21-15, 21-15 to enter the $1,250,000 Indonesia Open's second round. Meanwhile, HS Prannoy, who turned 27 today, lost 21-19, 18-21, 20-22 to world number two Shi Yuqi in the first round. Further, Kidambi Srikanth won his first-round match by defeating Japan’s Kenta Nishimoto 21-14, 21-13.

column2: Expect BJP govt in Karnataka next week: BJP National Gen Secy
column3: BJP National General Secretary P Muralidhar Rao on Wednesday claimed that a BJP government is expected to take charge in Karnataka next week. He said that the coalition government is in 'clear minority' and should go. Rao added that BJP is confident that the Congress-JDS government would lose the trust vote in the Legislative Assembly on Thursday.

column2: Crypto exchange Cryptokart shuts down over regulatory uncertainty
column3: Cryptocurrency exchange Cryptokart has decided to shut down its operations after about two years. The RBI had barred banks from serving cryptocurrency exchanges and firms in April 2018. Cryptokart Co-founder Gaurang Poddar said that since this decision, the general interest in cryptocurrency in India has "tanked" and regulatory uncertainty "just makes any long term planning difficult".

column2: Truth and justice prevail: Kejriwal on Jadhav's ICJ verdict
column3: After the International Court of Justice (ICJ) on Wednesday ruled in favour of India in Kulbhushan Jadhav's case, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal tweeted, "Truth and justice prevail." "I warmly welcome the ICJ judgment (of) staying the execution...and granting consular access to India," he wrote. "This son of our soil must be back soon with his family," the CM added.

column2: I'm sure Jadhav will get justice: PM Modi after ICJ verdict
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday welcomed the verdict by International Court of Justice (ICJ) in Kulbhushan Jadhav's case. "Truth and justice have prevailed. Congratulations to ICJ for a verdict based on extensive study of facts. I'm sure Jadhav will get justice," he tweeted. "Our government will always work for the safety and welfare of every Indian," the PM added.

column2: NCRB doesn't maintain specific data on lynching cases: MHA
column3: MoS for Home Nityanand Rai on Wednesday said the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) doesn't maintain specific data of lynching incidents in the country. He said this in response to a question on whether mob lynchings have increased in the last six months. "State governments are responsible for prevention, detection and investigation of crimes and for prosecuting criminals," he added.

column2: Will pray for Jadhav's early return: Cong after ICJ verdict
column3: The Congress party said it is a big win for India after the International Court of Justice (ICJ) on Wednesday ruled in favour of retired Indian Naval officer Kulbhushan Jadhav. "We welcome the ruling...we will continue to pray for his early return," the Congress tweeted. In its verdict, ICJ has directed Pakistan to review the death sentence given to Jadhav.

column2: Australia urges China to let Uighur mother and son leave country
column3: The Australian government has called on China to let an ethnic Uighur mother and son to leave the country. Sadam Abdusalam, an Uighur-Australian, has made a public call for the release of his wife and son, whom he has never met. China is believed to have held nearly 10 lakh Uighur Muslims in detention camps in the Xinjiang province.

column2: Jet Airways lenders to reopen bids to sell airline: Reports
column3: The lenders of grounded Jet Airways, led by SBI, will reportedly reopen bids to sell the carrier on July 20 to recover about ₹8,500 crore it owes to them. The candidates will likely be shortlisted by early August, reports said. The banks are also reportedly considering a nearly ₹70-crore interim infusion to pay some employee and legal costs, among others.

column2: Govt may list 5 units of world's top coal miner Coal India
column3: The government may reportedly list units of state-run Coal India (CIL), the world's largest coal miner, as separate companies to raise government funds and boost competition. Reports said the Coal Ministry is studying a proposal to list CIL's four production coalfields, constituting over three-fourths of its output, and its exploration unit. In 2017, think-tank NITI Aayog suggested a similar move.

column2: ICJ rules in India's favour, asks Pak to review Jadhav death sentence
column3: The International Court of Justice on Wednesday ruled in favour of India, finding Pakistan guilty of violating the Vienna Convention in retired Indian Navy officer Kulbhushan Jadhav's case for denying him consular access. The ICJ also extended the stay on the death sentence awarded to Jadhav by Pakistan on espionage and terrorism charges and asked it to review the conviction.

column2: I am locked in for good: Nick while explaining saat pheras on US show
column3: During his appearance on a US talk show, Nick Jonas talked about his marriage to actress Priyanka Chopra. "We [had our marriage] in Jodhpur, at a palace there which was beautiful," he said. "So you do the pheras, in which seven walks around the fire symbolise seven lives together. So I'm locked in for good now," he jokingly added.

column2: Makers of Prabhas' Saaho spend ₹70cr for 8-min action scene: Reports
column3: The makers of Prabhas and Shraddha Kapoor starrer 'Saaho' have spent ₹70 crore for an 8-minute action sequence, as per reports. The scene was shot in Abu Dhabi. International stuntman, Kenny Bates, known for his work in 'Pearl Harbour', 'Transformers: Dark of the Moon' and 'Mission Impossible - Ghost Protocol', has been signed to supervise the action scenes, reports added.

column2: Woke up wondering if it was a bad dream: Williamson on World Cup final
column3: Reacting to losing World Cup final on boundaries to England, New Zealand captain Kane Williamson said, "I woke up wondering if it was just a bad dream and it wasn't, was it?" "It sort of hits you in waves. You forget about it for 10 minutes...and then it comes back to you and you go...'Did that just happen?'" he added.

column2: MS Dhoni's parents want him to retire: Childhood coach Banerjee
column3: Team India wicketkeeper-batsman MS Dhoni's childhood coach Keshav Banerjee has revealed that the former India captain's parents want their son to retire from international cricket. "Dhoni's parents told me that the entire media is saying that Dhoni should retire and they feel that the media is right. They said they can't handle their big property alone anymore," he added.

column2: Suspended BJP MLA seen dancing with guns in video expelled for 6 yrs
column3: Uttarakhand BJP MLA Kunwar Pranav Singh Champion, who was already suspended from party, was on Wednesday expelled for six years after a video of him consuming alcohol and dancing with guns surfaced online. BJP had issued him a notice asking why he shouldn't be expelled and he couldn't give a satisfactory reply. He was earlier suspended for threatening a journalist.

column2: Rivigo fires up to 100 employees, cancels on-campus offers
column3: Gurugram-based billion-dollar logistics startup Rivigo has fired up to about 100 employees, mainly in its freight marketplace team, over the last few months. The startup had to withdraw around 50 offers from 10 premier campuses before joining dates, including IIT and IIM, among others. Rivigo Co-founder Gazal Kalra, confirming the firings, said they were over "performance and market dynamics".

column2: Rajasthan Police seize drugs & tweet, "Did anyone lose their smack?"
column3: Rajasthan Police on Wednesday shared a picture of seized smack on Twitter and wrote, "Oops! Did anyone lost (lose) their #Smack? If yes, we have them!" in order to track down its owners. "If you want them back contact us ASAP! Or else it'll be lost forever," police tweeted. "We promise free stay & food at our expense!" police added.

column2: Drunk woman stopped for not wearing helmet, hits traffic policeman
column3: A woman and her friend were arrested for misbehaving with a traffic policeman in West Delhi's Mayapuri on Tuesday, after she and the man on whose scooter she was riding pillion were stopped for not wearing helmets. In a video, the woman can be seen pushing and hitting the policeman. According to police, both of them were heavily drunk.

column2: Kerala man gets 3 life terms for raping 7-yr-old niece after murder
column3: The Additional Sessions (POCSO) court Kollam on Wednesday sentenced Kerala's 27-year-old Rajesh to three life terms and an additional jail term of 26 years for raping his 7-year-old niece after murdering her in 2017. He was also asked to pay ₹3.2 lakh fine to the court. According to the order, the three life terms are to run separately.

column2: NIA (Amendment) Bill passed in Rajya Sabha amid doubts by Opposition
column3: The Rajya Sabha has passed the National Investigation Agency (Amendment) Bill, 2019. Although the bill was passed unanimously, the Opposition raised doubts over its possible misuse. Union Home Minister Amit Shah said, "I assure the House that the bill will not be misused...Both Houses need to prove to the world and the terrorists that we are united in this fight."

column2: Great victory for India: Sushma as ICJ stays Jadhav's execution
column3: Former Union Minister Sushma Swaraj said it was a great victory for India after the International Court of Justice (ICJ) stayed retired naval officer Kulbhushan Jadhav's death sentence by Pakistan. ICJ ordered Pakistan to give India consular access to Jadhav and also review Jadhav's conviction. "I hope it will provide the much needed solace to Jadhav's family," added Swaraj.

column2: I don't have a racist bone in my body: Trump
column3: US President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that he does not have a "racist bone" in his body. The US President has been accused of racism over his recent remarks on four US Congresswomen, who are all minorities. Trump had said that the women should "go back" to the "broken and crime-infested" countries they "came from".

column2: Lagarde resigns as International Monetary Fund chief after 8 yrs
column3: International Monetary Fund (IMF) chief Christine Lagarde on Tuesday announced that she would leave the global crisis lender on September 12. Lagarde has held the top role at the IMF since 2011 and is in line to succeed European Central Bank President Mario Draghi in November. A former French finance minister, Lagarde was the first woman to head the IMF.

column2: Tata India's most valued brand at $19.6 bn, LIC next at $7.3 bn
column3: The brand 'Tata' has again been ranked as India's most valuable brand in 2019, according to a report by London-based consultancy Brand Finance. Tata's brand value rose 37% from last year to $19.6 billion, surpassing the combined value of the second and third most valued brands in India, LIC ($7.3 billion) and Infosys ($6.5 billion), respectively.

column2: Twitter CEO visits Apple HQ, talks to marketing team: Report
column3: Micro-blogging platform Twitter's Co-founder and CEO Jack Dorsey addressed Apple employees from the marketing department at the iPhone maker's headquarters, Bloomberg reported. Dorsey is one of several speakers talking to select Apple employees as part of an ongoing series, the report claimed. The address itself didn't point to a new partnership between Dorsey's companies and Apple, it added.

column2: New Delhi co-working space startup Awfis raising ₹90 crore
column3: New Delhi-based co-working space startup Awfis is raising about ₹90 crore in a mix funding round of equity and convertible debt from Bisque Limited and Link Investment Trust, regulatory filings revealed. The startup had raised $20 million in Series C funding in July 2018. Founded in 2015, Sequoia Capital-backed Awfis has raised over $43 million to date, as per Crunchbase.

column2: 90% of Kaziranga National Park submerged in floodwater
column3: The Assam Ministry of Forest and Environment said in a statement that 90% of the Kaziranga National Park in Assam's Golaghat and Nagaon districts is submerged in floodwater. Also, 155 out of the 199 anti-poaching camps in the park are affected by the floods. The officials assured that the authorities are working round-the-clock to check poaching at the National Park.

column2: 2 arrested for raping 14-yr-old girl in J&K's Kathua: Police
column3: Police on Wednesday arrested two persons for allegedly raping a 14-year-old girl at her house in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district. The police said that the victim's father lodged a complaint alleging that the accused raped his daughter last week when she was alone at home. The police are waiting for the medical examination reports of the girl.

column2: VIP darshans at Tirupati temple to end soon: TTD Chairman
column3: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) board Chairman has announced that the three categories (L1, L2 and L3) VIP darshans at the Tirupati temple would be abolished soon. The Chairman's comment came after a PIL was filed against the categorisation of devotees terming the TTD move illegal. He said TTD will introduce pilgrim-friendly seva tickets to provide "hassle-free darshan to pilgrims".

column2: 81 students in Karnataka fall ill after eating mid-day meal
column3: After consuming the mid-day meal, 81 students of a government school near Karnataka's Belagavi were rushed to hospital with complaints of health problems on Tuesday. As per reports, students were alerted after a teacher found a dead lizard in the rice container. After treatment, 69 students were discharged while 12 were kept under observation for a day in the hospital.

column2: 189 new rail lines under construction, says Piyush Goyal
column3: Railways Minister Piyush Goyal said that 189 new railway lines costing ₹3.74 lakh crore are in different stages of planning or sanction or execution across the country. Goyal added that the expenditure on the new rail line projects has been ₹76,917 crore up to March 2019. Goyal further said railway projects are sanctioned zone-wise.

column2: Vedanta to invest $650 million in new oil blocks
column3: Vedanta has said it'll invest $650 million in the oil and gas blocks it won in last two rounds of government auctions. It had won 53 oil and gas blocks in Discovered Small Fields (DSF) and Open Acreage Licensing Policy (OALP) rounds. Over next three years, Vedanta further plans to infuse $2.9 billion into oil and gas exploration, and production.

column2: I lost 26 kg as I had no appetite for first 4 months: Rishi on cancer
column3: Speaking about battling cancer, Rishi Kapoor revealed, "I had lost 26 kg as I had no appetite for the first four months. Now, I've gained 7-8 kg." Rishi, who has been undergoing treatment in New York, added, "It's been nine months and 16 days...I really miss home." The actor further said he is hoping to return to India by August-end.

column2: Williamson's silence 48 hours since WC final is remarkable: Shastri
column3: India head coach Ravi Shastri took to Twitter to laud New Zealand captain Kane Williamson's "composure" and "dignity" after boundary count rule decided the winner of 2019 World Cup. "Your dignified grace and silence 48 hours since is simply remarkable. We know you've one hand on that WC," Shastri wrote. "You not just Kane. You Kane and Able," he added.

column2: Terrible judicial precedent: Cong on SC order on rebel K'taka MLAs
column3: After the Supreme Court ordered that the rebel Karnataka MLAs cannot be forced to take part in the trust vote in the Assembly tomorrow, Congress Spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said it set a "terrible judicial precedent". "Blanket protection to MLAs, who are driven not by ideology but by far baser concerns, is unheard of," added Surjewala.

column2: Magnificent desolation: 2nd man to step on Moon recalls experience
column3: The second man to walk on the Moon, Buzz Aldrin, talking about his experience on the 50th anniversary of Apollo 11 Moon mission's rocket launch, recalled his description of the lunar surface as "magnificent desolation". The now 89-year-old astronaut said it was his "greatest good fortune" to have joined Neil Armstrong and pilot Michael Collins on the Saturn V rocket.

column2: UP court dismisses 20-year-old murder case against CM Yogi
column3: A special MP-MLA court in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj dismissed a 20-year-old murder case against Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday. The case pertains to the murder of police constable Satya Prakash Yadav in Maharajganj district. The Crime Branch, Crime Investigation Department (CB-CID) had probed the case and given a clean-chit to CM Yogi.

column2: Woman rescued from Mumbai building debris as rescuers spot gold ring
column3: A 23-year-old woman named Zinat Rehman Salmani was rescued from the debris of the 100-year-old Mumbai building that collapsed on Tuesday after the fire brigade and NDRF rescue workers spotted her gold ring. She was trapped under iron beams, a wooden door, and an LPG cylinder for over two hours. Zinat was rescued from the debris after a one-and-a-half-hour operation.

column2: Fire breaks out at SBI building in Delhi, no injuries reported
column3: A fire broke out on the sixth floor of the SBI building in Delhi's Sansad Marg on Wednesday, Chief Fire Officer Atul Garg said. Seven fire tenders were rushed to the spot and the blaze was brought under control within 20 minutes. No injury has been reported, while an effort to ascertain the cause of the fire is ongoing.

column2: Terrorist killed in encounter in J&K, arms recovered
column3: A terrorist was killed in an encounter with security forces in Sopore in Baramulla district, Jammu and Kashmir on Wednesday. The security forces had launched a search and cordon operation following inputs regarding the presence of terrorists in the Gund Brath area. Arms and ammunition have been seized from the encounter site, the police said.

column2: ₹4 lakh ex-gratia for kin of 14 killed due to rain in UP
column3: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has announced ex-gratia compensation of ₹4 lakh each for the families of the 14 people who have died due to rain-related incidents in different districts of the state. Meanwhile, according to official data from the state government, 133 buildings collapsed due to rain-related incidents from July 9 to 12.

column2: If not in schools, kids should be given eggs at home: Chhattisgarh
column3: The Congress-led Chhattisgarh government has said that if some parents are against serving eggs in mid-day meals in schools, authorities should make arrangements to serve them to non-vegetarian children at their homes. It added that separate seating arrangements should be made for students who don't consume eggs, and they should also be served alternatives like soya milk and fortified biscuits.

column2: 9 killed, 20 injured in UP gunfight between 2 groups over property
column3: At least nine people have been killed and around 20 people have been injured after a gunfight between two groups allegedly over a property dispute in Uttar Pradesh's Sonbhadra district on Wednesday. The gunfight reportedly took place for one hour and involved nearly 100 people. Meanwhile, District Magistrate Ankit Kumar Agrawal said they are investigating the case.

column2: Pakistan Minister criticises Trump on Twitter, deletes tweet later
column3: Pakistan's Human Rights Minister Shireen Mazari wrote on Twitter purportedly criticising US President Donald Trump but deleted the tweet later. "When racism and bigotry become acceptable political norms in democracies," Mazari had tweeted. "Anti-American" Mazari deleted the tweet in view of the forthcoming meeting of PM Imran Khan and Trump, former Pakistani diplomat Husain Haqqani said.

column2: Sudan's ruling military and opposition sign power-sharing deal
column3: Sudan's ruling military and opposition leaders have signed a power-sharing deal. The deal establishes a new transitional ruling body which will comprise of civilians and military leaders. A general will head the body for the first 21 months, then a civilian-run administration would take over for the remaining 18 months, followed by elections, as per the agreement.

column2: United to resume Delhi, Mumbai flights as Pakistan reopens airspace
column3: United Airlines said it'd restart daily non-stop service between New York/Newark, New Delhi and Mumbai from September 6, after Pakistan lifted airspace restrictions. The restrictions, imposed in February, added flight time for passengers and fuel costs for airlines as they were forced to take long detours. India said Pakistan's reopening of airspace brought in "significant relief for airlines".

column2: Will identify, deport infiltrators from every inch of India: Shah
column3: Home Minister Amit Shah said that the government will identify illegal immigrants and infiltrators living in every inch of this country and deport them as per the international law. Shah's comment came during a debate over the NRC in the Rajya Sabha. Shah said the people elected the BJP as it promised action against illegal immigrants in its poll manifesto.

column2: Committed to ensuring justice for all: Mamata on Int'l Justice Day
column3: On the occasion of International Justice Day on Wednesday, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee tweeted, "#InternationalJusticeDay #Bangla Govt is committed to framing good laws for people and ensuring good justice for all." She added, "19 human rights courts have been set up in #Bangla in the last 8 years."

column2: Former SP leader Atiq Ahmed's residence raided by CBI
column3: The CBI raided the residences of jailed former SP leader Atiq Ahmed in Prayagraj on Wednesday. The raids occurred about a month after Ahmed and 17 others were booked for allegedly kidnapping and assaulting a real estate dealer in December last year. The dealer was allegedly forced to transfer his business to the accused.

column2: Sachin Bansal's BAC Acquisitions to invest ₹20 crore in boAt
column3: Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal’s co-founded fund BAC Acquisitions (BACQ) has committed a venture debt of ₹20 crore to Mumbai-based consumer electronics brand ‘boAt’. Founded by Aman Gupta and Sameer Mehta in 2016, ‘boAt’ is a consumer tech brand which manufactures electronics products including earphones and headphones, among others. The brand raised ₹6 crore from Fireside Ventures in May 2018.

column2: Vadra granted 2 weeks to reply to plea against anticipatory bail
column3: The Delhi High Court on Wednesday granted two weeks' time to Robert Vadra to file his reply to the Enforcement Directorate's plea against his anticipatory bail. The court has listed the matter for further hearing on September 26. Earlier today, Vadra's counsel sought more time for responding stating that Vadra was outside India when the notice was served to him.

column2: Over 5,000 flood-affected people lodged in Mizoram relief camps
column3: More than 5,000 people have been shifted to relief camps due to the flood situation following heavy rains for the last seven days in Mizoram, officials said. At least five people have died due to rain-related incidents and 4,322 people were being evacuated. The officials added that the state government was gearing up relief operations in the affected areas.

column2: ₹5L for families of deceased in Mumbai building collapse
column3: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis on Wednesday announced a compensation of ₹5 lakh each to the families of the deceased in the building collapse in Mumbai's Dongri on Tuesday. A compensation of ₹50,000 was announced for the injured and all their medical expenses will be borne by the state government. As many as 14 people are reported dead in the incident.

column2: 2 injured, 1 feared trapped in Arunachal Pradesh landslide
column3: Two people were injured and one is feared to be trapped in a landslide that occurred due to intermittent rains in Arunachal Pradesh's Itanagar on Wednesday. With the help of five excavators, the NDRF, ITBP and CRPF are carrying out rescue operations in the area, officials said. The local administration said that many vehicles have been damaged in the landslide.

column2: Police arrest 3 after shootout on Delhi's Dwarka Expressway
column3: The Crime Branch of Gurugram Police has arrested three gangsters after a shootout on Delhi's Dwarka Expressway, an official said on Wednesday. The criminals were wounded during the shootout and were later admitted to a hospital, the official said. The accused have committed crimes including murder, dacoity and kidnapping for ransom in Haryana, Rajasthan and Delhi, he added.

column2: European Commission elects its first female President
column3: Germany's Ursula von der Leyen was elected as the first female President of the European Commission by the European Parliament on Tuesday. Von der Leyen has resigned from the post of Germany's Defence Minister to take over the new role at the European Union's executive body. She will succeed Jean-Claude Juncker who is set to step down on October 31.

column2: Stokes asked umpires to not award 4 overthrows in final, they ignored
column3: England pacer James Anderson has revealed what all-rounder Ben Stokes requested umpires after the ball deflected off his bat and England got four overthrows in World Cup final's last over. "Stokes...said, 'Can you take that four runs off. We don't want it'," Anderson said. The umpires ignored the request because it was a four as per rules, Anderson added.

column2: Can't force MLAs for trust vote, Speaker to decide on resignations: SC
column3: The Supreme Court has said Karnataka Assembly Speaker is free to decide on the status of the rebel MLAs' resignations, adding that he cannot be forced to take a decision within a time frame. However, the court stated the rebel MLAs cannot be compelled to participate in proceedings of Assembly, including the July 18 trust vote, till the Speaker decides.

column2: 26/11 Mumbai attack mastermind Hafiz Saeed arrested in Pak: Reports
column3: Jamaat-ud-Dawa chief and 26/11 Mumbai attacks mastermind Hafiz Saeed was arrested in Pakistan's Lahore on Wednesday and sent to judicial custody, as per reports. Pakistan registered cases of terror financing against Saeed, his brother-in-law and other aides. The move follows Financial Action Task Force's warning to Pakistan to improve efforts against terrorism financing or face action.

column2: You could've squeezed in: Brad to Leonardo on 'Titanic' door scene
column3: Brad Pitt trolled his co-star Leonardo DiCaprio during an interview while promoting their upcoming film 'Once Upon A Time In Hollywood'. When the host asked if Jack, Leonardo's character, could have fit on the floating door in the scene towards the end of 'Titanic', Brad said, "You could've [squeezed in there], couldn't you?" Responding to this, Leonardo said, "No comment".

column2: Google gaining unchecked power: 2nd protest walkout organiser quits
column3: Meredith Whittaker, one of seven Google employees who organised mass walkouts in November 2018 against the handling of sexual misconduct complaints, has quit after 13 years. "Google, in the conventional pursuit of quarterly earnings, is gaining significant and largely unchecked power," Whittaker wrote. This comes weeks after another walkout organiser Claire Stapleton quit Google in June.

column2: Bill Gates no longer world's 2nd richest person, overtaken by Arnault
column3: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates is no longer the world's second-richest person as his wealth was surpassed by French luxury goods tycoon Bernard Arnault's wealth, Bloomberg said today. Gates is now the world's third-richest person with $107 billion as compared to second-richest person Arnault's $108 billion wealth. Arnault derives most of his wealth from his holdings in Louis Vuitton owner LVMH.

column2: Musk's Neuralink unveils 'threads' that link brains to computers
column3: Elon Musk has unveiled his new startup Neuralink's flexible "threads" designed to be inserted in brains to link them directly to computers. Musk said Neuralink, in the long term, is about finding a way to "achieve a sort of symbiosis with artificial intelligence." "We hope to have this in a human patient by the end of next year," Musk added.

column2: Priyanka Gandhi shares 22-yr-old photo as #SareeTwitter trends online
column3: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra shared a picture of herself in a saree under #SareeTwitter, which is trending online. "Morning puja on the day of my wedding (22 years ago!)," she wrote. The #SareeTwitter trend began earlier this week, with several people, including celebrities and politicians, sharing their pictures on the microblogging website.

column2: BJP councillor beats health inspector, Udupi CMC staff go on strike
column3: BJP municipal councillor Yogish Salian allegedly thrashed junior health inspector Prasanna Kumar at Udupi City Municipal Council office in Karnataka on Tuesday. The two had reportedly argued over a delay in getting a drain cleaned. Kumar, who was injured near his eye, was admitted to a hospital even as CMC staff observed a pen down strike, barring emergency services.

column2: Fake Ferraris, Lamborghinis being sold for ₹41 lakh seized in Brazil
column3: Brazilian police have shut down a factory that was producing fake Ferraris and Lamborghinis and have arrested a father-son duo who ran it. Police said the cars were being offered on social media for $45,000-$60,000 (approximately ₹31 lakh-₹41 lakh). Eight partially finished vehicles were seized in the raid, and police said they are investigating how many were made.

column2: US, Pune-based tech startup Icertis now unicorn with $115 mn funding
column3: Washington and Pune-based technology startup Icertis has become a unicorn (achieved billion-dollar valuation) after raising $115 million in an advanced-stage funding round co-led by Greycroft Partners LLC and Wipro's Azim Premji's PremjiInvest. Existing investors including B Capital Group and Cross Creek Advisors participated. Founded in 2009, Icertis helps businesses manage contracts in the cloud.

column2: Sibal, his wife fired journos without pay, sent bouncers: Barkha Dutt
column3: Journalist Barkha Dutt has accused Congress leader Kapil Sibal and his wife Promila Sibal of not giving salaries to 200 journalists working at Tiranga TV and asking them to leave without the promised compensation. She also accused them of sending bouncers to intimidate employees protesting inside the office. However, the Sibals denied the allegations, saying the due salaries were cleared.

column2: 2 men assault traffic policemen on being stopped for drunk driving
column3: Two men have been arrested for allegedly assaulting traffic policemen and smashing their motorcycle after one of them was prosecuted for drunk driving in north Delhi's Netaji Subhash Place on Sunday evening, police said. A video of the incident showed them hurling abuses at the two traffic policemen, scuffling with them and repeatedly kicking their motorcycle to the ground.

column2: Lok Sabha sits till midnight for second time in less than a week
column3: The Lok Sabha sat till midnight on Tuesday to conclude discussion on demands for grants for the agriculture and rural development ministries. This was for the second time in less than a week that the Lower House continued its discussions till midnight, with first being on July 11. The ongoing Budget Session of the Parliament will conclude on July 26.

column2: Jadhav's friends wear 'India with Kulbhushan' t-shirts on verdict day
column3: Ahead of International Court of Justice's verdict on Kulbhushan Jadhav case on Wednesday, Jadhav's friends wore t-shirts with his photo and 'India with Kulbhushan' slogan and offered prayers. The 49-year-old was arrested by Pakistan in March 2016 and was given death penalty on the charges of espionage. Pakistan's ruling was challenged by India in the ICJ.

column2: Ex-MLA claims threat to life during train journey, hides in toilet
column3: Former Madhya Pradesh MLA from Samajwadi Party Sunilam has claimed that he was forced to hide inside a train toilet after an unidentified youth allegedly threatened to kill him. The incident happened when Sunilam was travelling from Nizamuddin to Multai in Gondwana Express on the intervening night of Monday-Tuesday. He also tweeted about it to Railway Minister Piyush Goyal.

column2: Tourists escape as elephant rams into jeep in S Africa; video viral
column3: A video taken during a jungle safari in South Africa shows an elephant running and ramming into a tourists' jeep multiple times. The jeep's driver can be seen driving the jeep in reverse to help the tourists escape even as the elephant continued to charge towards them. Many tourists in the jeep were reportedly from Australia.

column2: RSS economic wing says India should not issue foreign currency bonds
column3: RSS' economic wing Swadeshi Jagran Manch's co-convener Ashwani Mahajan has demanded that government review its plan to raise money by selling foreign currency bonds. He said the experience of countries that have taken loans from international markets to meet the budget deficit "has been far from good". "We are confident that government will withdraw its decision," Mahajan added.

column2: Kailash Gahlot appointed Delhi's environment minister
column3: Following a Cabinet reshuffle in CM Arvind Kejriwal's government, Delhi Law Minister Kailash Gahlot on Tuesday was given an additional charge of the Environment, Forest and Wildlife Department, an official said. Imran Hussain, who previously held the department, will now have Food and Supply and Election portfolios. Gahlot also has Revenue, Transport, IT and Administrative Reforms portfolios.

column2: All animals have a life span: BJP MLA after cows die in UP shelter
column3: After the death of several cows at a shelter in Barabanki district, UP BJP MLA Ajay Singh on Tuesday said, "There is so much outcry but most of the cattle have died a natural death." He added, "Every animal has a life span." He further said he'd told CM Yogi Adityanath that an ambulance service should be started for animals.

column2: Have to guard our MLAs as BJP wants to disturb Cong: Kharge
column3: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Karnataka, Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said that the party has to guard its MLAs as the BJP wants to create disturbance in the party. He also accused the Centre of "inducing" the rebel Congress MLAs. Kharge further said that the Congress-JD(S) coalition will win the vote of confidence in Karnataka Assembly on Thursday.

column2: Citizenship given to 1,310 migrants in Rajasthan: MoS Home
column3: MoS for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai said that 1,310 migrants have been given citizenship in Rajasthan. Rai added that Rajasthan government gave citizenship to 82 migrants, while District Collectors of Jodhpur, Jaisalmer, and Jaipur gave citizenship to 1,113, 7 and 108 respectively. The Citizenship Amendment Act seeks to provide citizenship to non-Muslims who came to India before December 31, 2014.

column2: Over 2L pilgrims perform Amarnath Yatra, break last 4-yr record
