column3: Over two lakh pilgrims have performed the Amarnath Yatra in the past 16 days, which is the highest number to visit the cave shrine during the first fortnight in the last four years, an official said. On Wednesday, 1,972 pilgrims left for Baltal while 2,612 for Pahalgam base camps. According to the officials, 16 pilgrims have died during the Yatra.

column2: Springboard mentors help learners transition into Data Science
column3: Springboard, a US-based online learning platform has launched Data Science and AI/ML career track for Indian working professionals. Data Scientists from companies like Flipkart, Swiggy, InMobi, PayTm, Ola and more will mentor aspiring Data Scientists every week for 6 months to help execute projects, understand concepts and learn about its real-life application in industries, thereby enabling successful career transitions.

column2: I am just playing a character: Priya on Sridevi Bungalow controversy
column3: Speaking about the controversy around her film 'Sridevi Bungalow', Priya Prakash Varrier said, "It is actually the director's and the producer's concern because I am just portraying a character they gave me." "There was no intention to hurt anybody," she added. Earlier, Boney Kapoor sued the film's makers after its teaser showed the death of an actress in a bathtub.

column2: GoT season 8 creates record with 32 nominations at Emmy Awards
column3: 'Game of Thrones' season 8 has secured 32 nominations at 71st Emmy Awards, creating a record for the most number of Emmy nominations received in a single year. It secured nominations for Outstanding Drama Series, as well as for editing, cinematography and directing along with acting categories. Drama series 'NYPD Blue' earlier held the record with 27 nominations in 1994.

column2: 2019 World Cup trophy could have been shared: Whatmore
column3: Former Sri Lanka coach Dav Whatmore has said that the 2019 World Cup trophy could have been shared with New Zealand as it would have been a fair reflection of the two teams' "tenacity". “It is a learning curve. These sort of things could have been handled better, may be have a re-match," he added.

column2: Saqlain Mushtaq gets extension as England spin consultant
column3: Ex-Pakistan spinner Saqlain Mushtaq, who was part of England’s World Cup-winning squad’s support staff, has been rewarded with a 55-day extension which'll cover the entire Ashes series. The England team spin consultant said the team worked very hard in the few years for World Cup success. He further said that he is always available to work for the Pakistan team.

column2: Amazon launches 'JEE Ready' app, enters edtech space in India
column3: American e-commerce giant Amazon has entered the edtech sector in India with the launch of an IIT-JEE exam preparation app called 'JEE Ready'. The JEE Ready app is currently in its beta testing phase and available only on Android devices. Amazon has reportedly partnered with coaching institutes to prepare 'All India Mock Test' to be offered in the app.

column2: Vistara flight makes emergency landing with just 10 mins of fuel left
column3: A Mumbai-Delhi Vistara flight, with 153 passengers onboard, made an emergency landing in Lucknow after it had just 10 minutes of fuel left on Monday. The plane was supposed to land in Delhi around 5 pm but couldn't due to poor weather conditions. It landed in Lucknow around 6.30 pm after the pilot declared 'Mayday' over critical fuel levels.

column2: UP man gives Triple Talaq in 24 hrs of marriage for not getting bike
column3: A man from Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki allegedly gave Triple Talaq to his wife within 24 hours of marriage after the woman's family failed to give him a motorcycle in dowry. The woman's father said that they gave all other things that were demanded in the dowry list by the groom. Police registered a case against the groom and his family.

column2: 1 Vistara, 1 Air India, 2 SpiceJet pilots suspended over safety norms
column3: Directorate General of Civil Aviation has suspended a Vistara pilot, a pilot and a crew member of Air India and two SpiceJet pilots for violation of safety norms. SpiceJet pilots were suspended for damaging runway lights during landing. Air India pilot and cabin crew member were suspended for fighting after the pilot asked the crew member to wash his tiffin.

column2: India's biggest convertible bond defaulter misses $172 mn payment
column3: Suzlon Energy, which became India's biggest convertible bond defaulter in 2012, said it defaulted on a $172-million bond payment due on Tuesday. The wind turbine maker is struggling with a debt of over ₹11,000 crore. Bloomberg had reported that Canada's Brookfield planned an offer for a majority stake in Suzlon and was talking to the firm's creditors to restructure loans.

column2: Ex-South Africa footballer Marc Batchelor shot dead at 49
column3: Former South Africa footballer Marc Batchelor was shot dead near his home in Johannesburg. "He was attacked by two men who were driving a motorbike," a police spokesman Col Lungelo Dlamini said. The 49-year-old, who played for South African teams Kaizer Chiefs, Orlando Pirates and Mamelodi Sundowns, was shot in his car.

column2: Fabian Delph joins Everton from Manchester City for ₹72 crore
column3: Premier League club Everton on Monday signed midfielder Fabian Delph from Manchester City for over ₹72 crore (£8.5 mn) on a three-year deal. The 29-year-old England international who joined Manchester City in 2015 scored 5 goals from 89 matches for the club. Delph has played 20 international matches and was also part of team's 2018 World Cup squad.

column2: TMC objects to repeated queries on WB violence in Parliament
column3: The TMC on Tuesday objected to the repeated queries raised in both Houses of Parliament on the political violence in West Bengal, claiming that this is in violation of the rules. "Why is the Bengal government being targeted in such a manner?" the party wrote in separate letters to Rajya Sabha Chairman Venkaiah Naidu and Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla.

column2: Yeddyurappa plays cricket with BJP MLAs in Bengaluru
column3: BJP state president BS Yeddyurappa was seen playing a game of cricket with BJP MLAs at the Ramada resort in Bengaluru on Tuesday. Amid the political crisis in Karnataka, BJP MLAs have been staying at the Ramada resort while Congress and JD(S) have shifted their MLAs to the Taj Yeshwantpur and Prestige Golfshire Club.

column2: Snapdeal a proud exception in Indian e-commerce: CEO Bahl
column3: Snapdeal Co-founder and CEO Kunal Bahl claimed the e-commerce platform's consolidated revenue rose by 73% to ₹925 crore while loss fell 70% year-on-year to ₹186 crore. Over the last two years, Snapdeal's loss was reduced by 96%, he said. "This makes us the proud exception in Indian e-commerce, where greater growth usually means greater losses," Bahl added.

column2: Will enact law against mob lynching, honour killing: Rajasthan CM
column3: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday said that his government has decided to enact a law to curb incidents of mob lynching and honour killing. Gehlot made the announcement while replying to debate on the state budget in the Vidhan Sabha. Recently, the Uttar Pradesh Law Commission framed draft legislation to deal with mob lynching cases in the state.

column2: Red alert in Kerala after 'extremely heavy rain' forecast
column3: The IMD has raised red and orange alerts in various parts of Kerala for four days from July 17. The red warning is issued in Idukki and Malappuram districts for July 18, 19 and 20 and Wayanad and Kannur for July 19. Extremely heavy rains (more than 204 mm in 24 hours) are forecasted in these districts.

column2: SP, VHP leaders shot dead in two separate incidents in UP
column3: A VHP leader and SP leader were shot dead in separate incidents in Uttar Pradesh. VHP's Pranav Mishra was killed by unidentified bike-borne assailants and SP leader Akhilesh Yadav (not to be confused with SP President) was killed when he was working out at a gym. "Criminals have no fear of police in the state," SP President Akhilesh Yadav said.

column2: UP madrasa vandalised over cattle slaughter rumours: Police
column3: A mob vandalised a madrasa and pulled down its boundary wall following rumours of cow slaughter in Uttar Pradesh's Fatehpur district on Tuesday, police said. Some things dumped outside the madrasa's gate were also reportedly set ablaze. A case against two persons who are absconding and an FIR against unknown persons for vandalising the madrasa have been registered by police.

column2: Who were the highest wicket-takers in 2019 World Cup?
column3: Australia pacer Mitchell Starc, who was the joint-highest wicket-taker in 2015 World Cup, finished 2019 World Cup as the highest wicket-taker with 27 wickets in 10 matches. Runners-up New Zealand fast bowler Lockie Ferguson followed Starc with 21 wickets. England pacer Jofra Archer, who made his international debut in May, finished joint-third with Bangladesh pacer Mustafizur Rahman (20 wickets).

column2: Easiest thing in the world is to rant about rules: Bhogle on WC final
column3: Reacting to criticism over boundary rule that decided World Cup winner, Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "The easiest thing...is to rant about the rules." "There are pluses and minuses with every system but teams and players are shown [the rules] and they agree to play within them," he added. He further stated the boundary rule has been there for a long time.

column2: Rohit Sharma 3rd Indian to score most runs in a World Cup edition
column3: India opener Rohit Sharma ended 2019 World Cup as the highest run-scorer with 648 runs in nine innings. The 32-year-old became the third Indian to end a World Cup edition as the top run-getter after Sachin Tendulkar (1996, 2003) and Rahul Dravid (1999). Rohit was followed by Australia opener David Warner, who scored 647 runs in the 2019 World Cup.

column2: British PM hosts World Cup-winning England team, shares pictures
column3: British PM Theresa May hosted England's World Cup-winning team at 10 Downing Street. Sharing pictures on Twitter, May wrote, "Here we've a team that'll be spoken of in awe for generations to come. On behalf of the whole country, congratulations to England's World Cup winners!" "You've helped the nation fall in love with cricket once again," she told the players.

column2: Sharing World Cup should be considered in case of a tie: NZ coach
column3: New Zealand coach Gary Stead has said sharing World Cup trophy in case of a tie in final should be considered. This comes after England won 2019 World Cup for scoring more boundaries after both the final and Super Over were tied. He added that ICC must've never expected such a World Cup final when they were writing the rules.

column2: Fatness doesn't necessarily lead to happiness: Adnan to Neesham
column3: Reacting to New Zealand all-rounder James Neesham asking kids to not take up sport and die at 60 really fat and happy after 2019 World Cup defeat, singer Adnan Sami said that fatness doesn't necessarily lead to happiness. "Hey chin-up mate! You guys were brilliant. You all taught the world the most important lesson of how to fight," he added.

column2: Jofra Archer's old tweets resurface, users connect it with WC final
column3: England fast bowler Jofra Archer's old tweets went viral, with fans connecting them to the 2019 World Cup final. Users related his 2013 tweet reading, "16 from 6" with the target set for New Zealand by England in the Super Over. Users also shared his 2015 tweet reading "What stupid rule is this," after the final ended on boundary count.

column2: Grass tasted like never before: Djokovic shares post on Wimbledon win
column3: After defeating world number three Roger Federer to win the Wimbledon for the fifth time, world number one Novak Djokovic shared a post on Instagram, writing, "It was a match to remember forever. Match that had everything in it. Match that transcends our sport." Djokovic, who ate grass following his win, added, "Grass tasted like never before."

column2: Record 5,000 rocket launch attempt marks 50 yrs of Apollo 11 launch
column3: US Space & Rocket Center has attempted a Guinness World Record of launching 5,000 model rockets simultaneously to mark the 50th anniversary of Apollo 11 mission's launch. Apollo 11, which landed Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin on the Moon, was launched at 7:02 pm IST on July 16, 1969. The previous such record included the launch of 4,231 rockets.

column2: Breathtaking: Biologist on finding rare human-sized jellyfish
column3: Wildlife host and biologist Lizzie Daly, sharing her encounter with a rare human-sized barrel jellyfish, described it as a "breathtaking" and "serene, grounding experience". "I know barrel jellyfish get really big in size but I have never seen anything like it before," Daly said. The giant 1.5-metre-long barrel jellyfish was spotted off the south-western coast of England last week.

column2: Madras Christian College prof sacked for sexually harassing students
column3: Madras Christian College in Chennai has sacked Zoology professor R Raveen after an internal inquiry found him guilty of sexually harassing female students. Several students had complained that Raveen made lewd remarks about their clothes, harassed them and behaved inappropriately during a department trip earlier this year. Another faculty Samuel Tennyson was accused of abetting Raveen's behaviour.

column2: Bihar govt to give ₹1.5 lakh to transgenders for sex change operation
column3: The Bihar government has announced that it would provide ₹1.5 lakh to transgenders who want to undergo sex change operation. It also announced jail from six months to two years to those who refused to give them houses on rent or violate their rights. The state government also formed a transgender welfare board.

column2: 959 students write same answers, make same errors in Guj 12th exam
column3: Gujarat Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board (GSHSEB) detected a mass copying incident where 959 students wrote the same answers and made the same mistakes in Class 12 exams. The students admitted the teachers at exam centres dictated answers to them. Their results have been withheld till 2020 and they've been failed in the subjects in which they allegedly cheated.

column2: Odisha girl breaks silence weeks after gangrape by classmates, 4 held
column3: A girl studying at a degree college in Odisha's Sundargarh was allegedly gangraped by five classmates last month, but she didn't report it. After the alleged incident, she stopped going to college which caused her family to think something was wrong. After being persuaded by her family, she lodged a police complaint on Monday, following which four accused were arrested.

column2: Democracy restored in Thailand as PM declares end of military rule
column3: Thai Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha has declared the end of military rule in the country after he resigned as the head of the military junta. Prayut had led the coup in 2014 and served as junta leader and Prime Minister. He will continue to serve as the Prime Minister with the support of the Parliament.

column2: US Air Force warns as 13L volunteer to storm Area 51 'to see aliens'
column3: The US Air Force has warned that it's "ready to protect America and its assets" after 13 lakh people signed up for a Facebook event to "storm" Area 51 to "see aliens". "[Area 51] is an open training range...we'd discourage anyone from trying to come into the area where we train armed forces," a US Air Force spokesperson said.

column2: Saravana Bhavan owner allowed to shift to private hospital
column3: Madras High Court has allowed Saravana Bhavan owner P Rajagopal, who is serving a life term for murder, to seek treatment at a private hospital. He was admitted to the prisoners’ ward of Government Stanley Medical College Hospital after surrendering on July 9. His son Saravanan said that his father's condition worsened as the doctors changed the medication and treatment.

column2: Embarrassed: Mahindra as woman points out plastic bottles in meeting
column3: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Tuesday responded to a woman who pointed out the plastic bottles at a boardroom meeting in a picture shared by him. "I think the boardroom should have Steel Bottle instead of Plastic bottle," the woman tweeted. "Plastic bottles will be banished. We were all embarrassed to see them that day," Mahindra responded.

column2: NZ should be forever proud of their 2019 WC performance: Vettori
column3: Praising New Zealand's performance in the 2019 World Cup final, former Kiwi captain Daniel Vettori said, "They should be forever proud of how they performed." The 40-year-old added there were far more positives than negatives to take away from the final which New Zealand lost on boundary count. "It's the time to celebrate what went right," Vettori further stated.

column2: 30% driving licences in India are fake: Nitin Gadkari
column3: While presenting the Motor Vehicles (Amendment) Bill in the Lok Sabha on Monday, Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari said 30% of drivers in India carry fake licenses. He added that India is the easiest country to obtain a driving license around the world. As a part of the amendments to the bill, traffic violation penalties would increase significantly.

column2: Toddler's half-burnt body found 2 days after he went missing
column3: The half-burnt body of a three-year-old boy was found near his home in Bhopal's Bairagarh Chichli village on Tuesday. DIG Irshad Wali said father of the child identified the body which was found covered in a piece of cloth in an abandoned house. The toddler was allegedly kidnapped on Sunday evening after he had gone out to buy chocolates.

column2: Assam floods death toll rises to 17, Centre releases ₹251 cr
column3: The Centre on Tuesday released ₹251.55 crore grants-in-aid to State Disaster Response Fund after the death toll in Assam floods rose to 17. As many as 30 of the state's 33 districts are submerged in floodwater and over 52 lakh people have been affected. The state has set up 695 relief camps where nearly 1.5 lakh people have sought shelter.

column2: Nayara Energy to invest $850 mn to build petrochemical plant
column3: Nayara Energy, backed by Russian oil major Rosneft, on Tuesday announced an investment of $850 million for its expansion into petrochemicals. The company said it is planning to set up a 4,50,000-tonne-a-year Polypropylene plant. Nayara added it has licensed technology from American chemicals firm WR Grace to produce a range of phthalate-free products at its refinery complex in Gujarat's Vadinar.

column2: Shahid smoking in 'Kabir Singh' doesn't make him a smoker: Rakul Preet
column3: Reacting to criticism over her smoking scene in the teaser of Telugu film 'Manmadhudu 2', actress Rakul Preet said, "[In] 'Kabir Singh', if Shahid [Kapoor] is smoking in the film it does not make him a smoker." "People should dissociate from what we are playing on-screen. [It] is different and it is a story of that one person," she added.

column2: #SareeTwitter trends online as women share their pictures in sarees
column3: #SareeTwitter has been trending on Twitter as women shared pictures of themselves in sarees with the hashtag. Several famous personalities, including actress and politician Nagma, BJP leader Nupur Sharma and actress Suzanne Bernert shared their pictures. Meanwhile, Assamese politician Gaurav Gogoi shared his wife's pictures and wrote, "Can husbands get on the #SareeTwitter train?"

column2: What is the eligibility criteria for Team India head coach?
column3: According to the eligibility criteria for Team India head coach, a candidate should've coached a full-member Test-playing nation for at least two years or a domestic side for at least three years. Further, the candidate should be below 60 years of age. He should've played at least 30 Tests or 50 ODIs, or should have BCCI Level 3 Certification.

column2: Former Samajwadi Party Rajya Sabha member Neeraj Shekhar joins BJP
column3: Former Samajwadi Party leader Neeraj Shekhar, who resigned from the Rajya Sabha on Monday, joined the BJP in the presence of working president JP Nadda at party headquarters in Delhi on Tuesday. The 50-year-old Uttar Pradesh politician, who is the son of former Prime Minister Chandra Shekhar, resigned from Rajya Sabha a year before his term was to end.

column2: OYO confirms acquiring co-working space provider Innov8
column3: India's most valuable private hotel chain, Gurugram-based OYO confirmed it has acquired co-working space provider Innov8, reportedly for over ₹200 crore. OYO Workspaces is already operational across 10 Indian cities with over 20 centres, comprising Innov8, Workflo and Powerstation as its three in-house brands, OYO said. It added it plans to have 50 OYO Workspaces centres by end of 2019.

column2: UK gives Tata Motors' Jaguar $620 million loan guarantee
column3: The UK government has given Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) a $620-million loan guarantee to support the design, manufacture and export of electric cars. Prime Minister Theresa May made the announcement after a round-table meeting with auto-industry representatives. Earlier this month, the Tata Motors subsidiary announced a new range of electrified cars to be made at a plant in central England.

column2: We'll never be a socialist or communist country: US Prez Trump
column3: US President Donald Trump said in a series of tweets on Tuesday that the US will never become a socialist or a communist nation. "If you are not happy here, you can leave! It is your choice, and your choice alone," he tweeted. He further said that those who hate the US are "anti-Israel" and "pro-al-Qaeda".

column2: Sorry f**k*rs: Boyfriend shares pics after killing Instagrammer
column3: Bianca Devins, a 17-year-old Instagrammer, was allegedly murdered by her boyfriend who shared pictures of the killing on social media. "Sorry f**k*rs, you're gonna have to find someone else to orbit," Brandon Clark wrote alongside a picture shared on gaming website Discord. Clark called 911 to confess about the murder and authorities found him stabbing himself as they approached him.

column2: I put them into trouble: Ex-South Africa Prez on Gupta brothers
column3: Former South African President Jacob Zuma has said that he'd suggested businessmen brothers, Ajay and Atul Gupta, to start a newspaper and television channel, both of which have collapsed. "It's me who put them into trouble...I said your paper is so successful and so your TV thing can be successful," he told a commission probing allegations of corruption against him.

column2: India's exports fall for the first time in nine months
column3: India's merchandise exports contracted for the first time in nine months in June while imports shrank first time in four months. Exports fell 9.71% from a year ago to $25 billion, compared with a 3.9% gain in May while imports declined 9.1% to $40.3 billion. Oil imports in June dropped 13.3% to $11 billion, partly due to low oil prices.

column2: Won't sell my stake in IndiGo: Billionaire Gangwal amid dispute
column3: IndiGo's billionaire Co-Founder Rakesh Gangwal said he won't sell his shareholding in India's largest airline amid a dispute with his partner Rahul Bhatia. "I am focusing on governance issues that have gone awry in this company and I am not seeking any additional control," Gangwal said. Gangwal and his affiliates own 37% of IndiGo while Bhatia's InterGlobe Enterprises controls 38%.

column2: England pacer Dernbach retires on day of England's World Cup win
column3: England's 33-year-old pacer Jade Dernbach, who last played an international match in 2014, announced his retirement from international cricket on the day England won 2019 World Cup. The Surrey cricketer said, "I think this is a good time...The team are in a good place moving forward." Dernbach, who made his international debut in 2011, represented England 58 times.

column2: AI algorithm can solve Rubik's cube in about 1 second
column3: California University researchers have created an AI algorithm that can solve a Rubik's cube in a "fraction of a second", the human record for which stands at 3.47 seconds. DeepCubeA algorithm solved 100% of all test configurations, finding shortest path about 60% of the time. DeepCubeA, however, is three times slower than MIT's non-AI 'min2phase' algorithm, the current fastest.

column2: Delhi govt built 23 flyovers in last 4.5 years: CM Kejriwal
column3: After inaugurating the Rao Tula Ram (RTR) flyover, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday claimed that his government has built 23 flyovers in the last 4.5 years. Kejriwal added, "We believe in doing our work and not indulging in dirty politics." He said that a few more such projects will be coming up before the end of his government's tenure.

column2: Nearly 400 terrorists infiltrated into J&K in last 3 yrs: Govt
column3: G Kishan Reddy, MoS for Home Affairs, on Tuesday informed the Lok Sabha that nearly 400 terrorists infiltrated into J&K in last three years and 126 of them have been killed by the security forces. Reddy added that 27 security personnel lost their lives during the engagements with the infiltrators. Four terrorists have been arrested so far, he further said.

column2: Man held for selling cannabis near schools in Kolkata
column3: The police have arrested a man for selling cannabis near schools and colleges in Kolkata's Park Street area and also seized 1.5 kg of cannabis from his possession. The police said that they recovered packets of cannabis from the man's motorcycle. The police have registered a case under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act.

column2: Very well prepared for Kargil-like war again: IAF Chief
column3: Indian Air Force Chief Marshal BS Dhanoa on Tuesday said, "If Kargil comes again, we are very well prepared." Dhanoa was addressing an event marking the 20th anniversary of IAF's Operation Safed Sagar during the Kargil war. Dhanoa further said that the Balakot strikes showed that the IAF is capable of carrying out precision strikes accurately and from standoff distances.

column2: Need NITI Aayog to turn Uttar Pradesh into Uttam Pradesh: CM
column3: Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Monday asked NITI Aayog to prepare a plan to help turn Uttar Pradesh into 'Uttam Pradesh' similar to the Centre's 'Transformation of Aspirational Districts' programme. The plan was launched to improve the socio-economic status of 117 districts across 28 states. The states are judged on 49 parameters like human development index, water resources and infrastructure.

column2: Coca-Cola India & SW Asia names Sarvita Sethi as VP for M&A
column3: Coca-Cola India & South West Asia on Tuesday announced it has appointed Sarvita Sethi as its Vice President of Mergers and Acquisitions, and New Ventures. Sethi earlier held the role of Vice President of Finance for Coca-Cola India & South West Asia. Meanwhile, Hindustan Coca-Cola Beverages CFO Harsh Bhutani will take over Sethi's role from August 1.

column2: Mindtree, L&T's IT firms to be run at an arm's length: L&T
column3: L&T CEO SN Subrahmanyan said Mindtree, which L&T acquired, and its own IT and engineering services firms will be run at an arm's length basis. L&T acquired a 60.06% stake in Mindtree in a hostile takeover. "There are other major conglomerates...like Tata, Mahindra, Hinduja and HCL which have also been running multiple IT companies successfully," he said.

column2: Working on resolution plan without haircut to lenders: DHFL
column3: Dewan Housing Finance (DHFL) on Monday said it was working closely with its shareholders and creditors on a resolution plan that would not need its lenders to take a haircut on its loan exposure. "While the sectoral stress is well-known...DHFL remains a strong going entity," it said. DHFL has cleared payment obligations of around ₹41,800 crore since September, it added.

column2: Greaves Cotton raises stake in EV maker Ampere to 81% from 67%
column3: Engineering firm Greaves Cotton announced it has raised its stake in Coimbatore-based electric vehicle maker Ampere Vehicles to 81.23% from 67.34%, by investing ₹38.49 crore through primary and secondary share purchases. Mumbai-based Greaves first acquired the 67.34% stake in Ampere in October 2018 for ₹77 crore. Ampere offers a range of low-speed and high-speed electric scooters.

column2: 3 bodies found with blood splattered on Shivling in Andhra temple
column3: In an incident of suspected human sacrifice and black magic, three people were found dead with slit throats in the premises of an under-construction temple in a village in Andhra Pradesh's Anantapuramu. Moreover, blood was found splattered over the Shivling inside the temple. The deceased have been identified as the temple caretaker, his sister and a woman from the village.

column2: Amitabh Bachchan shares tweet to mock ICC's boundary rule
column3: Amitabh Bachchan shared a tweet mocking ICC's boundary rule which decided the 2019 World Cup winner. "You have ₹2,000, I have ₹2,000, You have one note of ₹2,000, I have four notes of ₹500...Who is richer? ICC: The one who has four notes," it read. In another tweet, Bachchan wrote, "Isliye maa kehti thi ki 'chauka' bartan aana chahiye".

column2: Swatantra Dev Singh appointed as Uttar Pradesh BJP President
column3: The BJP on Tuesday appointed Uttar Pradesh Transport Minister Swatantra Dev Singh as the party's new state chief. Singh replaced Mahendra Nath Pandey who was inducted as a Union Minister for Skill Development and Entrepreneurship in May. The decision comes a day after Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath met party chief Amit Shah and working president JP Nadda in Delhi.

column2: Chandrakant Patil replaces Raosaheb Danve as Maharashtra BJP chief
column3: Chandrakant Patil was appointed as the new chief of BJP Maharashtra on Tuesday. Patil, a cabinet minister in the state government, replaced Raosaheb Patil Danve who resigned from the post earlier in the day. The development comes months ahead of the Maharashtra Assembly polls. Danve was made a Minister of State for Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution in May.

column2: Byju's valuation hikes $2 bn to $5.5 bn in latest funding round
column3: The valuation of India's most valuable edtech startup, Bengaluru-based Byju's, hiked by about $2 billion since its last funding to $5.5 billion in its ongoing Series F round. The startup has raised over $460 million in the round so far, as per data intelligence platform paper.vc. Byju's had confirmed raising $540 million from Naspers, among others, in December 2018.

column2: Conjoined twin girls separated after 55 hours of operations
column3: Two-year-old sisters Safa and Marwa Ullah, from Charsadda in Pakistan, have been separated at the Great Ormond Street Hospital in London after 55 hours of operations. The rare conjoined twins underwent four operations. "Safa and Marwa have a long road ahead - but we are hopeful they will be able to live active, happy lives!" the hospital tweeted.

column2: Chandrayaan-1 also faced glitch before launch: Ex-ISRO chief
column3: Hours after ISRO's decision to delay India's second Moon mission Chandrayaan-2's launch over a "technical snag", former ISRO chief K Madhavan Nair revealed Chandrayaan-1 had also faced a glitch before launch. "There was a leakage in propellent...detected two hours before the launch of Chandrayaan-1," he said. However, the leakage was fixed and ISRO had proceeded with Chandrayaan-1's launch.

column2: JNU guard cracks university's entrance exam, to study Russian
column3: A security guard at the Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) has cracked the university's entrance examination for admission into BA (Hons) in Russian. "Everyone - teachers and students - encouraged me; now they congratulate me. I feel like I have become famous overnight," Ramjal Meena said. "I follow newspapers through apps...students also helped me get PDF notes," he added.

column2: Court asks Hindu girl to distribute Qurans over FB posts, she refuses
column3: A local court in Jharkhand granted college student Richa Bharti bail for purportedly sharing offensive Facebook posts against Muslims and put a condition to distribute five copies of the Quran to government-owned educational organisations. The court also asked Bharti to present a copy to the complainant. She has refused to abide by the condition set by the court for bail.

column2: Married man reported kidnapped found waiting for girlfriend in park
column3: A 30-year-old married man from Noida who was reported kidnapped by his family, was found waiting for his girlfriend in a park on Monday, police said. He went 'missing' on Saturday, and his family approached the police on Sunday. He said he had fled to Rajasthan with his girlfriend, but they returned after his girlfriend's worried family started calling her.

column2: BMC asked to demolish Mumbai building 2 yrs ago that collapsed today
column3: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) in a letter dated August 7, 2017, had asked the Maharashtra Housing and Area Development Authority (MHADA) to immediately evacuate and demolish the 'Kesarbai' building that collapsed today. "In the event of any mishap this office won't be responsible," the BMC had said. The 100-year-old building in Dongri collapsed today, killing at least 12 people.

column2: Air-to-air missile seized from 3 men in Italy
column3: Italian police have seized an arsenal of weapons, including an air-to-air missile and a rocket launcher in raids on three neo-Nazi sympathisers. Assault rifles, pistols, bayonets and almost a thousand cartridges were also found. The raids were part of an investigation into Italian far-right extremists who had fought alongside the Russian-backed separatist forces in eastern Ukraine.

column2: Winning World Cup will give England confidence in Ashes: Root
column3: England Test captain Joe Root has said that winning the 2019 World Cup will give the team confidence going into a "series like Ashes". "It's what we set out to do two-three years ago and we're halfway there,” the 28-year-old said ahead of Ashes which begins in England from August 1. He added that the atmosphere of Ashes is unmatchable.

column2: Facebook hires ex-Vine GM for new experimental apps division
column3: Facebook has hired former Vine GM Jason Toff as the Project Management Director for its recently announced experimental apps division, New Product Experimentation (NPE) Team. Toff left Vine in 2016 and was most recently working for Google as a Partner for its Area 120 incubator, where employees work on experimental projects. Toff will be joining Facebook in next two weeks.

column2: Can't tell Speaker how to decide on resignation of MLAs: SC
column3: The Supreme Court on Tuesday said that it cannot say how the Speaker should decide on the resignations or disqualification of the rebel Karnataka MLAs. "We cannot fetter him. The question here is if there is any constitutional obligation for him to decide resignation before disqualification or to club his decision on both," CJI Ranjan Gogoi said.

column2: 2 children die as roof of their house collapses due to rains in UP
column3: Two children of a family died while five other members were injured after the roof of their house collapsed following heavy rainfall in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad on Tuesday, police said. The police added that the house was not properly maintained and was a "kutcha house". According to the police, there were nine people inside the house when the incident occurred.

column2: 199 relief camps have been set up so far: Bihar CM on floods
column3: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar on Tuesday said the flash floods have affected over 25 lakh people in the state. So far, 199 relief camps have been set up where 1.16 lakh people are taking shelter, Kumar added. "Availability of clean drinking water and medicines to check the outbreak of water-borne diseases...is also being ensured," the CM further said.

column2: Bihar opposition leaders protest over floods, allege govt inaction
column3: Opposition leaders in Bihar, including RJD leader Rabri Devi, on Tuesday protested outside the state Assembly alleging inaction by the Bihar government in dealing with the flood situation. The protestors raised slogans and urged CM Nitish Kumar-led government to set up relief camps in the flood-affected areas. As many as 25 people are reported dead in the floods till now.

column2: Man chained and thrashed by 5 men in Punjab, one arrested
column3: A man was chained and thrashed by five men in the Gholia Khurd village of Moga, Punjab. "Five people had chained and thrashed the man. They suspected that he had complained about them indulging in electricity theft," the police said on Monday. An FIR has been registered and one person has been arrested.

column2: Man kills pregnant daughter for marrying against his wishes
column3: The Mumbai Police have arrested a man for allegedly killing his pregnant daughter who had married against his wishes. According to the police, the accused called his daughter to meet him in Ghatkopar on the pretext of giving her some money and murdered her with a sharp weapon. The accused confessed to the crime after being interrogated, the police said.

column2: SP’s Neeraj Shekhar quits Rajya Sabha, may join BJP
column3: Samajwadi Party leader Neeraj Shekhar on Monday resigned as a member of the Rajya Sabha and his resignation was accepted by its Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu. Later, Neeraj reportedly met BJP President Amit Shah and Rajya Sabha MPs Bhupendra Yadav and Anil Baluni, among others. According to reports, he may join the BJP.

column2: Take relief ops in flood-affected states: Rahul to Cong workers
column3: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday appealed to the Congress workers to carry out relief operations in the flood-affected states like Assam, Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Tripura and Mizoram. Flood situation due to heavy rains across the country has affected the lives of people, particularly in the eastern and north-eastern states. At least 15 people have died due to Assam floods.

column2: Collapse of building in Mumbai is anguishing: PM Modi
column3: After a building collapsed in Mumbai's Dongri area on Tuesday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that the incident is 'anguishing' and hoped for quick recovery of the injured. "My condolences to the families of those who lost their lives...Maharashtra Government, NDRF and local authorities are...assisting those in need," he added. At least 12 people are reported dead in the collapse.

column2: Russian defence system will be fully deployed by Apr 2020: Turkey
column3: Turkish President Tayyip Erdoğan said on Monday that the Russian S-400 missile defence system, parts of which have been delivered to Turkey over the past four days, would be fully deployed in April 2020. "The S-400s are the strongest defence system against those who want to attack our country," he added. US has threatened to sanction Turkey over the purchase.

column2: Farmer held for killing scientist whose body was found in Nazi bunker
column3: A local farmer has been arrested on suspicion of murdering American scientist Suzanne Eaton on the Greek island of Crete. The 27-year-old has reportedly confessed to the murder, with the police saying sexual abuse was a likely motive. The body of Eaton, a molecular biologist, was found by the Greek authorities inside a bunker used by the Nazis during WWII.

column2: Aditya Birla Fashion to buy 51% stake in Finesse for ₹60 cr
column3: Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail (ABFRL), owner of brands Louis Philippe and Pantaloons, has agreed to acquire a 51% stake for around ₹60 crore in Finesse International Design, which owns the fashion label 'Shantanu & Nikhil'. ABFRL said the acquisition will be through primary equity infusion and secondary share purchase. Incorporated in 2007, Finesse had around ₹35.2-crore revenue in 2018-19.

column2: Reebok signs Varun Dhawan as its brand face
column3: Leading fitness brand Reebok announces Bollywood actor and fitness enthusiast, Varun Dhawan, as their Indian brand ambassador. The brand recently also signed in Katrina Kaif as the new face. With Varun, Reebok launches its biggest campaign Sole Fury, that aims to disrupt conventionality and celebrates those who dare to #SplitFrom the ordinary.

column2: RTR flyover to reduce traffic jams on way to airport opens in Delhi
column3: After almost a three-year delay, the Rao Tula Ram (RTR) flyover opened on Tuesday to reduce traffic jams on the way to the IGI airport from South and East Delhi and Noida. The flyover on Outer Ring Road will also smoothen the journey to Gurugram. The flyover branches out of Munirka flyover and ends before Army Research and Referral Hospital.

column2: 12 dead in Mumbai building collapse; CM says building 100-yr-old
column3: At least 12 people have been killed after a four-storey building collapsed in Mumbai's Dongri, Maharashtra Housing and Area Development Authority Chairman Uday Samant said. Five people have reportedly been rescued so far. "The building is around 100 years old. Entire focus is on rescuing the people trapped. Investigation will be done," Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis said after the incident.

column2: First pictures of Pooja Batra's wedding to Nawab Shah out
column3: The first pictures of actress Pooja Batra's wedding to actor Nawab Shah have surfaced online. The couple got married on July 4 in a private ceremony in Delhi, which was attended only by family members. Speaking about Pooja, Nawab said in a recent interview, "Pooja entered my life like sunshine...I wanted to marry her right after our first meeting."

column2: BCCI invites applications for Team India head coach, July 30 deadline
column3: The BCCI on Tuesday issued an official advertisement, inviting applications for support staff of Team India. The BCCI asked interested candidates for the positions of head coach, batting coach and bowling coach, among others, to send their applications on or before July 30. The current coaching staff will get an automatic entry in the recruitment process, it added.

column2: FBI, CIA should investigate Google over links to China: Peter Thiel
column3: Billionaire PayPal Co-founder Peter Thiel has said the FBI and CIA should investigate Google over its "seemingly treasonous" actions over alleged ties to the Chinese military. Thiel, a Facebook board member, suggested that AI developed by Google's sister firm DeepMind should be thought of as a potential "military weapon". Google responded saying it does not work with the Chinese military.

column2: Facebook's cryptocurrency Libra could be used for terrorism: US
column3: The US Treasury Department has said it has "very serious concerns" that Facebook's upcoming cryptocurrency Libra could be misused for terrorism and money laundering. Labelling the digital currency as a "national security issue", the department added, "Our overriding goal is to maintain the integrity of our financial system and protect it from abuse." Facebook announced the cryptocurrency in June.

column2: Delhi HC issues notice in plea to link property docs with Aadhaar
column3: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday issued a notice to the Central and Delhi governments in a petition seeking directions to them to link citizens' movable and immovable property documents with their Aadhaar number in an effort to curb corruption. The court sought their reply to the plea and scheduled the next hearing on October 15.

column2: Kejriwal granted bail in defamation case filed by BJP leader
column3: A Delhi court on Tuesday granted bail to Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on a personal bond of ₹10,000 in a defamation case filed by BJP leader Rajiv Babbar. Babbar had accused several AAP leaders of "harming the reputation" of BJP by claiming that EC had deleted over 30 lakh names from the voters' list in Delhi at the party's behest.

column2: Give me names of MPs absent from Parliament duty: PM Modi
column3: At a weekly meeting of the BJP parliamentary party, Prime Minister Narendra Modi reportedly asked for the details of all the Union Ministers who skipped Parliament duty despite being asked to be present for the session. PM Modi also asked BJP MPs to "work beyond the sphere of politics" and perform "unique work" in their constituencies, BJP leaders have revealed.

column2: MP BJP MLA gets into argument with SDM over power cuts
column3: BJP MLA Mahesh Rai got into an argument with SDM KL Meena over the issue of power cuts at the latter's office in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar on Monday. Rai demanded immediate action over an alleged discrepancy in electricity bills, and stated, "You don't know how to talk to an MLA." Meena responded that shouting would not resolve the issue.

column2: Sachin Bansal puts ₹200 cr in Piramal Enterprises' debt: Report
column3: Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal has invested ₹200 crore in debt papers issued by Piramal Enterprises, via non-convertible debentures (NCDs) route, Livemint reported. The NCD, issued at an interest coupon of around 9.5% and a repayment period of two years, would be used in Piramal's financial services business, the report said. Piramal Group is also reportedly in fundraising talks with SoftBank.

column2: Ashok Leyland shuts Pantnagar plant for 9 days due to weak demand
column3: Commercial vehicle manufacturer Ashok Leyland said it is shutting down its Pantnagar facility in Uttarakhand for 9 days starting Tuesday because of "weak demand and outlook for the industry". The plant can manufacture 1.5 lakh units annually. The Hinduja Group company's total vehicle sales in June stood at 12,810 units, down 19% from last year.

column2: Human chain searches for survivors in collapsed Mumbai building
column3: People formed a human chain to remove the debris with their hands of the four-storey building that collapsed in Mumbai's Dongri, to search for survivors on Tuesday. The narrow lanes and a dense neighbourhood came as a challenge for rescue workers to find the trapped survivors. At least 12 people have died due to the building collapse.

column2: Society watchman paraded naked for allegedly molesting 6-yr-old
column3: A 22-year-old watchman of a residential complex in Maharashtra's Palghar district was beaten up and paraded naked on the streets after being accused of molesting a six-year-old girl, police said on Monday. The girl's mother complained that the watchman touched the girl inappropriately when she returned from tuitions. While the police has booked the watchman, he is currently hospitalised.

column2: Supreme Court fines Delhi civic body ₹50,000 for suppressing facts
column3: The Supreme Court on Monday imposed a ₹50,000-fine on North Delhi Municipal Corporation (NDMC) for suppressing facts before a Vacation Bench to secure a favourable order. A Division Bench recalled the Vacation Bench's interim order passed in May. The NDMC had not informed the Vacation Bench that a regular Bench had already listed the matter for further hearing in July.

column2: Video of UK PM Theresa May dancing at an event goes viral
column3: A video of UK PM Theresa May dancing at the Henley Festival has gone viral on social media. May sang and danced to several songs by pop band Abba, including 'Mamma Mia', 'Take A Chance On Me' and 'Money Money Money'. "Living her best life it seems," a Twitter user wrote on her dancing.

column2: Ex-Malaysia PM spent ₹5.5 cr on jewellery in 1 day, court hears
column3: Ex-Malaysia PM Najib Razak used his credit cards to buy goods worth over ₹5.5 crore at a jewellery shop in a single day in 2014, prosecutors told a court during his corruption trial. The credit card bills were presented as evidence against Razak, who allegedly diverted over ₹4,804 crore from the state-run 1MDB wealth fund to his personal bank accounts.

column2: London Mayor rejects billionaire's plan for 1000-ft 'Tulip' tower
column3: London Mayor Sadiq Khan on Monday rejected a proposal by Brazilian billionaire Joseph Safra to build a 1,000-foot tulip-shaped skyscraper. Design of 'The Tulip' was deemed not to be good enough for such a prime location. "The tower would result in harm to London’s skyline and impact views of the nearby Tower of London world heritage site," Khan's office said.

column2: Grofers raises $10 mn from Abu Dhabi's Capital Investments
column3: Gurugram-based online grocery delivery startup Grofers has raised $10 million from Abu Dhabi's Capital Investment in its ongoing $200-million Series F round, as per regulatory filings accessed by paper.vc. The SoftBank-backed startup raised $130 million from its parent entity. Founded in 2013 by Albinder Dhindsa and Saurabh Kumar, Grofers has raised nearly $472 million to date, as per Crunchbase.

column2: Tiger kills 23-yr-old forest watcher in Corbett Tiger Reserve
column3: A 23-year-old forest watcher named Sohan Singh was mauled to death by a tiger in Kalagarh area of Corbett Tiger Reserve on Monday. "The family will be given a compensation of ₹3 lakh," Corbett reserve field director Rahul said. In November 2018, a 20-year-old man was mauled to death by a tigress in Dhikala zone of Corbett Tiger Reserve.

column2: Delhi Police arrest suspected Jaish terrorist from Srinagar
column3: A special cell of Delhi Police have arrested suspected Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorist Basir Ahmad from Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar, officials said on Tuesday. Ahmad was arrested in 2007, however, he got acquitted by a lower court. He was later sentenced by a High Court but had not been appearing for hearings leading to a non-bailable arrest warrant against him.

column2: No plan to replace New Pension Scheme with old scheme: Govt
column3: State Finance Minister Anurag Thakur on Monday informed the Lok Sabha that there is no proposal to replace the New Pension Scheme (NPS) with the old pension scheme for central and state government employees recruited since 2004. Employees have been demanding the old pension scheme as it was based on a fixed pension amount and provided more security upon retirement.

column2: 2 Rohingyas arrested in Tripura: Police
column3: The police have arrested two Rohingyas from Tripura near the India-Bangladesh International Border on Tuesday. The police said that the preliminary investigation revealed that the two entered into the Indian territory in search of jobs. The police also recovered refugee cards from them and the duo confessed that they stayed at a Rohingya refugee camp in Bangladesh.

column2: PM Modi, Rahul, other leaders greet nation on Guru Purnima
column3: PM Narendra Modi, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and other political leaders extended their greetings to the people of the country on the occasion of Guru Purnima. The PM said that it's a day to "bow" to the gurus who have played an important role in "shaping our society". Vice President Venkaiah Naidu also greeted the nation on the occasion.

column2: upGrad sees 500+ learners graduate in Machine Learning & AI course
column3: upGrad and IIIT-Bangalore witnessed 500+ learners graduate across multiple cohorts with PG Diploma in Machine Learning & AI. The program, ranked No. 1 by AIM in 2018 saw 1500+ enrolments with a 50% bump in the last quarter. It features cutting-edge concepts like neural networks, deep learning and offers 1-1 mentorship with industry experts along with 360 degree career support.

column2: Pak opens airspace for Indian flights 140 days after Balakot strike
column3: Around 140 days after the Balakot strike, Pakistan for the first time opened its airspace "for all type of civilian traffic", including that from India, on Tuesday. The country had earlier claimed it would not open its airspace for commercial flights until India removed its fighter jets from forward Indian airbases. Several airlines incurred losses due to the shut airspace.

column2: 40 feared trapped as 4-storey building collapses in Mumbai
column3: At least 40 people are feared trapped after a four-storey building collapsed in Mumbai's Dongri area on Tuesday. A team of National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) has rushed to the building collapse site. Last month, a compound wall collapsed due to heavy rains in Mumbai's Malad. The incident had killed 27 people and had left several others injured.

column2: Great Learning’s Data Science course includes placement support
column3: Companies such as Uber, Swiggy, Oyo and 100+ other companies participate in hiring drives for Great Learning's PG Program in Data Science and Engineering. The hiring drives are a part of the career assistance offered to program participants, in addition to 1-1 career mentorship and interview preparation sessions. Learners have seen an average salary hike of 65% upon transitioning.

column2: 'Arjun Reddy' actor criticises reporter asking actress about breakup
column3: 'Arjun Reddy' actor Vijay Deverakonda criticised a journalist who asked his co-star Rashmika Mandanna about her broken engagement with actor Rakshit Shetty. "I don't even understand the question...how is it anyone's business," he told the reporter during the promotions of his upcoming film 'Dear Comrade'. Rashmika, who got engaged to Rakshit in 2017, broke up with the actor last year.

column2: I had to live on beaches, sleep on platforms: Kher on struggling days
column3: Speaking about his struggling days in Mumbai, Anupam Kher revealed, "At one point I had no work, money or help. I had to live on beaches and sleep on platforms." He added that he soon got a role in Mahesh Bhatt's film but was replaced. However, he was signed when Bhatt "saw the vigour with which he wanted to act".

column2: Taapsee takes dig at 'Kabir Singh' citing girl's murder by boyfriend
column3: Taapsee Pannu has been criticised for taking a veiled dig at 'Kabir Singh' while citing a Maharashtra murder case, wherein a man allegedly killed his 19-year-old girlfriend suspecting her 'character'. "Or maybe let's just say...this 'act' was to validate his TRUE love," Taapsee tweeted. Earlier, 'Kabir Singh' director said he doesn't see any emotion if lovers "can't slap each other".

column2: Hrithik Roshan starrer 'Super 30' made tax-free in Bihar
column3: Hrithik Roshan starrer 'Super 30', which is based on mathematician Anand Kumar's life, has been made tax-free in Bihar. Tweeting about the same, Kumar wrote, "Thanks a lot to CM Nitish Kumar ji and Deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi ji...It will help more and more people see the film." Hrithik replied to the same tweet and also expressed his gratitude.

column2: How much prize money did India, NZ and England get in 2019 WC?
column3: England, the winners of 10-team 2019 World Cup, received a total prize money of $4.24 million (₹29.06 crore), while runners-up New Zealand got $2.2 million (₹15.08 crore). India, who lost in semi-finals to eventual runners-up New Zealand, received $1.08 million (₹7.40 crore). Australia also received the same prize money as India due to same number of victories in league stage.

column2: Learn to listen, Owaisi sahab: Amit Shah during LS discussion
column3: During a discussion on an amendment bill seeking to strengthen anti-terror agency NIA, Home Minister Amit Shah told AIMIM MP Asaduddin Owaisi, "Learn to listen also Owaisi sahab, this will not work." Shah made the statement after Owaisi objected to a part of BJP MP Satya Pal Singh's speech during the discussion on the amendment bill.

column2: Researchers find 4.2 mn-yr-old fossil of monkey that weighed 1kg
column3: Researchers working in Kenya have found a 4.2 million-year-old fossil of a miniature monkey which only weighed one kilogram. The newly discovered species, 'Nanopithecus browni', is the same size as the world's smallest Old World monkey, the talapoin. The dry grassland Kenyan habitat that 'Nanopithecus browni' lived in is also where some of earliest human ancestors' fossils have been discovered.

column2: IndiGo pilot says he was held hostage in cab, robbed at Delhi airport
column3: A 60-year-old IndiGo pilot has alleged he was abducted, held hostage in a cab, and robbed by four men, who offered him a ride at Delhi airport's Terminal 1 on Saturday. They withdrew ₹1 lakh in 10 instalments using his debit card and took ₹12,000 from his wallet. They drove him around for hours before dropping him on a flyover.

column2: Man survives in sea for 5 days by holding onto a bamboo pole
column3: A West Bengal man, who jumped off a fishing vessel that capsized, survived for five days by holding onto a bamboo pole in the Bay of Bengal. Rabindranath Das was spotted by a Bangladeshi vessel near Chittagong. "I did not eat during the entire time. There was intermittent rain and big waves. I drank water when it rained," he said.

column2: IAF air warrior donates ₹1cr to Defence Ministry 40yrs after retirement
column3: Around 40 years after retirement, Indian Air Force air warrior CBR Prasad handed over a cheque of ₹1.08 crore as donation for defence forces to Defence Minister Rajnath Singh. The 74-year-old had served the IAF for nine years. "I've given my daughter 2% of my property...1% to my wife. Rest 97% I'm giving back to the society," he said.

column2: 51 kids electrocuted by high-tension wire in UP school, hospitalised
column3: Around 51 students of a primary school in Uttar Pradesh's Balrampur district were hospitalised due to electric shock attributed to a high-tension wire coming in contact with trees in the school. The students had taken off their footwear to sit on gunny bags on the ground and came in contact with electricity that apparently passed through trees and moist ground.

column2: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, mother invest in Bengaluru startup Ambee
column3: Actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and her mother have invested in Bengaluru-based environmental intelligence startup Ambee. Investors including Rajan Anandan, Google's former Southeast Asia and India Vice President, together invested ₹3.22 crore in the startup. Founded in 2017, Ambee provides data about hyperlocal air quality which is accessible to developers, consumers, health researchers and media companies.

column2: Hopeful that Centre will soon resolve mining issue: Goa CM
column3: Goa CM Pramod Sawant said that he was hopeful that the Centre will soon resolve the mining issue of the state. He added, "We're of the belief that even if fresh extraction doesn't start, at least some mining activities can resume." Sawant said that instructions to restart the e-auctions have already been given and it'll restart within next 15-20 days.

column2: Give adequate security to BJP MLA's daughter, her husband: HC
column3: The Allahabad High Court on Monday directed police to ensure BJP MLA Rajesh Mishra or his family members do not interfere in the married life of his daughter Sakshi and Ajitesh Kumar. The court asked the couple to apply for registration of their marriage, while issuing a notice to Mishra to file his reply by the next date of hearing.

column2: 2 sisters held hostage, raped for 2 months in Rajasthan: Police
column3: The Rajasthan Police said that a man allegedly abducted and raped two sisters multiple times for over two months in Dholpur. The police added that the incident came to light after the minor sister managed to escape and lodged an FIR on Saturday. The elder sister is still held captive and efforts are on to locate her, the police said.

column2: PM calls Assam CM, assures support to tackle flood situation
column3: PM Narendra Modi called Assam CM Sarbananda Sonowal and took stock of the flood situation in the state, assuring all support from the Centre in dealing with it. Around 15 people died and over 43 lakh people were affected due to the floods, officials said. According to the officials, over 90,000 hectares of agricultural land got affected in the state.

column2: Mumbai Mayor's vehicle found in no-parking zone; fined
column3: The Mumbai traffic police on Monday issued a challan after Mayor Vishwanath Mahadeshwar's official vehicle was found parked under BMC's no-parking signboard. His vehicle was spotted outside a popular coastal fish food joint between Andheri and Vile Parle, a senior police official said. Since last week, the BMC has started a drive against unauthorised parking in the city.

column2: IndiGo secures ₹2,577 cr of credit facility in June quarter
column3: IndiGo-operator InterGlobe Aviation availed credit facility of around ₹2,577.75 crore in the first quarter for meeting its working capital requirements, filings showed. This is thrice the amount availed by it in the year-ago period. It secured ₹1,050 crore from Standard Chartered Bank in April, ₹660.32 crore from Crédit Agricole CIB in May, and ₹867.43 crore from Deutsche Bank in June.

column2: JSW Steel tells NCLT it's 'anxious' about BPSL fraud reports
column3: JSW Steel on Monday informed the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) that it was "anxious" about the reports of alleged fraud at bankrupt Bhushan Power & Steel (BPSL). However, it added it wasn't backing out of BPSL's ongoing insolvency resolution process. Allahabad Bank and Punjab National Bank recently reported alleged frauds of ₹1,775 crore and ₹3,805 crore respectively by BPSL.

column2: Differently-abled UPSC topper trolled on social media, shares post
column3: Differently-abled UPSC 2014 topper Ira Singhal in a Facebook post said she was cyberbullied by a person who commented "kubdi" on her Instagram post to troll her. "Unfortunately someone who cannot be bullied is being attempted to be bullied," she said. "This is why we need our education system to focus on producing better human beings," she added.

column2: ICC criticised for calling Stokes 'greatest' in pic with Sachin
column3: The ICC has been criticised for calling Ben Stokes 'the greatest cricketer of all time' in picture with Sachin Tendulkar. "Agree, because Sachin isn't a cricketer but God of cricket," a user tweeted. "Really?? It should be other way around...Congratulations Stokes for winning the Cup," wrote Harbhajan Singh. Sachin presented Stokes with Man of the 2019 World Cup final award.

column2: I have the capacity to play in the shorter format of the game: Pujara
column3: Batsman Cheteshwar Pujara has said he has the capacity to play in the shorter format of the game as he has been performing well in Tests. "I am improving my skills in ODIs and T20Is and in domestic matches...I want to play all the formats," he added. "It would've been nice play the World Cup," he further said.

column2: Ridiculous rule: Gambhir on WC final being decided on boundaries
column3: Reacting to England defeating New Zealand in the 2019 World Cup final on the virtue of scoring more boundaries after tied match and tied Super Over, ex-India cricketer Gautam Gambhir tweeted, "A ridiculous rule. It should've been a tie." "Don't understand how the game of such proportions, the #CWC19Final, is finally decided on who scored the most boundaries," he wrote.

column2: I'm probably most hated father in NZ: Stokes' father after WC final
column3: England all-rounder Ben Stokes father Ged, who stays in New Zealand, joked that he's the most hated father in New Zealand after his son's performance in 2019 World Cup final. "I really am disappointed for the Black Caps...Hand on heart, I am overjoyed for Ben and the team, but I am still a New Zealand supporter," Ged added.

column2: Don't know how much time will I take to get fit: Shaw before WI tour
column3: Batsman Prithvi Shaw on Monday said that he wasn't sure when he would recover from his hip injury. "I'm working with the physios to get back to fitness but can’t put a timeline on it right now," he added. Shaw is yet to feature in any international match for India since making his debut against the West Indies in October.

column2: Some rules definitely need a serious look in: Rohit on WC final
column3: Referring to 2019 World Cup final winner being decided on boundaries, the tournament's highest run-scorer Rohit Sharma tweeted, "Some rules in cricket definitely need a serious look in." England won the final on virtue of scoring more boundaries than New Zealand after the match and Super Over both ended in a tie. It was England's first ever World Cup victory.

column2: Right time for Rohit to become ODI captain: BCCI functionary
column3: Amid rumours of a rift between captain Virat Kohli and vice-captain Rohit Sharma, a BCCI functionary said the board is mulling split captaincy. "This would be the right time for Rohit to take over ODI captaincy. We all know some areas need a re-look," he added. He further said that the board will get to bottom of the rumours.

column2: Olympian accidentally runs over and kills son on his 1st birthday
column3: Sprinter Isaac Ntiamoah, who represented Australia in 2012 Olympics, accidentally ran over and killed his son while reversing his car out of his driveway. The incident happened when Ntiamoah was leaving the house to collect supplies for his son's first birthday party. New South Wales Police are investigating circumstances of the incident, which is being treated as a tragic accident.

column2: India squad for West Indies tour to be announced on July 19
column3: India squad for next month's tour of West Indies will be announced on July 19. Captain Virat Kohli and pacer Jasprit Bumrah are expected to be rested for limited-overs leg comprising three T20Is and three ODIs, as per reports. Talking about MS Dhoni's future, a BCCI official said, "Only he can decide whether he wants to carry on or not."

column2: Amit Shah is Home Minister, not God: Owaisi after spat in Lok Sabha
column3: Following a verbal spat with Home Minister Amit Shah in Lok Sabha during discussion on NIA (Amendment) Bill, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said Shah threatens by raising his finger but he is a Home Minister, not God. Owaisi alleged that whoever doesn't support their (BJP) decisions, they call them anti-nationals. NIA (Amendment) Bill was passed by Lok Sabha on Monday.

column2: Kolkata Metro starts high-level probe into passenger's death
column3: Two days after the death of a passenger in Kolkata Metro, senior railway safety officials visited the accident spot and started a high-level probe on Monday. Commissioner of Railway Safety (CRS-Metro division) Sailesh Garg examined the metro rake, a door of which had allegedly malfunctioned. The passenger had died after his hand got stuck between the gates of the train.

column2: DIG-rank officer booked for sexually harassing woman on train
column3: Railway Protection Force Deputy Inspector General Vijay Khatarkar, currently posted with West Central Railway in Jabalpur, has been booked for allegedly sexually harassing a railway official's wife on board a train. As per police, the complainant was sleeping on a lower berth when the DIG sexually harassed her. The complainant told police that she resisted DIG's advances and alerted co-passengers.

column2: Man jailed for posts against Trivendra Singh Rawat in Uttarakhand
column3: A man was sent to jail in Uttarakhand for allegedly posting offensive and objectionable posts against Chief Minister Trivendra Singh Rawat on his Facebook account. Uttarkashi Superintendent of Police Pankaj Bhatt said that the accused was arrested from Purola area on Sunday. He was produced before a court of the Chief Judicial Magistrate which sent him to jail.

column2: CRPF personnel jump in stream to save girl from drowning in J&K
column3: Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel saved a 14-year-old girl from drowning in a river in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla on Monday. The girl had slipped into the stream and was being washed away by strong currents. Six CRPF personnel rushed to save the girl and two constables, MG Naidu and Nalla Upendra, jumped into the stream to catch her.

column2: 4 Australian children take car on 1,000-kilometre road trip; held
column3: Four Australian children took a car on a 1,000-kilometre road trip before being nabbed by police, officials said. The children, including a 14-year-old boy, two 13-year-old boys and a 10-year-old girl, began their journey on Saturday when they took cash and packed fishing rods in the vehicle. The car belonged to the family of one of the kids.

column2: It was a day when sport won: Sania on World Cup, Wimbledon finals
column3: Reacting to 2019 World Cup and Wimbledon men's singles final which took place on Sunday, Sania Mirza tweeted, "What a day...It was a day when sport won." England defeated New Zealand on boundaries after the match and Super Over both ended in a tie. Meanwhile, Djokovic defeated Federer in four hours and 57 minutes to win his fifth Wimbledon title.

column2: All who watched at home will try to be the next Stokes: Morgan
column3: Praising Ben Stokes, England captain Eoin Morgan said, "[E]verybody watching at home will hopefully try and be the next Ben Stokes." Morgan further said, "It is almost superhuman. He has really carried the team and our batting line-up." Stokes ended the 2019 edition of the World Cup with a total of 465 runs and seven wickets.

column2: No exemption for Phogat, Punia from WC trials: WFI
column3: The Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) has specified that there will be no exemption for Vinesh Phogat and Bajrang Punia for the World Championship trials. WFI will conduct the men's trials on July 25 in Sonipat while the women will compete on July 26 in Lucknow. The World Championship will be held in Kazakhstan from September 14.

column2: Not worried about outrage over same-sex relationship: Dutee
column3: Indian sprinter Dutee Chand has revealed that the outrage over her relationship with a girl does not bother her anymore. Chand has returned after winning a gold medal in the 100m event in the World University Games at Napoli. "I got so many encouragements from eminent personalities which boost up my self-confidence to achieve this prestigious recognition," Chand added.

column2: Woman dies after fight over water at public tap in Andhra
column3: A 38-year-old woman was killed in a fight over filling water from a public tap in Andhra Pradesh's Srikakulam district. The victim was standing in a queue at the tap when another woman tried to break it, leading to an argument which turned violent. The victim died on the spot after sustaining head injuries and police have detained the attacker.

column2: Assam floods death toll rises to 15; nearly 43 lakh affected
column3: The death toll in the Assam floods, caused by heavy rainfall and landslides in the region, rose to 15 on Monday. The second wave of floods has increased the number of people affected to nearly 43 lakh in 30 of the state's 33 districts. The National Disaster Response Force has deployed 15 teams comprising 380 personnel to tackle the situation.

column2: Plea in Delhi HC seeks linking of Aadhaar with property documents
column3: A petition seeking a direction to the Centre and Delhi government for linking of people's movable and immovable property documents with their Aadhaar numbers was filed in Delhi High Court on Monday by BJP leader Ashwini Upadhyay. He said the move could help curb corruption, black money generation and 'benami' transactions. The petition is likely to be heard on Tuesday.

column2: Asked reporter 'Did your mom look hot when you were born?': Sameera
column3: Recalling an interaction with a reporter during her pregnancy, Sameera Reddy revealed he had asked her 'Will you return back looking hot like Kareena Kapoor did very soon or will you take time...like Aishwarya did?'. She added, "I went on to tell him, 'Where did you come from? Did your mom look hot when she gave birth to you?'"

column2: I'm still sexually attracted to women, hate the term wife: Miley
column3: Speaking about her sexuality, singer Miley Cyrus said, "I'm in a hetero relationship, but I still am very sexually attracted to women." "People become vegetarian for health reasons, but bacon is still f**king good," she added. Talking about marrying actor Liam Hemsworth, Miley said, "I definitely don't fit into a stereotypical wife role. I don't even like that word."

column2: Bigg Boss Telugu organiser asked how I could live without sex: Actress
column3: Actress Gayathri Gupta has filed a complaint against Bigg Boss Telugu organisers alleging that they cheated her and hurt her self-respect by asking inappropriate questions. She claimed that during her meeting with the show's coordinator from Mumbai, he asked her how she could live for 100 days without sex. Gayathri further alleged her contract for the show was abruptly terminated.

column2: Saki Saki a blockbuster song, felt bad on hearing the remix: Koena
column3: Actress Koena Mitra who featured in the original 'Saki Saki' song from the film 'Musafir', while speaking about the song's remix version, said, "This is a blockbuster song...The...remix has just made me sad." "Why are [composers] messing with...cult songs? These songs have a separate solid fan-base," she added. Koena said composers should make new songs instead of "damaging old ones".

column2: Taken out of context: Scarlett on 'politically correct casting' remark
column3: Hollywood actress Scarlett Johansson, while commenting on the controversy around her remark that as an actor, she "should be allowed to play any person, or any tree, or any animal" because that is her job, said the comment was "widely taken out of context". "The question I was answering...was about the confrontation between political correctness and art," she added.

column2: Allah was also with us: Eoin Morgan on 'luck' in World Cup final
column3: On being asked whether "the luck of an Irishman" got England over the line in World Cup final, Dublin-born England captain Eoin Morgan said, "We had Allah with us as well." "I spoke to Adil Rashid. He said...'Allah is definitely with us'. It's the rub of the green. It actually epitomises our team. Quite diverse backgrounds and cultures," he added.

column2: Williamson's reaction on being named Player of World Cup goes viral
column3: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson's reaction on being named Player of the 2019 World Cup has gone viral. On being told by an official from the organising team that he had won the award, Williamson looked seemingly surprised and asked, "Me?" "A bit of a LOL for you after a tough result!" New Zealand Cricket tweeted while sharing the video.

column2: 1 arrested for violence against doctors at Mumbai hospital
column3: A man was arrested on Monday by Mumbai Police in relation to the attack on three doctors of Nair Hospital. Three people were named in the FIR, out of which two were women. Family members of the patient allegedly attacked the doctors on Sunday after he died during treatment. Police said efforts were underway to arrest the other accused.

column2: Saravana owner suffers heart attack, extremely critical: Doctors
column3: Saravana Bhavan restaurant chain Founder and murder case convict P Rajagopal suffered from a heart attack on Saturday and remains extremely critical, doctors have said. Rajagopal, who is currently on ventilator support, surrendered in Chennai on July 9 to serve a life term. He had arrived in an ambulance with an oxygen mask strapped to his face to surrender himself.

column2: Air India pilot suspended for 3 months for failing alcohol test
column3: An Air India pilot was suspended for three months after he tested positive in a pre-flight breath-analyser test on Saturday. The pilot wanted to fly as a passenger from Delhi to Bengaluru, but as the flight was full, he requested to fly in the cockpit as an additional crew member. However, he was deplaned after he failed the alcohol test.

column2: Man held for threatening to kill self if not allowed to sell liquor
column3: A man was arrested in Gujarat's Rajkot on Saturday for threatening to set himself and his family on fire if the government didn't permit him to sell alcohol or run a gambling den. He was granted bail after he assured he wouldn't take any extreme step. He said he cannot do physical labour after losing a leg in an accident.

column2: Mathematician who cracked Nazi code for WWII win to be on £50 note
column3: English mathematician Alan Turing, who helped Britain win the Second World War by cracking Nazi code, will appear on Bank of England's new £50 polymer note by the end of 2021. The note features a ticker tape of binary code that depicts his birthday (June 23, 1912). He committed suicide in 1954 after he was chemically castrated for being homosexual.

column2: Leaving India big mistake, will return in 24 hrs: IMA scam accused
column3: Bengaluru-based IMA Jewels ponzi scam accused Mansoor Khan, who is believed to be in Dubai, claimed in a video on Monday that he will return to India within 24 hours. "It was a big mistake to leave India...but certain circumstances forced me to do so," he said. "I don't even know my family's whereabouts in the country," he added.

column2: British PM Theresa May to host World Cup-winning England team
column3: British Prime Minister Theresa May will host the World Cup-winning England cricket team at her Downing Street office later on Monday. "Yesterday was a brilliant performance by a brilliant team. They showed flair, courage and an absolute determination to become world champions. The achievement... on home soil will live forever in our sporting history," May's spokesman said.

column2: Act against forceful chanting of religious slogans: Mayawati
column3: BSP supremo Mayawati on Monday called the "new wrong practice" of forcefully making people chant religious slogans in states including Uttar Pradesh a "violent trend" and asked central and state governments to take strong action against it. This comes after 12 youths were booked for allegedly pulling an imam's beard and forcing him to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' in Muzaffarnagar.

column2: Mark Cuban, Serena Williams invest $3 mn in startup for new moms
column3: Investor Mark Cuban and tennis star Serena Williams have invested $3 million in Mahmee, a US-based startup that delivers data-driven care coordination and personalised support to new mothers. It provides online group discussions with other moms, connection to medical service providers and support from trained maternity coaches. It was founded in 2014 by Melissa Hanna, Linda Hanna and Sunny Walia.

column2: 7-yr-old drowns in Mumbai drain, 3rd such incident in a week
column3: In the third such incident in the past seven days, a seven-year-old boy drowned after falling into an open drain in Mumbai's Dharavi on Monday. The boy was pulled out and rushed to a hospital where he was declared brought dead. Police have filed a case of negligence against the officers and staff involved in supervision work of the drainage.

column2: Abortion will rise after media reports of MLA's daughter: BJP MLA
column3: Madhya Pradesh BJP MLA Gopal Bhargava on Sunday said that the reports run by national channels on BJP MLA Rajesh Mishra's daughter Sakshi will lead to a rise in abortion and female infanticide across the country. There will be a huge difference in the sex ratio which we will see in social surveys over the next three years, Bhargava said.

column2: ₹17.66-crore Marathi Language Bhavan to be built in Mumbai
column3: The Maharashtra government has approved the construction of a sub-centre for Marathi Language Bhavan costing ₹17.66 crore in Mumbai's Airoli. The move is a bid to bring all offices of the Marathi language department together for better coordination. The centre will accommodate departments like The Directorate of Languages, Board of Literature and Culture and Marathi Encyclopedia Production Board.

column2: C'garh govt criticised over proposal to add egg in mid-day meals
