The team, which is set to take part in the COTIF Cup in Spain later this month, won eight and lost five out of their 14 competitive matches since January.

column2: Long loses wedding ring, key to New York in WC win celebrations
column3: American footballer Allie Long was robbed of her wedding ring, cash and the key to New York while celebrating her team's FIFA Women's World Cup victory. Long and her teammates were attending an event in Los Angeles when her room in the Ritz-Carlton hotel was burgled. New York's Mayor Bill de Blasio had presented the ceremonial key to Long.

column2: Apple Co-founder Wozniak criticises FB, asks people to get off it
column3: Apple Co-founder Steve Wozniak has criticised Facebook and its photo-sharing platform Instagram for selling users' privacy to advertisers. He said that for some people, the benefits of Facebook are worth the loss of privacy. "To many like myself, my recommendation to most people is, you should figure out a way to get off Facebook," he added.

column2: So much to learn from you: Vadra praises Rahul as youth icon
column3: Businessman Robert Vadra on Saturday praised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, saying, "There's so much to learn from you." He added, "The Indian populace, which comprises 65% of the young (under 45 years), looks up to you and other young leaders for direction." Vadra said he is with Rahul in service to the nation, which is bigger than any party post.

column2: Philippine President mocks Iceland, says people there 'eat ice'
column3: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte has mocked Iceland after the country led a UN resolution to investigate his war on drugs. "What's the problem of Iceland? You've too much ice and there is no clear day and night there...you can understand why there's no crime, no policeman either, and they just go about eating ice," he said about the Nordic country.

column2: Probe launched into leak of emails in which UK envoy criticised Trump
column3: The Metropolitan Police has launched a criminal investigation into the alleged leak of emails in which the UK's former ambassador to the US, Kim Darroch, had criticised US President Donald Trump's government. He'd called the Trump government "inept" and "incompetent". The alleged leak has "damaged UK international relations", Neil Basu, Assistant Commissioner of the Metropolitan Police, said.

column2: World no. 7 Halep beats 7-time champ Serena to win maiden Wimbledon
column3: World number seven Simona Halep on Saturday defeated seven-time champion Serena Williams 6-2, 6-2 in the women's singles final to clinch her first-ever Wimbledon title. With this, the 27-year-old became the first Romanian to win the Wimbledon singles' title. Meanwhile, 23-time Grand Slam champion Serena has now lost each of her previous three Grand Slam finals.

column2: Kangana gives 24-hour ultimatum to Journalists' Guild to withdraw ban
column3: Actor Kangana Ranaut has sent a legal notice to Entertainment Journalists' Guild, demanding that the ban imposed on coverage of matters related to her be lifted within 24 hours. The Guild had boycotted Kangana Ranaut after she accused a journalist of "running a smear campaign" against her. Press Club of India had also backed Guild’s decision to ban her.

column2: Yuvraj, Kohli lend support to De Villiers over World Cup controversy
column3: Cricketers Yuvraj Singh and Virat Kohli took to Instagram to lend support to ex-South Africa captain AB de Villiers, who broke silence over 2019 World Cup selection controversy. "There was never a chance for SA in World Cup to win without you," wrote Yuvraj. "Seeing people enter your personal space has been sad to see and uncalled for," Kohli said.

column2: Apple HQ valued at $4.17 bn; one of world's costliest buildings
column3: Apple's doughnut-shaped headquarters in Cupertino, California, nicknamed 'spaceship', was valued at about $4.17 billion in a recent assessment, making it one of the world's most expensive buildings. The 2.8 million-square-foot headquarters was constructed for about $5 billion. Based on the valuation, Apple would be required to pay over $40 million in property taxes per year in California.

column2: 5 more rebel MLAs move SC over Speaker not accepting resignations
column3: Five more Karnataka Congress MLAs, who had submitted their resignations, approached the Supreme Court on Saturday against Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar for not accepting the resignations. The MLAs alleged they were "being forced to support the government on the threat of disqualification". Earlier, 10 rebel Congress-JD(S) MLAs had approached the top court, which'll continue hearing the matter on July 16.

column2: Please practice how to wield broom in private: Omar to Hema Malini
column3: Reacting to the video of BJP MP Hema Malini sweeping the Parliament premises for 'Swachh Bharat Mission', ex-J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah tweeted, "Ma'am, please practice how to wield the broom in private before your next photo op." "This technique you've employed won't contribute much to improving cleanliness in Mathura (or anywhere else for that matter)," he added.

column2: New Zealanders hand over weapons after Christchurch mosque attacks
column3: People in New Zealand handed over their weapons in the first round of a buyback scheme on Saturday. The government had banned military-style semi-automatic weapons following the shootings in March at two mosques in Christchurch in which 51 people were killed. Authorities paid over NZ$433,600 (nearly ₹2 crore) in compensation to 169 firearms owners, who handed over 224 weapons.

column2: Sleep with loaded gun: Journo after she accused Trump of sex assault
column3: Journalist E Jean Carroll, who accused US President Donald Trump of sexually assaulting her, has said that she sleeps with a loaded gun by the bed, following the accusation. Carroll added that she has received death threats on social media and now stays offline. She said she decided to come forward with the accusation after the #MeToo movement gathered prominence.

column2: Hafiz Saeed challenges terror financing cases against him in Pak
column3: Jamaat-ud-Dawa chief and 26/11 Mumbai attacks mastermind Hafiz Saeed and his aides have challenged the cases of terror financing against them in the Lahore High Court. "The Indian lobby made allegations against them (Saeed and others) that they are involved in Mumbai attacks but there is no such evidence," their petition read. They argued that they're not associated with Lashkar-e-Taiba.

column2: If my replacement needs 1 yr to be mentored, I don't want them: Puri
column3: HDFC Bank Managing Director Aditya Puri, who retires in October 2020, on Friday said that his successor should be able to learn his job in 15 days. "If my replacement wants to be mentored for one year, I don't want that replacement," he said. Puri is India's longest-serving bank chief, having helmed HDFC Bank since its inception in 1994.

column2: My daughter doesn't consider me 'woke' enough: Raghuram Rajan
column3: Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan has said that he would call himself a feminist but his daughter feels that he falls short on many dimensions. "There is this term 'woke' that is very popular these days, but she doesn't consider me woke enough," the 56-year-old said. "So, I have to pay attention to what she has to say," he added.

column2: Foreign investors ask India to reconsider high taxes after Budget
column3: Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) have urged Indian government to reconsider its decision to increase taxes on them. Budget documents revealed the new tax will apply not just for individuals but also for FPIs setup as trusts to invest in Indian markets. About 40% of roughly 9,400 FPIs are reportedly registered as trusts while the rest are registered as corporates.

column2: Would like to have Rahane at the No. 4 slot: Ex-BCCI Secretary
column3: Former BCCI Secretary Sanjay Jagdale said that he would like to have Ajinkya Rahane at the number four slot in the Indian batting lineup. "[H]e has been performing well outside the sub-continent. So why can't you have somebody like Rahane just to ensure that you play out the 50 overs when situations get tight?" Jagdale added.

column2: One of my favourite matches ever: Federer on win vs Nadal
column3: Speaking after his win over Rafael Nadal in 2019's Wimbledon semi-final, Swiss tennis player Roger Federer said, "It's definitely going to go down as one of my favourite matches to look back on because it's Rafa, it's at Wimbledon." This was the pair's 40th career meeting to move into his 31st Grand Slam final where he will face Novak Djokovic.

column2: Kane Williamson is New Zealand's greatest: Ian Smith
column3: Kiwi commentator Ian Smith praised New Zealand captain Kane Williamson's batting and his leadership quality, terming the 28-year-old 'New Zealand's greatest player'. "I think even Martin [Crowe] would have acknowledged that Kane is pretty special, and it's hard to deny that," Smith said about the late former New Zealand captain Martin Crowe.

column2: I don't feel sorry for Rayudu, Karthik: Former BCCI Secretary
column3: Speaking about India's team selection for the World Cup 2019, former BCCI Secretary Sanjay Jagdale said, "I don't feel sorry for Rayudu. Rayudu, Karthik; they had enough chances." "I feel sorry for somebody like Manish Pandey. Shreyas Iyer, too, was unfortunate... They were backing the wrong players," Jagdale added about the Indian team selection.

column2: Samsung working on foldable AR glasses, suggests patent
column3: South Korean technology giant Samsung has filed a patent for foldable Augmented Reality (AR) glasses with thick frames to accommodate its electronic components. The current design, as explained by Samsung, is an eyepiece that automatically switches on whenever it's unfolded. Samsung is planning to use magnetic sensors to restrict the glasses from being folded unintentionally.

column2: Microsoft may make Windows 10 password-free by 2020
column3: Microsoft has started testing a way to sign in to its Windows 10 operating system without using a password, which it may reportedly enforce by 2020. The software giant is planning to replace passwords with face recognition, PIN or fingerprint authentication over the relatively high security offered by these methods. The test presently has the password-less method as optional.

column2: US court dismisses Oracle lawsuit over $10-bn Pentagon contract
column3: A US federal court has dismissed Oracle's lawsuit against the US Department of Defence's decade-long $10-billion JEDI cloud contract. The lawsuit had alleged the Pentagon's contract with a single-vendor award was unfair and illegal. Oracle, which didn't meet the criteria for a bid, had claimed the contract violates federal procurement laws and is 'unfairly tainted' by conflicts of interests.

column2: $73-million NASA contract to 3D print spacecraft parts in orbit
column3: NASA has awarded an over $73-million contract to Silicon Valley-based startup Made In Space to demonstrate the ability of a small spacecraft, Archinaut One, to 3D print spacecraft components in low-Earth orbit. The spacecraft will print two beams extending 32 feet out from each side of the spacecraft, NASA said. It could launch as early as 2022, it added.

column2: Policeman arrested with 750 gms of heroin in J&K's Kupwara
column3: The Jammu and Kashmir Police have arrested a policeman and seized 750 grams of heroin from his possession in Kupwara district. The police, during a routine check, seized the heroin concealed in a polythene bag from the policeman. On June 29, Narcotics and Affairs of Border (NAB) police seized drugs worth ₹100 crore in Manipur.

column2: 2 peddlers with brown sugar worth ₹50,000 held in Kolkata
column3: The Narcotics team of the Kolkata Police arrested two drug peddlers from Darga road area on Friday and seized 50 grams of brown sugar worth ₹50,000 from their possession. According to the police, after the arrest, the duo confessed that their prime customers were students. The police said that the details of the affected students will be collected for counselling.

column2: Politician, journo among 26 killed in terror attack on Somalia hotel
column3: A local politician, a journalist, three Kenyans, two Americans and one Briton were among 26 people killed in a terror attack on a hotel in Somalia, officials said. Gunmen stormed the hotel in the Kismayo city after a suicide bomber rammed a car loaded with explosives into the building on Friday. Al-Qaeda-linked al-Shabaab group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

column2: FTC approves $5B Facebook fine; its largest on a tech firm: Reports
column3: The US Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has approved a roughly $5-billion fine on Facebook to settle its investigation on privacy leaks by the social media giant, reports claimed. If approved by the US Justice Department, the fine would be the largest-ever by FTC on a technology firm. Facebook's stocks rose by about 1.8% after reports of the settlement.

column2: Bitcoin miners steal $3-million electricity in China; 22 arrested
column3: East China police have busted a ring of illegal bitcoin miners who stole nearly $3-million worth of electricity for mining the digital currency, state news agency Xinhua reported. The police found the criminal gang had rented nine factories with installed mining equipment after a two-month investigation and arrested 22 people. They also confiscated around 4,000 mining devices.

column2: Rajasthan govt can fall at anytime: BJP MLA amid K'taka crisis
column3: Amid crisis over Congress MLAs resigning in Karnataka and Goa, Rajasthan BJP MLA Kalicharan Saraf said, "The infighting between (CM Ashok) Gehlot and (Sachin) Pilot has endangered the government and it can fall anytime." Another BJP MLA Ashok Lahoti said, "There'll be political instability in Rajasthan in two months." Congress' Shakuntala Rawat rejected the claims, calling it "BJP's pipe dreams".

column2: Trying to stay in Cong, need some time to decide: Rebel K'taka MLA
column3: After Congress leader DK Shivakumar and Karnataka Deputy CM G Parameshwara visited rebel MLA MTB Nagaraj's house on Saturday, Nagaraj said, "I'm trying to stay back in [Congress]. I resigned because I had differences." He further said he has asked the party to give him some time as he needs to discuss the issue with another rebel MLA K Sudhakar.

column2: Shabaash: Smriti Irani shares meme on working weekends
column3: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Saturday took to Instagram to share a meme on working weekends. The meme shows a picture of Aamir Khan from movie 'Dangal', saying, "Shabaash" and her caption read, "When you tell the weekend...agle hafte aana aaj busy hu (come next week, today I'm busy)." Replying to her post, Ekta Kapoor wrote, "Waah wat weekend!"

column2: 3 dead in massive fire at rubber factory in Delhi's Jhilmil
column3: At least three people died after a massive fire broke out at a factory in Delhi's Jhilmil industrial area on Saturday, Chief fire officer Atul Garg said. A team of 26 fire tenders was rushed to the spot to extinguish the fire. The factory is reportedly housed in a building that consists of a ground floor and three upper floors.

column2: No intrusion by Chinese soldiers in Ladakh's Demchok: Army Chief
column3: Amid reports of some Chinese soldiers crossing the Line of Actual Control on Dalai Lama's birthday on July 6, Indian Army Chief General Bipin Rawat said, "There is no intrusion." He added, "Celebrations were going on our side by our Tibetans in Demchok sector...Some Chinese also came to see what was happening. But there have been no intrusions. Everything's normal."

column2: Out on bail in murder case, man beheads 2 kids in Jharkhand
column3: A 35-year-old man was arrested for allegedly beheading an 11-year-old boy and a 10-year-old girl in Latehar district, the Jharkhand police said on Friday. The accused, who reportedly showed signs of mental illness, had allegedly killed his brother-in-law and uncle in 2009 and was currently on bail. Meanwhile, the bodies of the two children were handed over to their families.

column2: Brazil President Bolsonaro invites son to be ambassador to US
column3: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has invited his son Eduardo to become the country's next ambassador to the US. Denying that it was an act of nepotism, Bolsonaro said, "It's not up to me, it's up to my son to accept and then he'll be subject to Senate approval." Eduardo Bolsonaro is currently serving as a congressman.

column2: India's overseas debt plan has enormous risks and no benefit: Rajan
column3: Ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan warned that India's plan to issue bonds overseas has enormous risks but no real benefit. Rajan added India should worry about short-term "faddish investors, buying when India is hot, and dumping us when it's not". He said the lower dollar interest rate is offset in the long run by higher principal repayments as the rupee depreciates.

column2: 60 birds fall from sky in suspected poisoning in Australia
column3: Nearly 60 birds have died after falling from the sky in a suspected case of poisoning in Adelaide, Australia. Most of the birds killed were long-billed corellas, which is a protected species. "They couldn't fly any more, they were bleeding out of their mouths," Sarah King, the founder of Casper's Bird Rescue, said.

column2: Will be appointed minister when they need me: MP BSP MLA
column3: Replying to a question on whether she is unhappy for not being made a minister in the Madhya Pradesh government, BSP MLA Ramabai said, "They will do it when they will need me." She added, "CM Kamal Nath is a good person...Despite me being ill-treated I am with him." Earlier, she'd claimed she was offered a ministerial berth by BJP.

column2: Karnataka rebel MLAs visit Sai Baba temple in Shirdi
column3: The rebel Karnataka MLAs on Saturday visited Sai Baba temple in Shirdi. The rebel MLAs are staying at a hotel in Mumbai after resigning and withdrawing support to the Congress-JD(S) coalition government in Karnataka. On Thursday, the rebel MLAs met the Karnataka Assembly Speaker to submit their resignations in Bengaluru but returned to the hotel the same day.

column2: E-commerce solutions startup Ace Turtle raises ₹27cr: Report
column3: Bengaluru-based e-commerce solutions startup Ace Turtle has reportedly raised ₹27 crore in a pre-Series B funding round from existing investor Vertex Ventures and a new private equity investor. Founded by Berry Singh and Nitin Chhabra, Ace Turtle provides end-to-end e-commerce solutions ranging from order processing to last-mile delivery. It has raised over ₹60 crore to date, as per Crunchbase.

column2: 2 die, several injured after bus gutted in fire in Haryana
column3: At least two people died and several others were injured after a double-decker bus caught fire in Haryana's Kurukshetra. "At least 14-15 people were admitted to our hospital, two among them were critically injured and the rest were given proper treatment," a hospital official said. On Thursday, five people were killed in a car accident near Punjab's Jalandhar.

column2: Surgical strikes showed India's political resolve: Army Chief
column3: Army Chief General Bipin Rawat said that surgical strikes after the 2016 Uri attack and 2019 Pulwama attack have demonstrated India's political resolve against terror. Speaking at an event on the 20th year of the Kargil conflict, he added that any act of terror will not go "unpunished". He said any misadventure will be repelled with a "punitive response".

column2: 3 people murdered inside building compound in Navi Mumbai
column3: Three people were found murdered inside a building compound in Navi Mumbai on Saturday morning, said the police. The deceased have been identified as 20-year-old Irshad Sheikh, 14-year-old Naushad Sheikh and 28-year-old Rajesh. The deceased used to work in the scrap business and the police suspect that they were killed with a sharp weapon.

column2: US Labour Secretary resigns amid row over Epstein sex crimes case
column3: US' Labour Secretary Alexander Acosta has resigned amid controversy about his handling of a 2008 sex crimes case involving multimillionaire Jeffrey Epstein when he was a US attorney. Epstein was jailed for 13 months, although he was allowed to leave during the day to work at his office. Acosta is accused of not notifying Epstein's victims of the arrangement.

column2: Upskill with the Cybersecurity program from Stanford faculty
column3: According to a NASSCOM report, 1 million cybersecurity professionals would be needed in India by 2020. Working professionals can meet this demand with Stanford Center's Professional Development's Advanced Computer Security Program, delivered & supported by Great Learning. The 6-month online program delivers industry-relevant skills through project-based and mentor-driven learning. Participants will receive a certificate from Stanford Center for Professional Development.

column2: Audience didn't like 'Kalank' as it was a bad film: Varun Dhawan
column3: Talking about his film 'Kalank', actor Varun Dhawan said, "It (Kalank) was not accepted by the audience because it was a bad film and somewhere we all failed collectively." Asserting it was wrong to blame just the director and producer of the film, Varun added, "Being a part of the team, I will take part of the blame as well."

column2: Shocked by abusive language for media: Press Club criticises Kangana
column3: Press Club of India has condemned Kangana Ranaut's argument with a journalist at 'Judgementall Hai Kya' promotional event. Reacting to her video calling journalists "deshdrohi", it said, the club is shocked with the actress using "uncivilised, uncultured, filthy and abusive language" against media persons. The club extended support to Entertainment Journalists' Guild who decided to boycott her.

column2: John Cena shares meme showing Shilpa as ex-WWE wrestler, she responds
column3: John Cena on Friday shared a meme, which shows actress Shilpa Shetty's face morphed onto the body of former WWE wrestler Steve Austin, better known by the ring name 'Stone Cold'. "Stone Cold Shilpa Shetty Kundra", the caption in the meme reads. Shilpa reposted the meme and wrote, "This is hilarious... I certainly 'Didn't SEE' this coming @johncena."

column2: Dubbed a scene in Lion King twice as Aryan and I sounded alike: SRK
column3: Talking about dubbing along with his son Aryan Khan for the Hindi version of 'The Lion King', Shah Rukh Khan said he had to re-dub a scene as they both "sounded too much like each other". He further said he never thought they sounded alike. "It was a sweet thing for a father to know...extremely special and heart-warming," he added.

column2: Neesham urges Indian fans to resell final tickets on official platform
column3: After the unofficial resale price of tickets for World Cup final reached ₹14 lakh, New Zealand all-rounder Jimmy Neesham urged Indian cricket fans to resell their tickets via official platform. "I know it's tempting to try to make...large profit but please give all genuine cricket fans a chance to go," he tweeted. Indian fans bought 41% tickets for Lord’s final.

column2: MS Dhoni may join BJP after retirement: Ex-Union Minister
column3: Amid speculations on MS Dhoni's retirement from cricket, BJP leader and former Union Minister Sanjay Paswan said the cricketer may join BJP after retirement. "Dhoni is my friend, he is a player of world fame and there have been discussions on bringing him into the party fold," he stated. The decision will be taken only after his retirement, Paswan added.

column2: Sehwag's wife accuses business partners of forging sign for ₹4.5cr loan
column3: Ex-India cricketer Virender Sehwag's wife Aarti has filed a fraud complaint against her business partners alleging they took a loan of ₹4.5 crore by forging her signature. She also alleged they later defaulted on payment. Aarti, a partner in an agro-based company, named eight of her business partners in the complaint. The police have filed an FIR against the accused.

column2: Confident of winning trust vote, BJP has black sheep: Siddaramaiah
column3: After Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy called for a floor test amid the ongoing political crisis in the Congress-JD(S) coalition government, Congress leader Siddaramaiah said, "We are confident. That is why we are moving a vote of confidence motion." He added, "The BJP is afraid because they know there are black sheep in their party."

column2: VW to put $2.6 bn in Ford-backed self-driving startup Argo
column3: German multinational automaker Volkswagen is investing $2.6 billion in capital and assets into Ford-backed self-driving startup Argo AI, at a valuation of over $7 billion, the startup revealed. The deal is part of a broader alliance between the German automaker and US-based Ford, which covers autonomous and electric vehicles. Ford had invested $1 billion in Argo AI two years ago.

column2: Army jawan held for leaking confidential info to Pak woman
column3: An Army jawan from Haryana has been arrested for allegedly leaking confidential information on national security to a woman on Facebook. The jawan, who'd shared the location of his unit and photographs of rifles used by Army, was nabbed after police got a tip-off about the matter. The woman, believed to be from Pakistan, had deposited ₹5,000 in his account.

column2: Punjab CM Amarinder Singh's 75-yr-old wife faints at cleanup drive
column3: Patiala MP and Punjab Chief Minister Amarinder Singh's wife, Preneet Kaur, fainted at the plastic cleanup campaign 'Swachhta Shramdan' drive in her constituency on Saturday, officials said. She later got her blood pressure checked, which a doctor said was fine. "I urge all of you to join this movement and help us make our surroundings cleaner," she tweeted.

column2: MP govt transfers police dogs, handlers; 3 dogs shifted to CM's house
column3: Madhya Pradesh government has issued an order transferring 46 police dog handlers across the state along with their canines. Handlers of tracker, sniffer and narco dogs from 23 Battalion Dog Squad have been given new postings in different districts, it stated. Three sniffers, one each from Chhindwara, Satna and Betul, have been shifted to CM Kamal Nath's house in Bhopal.

column2: Indian pilots taking to Rafale amazing: French Air Force Chief
column3: Following the Indo-French Garuda VI exercise held at a French air base, French Air Force Chief of Staff General Philippe Lavigne said, "Indian pilots taking to Rafale jets during the Indo-French Garuda VI exercise was amazing." Lavigne added, "After two or three flights, it feels very comfortable and the feedback I've gotten from the squadron says 'Wow'."

column2: Pak removes pro-Khalistani from Kartarpur panel after India objects
column3: Ahead of the second round of India-Pakistan meeting on Kartarpur Corridor on Sunday, Pakistan's federal cabinet removed pro-Khalistani leader Gopal Singh Chawla, a Pakistan Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (PSGPC) member, from his post. The cabinet reconstituted PSGPC, thereby dropping Chawla from the panel. The talk was originally scheduled for April 2 but India objected to Chawla being part of the project.

column2: Student stabbed at Kerala University campus, triggering protests
column3: A third-year BA Political Science student named Akhil was stabbed inside the Kerala University campus in Thiruvananthapuram on Friday. Akhil and his assailants reportedly belonged to Students' Federation of India, which is a student organisation affiliated to CPI(M). Following the incident, Akhil was rushed to the hospital while students held protests demanding justice.

column2: MP govt issues transfer order for Panchayat head instead of secy
column3: A transfer order was released for Panchayat Sarpanch instead of the Panchayat Secretary by administration in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa district. The state's Rural Development Minister Kamleshwar Patel called it a "clerical mistake" at lower level. Notably, Sarpanch is elected by the people and is not entitled to be transferred by the state government.

column2: Video shows Trump kissing ex-aide; his team says it 'wasn't forceful'
column3: US President Donald Trump's legal team shared a three-year-old video of him kissing ex-campaign aide Alva Johnson, who accused Trump of kissing her forcibly and without consent. Trump's lawyer said the video shows an "innocent interaction that's mutual and not forcible". However, Johnson's lawyer said that the video shows exactly what his client alleged "an unwanted kiss from Defendant Trump".

column2: US officer mistakes 17-yr-old girl's fake gun as real, shoots her dead
column3: US' California police on Friday released body-camera footage showing an officer shooting dead a 17-year-old girl after he mistakes her fake gun as real. The video shows the girl pointing the fake gun at the officer after he chased and stopped her from driving her vehicle at high speed. The video shows her pleading for help after being shot.

column2: IBM patents smartwatch that can transform into a tablet
column3: American multinational IT giant IBM has secured a patent for a smartwatch that can be transformed into a tablet. IBM, in the patent, explained this may be achieved as "a set of auxiliary display panels may be packed in layers behind a primary display panel." The patent revealed the inventor of the technology as Ranjeeth Pasupathi from Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu.

column2: 2 arrested for allegedly poaching blackbuck in Maharashtra
column3: The Maharashtra Police on Friday arrested two people for allegedly poaching a blackbuck in Aurangabad. "We received a tip-off that a few people were planning to cook the meat of blackbuck and have a party," an official said. The police recovered carcass of the blackbuck, sharp knife and liquor bottles after reaching the spot, while three accused fled the scene.

column2: 6 killed, over 4 lakh affected due to floods in Assam
column3: Six people died and over four lakh have been affected as the Assam flood situation worsened with rivers flowing above the danger level, officials said. NDRF and SDRF teams have been deployed and temporary relief camps have been set up to shelter flood-hit people, officials added. CM Sarbananda Sonowal instructed the officials to step up operations to rescue flood-affected people.

column2: 4 held, 1,400 kg cannabis worth over ₹1.5 cr seized in Vizag
column3: Excise officials along with police arrested four people and recovered 1,400 kilograms of cannabis worth over ₹1.5 crore in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam. Based on credible information, the police caught hold of two vans which were carrying potatoes, inside which the cannabis was sealed. The police also seized two mobile phones and ₹4,800 cash from the arrested persons.

column2: Trinamool Congress leader shot dead in Bengal's Murshidabad
column3: A Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader was shot dead by some unidentified assailants in West Bengal's Murshidabad district on Friday, police said. The leader was travelling in his car when miscreants surrounded the vehicle, forced him to alight and fatally shot him. The police later reached the site of the crime and took possession of the body.

column2: Gadkari inaugurates underpass to ease traffic to Delhi airport
column3: Union Minister of Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari on Friday inaugurated a three-lane underpass at Parade Road junction near Manekshaw Centre on the Dhaula Kuan-Airport stretch on National Highway-8. According to officials from the National Highways Authority of India, travel from the Delhi airport to Dhaula Kuan will become signal-free with the opening of the underpass.

column2: State Bank of India MD Anshula Kant named MD and CFO of World Bank
column3: State Bank of India Managing Director (MD) Anshula Kant has been appointed as the MD and Chief Financial Officer of the World Bank Group. Kant is a graduate in Economics Honours from Lady Shri Ram College for Women and holds a masters degree in economics from Delhi School of Economics. The 58-year-old joined SBI as a probationary officer in 1983.

column2: Roger Federer defeats Rafael Nadal to reach his 12th Wimbledon final
column3: Eight-time champion Roger Federer defeated his long-time rival Rafael Nadal in their first meeting at Wimbledon after 11 years to reach the final for the 12th time. The 37-year-old won the match with a scoreline of 7-6(7-3), 1-6, 6-3, 6-4 in 3 hours and 2 minutes. Federer will face world number one Novak Djokovic in the final on Sunday.

column2: Had dent on my back, never felt pain like that: Kim on Met dress
column3: Reality television personality Kim Kardashian revealed in an interview that she got indentations on her back and her stomach due to the dress she wore at the 2019 Met Gala. Kim added that she had to take breathing lessons in order to wear the dress. "I have never felt pain like that in my life," Kardashian further said.

column2: Badshah's 'Paagal' gets 75 mn views in 24 hrs, breaks world record
column3: The video of rapper Badshah's new song 'Paagal' has become the most watched video on YouTube in 24 hours, after crossing 75 million views in a day. It broke the previous record set by K-Pop group BTS' video of 'Boy With Luv', which received 74.6 million views. Paagal, released on July 10, has received over 82 million views.

column2: Vivek posts meme on Indian fans after World Cup exit, gets criticised
column3: Vivek Oberoi has been criticised on Twitter for posting a GIF, captioned, "This is what happened to Indian fans in WC semi-finals!" In the GIF, a man can be seen advancing towards a woman for a hug but she ignores him and hugs another man. "Mr Oberoi, be mature otherwise people will always take you lightly," a user tweeted.

column2: Who were India's top run-scorers, wicket-takers in 2019 World Cup?
column3: Rohit Sharma top-scored for India in 2019 World Cup with 648 runs in nine innings, while captain Virat Kohli followed him with 443 runs. KL Rahul ended as India's third highest-scorer with 361 runs. Pacer Jasprit Bumrah took 18 wickets in nine matches to finish as India's highest wicket-taker. He was followed by pacer Mohammad Shami (14 wickets, four matches).

column2: Gilchrist calls Vaughan idiot for mocking Australia's bonding session
column3: Ex-Australia wicketkeeper Adam Gilchrist called ex-England captain Michael Vaughan an "idiot" after the latter suggested that Australia should try bowling barefoot against England. Vaughan had made the comment mocking Australia over their team bonding session wherein they had walked barefoot in the stadium ahead of the semi-final. Responding to Gilchrist, Vaughan shared a GIF showing bare feet.

column2: Heartbreaking that our dreams have come to an end: KL Rahul
column3: Following Team India's World Cup exit, KL Rahul took to Instagram to express his gratitude to the fans. "Heartbreaking that our dreams have come to an end. As a team and as a nation we've stood strong together through the last 6 weeks. Big thank you and lots of love to everyone," Rahul wrote.

column2: Why even talk about MS Dhoni’s retirement: Javed Akhtar
column3: Reacting to speculation about MS Dhoni's retirement, lyricist Javed Akhtar said there's still a lot of cricket left in ex-India captain. "As a middle-order batsman or a wicketkeeper, MS Dhoni's totally dependable and trustworthy. Virat is graceful enough to accept that Dhoni's understanding of game is an advantage for the team...Why even talk about his retirement?" he tweeted.

column2: Barcelona sign Griezmann from Atlético Madrid for ₹926 crore
column3: Barcelona have signed World Cup-winning French forward Antoine Griezmann from Atlético Madrid for $135 million (₹926 crore) on a five-year deal. The 28-year-old had rejected a move to Barcelona last year but announced in May that he was leaving the Madrid side, where he spent last five seasons since signing from Real Sociedad in 2014.

column2: 18-yr-old Kashmir cricketer gets hit on neck by ball in match, dies
column3: Jahangir Ahmad War, an 18-year-old cricketer, died after being hit by a ball on his neck while batting during a match between Baramulla and Budgam under-19 teams. War, a Class 11 student, was attempting a pull shot when he got hit and collapsed. Jammu and Kashmir Governor Satya Pal Malik has announced ₹5 lakh as ex-gratia to War's family.

column2: Casio sues Snapdeal over alleged sale of its fake products
column3: Japanese consumer electronics giant Casio has sued Gurugram-based e-commerce startup Snapdeal and sellers on the platform over an alleged sale of its counterfeit products. The Tis Hazari court has restrained Snapdeal and the other accused parties from selling, displaying and advertising goods with the Casio trademark. "Casio has...extended its battle against the fakes on the internet," Casio said.

column2: 15 dead, 133 buildings collapse in 4 days due to rain in UP
column3: As many as 15 people have lost their lives and 133 buildings have collapsed from July 9 to 12 due to rain-related incidents in 14 districts of Uttar Pradesh. According to official data, 23 animals were also killed in the affected districts, which include Prayagraj and Gorakhpur. Heavy rainfall in East Uttar Pradesh is expected on Saturday, according to IMD.

column2: SC refuses to stay installation of CCTV cameras in Delhi govt schools
column3: The Supreme Court on Friday refused to put a stay on the installation of CCTV cameras in government schools in Delhi and live-stream the footage to students' parents. The court's order came on a PIL wherein the petitioner argued the installation would violate the fundamental right to privacy of students, especially girls, as well as female teachers.

column2: SC allows calling off rescue ops for trapped miners in Meghalaya
column3: The Supreme Court on Friday allowed the Meghalaya government to call off rescue operations to retrieve the remains of 13 coal miners who were trapped in an illegally operated rat-hole coal mine in December 2018. Families of the trapped miners had given their consent to call off the rescue operations in May. Two bodies had been recovered so far.

column2: Child Sex Ratio has declined in 21 states/UTs: Smriti Irani
column3: Women and Child Development Minister Smriti Irani in Lok Sabha on Friday stated that as per the Census 2011, the Child Sex Ratio (CSR) has declined in 21 states and Union Territories in comparison of Census 2001. She further stated that India's Sex Ratio at Birth (SRB) has increased from 923 to 931 between 2015-16 and 2018-19.

column2: 'Paan ki dukaan' has done well: IndiGo's Bhatia responds to Gangwal
column3: Reacting to IndiGo Co-Founder Rakesh Gangwal's comment that a "paan ki dukaan" would've handled things better than IndiGo, fellow Co-Founder Rahul Bhatia said, "Paan Ki Dukaan has apparently done well and continues to do well." "Gangwal's allegations about lack of corporate governance are much ado about nothing," Bhatia added. Gangwal asked SEBI to take away Bhatia's "unusual" controlling rights.

column2: FIFA doubles ban to 10 games for racist behaviour
column3: Football's governing body FIFA is set to double the minimum ban for player incidents involving racism to 10 games. Additionally, a football match will be forfeited by the team if their supporters are found to be guilty of racist and other discriminatory behaviours. FIFA also expanded the scope of what is to be considered discriminatory behaviour.

column2: Sports Minister takes up #BottleCapChallenge to promote fitness
column3: Sports Minister Kiren Rijiju took to social media to share a video of himself attempting the viral #BottleCapChallenge. "Say no to drugs and stay fit. Take #BottleCapChallenge into positive stride", Rijiju wrote while sharing his video. The challenge requires one to open a bottle's cap using their foot in the middle of a kick without knocking the bottle down.

column2: Lucky to get direct hit: Guptill on Dhoni run-out in semi
column3: New Zealand opener Martin Guptill, who ran MS Dhoni out in 2019 World Cup semi-final, said, "Lucky enough to get a direct hit from out there, lucky...he was out of his ground." Guptill hit the stumps directly from short fine leg area when Dhoni was trying to take a second run. India required 25 runs when Dhoni got out.

column2: 'Robot umpires' make debut at Atlantic League All-Star game
column3: A "robot" umpire made its debut officiating at the Atlantic League All-Star Game. The home plate umpire Brian deBrauwere had a phone in his back pocket that was connected to the ball-tracking 'TrackMan' system and a headphone, through which deBrauwere heard the system's calls and signalled accordingly. The umpire can override the system if he disagrees with it.

column2: Hackers steal over ₹222 crore from Tokyo crypto exchange
column3: Tokyo-based cryptocurrency exchange Bitpoint has suspended its services after it discovered hackers have stolen about 3.5 billion yen (over ₹222 crore) in various digital currencies. About 2.5 billion yen (about ₹159 crore) of the missing currency was customer funds while the rest was owned by Remixpoint, which operates the exchange. Remixpoint said it would compensate customers for the losses.

column2: Govt sold driving licence data to private companies: Surjewala
column3: Citing a news report, Congress chief spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said that the government has sold people's driving licence data to private companies. He added that the privacy of citizens has become a "severe casualty" under the BJP government. Surjewala said, "Not only Big Brother is watching, but his crony friends are too!"

column2: Maoists set ablaze 16 vehicles, assault 6 in Jharkhand
column3: Maoists set ablaze 16 vehicles at a railway siding and also assaulted six labourers in Jharkhand's Latehar, police said on Friday. The denial of levy from the area is said to be the reason for the attack as coal transportation is done from the railway siding. Following the attack, coal transportation has been stopped from the railway siding.

column2: 13-year-old suicide bomber kills 5 at wedding in Afghanistan
column3: At least five people were killed and 40 others were injured after a 13-year-old suicide bomber blew himself up at a wedding in Afghanistan's Nangarhar province on Friday, officials said. The wedding was organised by Malik Toor, commander of a pro-government militia. Toor died in the attack and was likely the target of the bomber.

column2: Stupid stories: Boney on IPS officer implying Sridevi was murdered
column3: Producer Boney Kapoor has reacted to IPS officer Rishiraj Singh's insinuation that Kapoor's wife Sridevi was murdered. "Such stupid stories keep coming. This is somebody's figment of imagination," he said. Singh claimed that a forensics expert friend thought Sridevi didn't die of accidental drowning in her bathtub as according to him, a person will never drown in one-foot deep water.

column2: Roy calls umpire's decision 'f***ing embarrassing', fined 30% fee
column3: England opener Jason Roy was fined 30% of his match fee after he argued with the umpires and refused to leave the pitch after being wrongly given out in England's 2019 semi-final victory over Australia. The 28-year-old was heard yelling, "That's f***ing embarrassing," to umpires. He was given caught behind out despite the gloves and bat not touching the ball.

column2: Ticketless Team India stranded in England until World Cup final
column3: After being knocked out by New Zealand from 2019 World Cup in semi-final, India players have been left stranded in England till July 14 as team management failed to procure tickets immediately. The players will arrive in India in batches as and when they get tickets, an official said. India-New Zealand semi-final took place on July 9 and 10.

column2: Rashid named Afghanistan captain across formats, Asghar his deputy
column3: Twenty-year-old Rashid Khan has been appointed as captain of Afghanistan across all formats, while Asghar Afghan, who was sacked as captain ahead of World Cup, has been named as Rashid's deputy. Ahead of the 2019 World Cup, the Afghanistan Cricket Board had replaced Asghar Afghan as captain with Gulbadin Naib in ODIs, Rashid in T20Is and Rahmat Shah in Tests.

column2: Djokovic reaches his 6th Wimbledon final, to face Federer or Nadal
column3: Defending champion Novak Djokovic defeated Bautista Agut 6-2, 4-6, 6-3, 6-2 in two hours and 48 minutes on Friday to reach his sixth Wimbledon final. The 32-year-old will next face eight-time Wimbledon champion Roger Federer or two-time champion Rafael Nadal. The final will be Djokovic's 25th in Grand Slam history.

column2: Nagaland Police personnel march to 'Dhal Gaya Din' song
column3: A video of Nagaland Police personnel marching to the tunes of the Bollywood song 'Dhal Gaya Din' has gone viral on social media. Reacting to the video, Sports and Youth Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju said that "anything from (North East) means friendship and happy memories". "Aage jaake kya karega...peeche mur," he further wrote in a tweet.

column2: Don't play with fire: China warns US over Taiwan
column3: China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi has warned the US not to "play with fire" after the US approved a potential arms sale of an estimated $2.2 billion to Taiwan. The deal is for 108 Abrams tanks, 250 Stinger missiles and related equipment. China claims Taiwan as part of its territory, but the island has been autonomously ruled since 1949.

column2: Amazon invests ₹51 crore in India's Quess Corp at 50% premium
column3: Amazon has invested ₹51 crore in Indian business services provider Quess Corp for a 0.51% stake. Amazon invested the amount at a price of ₹676 per share, about 50% higher than Quess' Thursday closing price. The investment will be going into the company's subsidiary Qdigi Services, which provides after-sales services for smartphones and other electronic products and consumer durables.

column2: NCLAT to hear Dutch court administrator in Jet insolvency case
column3: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has agreed to hear a petition by a Dutch court-appointed administrator in the Jet Airways insolvency case and asked SBI to respond. It also stayed parts of NCLT order which declared the insolvency proceedings in the Netherlands court null and void. Meanwhile, the administrator agreed not to sell a confiscated Jet Airways plane.

column2: Brazil seeks WTO panel over India's sugar subsidies
column3: Brazil on Thursday said it had asked the World Trade Organization (WTO) to establish a panel aimed at resolving its dispute over India's sugar subsidies. Australia and Guatemala also lodged complaints against India on Thursday, Brazil said. The South American nation argues that Indian subsidies are distorting global sugar markets causing significant losses for Brazilian exporters.

column2: Deutsche CEO scolds staff who got ₹1 lakh suits fitted amid lay-offs
column3: Deutsche Bank CEO Christian Sewing said he personally scolded senior executives for having suit fittings at the London headquarters on the same day that thousands of their colleagues were fired. Two tailors carrying suit bags were spotted leaving the bank's premises. They were fitting suits, costing at least ₹1 lakh, for senior managers who weren't affected by the job cuts.

column2: India's retail inflation hits eight-month high of 3.18% in June
column3: India's retail inflation hit an eight-month high in June on higher food prices but stayed below the RBI's medium-term target of 4% for an eleventh straight month. Annual retail inflation in June was 3.18%, up from 3.05% the previous month. Food prices grew 2.17% during the month compared to 1.83% in May.

column2: Hamilton unhappy British GP being held same day as WC final
column3: Lewis Hamilton stated that he is unhappy with the scheduling of the upcoming British Grand Prix, which is scheduled for the same day as the World Cup 2019 and Wimbledon 2019 finals. "[S]uch a special weekend needs the focus of the whole country. People will be switching between channels on Sunday not knowing what to watch," Hamilton said.

column2: Former England striker Peter Crouch retires from football at 38
column3: Former England football team striker Peter Crouch has retired from football at the age of 38. Crouch had made his debut with QPR before going on to play for nine clubs, including Liverpool, Portsmouth, Tottenham and Stoke. Notably, Crouch holds the record for the most headed goals in the history of the English Premier League.

column2: BCCI chief praises Team India for WC semi performance
column3: BCCI president CK Khanna on Thursday praised Indian cricket team for their 2019 World Cup semi-final performance saying, "It was a tough game...our boys played their hearts out. Each player tried really hard." "Team...played brilliant cricket in league phase...Congratulations to New Zealand team," he added. India crashed out after losing to New Zealand by 18 runs.

column2: Apple suspends development of its AR/VR headset: Report
column3: Apple has reportedly suspended the development of its head-mounted display (HMD) AR/VR headsets. The technology giant has already disbanded its team for the development of AR/VR HMDs, which has now been transferred to other product lines, as per a report. Earlier, reports had claimed Apple could launch its AR/VR glasses as early as 2020.

column2: Goa CM unhappy with ministers taking people for granted: Dy Speaker
column3: Discussing the possibility of a Cabinet reshuffle in Goa, Deputy Speaker Michael Lobo on Friday said, "The Chief Minister will do the correction that is needed." Lobo added, "The Chief Minister said he was unhappy with the functioning of certain ministers as they were taking people for granted. They were acting as if they were the government."

column2: TDP's Legislative Council member Annam Prabhakar joins BJP
column3: TDP's Andhra Pradesh Legislative Council member Annam Satish Prabhakar on Friday joined BJP in the presence of its working president Jagat Prakash Nadda. Prabhakar had recently resigned from TDP citing his failure to win Bapatla constituency in two consecutive Assembly elections. He thanked TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu for giving him the opportunity to contest from Bapatla.

column2: CollegeDekho acquires overseas admission consulting firm SFS
column3: Gurugram-based edtech startup CollegeDekho has acquired New Delhi-based overseas admission consulting firm Scholarship Facilitation Services (SFS) for an undisclosed amount. Started in 2012 by Manik Kubba, Umesh Sharma and Vikaas Wahi, SFS offers need-based, budget and university-based admission counselling. CollegeDekho was founded by Ruchir Arora, Rohit Saha, Saurabh Jain and Rajiv Singh.

column2: Mysterious black hole disc found 130 mn light-years away
column3: Astronomers using Hubble Space Telescope have found a thin disc of material encircling a supermassive black hole at the heart of a spiral galaxy 130 million light-years away. Astronomers said the presence of the black hole disc in "such a low-luminosity active galaxy" was surprising. The disc's material was measured to be spinning at over 10% the speed of light.

column2: Man held for posing as PMO official in Delhi
column3: A man, impersonating an official of Prime Minister's Office (PMO), was arrested by the Delhi Police on Friday. The man visited a showroom in Delhi on Thursday and tried posing as a PMO official to seek favours and threatened the salesmen. The man was taken into custody following a complaint by the manager of the showroom.

column2: Vikas Swarup appointed Secretary of Overseas Indian Affairs
column3: India's current High Commissioner to Canada Vikas Swarup has been appointed as Secretary in the Consular, Passport, Visa and Overseas Indian Affairs division, with effect from August 1. The 1986-batch IFS officer takes over from Sanjiv Arora, who was appointed to the post earlier this year. Swarup is a former spokesperson of the External Affairs Ministry.

column2: Naxal carrying ₹5L reward killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh
column3: A Naxal, carrying a reward of ₹5 lakh on his head, was killed in an encounter with personnel of District Reserve Guard in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada, police said on Friday. A huge cache of arms and ammunition was recovered along with his body, Dantewada Superintendent of Police added. On July 9, a woman Naxal was killed in an encounter in Sukma.

column2: 35 cattle found dead at temporary shelter in UP's Prayagraj
column3: Around 35 cattle were found dead at a temporary cow shelter home in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj. Prayagraj District Magistrate said, "Prima facie it appears that 35 cattle have died due to lightning." The incident came days after CM Yogi Adityanath directed officials to ensure that the cow sheds are self-reliant and all the facilities to protect them are available there.

column2: 4 lakh people volunteer to storm Area 51 'to see aliens'
column3: Over 4 lakh people have signed up for a Facebook event to "storm" Area 51 in Nevada, US, to "see aliens". There have been several conspiracy theories related to Area 51, most importantly those pertaining to the US government's cover-up of secrets related to UFOs and aliens. In 2013, the US government acknowledged Area 51 as a military site.

column2: AB de Villiers breaks silence on World Cup selection controversy
column3: Ex-South Africa captain AB de Villiers took to Twitter to break his silence on 2019 World Cup selection controversy. The 35-year-old said that he "made no demands at all" to overturn retirement and did not force his way into World Cup squad. Adding that he was unfairly described as arrogant, selfish and indecisive, De Villiers said, "My conscience is clear."

column2: Singer R Kelly arrested over 13 charges including child pornography
column3: R&B singer R Kelly has been arrested on 13 federal charges, including child pornography and obstruction of justice, in US' Chicago. This was the second time this year that the Grammy winner was arrested on the sex charges. In 2008, Kelly was acquitted of child pornography charges connected to a videotape of him allegedly having sex with an underage girl.

column2: Google admits private conversations being accessed via Assistant
column3: Google has admitted its contractors can listen to recordings of private conversations of users with its AI-based Assistant. This came after some of the recordings in the Dutch language were leaked. Google has said only 0.2% of all recordings are accessed by humans for transcription, and that all identifiable user information is delinked from the audio files.

column2: Suspended MLA, who danced with guns, expelled from BJP: Reports
column3: BJP reportedly expelled its suspended Uttarakhand MLA Pranav Singh Champion on Friday after a video showing him dancing with guns went viral on social media. Champion was earlier suspended from the party for three months for threatening a journalist. "BJP is a party which does not compromise on principles," party's state unit chief Ajay Bhatt had said.

column2: JD(U) leader hangs himself in Bihar police station's toilet
column3: JD(U) leader Ganesh Ravidas, detained in connection with a case of a minor girl's kidnapping, allegedly committed suicide by hanging himself inside a police station's toilet in Bihar's Nalanda district. Two police officers have been suspended after locals staged a protest outside the police station following the incident. An inquiry has been ordered into the 52-year-old's custodial death.

column2: Tiger Global to sell its 21% PolicyBazaar stake for $300M: Report
column3: American hedge fund Tiger Global is reportedly looking to sell its 21% stake in Gurugram-based insurance aggregator PolicyBazaar for $300 million at a $1.5-billion valuation. Softbank Vision Fund (SVF) and Chinese internet giant Tencent are reportedly among investors looking to buy the same. Tiger Global has reportedly invested about $60 million in PolicyBazaar's parent firm in past five years.

column2: Man asks for marriage certificate after 16 years, told to wed again
column3: A man seeking an attested marriage certificate from Sub-Registrar's office in Kerala's Kozhikode 16 years after he got married was asked to marry once again by officials. State Registration Minister G Sudhakaran revealed the officials made fun of him and asked him to wait for three days. The minister added that he has suspended four officials for the same.

column2: Andhra CM announces ₹2,000 crore for drought relief
column3: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy has announced a natural calamity fund of ₹2,000 crore to mitigate drought conditions and tackle drinking water scarcity in the state. Reddy added that ₹1 crore each will be given to all 175 Andhra MLAs to identify and take measures to solve the drinking water scarcity in their constituencies.

column2: India lifted 27.1 crore people out of poverty between 2006-16: UN
column3: India lifted 27.1 crore people out of poverty between 2006 and 2016, the UN Development Programme said in its 2019 global Multidimensional Poverty Index report. Among the four poorest states— Bihar, Jharkhand, Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh— Jharkhand made the most progress. Multi-dimensional poverty takes into consideration several indicators, including income, nutrition, and quality of work.

column2: Won't open our airspace until India removes its jets: Pakistan
column3: Pakistan's Aviation Secretary Shahrukh Nusrat has said the country won't open its airspace for Indian flights until India withdraws its fighter jets placed forward. He added that the "Indian government approached asking (them) to open the airspace". Pakistan closed its airspace in February after the Indian Air Force strike on a Jaish-e-Mohammed terror camp in Balakot.

column2: Turkey receives S-400 missile parts from Russia defying US warning
column3: Turkey on Friday received the first parts of the Russian S-400 air defence system, defying the US' warning against the purchase. The US has said that Turkey cannot have both the S-400 air defence system and US' F-35 fighter jets. The US claims that the Russian system could be used to analyse and collect intelligence on the F-35.

column2: You censorious thug: Journalist tells Pakistan's Foreign Minister
column3: Canadian journalist Ezra Levant criticised Pakistan's Foreign Minister Shah Mahmood Qureshi over censorship on Twitter, calling him a "censorious thug" at a conference in London. Levant claimed that Twitter had removed one of his tweets on the request of the Pakistani government. "You don't like free speech...shame on you," the journalist further told the Pakistani minister.

column2: SBI waives off IMPS charges for online fund transfers from Aug 1
column3: State Bank of India (SBI), the country's largest lender by assets, has decided to do away with charges on fund transfer using IMPS for internet banking and mobile banking customers from August 1. SBI had waived off charges on NEFT and RTGS transactions through internet and mobile banking from July 1 after RBI decided to remove these charges.

column2: Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies are not money: Trump
column3: US President Donald Trump has said that he's not "a fan of Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies", saying they aren't money and their "value is highly volatile and based on thin air". "We have only one real currency in USA, and it's stronger than ever...It's by far the most dominant currency anywhere in the World...It's called the US Dollar!" he added.

column2: India’s World Cup exit may cost Star Sports up to ₹15 crore
column3: Star Sports is likely to lose up to ₹15 crore in advertising revenue following India's exit from the World Cup. Star would have charged a premium selling last-minute ad spots for as high as ₹25-30 lakh per 10 seconds if India played the finals, according to media buyers' estimates. These spots are now expected to be sold for ₹15-17 lakh.

column2: Proud of India's performance at 2019 World Cup: Sunil Chhetri
column3: The Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri took to Twitter to commend the Indian cricket team's performance at the ongoing World Cup 2019. "It was a fantastic journey that fell a few yards short, but I'm sure you boys will pick yourselves up soon. Very proud of Team India," read part of Chhetri's tweet about the Indian team.

column2: Google Maps now shows 45,000 public toilets in 1,700 cities
column3: Google Maps now displays over 45,000 community and public toilets covering 1,700 Indian cities as part of the Central government's "Loo Review" initiative. The Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs joined hands with Google to launch the 'Loo Review' campaign in September 2018. The campaign encourages local guides in India to rate and review public toilets on Google Maps.

column2: SC notice to Sikkim CM on plea challenging his appointment
column3: The Supreme Court issued a notice to Sikkim CM Prem Singh Tamang on a plea challenging his appointment to the post. The petitioner contended that Tamang was earlier convicted and sentenced to a year's jail in a corruption case, making him ineligible to be appointed as the CM. The court also issued a notice to the Centre and Sikkim Governor.

column2: IIM alumni's startup Stanza Living to get ₹342 crore: Report
column3: New Delhi-based student housing startup Stanza Living has secured funding of about ₹342 crore in the first tranche of a larger funding round led by Falcon Edge, Livemint reported. The round reportedly saw participation from existing investors including Sequoia Capital, Matrix Partners and Accel. Stanza Living was founded in 2017 by IIM-Ahmedabad alumni Sandeep Dalmia and Anindya Dutta.

column2: Madrasa students thrashed, forced to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' in UP
column3: A group of Madrasa students playing cricket was allegedly thrashed with cricket bats and forced to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' in Unnao, Uttar Pradesh on Thursday. Three of the students were injured in the incident. Meanwhile, the police said the accused were identified with the help of their social media accounts, on which they had shared certain pictures.

column2: K'taka Speaker to not take decision on resignations till July 16: SC
column3: During the hearing on resignations by Karnataka Congress and JD(S) MLAs, the Supreme Court ordered to maintain status quo on the resignations and the disqualification proceedings against them. This comes after Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar said he was bound to decide on disqualification petitions before deciding on the resignations. The court stated the matter would be heard again on Tuesday.

column2: SC refuses to put stay on Maratha quota on jobs and admissions
column3: The Supreme Court has refused to stay Bombay High Court's decision on Maratha reservation in jobs and education. However, the top court said it'll hear the appeals against the reservation and issued a notice to Maharashtra government over such pleas. The High Court had brought down the quota from the proposed 16% to 12% in education and 13% in jobs.

column2: Event organiser trying to malign my image: Sonakshi on cheating case
column3: Responding to cheating allegations against her, Sonakshi Sinha tweeted, "An event organiser who couldn't live up to his commitment obviously thinks he can make a fast buck by maligning my crystal clear image in the press." She urged media not to "fan" his "bizarre claims". He accused Sonakshi of not turning up for an event after taking the booking amount.

column2: Actress Sameera Reddy blessed with a baby girl, shares 1st glimpse
column3: Actress Sameera Reddy and her husband Akshai Varde were blessed with a baby girl on Friday. Sameera, who was admitted to a hospital in Mumbai last night, shared the first glimpse of the newborn on Instagram. Both the baby and the mother are doing fine, said the actress' mother. The couple is already parents to a son named Hans Varde.

column2: Hrithik Roshan-starrer 'Super 30' hits the theatres
column3: In Hrithik Roshan-starrer 'Super 30', which released today, "emotional manipulation gets in the way of inspiration", Hindustan Times wrote. "Hrithik Roshan pulls off a solid performance essaying Anand Kumar," said Times of India. NDTV wrote, "Super 30 is overly simplistic and excessively fanciful when it is not downright vapid." It has been rated 2/5 (HT, NDTV) and 3.5/5 (TOI).

column2: Archer's old tweets 'foretelling' England's semi-final win go viral
column3: England pacer Jofra Archer's tweets ranging from 2013-2018 'foretelling' England's World Cup semi-final win went viral. The Guardian related his "Umpire you smoking a spliff from zac? Da ain out" tweet to Jason Roy being wrongly given out, while "All batsmen buy 2 helmets cause went we meet they'll be in use" tweet was connected to him hitting Alex Carey.

column2: Cong to move court for disqualification of Goa MLAs who joined BJP
column3: Goa Congress in-charge A Chellakumar on Thursday said Congress will move court seeking the disqualification of the 10 MLAs who resigned from the party and joined the BJP. Stating that Congress will appoint a new leader in the upcoming Assembly session, Chellakumar added, "If somebody is leaving they don't damage the party in any way...We're not bothered about individuals."

column2: Ready to prove majority of my govt: Karnataka CM to Speaker
column3: Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy on Friday said that he's ready to prove his government's majority and sought a trust vote in the Assembly, adding that he wasn't here to cling to power. Kumaraswamy also asked Assembly Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar to fix the time for it. This comes after several Congress and JD(S) MLAs submitted their resignations.

column2: Mumbai doctors remove female reproductive organs from man's body
column3: A 29-year-old man, who had sought cure for infertility, was found to have non-functioning female reproductive organs. Doctors at a government-run Mumbai hospital operated on him last month and removed a uterus, partial vagina, fallopian tubes and cervix from his body. A doctor said the condition is called Persistent Mullerian duct syndrome and only 200 such cases have been found.

column2: Rafale-Sukhoi potent combination against Pak: Air Marshal Bhadauria
column3: After taking a sortie on a Rafale aircraft at a French air force base, IAF Vice Chief Air Marshal RKS Bhadauria said, "Once the Su-30MKI and the Rafale start operating together, it will be a potent combination against our adversaries, be it Pakistan or anybody else." He added, "The attrition that we will inflict would be very very high."

column2: 1st 50-wagon train carrying 25-lakh-litre water reaches Chennai
column3: The first train carrying 25-lakh-litre water from Jolarpettai railway station in Vellore district has reached Chennai on Friday. The train has been decorated with flowers and has a poster reading 'Drinking water for Chennai'. As many as 50 wagons have been brought from Rajasthan to be attached to the train and carry 50,000 litre of water each.

column2: ₹93 lakh cash, gold found at home of Telangana officer who won award
column3: Telangana's Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) on Thursday arrested a tahsildar, V Lavanya, after over ₹93 lakh cash and 400g gold was recovered from her house. Lavanya had received the Best Tahsildar award two years ago from the Telangana government. The ACB raided Lavanya's house after the arrest of Village Revenue Officer (VRO) Antaiah for taking bribe from a farmer.

column2: Lok Sabha debate continues till midnight; Minister calls it 'record'
column3: The Lok Sabha sat till 11.58 pm on Thursday to conclude debate on demands for grants for the Railway Ministry. Nearly 100 members participated in the debate, which began in the afternoon. Parliamentary Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi called it a "record", saying it's for the first time in nearly 18 years that the Lower House has sat for this long.

column2: Pakistan violates ceasefire in J&K's Poonch, Rajouri districts
column3: Pakistan violated ceasefire along the Line of Control (LoC) in Krishna Ghati sector of Poonch district and Nowshera sector of Rajouri district on Friday. No injuries have been reported so far, while the Indian Army has launched an effective retaliation. On Wednesday night, Pakistan had violated ceasefire in Poonch district's Digwar sector.

column2: Lalu Yadav granted bail in fodder scam case relating to Deoghar treasury
column3: Jharkhand High Court today granted bail to RJD leader Lalu Prasad Yadav in fodder scam case relating to Deoghar treasury. Lalu was convicted by a special CBI court in Ranchi in December 2017 and sentenced to 3.5 years in jail for the case in 2018. The case referred to the misappropriation of around ₹90 lakh meant for buying fodder.

column2: Kalyani Rafael gets $100 mn order for Barak-8 missile kits for Army
column3: Kalyani Rafael Advanced Systems (KRAS) has bagged a $100 million order from Israel's Rafael Advanced Defense Systems for the supply of 1,000 Barak-8 MRSAM missile kits to the Indian Army and Air Force. KRAS is a joint venture between Baba Kalyani-led Bharat Forge and Rafael. The missile kits will be supplied to state-run Bharat Dynamics for further integration.

column2: One of our worst performances overall: Aus captain Aaron Finch
column3: Speaking after his side's loss to hosts England in the World Cup 2019 second semi-final, Australia captain Aaron Finch termed the loss as 'one of our worst performances overall for the tournament'. "Really proud of where we have come from and the gains that a lot of players have made over the last 12 months in particular," Finch said.

column2: India-made top-end iPhones may come to stores from next month
column3: Apple's top-end iPhones including XR and XS models, assembled in India by Foxconn's local unit, are likely to come to Indian stores next month, Reuters reported. Apple is yet to secure some approvals, Reuters cited a source as saying. This could reportedly lead to Apple reducing the prices of the models as it'll save on high taxes levied on imports.

column2: PM Modi meets BJP's women MPs over breakfast
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met women MPs of the BJP over breakfast at his residence on Friday. According to reports, BJP MPs have been divided into seven groups and PM Modi has already met party parliamentarians belonging to OBC, SC and ST categories. Pralhad Joshi and Amit Shah are the only Union Ministers present at these meetings, an MP said.

column2: BJP and its leaders hardly care about Constitution: Azad
column3: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Karnataka, Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad criticised the BJP saying that the party and its leaders "hardly care" about the Constitution. He added, "It looks as if the BJP government has come to power just to finish democracy and Opposition." This comes after the resignations of over 10 Congress-JD(S) coalition MLAs in Karnataka.

column2: Cong-JD(S) going strong despite efforts to destabilise: K'taka CM
column3: Amid the ongoing political crises in Karnataka, CM HD Kumaraswamy on Thursday said that the Congress-JD(S) coalition in the state is going strong despite efforts being made to destabilise it. His comment came ahead of the commencement of the Monsoon session of the Legislative Assembly. Kumaraswamy further added, "We're confident and prepared for smooth and fruitful conduct of legislative sessions."

column2: No plans to form e-commerce regulatory authority: Piyush Goyal
column3: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal has said the government is not considering any proposal to create an e-commerce regulatory authority to monitor and regulate e-commerce business in India. Measures to check malpractices by e-commerce firms including predatory prices and deep discounts are laid down in the Competition Act 2002, he said. He added it also checks anti-competitive agreements.

column2: 153 booked for drinking in public places in Delhi
column3: Around 153 people were booked on Thursday for violating the Delhi Excise Act by drinking in public places in Outer North Delhi area, police said. "Group patrolling teams were constituted and tasked to nab such violators from vehicles, near markets," the police added. On July 6, around 474 people were arrested in Noida and Greater Noida for a similar offence.

column2: 9,500 buses to ply on Delhi roads by May 2020: Sisodia
column3: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that by May 2020, Delhi will have as many as 9,500 buses plying on the roads. He added that 4,000 buses will be added in the current fleet of 5,500 buses in Delhi. Sisodia further said, "The first batch of the buses will start coming in July 2019 and it'll continue till May 2020."

column2: Rohit Sharma reacts to India's exit from 2019 World Cup
column3: Following Team India's exit from 2019 World Cup, opener Rohit Sharma said that they failed to deliver as a team when it mattered. "30 minutes of poor cricket... and that snatched away our chance for the cup. My heart is heavy as I'm sure yours is too," he tweeted. He further thanked the fans for their "incredible" support.

column2: I puked while auditioning, filmmaker thought it was brilliant: Ranveer
column3: Ranveer Singh revealed he once puked during an audition after his debut film 'Band Baaja Baaraat' released. "The scene was that a character...a teetotaller happens to drink one night, and starts dancing. I performed and danced my heart out. Such was the intensity that I puked at the end," he said. "The filmmaker thought it was sheer brilliance," Ranveer added.

column2: Smith gets run-out after ball goes between his legs, video viral
column3: A video of England wicketkeeper Jos Buttler producing a nutmeg run-out to dismiss Australia batsman Steve Smith in 2019 World Cup semi-final has gone viral. Buttler caught Smith short of crease after nailing a direct hit which went between Smith's legs at non-striker's end when the latter chanced a leg-bye. "That is an astonishing bit of fielding," a user tweeted.

column2: Halep becomes first Romanian woman to reach Wimbledon final
column3: Simona Halep became the first Romanian woman to reach Wimbledon final after defeating Ukraine's Elina Svitolina 6-1, 6-3 on Thursday. The world number seven, who took 73 minutes to win the semi-final, will face Serena Williams, who is chasing her 24th Grand Slam, in the final. "I'm desperate to win Wimbledon more than to stop her," said Halep.

column2: Dhoni has a lot of cricket left in him, youngsters need him: Edulji
column3: Committee of Administrators (CoA) member Diana Edulji has said that she still feels that MS Dhoni has a lot of cricket left in him. "The youngsters in the team still need his mentorship," she added. "I completely appreciate the way he played in the whole tournament. That (retirement) is his personal decision," she further said.

column2: Serena reaches her 11th Wimbledon final, to face Simona Halep
column3: Seven-time champion Serena Williams defeated world number 54 Barbora Strycova in straight sets on Thursday to reach the Wimbledon final for the 11th time. Serena dropped just three games in the semi-final and fired 27 winners and four aces to win the match with a scoreline of 6-1, 6-2. The 37-year-old will face world number seven Halep in the final.

column2: Twitter suffers an hour-long worldwide outage
column3: Twitter suffered an hour-long global outage on Friday and displayed a message saying, "Something is technically wrong. Thanks for noticing - we're going to fix it up and have things back to normal soon." DownDetector showed that Twitter began having issues since 12:20 AM IST. Twitter returned at about 1:15 AM IST but took few minutes to regain full functionality.

column2: Can't work at lightning speed: K'taka Speaker on meeting rebel MLAs
column3: After receiving the resignations again from rebel Congress-JD(S) MLAs, Karnataka Assembly Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar on Thursday said, "I am not acting in haste because I have to convince myself first. I cannot work at a lightning speed." He added that the resignation letters are now in correct format and he would decide overnight "whether these were genuine and voluntary".

column2: Sued ex-Tesla employee admits to storing Autopilot source code
column3: Former Tesla employee Guangzhi Cao has admitted that he stored the source code of the electric carmaker's Autopilot on his iCloud but refuted allegations of trade theft, as per court documents. Cao, who joined Tesla-rival Xiaopeng Motors in November 2018, argued he made "extensive efforts to delete and/or remove any such Tesla files". Tesla had sued Cao in March.

column2: Over-qualification is disqualification for govt job: Madras HC
column3: The Madras High Court on Thursday ruled that if overqualified applicants are employed for Group-4 services and basic services, the quality of public administration would be brought down. Stating that over-qualification is also disqualification for a job, it dismissed two petitions of engineering graduates who were rejected for posts of metro train operator and revenue department assistant.

column2: Raj Police to re-open cow smuggling case against Pehlu Khan's sons
column3: An Alwar court has permitted the Rajasthan Police to reinvestigate the case of cattle smuggling against the sons of Pehlu Khan, a 55-year-old dairy farmer who was killed by a group of gau rakshaks in 2017. This comes after the police sought the court's permission to re-open a chargesheet that named the victim's sons as accused in the case.

column2: Air Canada passengers hit plane's ceiling due to turbulence; 37 injured
column3: An Australia-bound Air Canada flight on Thursday suffered intense turbulence, which led unbuckled passengers to hit the plane's ceiling and therefore, forcing the plane to land in Hawaii. Around 37 people on the flight were injured. A passenger said, "The plane just dropped...I woke up and...the next thing I knew there's just literally bodies on the ceiling of the plane."

column2: India's new e-commerce rules regressive: Walmart told US govt
column3: Walmart, which acquired Flipkart for $16 billion, told the US government in January that India's new FDI rules for e-commerce were regressive. The rules, implemented from February 1, barred companies from selling products via firms in which they have an equity interest. Walmart argued that the policy discriminated against foreign firms and not just in favour of small local players.

column2: Dhoni is an absolute legend: Akhtar after India's semi loss
column3: Former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar praised MS Dhoni's performance at 2019 World Cup semi-final saying, "Dhoni...you are an absolute legend... You have proved you're a great batsman and a great brand ambassador for the team." Akhtar, who also praised Jadeja, added Dhoni should have dived to avoid getting run-out. India crashed out after losing to New Zealand by 18 runs.

column2: WhatsApp may let users edit sent, received photos within app
column3: WhatsApp is testing a new feature to let users edit images that have already been sent or received by them, WABetaInfo revealed. The editing tools will reportedly be the same as the ones available before an image is sent. The new 'Edit' button will be introduced next to 'Share' and 'Favourite' buttons, as per screenshots shared by WABetaInfo.

column2: Decision on new Cong Prez should be taken at earliest: Scindia
column3: Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scindia has said that a lot of time has "elapsed" and the decision on a new Congress President should be taken "at the earliest".
