He added that the party needs to "reinvent" itself and must win faith, love and blessings of the country. On July 3, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi officially resigned as the party President.

column2: Mumbai robotics startup Emotix raises ₹19 cr led by Chiratae
column3: Mumbai-based robotics startup Emotix has raised nearly ₹19 crore in a seed round of funding led by Chiratae Ventures, as per regulatory filings. The funding saw participation from YourNest Venture Capital and Technology Venture Fund, Entrackr revealed. Incorporated in 2015 by IIT-Bombay alumni Chintan Raikar, Prashant Iyengar and Sneh Vaswani, Emotix had raised ₹13.7 crore in a pre-Series A round.

column2: 2 girl students dead as hostel wall collapses in Arunachal
column3: Two girl students were killed and at least one was injured after the boundary wall of a government school hostel collapsed in Arunachal Pradesh's Tawang on Thursday. The wall reportedly collapsed due to a landslide following incessant rainfall in the region. As many as 19 girl students were sleeping in the hostel when the incident took place.

column2: 20 students hospitalised after consuming mid-day meal in Andhra
column3: At least 20 students of Ramakrishna Mission School were hospitalised on Thursday allegedly after they consumed mid-day meal in Andhra Pradesh's Guntur. They were rushed to a hospital when they complained of vomiting and unconsciousness soon after consuming the food. According to the doctors, all the students are stable and no inquiry has been initiated in the case so far.

column2: World Cup to get first-time winners as Eng beat Aus to reach final
column3: Three-time runners-up England defeated five-time champions Australia by 8 wickets in the second 2019 World Cup semi-final to reach World Cup final for the fourth time and the first time since the 1992 edition. In the final, England will face New Zealand, who also haven't won the World Cup so far. The final will take place at Lord's on Sunday.

column2: Kartik buys same flat in Mumbai where he once lived on rent: Reports
column3: Actor Kartik Aaryan has bought the same flat in Mumbai where he stayed as a paying guest during his struggling days, as per reports. He paid ₹1.6 crore for the flat and stamp duty of ₹9.6 lakh, reports added. As per documents sourced by a newspaper, Kartik bought the property in May and the papers also mention his mother's name.

column2: Australia lose a semi-final for the first time in World Cup history
column3: The eight-wicket defeat against England today was the first instance of Australia losing a World Cup semi-final. Australia had won six of their previous seven semi-finals and their 1999 semi-final against South Africa had ended in a tie. Australia were dismissed for 223 by England, only the second time they lost all their 10 wickets in a World Cup semi-final.

column2: I will give my best till my last breath: Ravindra Jadeja to fans
column3: Following India's 18-run defeat against New Zealand in 2019 World Cup semi-final on Wednesday, all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja tweeted, "Sports has taught me to keep on rising after every fall & never to give up." "Can't thank enough each & every fan who has been my source of inspiration...Keep inspiring & I'll give my best till my last breath," he added.

column2: Virat Kohli backs IPL-style playoffs for World Cup
column3: Following India's exit from the 2019 World Cup, Team India captain Virat Kohli backed IPL-style playoffs for World Cup. "If topping the table means anything. I think these things can come into consideration, looking at the magnitude of this tournament," he added. India crashed out of 2019 World Cup after losing to New Zealand in the semi-finals.

column2: Delhi HC rejects plea against free Metro for women; fines man ₹10,000
column3: Delhi High Court has dismissed a man's plea against AAP government's proposal of free Metro rides to women and instead fined him ₹10,000. The court said the plea had no substance, adding that it's for the authorities to decide on giving concession to a particular class. The court also rejected the prayer in the petition seeking a reduction in fares.

column2: 24-yr-old man drowns in lake during TikTok video shoot in Hyderabad
column3: A 24-year-old man drowned in a lake located on the outskirts of Hyderabad while he was taking a bath along with his cousin, police said. The man drowned after he moved deep into the lake when his cousin was recording a video of them bathing, for TikTok app, police added. The victim did not know how to swim.

column2: Fast-track Maldives' re-admission as member: India to Commonwealth
column3: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has called to fast-track the process of re-admitting the Maldives as a member of the Commonwealth. The Maldives had quit the Commonwealth in 2016, accusing it of interfering in its domestic affairs. Ex-Maldives President Abdulla Yameen had taken the step after the Commonwealth asked to address the deteriorating human rights issue in the country.

column2: N Korea revises constitution to make Kim Jong-un head of state
column3: North Korea has revised its constitution to declare Kim Jong-un as the official head of the state. The revised constitution states that the Chairman of the State Affairs Commission (SAC) serves as its supreme leader that "represents the country". Previously, the President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly represented the country as the constitutional head of the state.

column2: US and UK will regret seizing our tanker: Iran
column3: The US and UK will "regret" seizing an Iranian oil tanker, a deputy commander of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps said. The tanker was seized off Gibraltar, with the British Royal Marines claiming it was carrying oil to Syria in breach of sanctions. "An action that doesn't need ability but stupidity has been carried out by them," the official added.

column2: IndiGo's $20 billion CFM deal led to Co-Founders' dispute: Reports
column3: The $20-billion agreement IndiGo recently signed with aircraft engine maker CFM may have triggered the dispute between Co-Founders Rakesh Gangwal and Rahul Bhatia, as per reports. The decision was reportedly not supported by Gangwal, who has been managing the technical aspects of IndiGo since its inception. The airline previously relied on engines from United Technologies' Pratt and Whitney.

column2: Rupee hits 11-month high of 68.45 against US dollar
column3: The Indian rupee, along with other Asian currencies, strengthened against the US dollar on Thursday after Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell signalled that the US central bank could soon cut interest rates. The rupee gained 12 paise to end at 68.45, an 11-month high. The rupee has risen 1.9% against the dollar so far this year.

column2: Mayhem with new ball: Boult on WC semi-final win vs India
column3: After New Zealand defended their 240-run target to win 2019 World Cup's first semifinal against India on Wednesday, pacer Trent Boult said, "It was mayhem out there with the new ball." "It was a dream start for us," said Boult, whose team reduced India to 24/4 in first ten overs. "Our best balls are good enough for anyone," he added.

column2: Playing vs Federer always unique: Nadal ahead of Wimbledon semi
column3: Ahead of their Wimbledon semi-final, world number two Rafael Nadal said that playing against Roger Federer is "always a unique situation" and he's "excited" to play him at Wimbledon after 11 years. The duo will meet for the 40th time on Friday, which will also be their fourth Wimbledon encounter. Notably, Nadal won French Open semi-final against Federer last month.

column2: McAfee may go public again, get $1 bn at $5-bn valuation: Report
column3: Cybersecurity software firm McAfee is planning to return to the public market, The Wall Street Journal reported, adding that an IPO could raise at least $1 billion at an over $5-billion valuation. This comes weeks after McAfee CEO said going public again could widen the firm's options. McAfee responded to the report saying it "does not comment on rumours".

column2: TMC MP plays football in Lok Sabha, appeals PM to promote it
column3: TMC MP Prasun Banerjee on Thursday began playing football in the Parliament premises in a bid to promote the game. The retired international footballer said he will appeal to Prime Minister Narendra Modi to promote the game nationally as well as internationally. "I hope India will play football in the World Cup...We will try to achieve it," Banerjee said.

column2: Cong media coordinator quits, says 'No sign of new party president'
column3: Congress' national media coordinator Rachit Seth on Thursday resigned from his post, saying there was no meaning in holding any political position after Rahul Gandhi's resignation. "45 days have gone and...there is no sign of the new Congress President," he said. Seth further said that there was no point in blaming the BJP if the fault lay within the party.

column2: India is fully committed to Kartarpur corridor: Govt
column3: External Affairs Ministry Spokesperson Raveesh Kumar on Thursday said that India is fully committed to the Kartarpur Sahib corridor project and wants the work to be completed expeditiously. This comes amid reports that India is lagging behind in the construction of the corridor. The passenger terminal and the four-lane highway will be completed by September and October 2019, Kumar said.

column2: Missing US scientist found murdered in Nazi bunker in Greece
column3: The body of Suzanne Eaton, an American scientist who went missing over a week ago, has been found in a bunker used by the Nazis during WWII on the Greek island of Crete, authorities said. Eaton was attending a conference in Crete and is believed to have disappeared during a run. A post-mortem examination found that she was asphyxiated.

column2: Reliance Infra's 16 lenders sign pact for debt resolution
column3: Anil Ambani-led Reliance Infrastructure (RInfra) has said its 16 lenders have signed Inter-Creditor Agreement (ICA) for the resolution of its debt worth over ₹6,000 crore. The company said it's confident of implementing the resolution plan well before the 180-day deadline. RInfra earlier announced the sale of Delhi-Agra Toll Road for enterprise value of ₹3,600 crore to cut debt by 25%.

column2: Vodafone CEO takes $1.6 million bonus cut after shares fall
column3: Vodafone Group CEO Nick Read and CFO Margherita Della Valle have voluntarily requested a 20% reduction in their three-year share awards after company's shares fell 30% in 12 months. The company said Read will give up stock worth $1.6 million, reducing his share bonus to about $6.4 million. This follows a shareholder advisory group objecting to Vodafone's latest remuneration plan.

column2: ED attaches Mehul Choksi's assets worth ₹24.8 crore
column3: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has attached assets worth ₹24.8 crore of fugitive diamantaire Mehul Choksi, who is an accused in the ₹14,000-crore PNB fraud case. The assets attached comprise three commercial properties in Dubai, a Mercedes-Benz E280, valuables, and a fixed deposit. The agency said assets worth ₹2,534.7 crore have been attached till date.

column2: Please don't think about retirement: Lata Mangeshkar to MS Dhoni
column3: Legendary singer Lata Mangeshkar took to Twitter to request former India captain MS Dhoni to not think about retirement as India needs him. "I am hearing a lot these days that you want to retire. Please don't think like this. The thought of retirement shouldn't come to your mind," she wrote. Dhoni scored 273 runs in the 2019 World Cup.

column2: Starc registers most wickets in a World Cup, breaks McGrath's record
column3: After taking his first wicket in the 2019 World Cup semi-final against England on Thursday, Australia fast bowler Mitchell Starc set the record for taking most wickets in a World Cup edition. The 29-year-old took his tally to 27 wickets in the current edition, overtaking Glenn McGrath, who had taken 26 wickets in the 2007 World Cup.

column2: 10 rebel Congress MLAs from Goa join BJP
column3: Ten rebel Congress MLAs from Goa who resigned on Wednesday met BJP's Working President JP Nadda in Delhi on Thursday and formally joined the BJP. Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant accompanied the MLAs to the meeting in Delhi. After their merger with the BJP, the party's strength in the Goa Assembly has increased to 27.

column2: Fan dies of heart attack in Kolkata after Dhoni gets run-out
column3: A cycle shop owner, 33-year-old Srikanta Maity, died of heart attack in his shop in Kolkata after MS Dhoni got run-out in World Cup semi-final on Wednesday. Maity was watching the match on his phone. "We saw him lying unconscious...We took him to Khanakul hospital, where he was declared dead on arrival," a sweet shop owner in the area said.

column2: Smith 1st batsman to hit 4 straight 50+ scores in WC knockout matches
column3: Australia batsman Steve Smith has become the first-ever batsman to slam four consecutive 50-plus scores in World Cup knockouts. The 30-year-old, who scored 65, 105 and 56* in 2015 World Cup quarter-final, semi-final and final respectively, slammed 119-ball 85 against England in 2019 World Cup semi-final. He equalled Sachin Tendulkar's record for most 50-plus scores (4) in World Cup knockouts.

column2: BSF constable loses hand in smugglers' bomb attack at B'desh border
column3: Anisur Rehman, a BSF constable lost his right hand and suffered serious injuries in a country-made bomb attack by Bangladeshi cattle smugglers along the India-Bangladesh border in West Bengal. Rehman fired a round from his pump action gun in self-defence before he fell unconscious. One Bangladeshi smuggler sustained injuries but managed to flee away to Bangladesh, as per intelligence report.

column2: Dalit husband's family gets security after BJP MLA's daughter's video
column3: Bareilly Police on Thursday provided security to the family of a Dalit man whose wife, BJP MLA Rajesh Kumar Mishra's daughter, claimed a threat to their lives over their inter-caste marriage, in a viral video. The MLA's daughter, Sakshi Kumar Mishra, moved Allahabad High Court seeking security. The couple got married at a Prayagraj temple on July 4.

column2: Bihar CM denies Guru Purnima holiday, asks lawmakers to work extra
column3: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar rejected a demand by lawmakers for a state holiday on the occasion of 'Guru Purnima' on July 16. "I think we should work two additional hours on Guru Purnima as a mark of respect for our gurus," Kumar told the lawmakers. "Who will take classes if teachers do not come to class?" he further questioned.

column2: IndiGo Co-Founder Bhatia in talks to buy Burger King India: Reports
column3: IndiGo Co-Founder Rahul Bhatia's InterGlobe Enterprises is reportedly in the final stage of talks to acquire Burger King's India franchise from private equity firm Everstone Capital for ₹1,400 crore. Burger King India operates around 200 outlets and generated sales of ₹389 crore in 2017-18. InterGlobe currently has interests in aviation, hospitality, real estate, IT services and travel booking.

column2: HDFC Bank MD says Mallya not a friend, explains why he refused loan
column3: HDFC Bank MD Aditya Puri said Vijay Mallya was not his friend, adding that friendship and banking are not correlated. Puri said, "Somebody in Mallya's office will tell you, every time the call came from me, Mallya used to abuse." He added that when Mallya's officials came to him for a loan, he gave them coffee and sent them back.

column2: How is Anil Ambani's Reliance Group planning to reduce its debt?
column3: Reliance Infrastructure is seeking ₹9,000 crore from the sale of nine road projects and planning to lease out 7,00,000-square-foot Reliance Center. Reliance Capital aims to raise ₹1,200 crore by selling Big FM, and ₹11,500 crore by monetising its holdings in general insurance, mutual fund, and housing finance businesses. Anil Ambani's four biggest listed companies have about ₹94,000 crore in debt.

column2: I-T dept finds Google, FB underreporting Indian revenues: Report
column3: The Income Tax department has reportedly decided to scrutinise global firms including technology giants like Google and Facebook over allegations of underreporting Indian revenues. "Revenues reported in India are not reflective of the actual advertisement revenues earned from users in India," the report quoted an I-T official. The firms are reportedly doing so to avoid paying a withholding tax.

column2: Apple opens 1st China app design and development accelerator
column3: Apple has opened the first app design and development accelerator for China in Shanghai to help local developers create better apps. Apple said over 2.5 million developers from Greater China have earned over $29 billion since App Store's China launch in 2010. The accelerator is similar to the one that the technology giant had opened in Bengaluru two years ago.

column2: FDI norms forcing Flipkart to scale down wholesale biz: Report
column3: Flipkart is being forced to scale down its B2B wholesale business due to compliance with the revised FDI norms, which came into effect from February 1, as per a report. Flipkart has started curtailing or altogether stopped buying products directly from companies, the report said. It is also reportedly asking preferred sellers to buy merchandise directly from manufacturers.

column2: Treebo fires 15% workforce after failing to raise funds: Report
column3: Bengaluru-based budget hotel chain Treebo Hotels has reportedly fired over 120 employees, representing about 15% of its around 900-employee workforce, Entrackr reported citing over half a dozen sources including employees. "The firm has been trying to raise funds from quite some time," Entrackr's sources said, adding, "It looks like the fundraising plan is far from materialising."

column2: Used to such threats: Govt on Al-Qaeda's video on Kashmir
column3: External Affairs Ministry Spokesperson Raveesh Kumar on Thursday reacted to Al-Qaeda's video saying, "We are used to such threats...this should [not] be taken seriously." Our security forces are well equipped and capable of maintaining our territorial integrity, he added. On Wednesday, the Al-Qaeda in a video message called for militants in Kashmir to inflict unrelenting blows on the Indian Army.

column2: 11 killed, 60 injured in Pakistan train collision
column3: At least 11 people were killed and over 60 others were injured after a passenger train crashed into a freight train in Pakistan's Punjab province on Thursday. Five carriages were destroyed and workers cut through the metal of the carriages to rescue the trapped passengers. Pakistan PM Imran Khan blamed decades of neglect of railway infrastructure for the crash.

column2: 6 people killed, 100 injured in 20-minute storm in Greece
column3: At least six people were killed and 100 others were injured in a storm that hit northern Greece on Wednesday, officials said. The storm had lasted only for about 20 minutes, as per reports. Hail storms and strong winds of over 100 kmph damaged buildings, overturned cars and uprooted trees in Halkidiki, near the city of Thessaloniki.

column2: Govt to check IndiGo shareholder pact for violation: Reports
column3: The Centre will reportedly scrutinise the disputed shareholders' agreement between IndiGo Co-Founders Rakesh Gangwal and Rahul Bhatia. Reports said any Companies Act violation could cause the annulment of special rights held by Bhatia's IGE Group to appoint IndiGo's three board directors, MD and CEO. Gangwal had accused Bhatia of entering into "questionable" related party transactions with IndiGo.

column2: RBI cancelled licences of 1,701 NBFCs in 2018-19
column3: The RBI cancelled licences of 1,701 non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) in 2018-19 for not meeting minimum capital requirements, according to data compiled by Livemint. Nearly 779 licences were cancelled in October and November 2018, soon after IL&FS defaulted on debt repayments, sparking a crisis in the sector. RBI had cancelled 26 NBFC licences in 2017-18.

column2: IL&FS puts 2,880 acres of land in Gujarat's Kutch on sale
column3: Debt-laden IL&FS Group has put up its 2,880 acre of non-contiguous land parcels spread across seven villages in Gujarat's Kutch district for sale in order to monetise its assets. The group invited expressions of interest (EOIs) from potential bidders for the land parcels, owned by three of its subsidiaries. The group has a debt burden of around ₹1 lakh crore.

column2: Swara tweets to Mumbai Police about man who said she's a 'call girl'
column3: Actress Swara Bhasker tweeted to Mumbai Police and complained about a man who called her a "call girl". "In his own words 'mad, proud and fortunate nationalist & Hindu' bringing shame upon his (and my) religion and nation!" she wrote while quoting his Twitter bio. Replying to her tweet, Mumbai Police wrote, "We will look into this on priority."

column2: Shraddha Kapoor, rumoured boyfriend Rohan to marry in 2020: Reports
column3: Actress Shraddha Kapoor and her rumoured boyfriend, photographer Rohan Shrestha will get married in 2020, as per reports. They have been dating for a couple of years, reports added. Shraddha's mother, Shivangi Kapoor, is already busy with wedding preparations, reports further said. Her father Shakti Kapoor has however denied the rumours about their marriage.

column2: Aus' Carey gets hit on face, continues to bat with bleeding chin
column3: Wicketkeeper-batsman Alex Carey was hit on the face by a 139-kmph delivery bowled by England pacer Jofra Archer in eighth over of Australia's innings in 2019 World Cup semi-final on Thursday. Carey's helmet was detached after he copped the ball on the chin. He continued to play with bleeding chin before his jaw area was covered up with a bandage.

column2: SC rejects K'taka Speaker's plea for more time on MLAs' resignations
column3: The Supreme Court on Thursday rejected Karnataka Assembly Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar's plea seeking more time to decide on rebel MLAs' resignations. The SC said it had already passed the order in the morning asking the Speaker to decide on the resignations during the course of the day. Sixteen MLAs, including Housing Minister MTB Nagaraj, have resigned.

column2: Virgin Orbit successfully performs its 1st rocket drop test
column3: Billionaire Richard Branson's spaceflight firm Virgin Galactic's sister firm Virgin Orbit has successfully performed its first rocket drop test with a 70-foot dummy LauncherOne rocket. The test was performed using its Boeing 747-based launch aircraft, nicknamed "Cosmic Girl", from an altitude of 35,000 feet. CEO Dan Hart estimated the cost of a launch using LauncherOne to be about $10-15 million.

column2: Volkswagen ends production of its iconic Beetle car after 8 decades
column3: Volkswagen's Beetle production officially came to an end after over eight decades as the last Beetles produced rolled off the assembly line in Puebla, Mexico on Wednesday. A special ceremony at factory marked the end of production. The last Beetles will be sold on Amazon in a move symbolising Volkswagen's embrace of the future, Volkswagen Mexico CEO Steffen Reiche said.

column2: Local authorities can bar malls from collecting parking fee: Guj HC
column3: Gujarat High Court on Wednesday said local authorities can prohibit owners of malls and multiplexes from collecting parking fee, under the provisions of the Comprehensive General Development Control Regulation, 2017. This comes after a firm challenged the order of single-judge bench, barring commercial complexes from collecting fee for parking vehicles for the first hour.

column2: Pak hasn't acknowledged presence of PoWs in its custody: India
column3: Pakistan has not acknowledged the presence of any missing Indian defence personnel or Prisoners of War (PoWs) in its custody so far, despite consistent efforts from India to ensure their release, the government said on Wednesday. However, the government added that as per available information, around 83 missing Indian defence personnel including PoWs, are believed to be in Pakistan's custody.

column2: Kidney 'has a very special place in the heart': Trump
column3: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday said that "the kidney has a very special place in the heart". His remarks came as he signed an executive order aimed at improving medical care for people who have kidney-related health issues. Trump also said that his administration would work on encouraging the development of new treatments.

column2: US man missing for months found to be eaten by his 18 pet dogs
column3: A 57-year-old man, who was reported missing in US' Texas in May, was completely eaten by his 18 pet dogs at his trailer home, police said. DNA testing determined that pieces of bone and clothes recovered from the dogs' faeces were of their owner. It's unclear whether the dogs killed their owner or just consumed his body after he died.

column2: US seizes JPMorgan-owned ship with $1.3 billion worth of cocaine
column3: US customs authorities have seized a large container ship operated by Switzerland-based Mediterranean Shipping Company weeks after they found about 20 tons of cocaine worth $1.3 billion on the vessel. The MSC Gayane is owned by JPMorgan Asset Management and chartered to MSC. Worth about $90 million, the ship was built in 2018 and has capacity for around 10,000 containers.

column2: Adani says he'll bring in 'Googles and Amazons' to his data centres
column3: Billionaire Gautam Adani said that if a proposed law requiring data to be stored locally goes through, "it will explode data storage requirements". Adani Enterprises in January said it will invest ₹70,000 crore to build data parks in Andhra Pradesh. "This will be a multi-billion-dollar project that will bring in the Googles and the Amazons of the world," he added.

column2: What's the necessity for me to resign: K'taka CM Kumaraswamy
column3: Responding to reports that claimed he was ready to step down amid the political crisis in Karnataka, Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy today asked, "What is the necessity for me to resign now?" He added, "In 2009-10, when the same (BJP state chief) Yeddyurappa was CM, at that time 18 MLAs including eight ministers opposed him."

column2: Sonia, Rahul protest outside Parliament over Karnataka crisis
column3: Congress leaders, including Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, held a protest against the ruling BJP in the Parliament complex on Thursday over the political crisis in Karnataka and Goa. They also carried placards with messages like 'Save Democracy'. Leaders of Samajwadi Party, TMC, NCP and RJD also took part in the protest.

column2: Zoomcar raises ₹78 crore from Trifecta Capital, others
column3: Bengaluru-based self-drive car rental startup Zoomcar has raised nearly ₹78 crore in a mix of equity and debt funding from its US-headquartered parent firm and Trifecta Capital among others, Inc42 revealed. The startup has raised nearly ₹12 lakh in debt from Mahindra & Mahindra. Founded in 2012, Zoomcar has raised over $115 million to date, as per Crunchbase.

column2: Japan spacecraft lands on asteroid 300 mn km away for 2nd time
column3: Japan's space agency JAXA has confirmed that its Hayabusa2 spacecraft has successfully landed on asteroid Ryugu about 300 million km away from Earth for second time. The $270-million spacecraft had dropped a 2-kg bomb to create a small crater on the asteroid in April. Hayabusa2 will again fire a bullet at the asteroid to collect sub-surface samples blown by it.

column2: 7-yr-old raped by 65-yr-old man in Bihar; video circulated
column3: Police on Wednesday arrested a 65-year-old man for allegedly luring a seven-year-old girl into a temple with chocolate and raping her in Bihar's Bhojpur district. A youth was also arrested for filming the act and uploading the video on social media. The matter came to light when the victim's parents learned about the video and lodged a police complaint.

column2: Parties should come together for a population control law: Giriraj
column3: Union Minister Giriraj Singh on Thursday took to Twitter to say all policial parties should come together to make a law for population control. Religious disruption to population control is one of the reasons for cultural division, Singh added. The BJP leader shared statistics showing the increase in India's population from 30 crore in 1947 to 140 crore in 2019.

column2: 60 foreigners staying without valid docs detained in Greater Noida
column3: As many as 60 foreign nationals were detained in Greater Noida on Wednesday for staying in India without valid papers. Some were found staying in India on an expired visa, while others were in possession of forged visa documents. Some of the detained persons are from Nigeria, Kenya, Tanzania, Zambia, Angola, Malawi and the Philippines.

column2: Waterlogging due to rains forces schools to shut in UP's Azizpur
column3: Heavy rainfall led to massive waterlogging in several parts of Azizpur, UP on Wednesday. Reportedly, there were traffic jams and several schools declared holidays due to the waterlogging. A primary school student said, "Each year we face the same issue...We had earlier filed a complaint regarding this but no action was taken by the authorities."

column2: Toddler falls into open drain in Mumbai, feared washed away
column3: A toddler fell into an open drain in Mumbai's Goregaon on Wednesday night, said officials. Rescue operations started soon after he fell in and continued through Thursday morning, but the child is feared to have been washed away. His parents blamed BMC for the open drains and angry relatives have threatened to block roads if the boy is not found.

column2: Former Miss Iraq may lose her citizenship for defending Israel
column3: Former Miss Iraq Sarah Idan has said that her citizenship may be revoked after she spoke in defence of Israel at the United Nations Human Rights Council. She'd also spoken against the human rights abuses by Iraq. Idan's family fled Iraq following death threats after she posted a picture of herself with Miss Israel at the 2017 Miss Universe pageant.

column2: SC asks rebel K'taka MLAs to submit resignations to Speaker by 6 pm
column3: Supreme Court has asked 10 rebel Congress-JD(S) MLAs of Karnataka "to meet the Karnataka Assembly Speaker at 6 pm today and submit their resignations if they so wish." The Speaker has to take a decision in the remaining part of the day. It also ordered DGP of Karnataka to provide protection to the MLAs and adjourned the hearing for tomorrow.

column2: Not against marriage, but boy is 9yrs older: MLA on daughter's video
column3: After his daughter accused him of threatening her life following her marriage to a Dalit man, BJP MLA Rajesh Mishra denied the allegations. "I am not opposed to the marriage of my daughter. My only concern is that the boy is more than nine years older than her...[and] doesn't earn much." "I want them (couple) to return home," he added.

column2: Runwal Group launches Runwal Pinnacle, Mulund's tallest towers
column3: Situated in the heart of the city, Runwal Pinnacle offers the luxuries of high rise living. The 67 storeyed towers provide a panoramic view of the mangroves and Sanjay Gandhi National Park. It has two levels dedicated to clubhouse and recreational amenities, along with a sky deck and a rooftop leisure zone 200 meters above ground.

column2: SC hearing on Ayodhya land dispute from July 25 if mediation fails
column3: The Supreme Court on Thursday asked the Ayodhya land dispute mediation panel headed by Justice FMI Kalifulla to submit the status report by July 18. The court said that in case the report indicates that mediation should be concluded, it'll start hearing the appeals from July 25. Sri Sri Ravi Shankar and Sriram Panchu are also part of the panel.

column2: Kangana Ranaut responds after Journalists' Guild boycotts her
column3: In videos released by Rangoli Chandel, Kangana Ranaut has responded after Entertainment Journalists' Guild of India boycotted her over her argument with a reporter. Calling these journalists "deshdrohi" and "saste", Kangana said they are "on sale for ₹50-₹60". "I request you with folded hands, please ban me because I don't want to be a reason behind your earnings," she added.

column2: Super 30 founder Anand Kumar reveals he's suffering from brain tumour
column3: Mathematician Anand Kumar, founder of IIT coaching programme 'Super 30', has revealed that he's suffering from a non-cancerous tumour on the main nerve, leading from the inner ear to the brain. "In 2014, I was unable to hear...After some tests...I came to know that 80-90% of hearing ability was destroyed," he added.

column2: How have Australia and England fared in World Cup semi-finals?
column3: Australia have featured in seven semi-finals in World Cup and emerged victorious in six, while one ended in a tie. England, who last played a World Cup semi-final in 1992, have won three of their five World Cup semi-finals. England and Australia last met in a World Cup semi-final in 1975, with Australia winning the low-scoring encounter by four wickets.

column2: What a moment of brilliance: ICC on Guptill's run-out of MS Dhoni
column3: The ICC took to Twitter to share a video of New Zealand's Martin Guptill running out India's MS Dhoni in 2019 World Cup semi-final, writing, "What a moment of brilliance!" Guptill hit the stumps directly from short fine leg area when Dhoni was trying to take a second run. India required 25 runs off 10 balls when Dhoni got run-out.

column2: Video of Rohit signalling 'you are strong' to Jadeja goes viral
column3: A video of Team India opener Rohit Sharma making the 'you are strong' gesture to all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja during the 2019 World Cup semi-final against New Zealand has gone viral on social media. After Jadeja completed his half-century off 39 balls, Rohit applauded the all-rounder and made the gesture. "You guys won our hearts," a user reacted to the video.

column2: My father's path of politics ended on March 17: Parrikar's son
column3: After 10 Congress MLAs resigned and joined BJP, former Goa CM Manohar Parrikar's son Utpal said BJP took a different direction after his father's demise. Utpal added, "The path of trust which Parrikar established in his politics ended on March 17." He said he's willing to help in re-establishing the philosophy of trust among members of the BJP.

column2: Opposition's work most enjoyable, easy: Rahul to Congress workers
column3: Addressing party workers in Amethi on Wednesday, former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi said, "We have to do the work of opposition now. You know that the work of opposition is most enjoyable, it is easy." He added, "You know the condition of the economy, employment, corruption, so there is no dearth of issues."

column2: Rivigo raises $65 mn in Series E round led by Warburg Pincus, SAIF
column3: Gurugram-based logistics startup Rivigo has raised $65 million in its ongoing Series E round led by existing investors Warburg Pincus and SAIF Partners. Prior to this round, Rivigo raised $216.2 million from investors and the last tranche of $35.6 million of Series E round was at around $950-million valuation. Reports said Rivigo raised the funding at over $1-billion valuation.

column2: Bus driver suspended for shooting TikTok video while driving
column3: Punjab Roadways has suspended a bus driver after he took a TikTok video while driving a bus from Jalandhar to Delhi and it went viral on social media. "The shocking negligence could not be ignored," said Punjab Roadways General Manager Parneet Singh Minhas. A strict warning has been issued to other employees against using their phones while driving, he added.

column2: BSF officer steals bag with ₹15 lakh jewellery at Delhi airport, held
column3: An Assistant Sub-Inspector with the BSF was on Wednesday arrested for allegedly stealing a woman's handbag containing gold and diamond jewellery worth ₹15 lakh, at the Delhi airport. The woman's bag was stolen after she kept the bag under the liner chair while waiting for the boarding time. The police reportedly recovered the entire stolen jewellery within 45 minutes.

column2: Ex-BJP MP, 6 others get life sentence for RTI activist's murder
column3: A CBI court in Ahmedabad has sentenced former BJP MP Dinu Solanki and six others to life imprisonment in RTI activist Amit Jethwa's murder case, who was shot dead outside Gujarat High Court in 2010. All the seven accused were convicted by the court on Saturday. Jethwa reportedly exposed illegal mining around Gir Wildlife Sanctuary in which Solanki was involved.

column2: Kenya MP visits Indian grocer after 30 years to repay debt of ₹200
column3: Kenya MP Richard Tong'i visited a grocery shop owner, Kashinath Gawli, in Maharashtra's Aurangabad to repay a debt of ₹200 after 30 years. Richard, who studied at an Aurangabad college during 1985-89, said Gawli and his family had helped him when he was at his "lowest point". "I thought that some day, I will come back and (re)pay," he added.

column2: 8 killed after speeding truck rams into wedding pandal in Bihar
column3: At least eight people died and six people have been injured after a speeding truck rammed into a wedding pandal in Bihar's Lakhisarai district at 2 am on Thursday. Five members from the bride's side and three from the groom's family were killed on the spot, police said. Reportedly, the driver fled from the spot leaving his vehicle behind.

column2: UK says Iran attempted to block its oil tanker in the Gulf
column3: The UK has said that three Iranian boats tried to block one of its oil tankers through the Strait of Hormuz. The Iranians withdrew after a UK warship escorting the tanker aimed its guns and warned the Iranians to move away. This comes after the UK helped Gibraltar seize an Iranian tanker claiming it was carrying oil to Syria illegally.

column2: Samsung’s VC arm debuts in India, puts $8.5 mn in 4 startups
column3: Samsung Venture Investment Corporation (SVIC), the venture capital arm of South Korean technology giant Samsung, has invested around $8.5 million in total in its maiden investment in the Indian startup ecosystem. SVIC has acquired 20% stake in Mumbai system apps startup Indus OS. It has also backed Bengaluru's Gnani.ai and Silvan Innovation Labs and an undisclosed computer vision startup.

column2: Apple apologises for Watch app bug that risked iPhone eavesdropping
column3: Apple has disabled its Watch's Walkie-Talkie app due to an unspecified vulnerability that could allow a person to listen to another customer's iPhone without consent. Apple apologised for the bug and for the inconvenience of being unable to use the feature while a fix is made. Apple said there is no current evidence that the bug was exploited.

column2: Google testing new social networking app 'Shoelace' in NYC
column3: Technology giant Google is testing a new hyperlocal social media platform called 'Shoelace' in New York City that lets users "connect with others who have the same interests". The app, which runs on both iOS and Android, is currently functioning on an invite-only basis. Notably, Google had officially shut down its social media platform Google+ after eight years in April.

column2: God save this country: Goa Congress as 10 MLAs resign, join BJP
column3: After 10 of 15 Congress MLAs submitted their resignations and merged with the ruling BJP in Goa, state Congress chief Girish Chodankar said, "God save this country." He added, "People are watching this naked game of destruction of democracy and they will certainly teach a lesson to those involved in this utter shameful act of murdering democracy."

column2: I'm Wayanad MP but ties with Amethi are 3 decades old: Rahul
column3: During his first visit to Amethi since he lost the parliamentary seat to Union Minister Smriti Irani, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi reportedly said, "I am the MP from Wayanad but my ties with Amethi are three decades old." He added, "The development of Amethi will not be hampered... I will fight for Amethi in Delhi."

column2: Moglix raises $60 million co-led by Tiger Global, Sequoia
column3: Asia-based B2B marketplace for industrial goods Moglix has raised $60 million in its Series D funding round led by Tiger Global Management and Sequoia Capital. The funding round also saw participation from a new investor, Hong Kong-based Composite Capital. Founded in 2015 by former Google executive Rahul Garg, Moglix procures and supplies industrial goods like safety tools and hardware.

column2: Over 52 kg of ganja seized in Karnataka, one arrested
column3: One person has been arrested and over 52 kg of ganja worth ₹10 lakh has been seized by the police in Karnataka. The ganja was allegedly being illegally transported to Karwar and Goa and a case has been registered in this regard. Meanwhile, the accused's cell phone and the vehicle carrying the contraband were also seized.

column2: Xiaomi Redmi K20 series pre-bookings to start July 12 in India
column3: Xiaomi has announced Alpha Sale for Redmi K20 and K20 Pro in India, allowing buyers to pre-book the smartphones starting 12 noon on July 12. Buyers can pre-book one unit for themselves for ₹855 across Mi.com and Flipkart. Buyers will be able to complete the purchase with the token amount deducted from the final price on the day of launch.

column2: My life threatened by my father: BJP MLA's daughter on marrying Dalit
column3: Uttar Pradesh BJP MLA Rajesh Mishra's daughter has alleged that her life is threatened by her father after she got married to a Dalit man. In a video message, the 23-year-old asked her father and brother to recall the goons sent by them and to stop bothering her husband and his relatives. "Papa, please change your mentality," she asserted.

column2: Akshay Kumar only Indian in Forbes Highest-Paid Entertainers List
column3: With $65 million (₹444 crore), Akshay Kumar has become the only Indian to enter Forbes magazine's Highest-Paid Entertainers List 2019. The magazine wrote that he earns at least $5 million (₹34 crore) and up to $10 million (₹68 crore) per film, along with earnings from endorsements. Akshay, who came 33rd, beat Hollywood actors including Chris Evans and Bradley Cooper.

column2: Mom was protective, sent my cousin on my dates with Rishi: Neetu
column3: Actress Neetu Kapoor, while recalling the days when she was dating Rishi Kapoor, revealed, "My mother was very protective of me and used to send my cousin Lovely on my dinner dates with Rishi." "I was very young, and I had never really been on a date before. This went on for three years," she added.

column2: Canadian man swept over Niagara Falls survives 188-foot fall
column3: A Canadian man, who was swept over Niagara's Horseshoe Falls on Tuesday, survived a fall of nearly 188 feet into the Lower Niagara River, Niagara Falls Park Police said. Officers found the man sitting on the rocks at the bottom of the falls. He was taken to the hospital for treatment.

column2: By bits and pieces, Ravindra Jadeja ripped me apart: Sanjay Manjrekar
column3: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar, who earlier called Ravindra Jadeja a "bits and pieces" player, praised the all-rounder saying he ripped him apart by "bits and pieces" during India-New Zealand World Cup semi-final. "Bits and by pieces of sheer brilliance just proved me wrong on all fronts...This is the Jadeja we haven't seen before. Today he was brilliant," he added.

column2: We gave everything we had: Kohli to fans after World Cup exit
column3: Following India's exit from 2019 World Cup, captain Virat Kohli took to Twitter to express his gratitude to fans. "We're all disappointed & share the same emotions as you. We gave everything we had. Jai Hind," he wrote. "You made it a memorable tournament for all of us & we definitely felt the love showered upon the team," he added.

column2: India lose a major ICC semi-final or final for 5th straight time
column3: The 18-run defeat against New Zealand in 2019 World Cup semi-final was India's fifth consecutive defeat in a semi-final or final of a major ICC tournament. India finished runners-up in 2014 T20 World Cup and were knocked out of 2015 World Cup in semi-final. India lost 2016 T20 World Cup semi-final and lost Champions Trophy final in 2017 against Pakistan.

column2: Rafael Nadal to face Roger Federer at Wimbledon after 11 years
column3: World number two Rafael Nadal defeated Sam Querrey 7-5, 6-2, 6-2 on Wednesday to reach his seventh Wimbledon semi-final. With this, Nadal set up his 40th matchup and first at Wimbledon since their 2008 final, with longtime rival Roger Federer. Nadal had beaten Federer in the French Open semi-final last month.

column2: Just wish it hadn't rained yesterday: Aamir as India lose WC semi
column3: Reacting to India losing the 2019 World Cup semi-final to New Zealand on Wednesday, Aamir Khan tweeted, "I just wish it hadn't rained yesterday...the result might have been different." "For me, India had already won the World Cup when we qualified for the semi-finals at the top of the list as the number one team," he added.

column2: Performance of the India-NZ semi-final came from Jadeja: Bhogle
column3: Talking about the 2019 World Cup semi-final match between India and New Zealand, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "It is convention to give the player of the match award to someone from the winning side." "Matt Henry was fantastic today but the performance of the match came from Ravindra Jadeja. He is my player of the match,"' he added.

column2: Federer beats Nishikori to win 100th Wimbledon match, reaches semi
column3: Eight-time champion Roger Federer defeated Kei Nishikori on Wednesday to advance to the semi-finals of Wimbledon for the 13th time. The quarter-final victory was Federer's 100th at Wimbledon, making him the first player in history to earn 100 victories at Wimbledon. Federer also holds the record for winning most matches in Australian Open (97).

column2: BJP trying to have One Nation One Party: Cong after 10 Goa MLAs quit
column3: After 10 of the 15 Goa Congress MLAs resigned and merged with the BJP, Goa Congress President Girish Chodankar said that BJP is attempting to have One Nation One Party, instead of One Nation One Election. Chodankar added that BJP exposed its "intense insecurity" with its coalition partners and within its camp by inducting 10 Congress MLAs in its camp.

column2: Matter of shame: Cong's Shivakumar on being deported back to K'taka
column3: Karnataka Congress leader DK Shivakumar, who was detained by Mumbai police and deported to Bengaluru, said, "Mumbai is known for its hospitality...but BJP and officials misused their authority. It's a matter of shame." Shivakumar was detained after he was waiting to meet the rebel MLAs outside the hotel they were staying at. Police had imposed Section 144 in the area.

column2: PayU India Co-founder & MD Shailaz Nag quits after 8 years: Report
column3: Shailaz Nag, the Co-founder and Managing Director of South African conglomerate Naspers-owned PayU's India arm has reportedly quit after eight years. The Harvard Business School alumnus is looking out for opportunities in the payments space, the report cited its sources as saying. This comes days after Managing director for PayU India's LazyPay Jitendra Gupta had also announced his departure.

column2: Practice Vajrasana: UP Minister to drivers 2 days after bus accident
column3: Two days after 29 passengers died when their bus fell into a drain on Yamuna Expressway, Uttar Pradesh Transport Minister Swatantra Dev Singh advised drivers to practice 'Vajrasana' (a yoga pose) after a heavy meal. Singh said he received the tip from a video by Sadhguru. A probe suggested the accident occurred after the driver dozed off at the wheel.

column2: Spoke like teacher to class of students: FM over Budget queries
column3: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said she "spoke like a teacher to a class of students" after she elaborated on some questions on Budget asked by MPs. "And even if that's not sufficient, I'm quite happy to receive Members to room number 36 with due respect," she said. Leader of Congress in Lok Sabha, Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury, objected to Sitharaman's comment.

column2: Billion broken hearts: Rahul Gandhi on India's WC semi loss
column3: Reacting to India crashing out of the 2019 World Cup after losing to New Zealand in the semi-final, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "Though there are a billion broken hearts tonight, Team India, you put up a great fight." Gandhi added that Team India deserve "our love and respect". The Wayanad MP also congratulated New Zealand for their "well-earned win".

column2: Djokovic defeats Goffin in straight sets to reach 9th Wimbledon semi
column3: Defending champion Novak Djokovic defeated world number 23 David Goffin in straight sets on Wednesday to reach the Wimbledon semi-finals for the ninth time. The 32-year-old won the match with the scoreline of 6-4, 6-0, 6-2 in one hour and 57 minutes. Djokovic is pursuing his fifth title at Wimbledon.

column2: India still the best team in world: Tharoor on WC semi loss
column3: Following India's 2019 World Cup semi-final loss, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor tweeted, "They had a great run in World Cup, topped the table...lost only one match in group stage. They're still the best team in world cricket." "Let's be gracious enough to congratulate Kiwis," the Thiruvananthapuram MP further wrote. India lost to New Zealand by 18 runs.

column2: Why is BJP in a hurry to capture all states, asks Mamata
column3: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday accused the BJP of indulging in horse-trading in Karnataka, and asked, "Why they are in such a hurry to capture all states?" Mamata added, "I do not understand why they are so greedy...This is dirty politics. After Karnataka, they will turn to Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan. Is it their job to break governments?"

column2: Delhi HC bars Amazon, Flipkart from selling Amway products
column3: The Delhi HC has passed an interim order to prevent e-commerce platforms including Amazon, Flipkart and Snapdeal from advertising, displaying or selling Amway products without the brand's consent. Platforms were accused of violation of the Direct Selling Guidelines, 2016 by offering unauthorised sale. Amazon responded to the claims saying it was only an intermediary and couldn't be held liable.

column2: Brookfield plans offer for majority stake in Suzlon: Reports
column3: Canada-based Brookfield Asset Management is reportedly planning an offer to buy majority stake in debt-laden Suzlon Energy. The investment firm is reportedly in talks with Suzlon's creditors to restructure its $1.6-billion debt in a one-time settlement plan, asking SBI-led lenders to take a 50% haircut. Reports said Brookfield may offer to buy new shares, followed by shares from existing holders.

column2: Wasn't aware I was pregnant with Alia, smoked for a scene: Mom Soni
column3: Actress Alia Bhatt's mother Soni Razdan has revealed that she was pregnant with Alia during the shooting of the 1993 film 'Gumrah' but was not aware about it. "And did that scene where I smoked soooo many cigarettes," she added. Directed by her husband Mahesh Bhatt, the film starred Sridevi and Sanjay Dutt in lead roles.

column2: Bunch of 24 'Ruby Roman' grapes sold for ₹7.5 lakh in Japan
column3: A bunch of 24 grapes of 'Ruby Roman' variety was sold for over ₹7.5 lakh (1.2 million yen) at an auction in Japan on Tuesday. The grapes of this variety are known for being extremely juicy, with little acidity, high sugar content, and each grape weighs over 20 grams. A 45-year-old manager of Japanese hot spring inns bought the bunch.

column2: Manjrekar criticised for 'sarcastic' tweet praising Ravindra Jadeja
column3: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has been criticised for his 'sarcastic' tweet praising all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja for his performance in 2019 World Cup semi-final. Manjrekar wrote, "Well played Jadeja!" followed by a wink emoji. "Verbal diarrhea in action," a user tweeted. "We would've accepted it as a sportsman spirit but you lost people's respect by using a winking emoji," wrote another.

column2: 45 minutes of poor cricket cost us a place in the final: Virat Kohli
column3: During the post-match press conference after losing the 2019 World Cup semi-final to New Zealand, Team India captain Virat Kohli said, "Very disappointed, we have played outstanding cricket throughout the tournament." "To go out after 45 minutes of poor cricket is saddening. It breaks your heart too. A spell of bad cricket and you're out of the tournament," he added.

column2: Good to see India's fighting spirit till very end: PM on WC semi loss
column3: Reacting to India crashing out of the 2019 World Cup after losing to New Zealand in the semi-final, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, "A disappointing result, but good to see #TeamIndia’s fighting spirit till the very end." "Wins and losses are a part of life. Best wishes to the team for their future endeavours. #INDvsNZ," he added.

column2: Dhoni has not told us anything about his retirement: Virat Kohli
column3: India captain Virat Kohli has said that MS Dhoni hasn't told them anything about his retirement plans amid speculation that he may quit after team's semi-final exit from the World Cup. MS Dhoni, who hit 50 runs off 72 balls in the semi-final, scored 273 runs in eight innings in the 2019 World Cup. It was Dhoni's fourth World Cup.

column2: Facebook permits death threats against 'dangerous individuals'
column3: Facebook has updated its Community Standards policy, which now accepts calls for "high-severity violence" including death threats if the targets are 'dangerous individuals or organisations'. Facebook stated targets can be "described as having carried out violent crimes or sexual offences", wherein criminal/predator status has been established by media reports, market knowledge of news event, etc.

column2: Rebel Karnataka MLA chased by police, pushed and sent into his car
column3: Rebel Karnataka Congress MLA K Sudhakar, who submitted his resignation to the Speaker of the Assembly, was chased by the police. The police pushed Sudhakar into his car after catching him and sent the car away. A scuffle between the BJP and Congress leaders took place at Karnataka Secretariat, forcing police to bring the situation under control.

column2: Night or 4 am I'd be here: Rahul to Amethi in 1st visit after defeat
column3: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday visited Amethi constituency in Uttar Pradesh for the first time after his defeat in Lok Sabha elections against BJP's Smriti Irani. Rahul said, "I was Amethi MP for 15 years, I have old ties with Amethi. Whenever Amethi would need me, be it at night or four in the morning, I would be here."

column2: 1st pics of 'Baahubali' rocket that will launch Chandrayaan-2 out
column3: The first images of India's heaviest rocket GSLV MkIII-M, referred to as 'Baahubali', were released by ISRO on Wednesday ahead of India's second Moon Mission 'Chandrayaan-2' launch scheduled for July 15 from Sriharikota. The three-stage vehicle, India's most powerful launcher to date, will carry Chandrayaan-2 to its designated orbit. The mission aims to place robotic rover 'Pragyan' on the Moon.

column2: CBI books former SP minister, 4 IAS officers in UP sand mining scam
column3: CBI has registered two new cases in Uttar Pradesh sand mining scam, accusing four IAS officers and Gayatri Prajapati, former minister in Samajwadi Party government. UP government had ordered e-tendering for renewal and award of fresh leases in 2012. CBI alleged that two beneficiaries used Prajapati's influence to get their lease renewed in violation of e-tendering policy of the government.

column2: Pro-Khalistani group Sikhs for Justice banned for anti-national acts
column3: The Centre on Wednesday banned the US-based pro-Khalistani group, Sikhs for Justice (SFJ), for its alleged anti-national activities. SFJ pushes for Sikh Referendum 2020 as part of its separatist agenda. It openly supports the cause of Khalistan and its primary objective is to establish an "independent and sovereign country" in Punjab, said an official.

column2: Merkel seen shaking for 3rd time in a month amid health concerns
column3: German Chancellor Angela Merkel was seen shaking for the third time in a month as she stood alongside Finland PM Antti Rinne during a ceremony in the capital Berlin on Wednesday. Following the incident, Merkel said she was "very well" and there was "no need to worry", adding that she was still psychologically "processing" her first shaking episode.

column2: Airtel Africa becomes Nigeria's third biggest company
column3: Airtel Africa listed on the Nigerian Stock Exchange on Tuesday in a $4.4 billion flotation, after raising about $750 million in London last month. Airtel Africa, the continent's second-largest wireless carrier by subscribers, has become Nigeria's third-largest listed company displacing Nestle Nigeria. Dangote Cement is Nigeria's most valuable stock followed by telecom market leader MTN Nigeria.

column2: Facebook to not launch Libra in India due to local restrictions
column3: Facebook said it has no plans to offer its Calibra digital wallet services in India, effectively ruling out the rollout of its Libra cryptocurrency in the country. "As you may know, there are local restrictions within India...Calibra will respect the legislation," Facebook said. "But we're looking to work with regulators to see if the legislation can be updated," it added.

column2: Media have an agenda against Paul Pogba: Man Utd manager
column3: Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has said Paul Pogba has "never been a concern" and that the media have an "agenda" against the France midfielder. "Agents talk all the time...We have not had any bids from any clubs," Solskjaer added. Pogba's agent Mino Raiola had recently revealed that the 26-year-old is determined to leave Manchester United.

column2: Russian blogger sues Instagram over plans to make 'likes' private
column3: Russian blogger Ruslan Zakharkin claimed he has sued Facebook-owned Instagram over its plans to make the number of 'likes' on a post private. He argued the move will be the end of blogging as a source of income. "I'm representing the community of all Russian bloggers," Zakharkin said, adding Instagram owes him 500 thousand rubles in compensation for moral damages.

column2: Fintech startup NiYO gets $35 million from Tencent, Horizons
column3: Bengaluru-based digital banking fintech startup NiYO Solutions has raised $35 million in Series B round. The round saw participation from China's Tencent Holdings, Hong Kong-based Horizons Ventures and existing investor JS Capital. Founded in 2015 by Vinay Bagri and Virender Bisht, NiYO helps employees increase cash flows by claiming tax-saving allowances on CTC disbursed by their employer.

column2: Swiggy may put $100 million into micro-delivery through Supr
column3: Bengaluru-based Swiggy is reportedly planning to invest about $100 million for its subscription-based delivery business under Supr Daily, a Mumbai-based micro-delivery startup it reportedly acquired last year. The foodtech platform reportedly plans to do so over the next two to three years. Supr Daily was founded in 2015 by IIT-Bombay alumni Puneet Kumar and Shreyas Nagdawane.

column2: IAS officer Arun Kumar appointed as full-time DGCA chief
column3: Arun Kumar, the Additional Secretary and Financial Adviser in Civil Aviation Ministry, has been appointed as the Director General (DG) of Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) on Tuesday. A 1989-batch IAS officer of Haryana cadre, Kumar has been holding additional charge as the DG since the former DG BS Bhullar retired on May 31.

column2: Co-founders' dispute has nothing to do with IndiGo, says CEO
column3: IndiGo CEO Ronojoy Dutta has written to the airline's employees saying that the dispute between its co-founders Rakesh Gangwal and Rahul Bhatia has nothing to do with the airline and its functioning. "The issues between them will eventually get sorted out," he said. Gangwal has accused Bhatia and his firms of entering into "questionable" related party transactions with the airline.

column2: Indonesia assures it will cut tariffs on Indian sugar imports
column3: Indonesia will better facilitate imports of sugar by reducing tariffs on the commodity from India, Indonesian Trade Minister Enggartiasto Lukita told Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal in a bilateral meeting. He also requested India to cut duty on refined palm oil imports. Goyal in the meeting raised concerns about India's trade deficit with Indonesia, which was $10.57 billion in 2018-19.

column2: New Zealand defeat India to reach their 2nd straight World Cup final
column3: New Zealand defeated India by 18 runs in the first semi-final of the 2019 World Cup at Manchester on Wednesday to reach World Cup final for the second straight time. This is the second straight time that India have been eliminated from World Cup in semi-finals. The semi-final was played over two days after rain interrupted play on Tuesday.

column2: Ravindra Jadeja smashes a fifty in ODI cricket after 5 years
column3: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja smashed a fifty in ODI cricket after five years after reaching the 50-run mark off 39 balls against New Zealand in the 2019 World Cup semi-final on Wednesday. With this, he became the first player to score a fifty batting at number eight or lower in World Cup knockout matches.

column2: Wife's impersonator cheating people as Amazon casting head: Shreyas
column3: Actor Shreyas Talpade has warned that a woman is misleading people on social media by using his wife Deepti's name as the Amazon casting head. "She's using the picture of Deepti and me as her profile picture and contacting people through the same WhatsApp identity," he said. "Deepti is an independent producer...She isn't the casting director at Amazon," Shreyas added.

column2: I don't eat anything for 16 hrs daily: Ram Kapoor on 30kg weight loss
column3: Actor Ram Kapoor, whose pictures after weight loss went viral, revealed his workout and diet routine. "I do an hour of weight-lifting on empty stomach after waking up and do cardio just before sleeping," the actor who lost about 30 kilograms said. "I eat limited food during an eight-hour period. For the rest...16 hours, I don't eat anything," Ram added.

column2: Shahid hikes his fee to ₹35 crore after 'Kabir Singh': Reports
column3: Actor Shahid Kapoor has hiked his fee to ₹35 crore after the success of his latest release 'Kabir Singh', as per reports. This will make Shahid one of the highest paid actors in the industry. He was earlier reported to be charging ₹30 crore for a film. Notably, 'Kabir Singh' has crossed ₹200 crore in 13 days.

column2: Kohli got out to left-arm pacers in his 3 WC semis, scored 11 runs
column3: India captain Virat Kohli was dismissed LBW for 1(6) off New Zealand left-arm pacer Trent Boult in 2019 World Cup semi-final on Wednesday. Interestingly, in 2011 World Cup semi-final, Pakistan left-arm pacer Wahab Riaz dismissed him for 9(21), while in the 2015 World Cup semi-final, he was dismissed for 1(13) on the bowling of Australia left-arm pacer Mitchell Johnson.

column2: Indonesian minister challenges Mark Zuckerberg to paddle race
column3: Indonesian minister Susi Pudjiastuti challenged Mark Zuckerberg to a race after the Facebook founder posted a picture of himself paddling on a lake. She asked for 10% stake in Facebook if she won. Pudjiastuti added she'd sell the shares back to Zuckerberg and use the money to buy a "few big patrol vessels" to protect Indonesian waters from illegal fishing.

column2: Mortified: Bumble CEO on allegations of owner promoting drugs
column3: Bumble Founder and CEO Whitney Wolfe Herd, responding to the Forbes report accusing Bumble's billionaire owner Andrey Andreev of promoting sexism, porn and drugs, said she was "mortified by the allegations". "We at Bumble have never seen or heard of any of this behaviour from any team members, and if we had we would have never tolerated it," she added.

column2: Now a dancer will help BJP win votes: JJP leader on Sapna Choudhary
column3: Two days after Haryanvi dancer Sapna Choudhary joined the BJP, Jannayak Janta Party (JJP) leader Digvijay Chautala on Tuesday remarked, "Ab thumke lagane wali (Sapna Choudhary) BJP ke liye votes layegi (Now, a dancer will help the BJP win votes)." He also called her art "vulgar". The Haryana State Commission For Women has issued a notice to the JJP leader.

column2: Detained Cong leaders released in Mumbai, Shivakumar to be sent back
column3: Congress leader Milind Deora's office has said that Mumbai Police has released Congress leaders including Deora who were detained earlier today for waiting outside the hotel where rebel Karnataka MLAs are staying. Deora's office further said that the police is taking Karnataka Congress leader DK Shivakumar directly to the airport from where he will be "forcibly" sent back to Bengaluru.

column2: Is keeping licensed gun a crime? Suspended BJP MLA on viral video
column3: Hours after suspended Uttarakhand BJP MLA Pranav Singh Champion's video of brandishing guns while drinking alcohol went viral, he questioned, "Is drinking alcohol and keeping licensed gun a crime?" He said, "This is a conspiracy. They are licensed weapons and not loaded." He added, "I'm not pointing towards anyone or threatening anyone. What's the crime?"

column2: Mumbai hotel serves tea, doughnuts to Shivakumar after denying room
column3: Karnataka Congress leader DK Shivakumar was served tea and doughnuts by the Mumbai hotel that cancelled his room booking on Wednesday. The media and the police personnel outside the hotel were also offered food. It was not clear whether the snacks were paid for or if the hotel served them as a courtesy gesture after denying entry to Shivakumar.

column2: Detained Shivakumar, Deora kept at Mumbai University's Kalina campus
column3: Detained Congress leaders including DK Shivakumar and Milind Deora have been kept at Mumbai University's Kalina campus rest house. They were sitting outside Renaissance Mumbai Convention Centre Hotel, where 10 rebel Congress-JD(S) Karnataka MLAs are staying, when they were detained after the MLAs refused to meet them. Sixteen Congress-JD(S) MLAs have submitted resignations to Karnataka Speaker.

column2: Dawood's D-Company transformed into terrorist network: India at UN
column3: Underworld don Dawood Ibrahim's D-Company has transformed from a criminal syndicate into a terrorist network, which poses a "real and present danger" in the region, Indian Ambassador to the UN, Syed Akbaruddin, told the Security Council. The D-Company is engaging in illegal economic activities such as gold smuggling and arms and drug trafficking from a "safe haven", Akbaruddin added.

column2: Pak news anchor shot dead in Karachi, suspect attempts suicide
column3: Pakistani news anchor Mureed Abbas was shot dead outside a cafe in Karachi on Tuesday over a personal dispute, police officials said. Abbas' friends informed the police that he had a monetary dispute with someone whose identity had been withheld. The suspect was caught attempting suicide when the police raided his house and he's been admitted to hospital.

column2: Pregnant women, children killed in Papua New Guinea massacre
column3: Pregnant women and children were among 24 people murdered in a tribal massacre in Papua New Guinea's (PNG) Hela province. The killings were in retaliation for an earlier attack that killed six people, officials said. The killings occurred in the district represented by PNG's PM James Marape, who called it "one of the saddest days of (his) life".

column2: Billionaire Dyson buys Singapore's costliest flat for ₹372 crore
column3: Brexit-backing British billionaire and inventor James Dyson has bought Singapore's most expensive apartment, accessed by its own lift. The three-storey penthouse at the top of Singapore's tallest building, Tanjong Pagar Centre, sold for S$73.8 million (₹372 crore), local media reported. Dyson's purchase topped the S$60 million paid by Facebook Co-Founder Eduardo Saverin for a penthouse in 2017.

column2: IndiGo loses ₹11,600 cr in m-cap as promoter dispute becomes public
column3: India's largest airline IndiGo lost as much as ₹11,600 crore in market value after a dispute between its billionaire Co-Founders Rakesh Gangwal and Rahul Bhatia became public. Gangwal called on SEBI to take away the "unusual" controlling rights exercised by Rahul Bhatia and said that governance standards had "collapsed" at IndiGo. Gangwal owns 37% of IndiGo, while Bhatia controls 38%.

column2: It feels like coming home: Rahul on Amethi visit
column3: During his first visit to Amethi since he lost the parliamentary seat to BJP's Smriti Irani, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said, "It feels like coming home". "I'm very happy after coming to Amethi," Rahul tweeted after reaching Amethi. Earlier today, Rahul thanked his Twitter followers after his follower count on the social media platform reached 10 million.

column2: AAP rules out forming alliance with JJP for Haryana polls
column3: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has ruled out an alliance with the Jannayak Janta Party (JJP) for the upcoming Assembly elections in Haryana. However, the AAP and the JJP together fought the Lok Sabha elections on all 10 Haryana parliamentary seats. The Assembly elections in Haryana are due in October 2019.

column2: SpaceX wins $50-mn NASA contract for black hole research mission
column3: NASA has awarded an over $50-million contract to Elon Musk-led aerospace startup SpaceX to launch its Imaging X-Ray Polarimetry Explorer (IXPE) mission. The IXPE mission is aimed towards studying polarised light from sources including supermassive black holes, neutron stars and pulsar wind nebulae. The mission is presently scheduled to launch in April 2021 on SpaceX's Falcon 9 rocket from Florida.

column2: June passenger vehicle sales fall 17.5%, car sales down 24%
column3: India's domestic passenger vehicles sales declined by 17.54% year-on-year in June to 2,25,732 units, according to the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM). The domestic sales of passenger cars in June fell by 24.07% to 1,39,628 units compared to 1,83,885 units in June 2018. Earlier, India's largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki cut production for a fifth straight month in June.

column2: UK to give free HPV vaccines to boys, aims to stop 1L cancer cases
column3: The UK has announced that starting September, boys in the year 8 of the country's schooling system, aged around 12-13, will receive free vaccination against sexually-transmitted Human Papillomavirus (HPV). The move aims to prevent over 1 lakh cancer cases by 2058. About 5% of all cancers worldwide are linked to HPV virus, UK's Public Health England said.

column2: Fairfax-backed CSB Bank set to file for ₹500-cr IPO: Reports
column3: Kerala-based CSB Bank, formerly Catholic Syrian Bank, is reportedly set to file for up to ₹500-crore Initial Public Offering (IPO). Canadian billionaire Prem Watsa's Fairfax acquired 51% stake in the bank for $168 million last year following RBI's first such approval given to a foreign firm. The IPO will largely be an offer for sale by existing investors, reports added.

column2: Appreciate Ekta's stand but will continue ban on Kangana: Journalists
column3: Entertainment Journalists' Guild of India has accepted producer Ekta Kapoor's apology over Kangana Ranaut's argument with a reporter. "The Entertainment Journalists Guild appreciates Ms Ekta Kapoor's support and standing for what is right through her official statement," the body wrote. "However, we will continue the ban on Ms Kangana Ranaut across all media platforms," the statement further read.

column2: It is very unfair to criticise MS Dhoni: Kapil Dev
column3: India's 1983 World Cup-winning captain Kapil Dev has said it is very unfair to criticise ex-India captain MS Dhoni. "It has happened to those who have been rated as all-time greats. They aren't going to be 20 all over again," he added. "The most important thing is Dhoni is doing good as far as team is concerned," he further said.

column2: India register the lowest powerplay score in 2019 World Cup
column3: India registered the lowest powerplay score in 2019 World Cup after being restricted to 24/4 in the first 10 overs against New Zealand in the semi-final on Wednesday. India's top three batsmen got out for one run each in the innings. The previous lowest powerplay score in 2019 World Cup was recorded by New Zealand (27/1) in the same match.

column2: Sehwag jokingly suggests DLS method for salaries during rainy days
column3: After rain interrupted India-New Zealand semi-final on Tuesday, Virender Sehwag mocked the Duckworth Lewis method. "Will it be advantage employees if salary is given by Duckworth Lewis in rainy months. If baarish mein bhi employee is coming to office. What do HR log think?" he tweeted. "Cricket mein DLS aur Salary mein CTC kisiko samajh aaya hai?" a user tweeted.

column2: Woman claims American Airlines told her to cover up outfit with blanket
column3: A US doctor has alleged she and her 8-year-old son were denied boarding on an American Airlines flight over her outfit. "I was asked to 'cover up'...I was threatened with not getting back on the flight unless I walked down the aisle wrapped in...blanket," she tweeted while sharing her outfit's pictures. "We apologise...for their experience," the airline's spokesperson said.

column2: Ghulam Nabi Azad, other Cong leaders detained for protesting in B'luru
column3: Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad and other party leaders were detained on Wednesday near Raj Bhawan in Bengaluru while protesting against the alleged horse-trading in Karnataka. JD(S) chief and former PM HD Deve Gowda and Congress leaders Siddaramaiah and KC Venugopal were also present at the protest site. Notably, Congress leaders DK Shivakumar and Milind Deora were detained in Mumbai.

column2: Don't want to insult Shivakumar, but can't meet him: Rebel Cong MLA
column3: After rebel Karnataka MLAs refused to meet Congress leader DK Shivakumar who came to Mumbai, rebel Congress MLA ST Somashekar said, "We don't intend to insult Shivakumar. We've faith in him but there's a reason we've taken this step." He added, "Friendship, love and affection are on one side, [but] we request him to understand why we can't meet him."

column2: 7 more arrested for murder of Congress leader Vikas Chaudhary
column3: Seven more people were arrested on Tuesday in connection with the murder of Haryana Congress leader Vikas Chaudhary, who was shot dead outside a gym in Faridabad on June 27. Four other people allegedly involved in planning the murder and supplying weapons to the perpetrators had been arrested earlier. Earlier, the police said Vikas was murdered over a financial dispute.

column2: Orange alert for heavy rainfall in 9 Uttarakhand districts
column3: The India Meteorological Department has issued an orange alert in Uttarakhand from July 11-14, predicting that heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely to occur at isolated places in nine districts. The alert has been issued for Nainital, Champawat, Udham Singh Nagar, Pithoragarh, Chamoli, Tehri Garhwal, Pauri Garhwal, Dehradun and Haridwar districts.

column2: 7-month-old girl, 2-year-old boy die in Patna wall collapse
column3: A seven-month-old girl and a nearly two-year-old boy were killed and five people were injured in Patna after a wall of an office building collapsed on a hut following heavy rains on Tuesday. "All the families have been contacted. I...visited the accident site and gave ₹4 lakh cheques to each of the two families," Patna District Magistrate Kumar Ravi said.

column2: Wrong placement of height barrier blamed for Dubai bus crash
column3: The placing of the height barrier in which a bus crashed in Dubai last month, killing 17 people including 12 Indians, was blamed for the accident in a UAE court. The bus had wrongly entered a road and crashed into a height barrier. The distance between the warning signboard and the barrier was only 12 metres, the court was told.

column2: UK Ambassador to US resigns after calling Trump govt 'incompetent'
column3: Kim Darroch, the UK's Ambassador to the US, has resigned after leaked emails revealed that he'd called President Donald Trump's administration "dysfunctional" and "incompetent". This comes after Trump said that the US would no longer deal with Darroch. "The current situation is making it impossible for me to carry out my role as I'd like," Darroch said in a statement.

column2: Trump calls UK PM May 'foolish' and her ambassador 'wacky'
column3: US President Donald Trump called UK PM Theresa May "foolish" and the UK's Ambassador to the US, Kim Darroch, "wacky" and "a very stupid guy". Trump said May failed in her Brexit negotiations as she ignored his advice. He earlier said the US will no longer deal with Darroch after leaked emails revealed that he called Trump administration "dysfunctional".

column2: Indian ethnic group workers in UK earn more than white British
column3: Chinese and Indian ethnic group workers in the UK had higher median hourly pay than white British employees in 2018, an official survey revealed. Chinese ethnicity group is the highest paid, receiving £15.75 an hour, followed by Indian workers at £13.47. The median pay of white British workers was £12.03 an hour compared with £9.60 for people of Bangladeshi ethnicity.

column2: Google to buy Israeli-US cloud storage startup Elastifile
column3: Google has announced it plans to acquire Israeli-US cloud storage startup Elastifile reportedly for around $200 million, which will join Google Cloud post-acquisition. This marks another acquisition under former Oracle executive Thomas Kurian, who was named as the new Google Cloud CEO in November 2018. Founded in 2013, Elastifile has raised about $75 million from Huawei and Lenovo, among others.

column2: Delhi has an entire museum dedicated to toilets
column3: The Sulabh International Museum of Toilets in West Delhi area has numerous items to display the transition in toilet-related technology, sanitation habits and hygiene etiquettes. It also has several humorous and intellectual poems, stories, jokes and phrases on toilets from various times. The museum is the brain-child of Sulabh International Social Service Organisation's Founder Bindeshwar Pathak.

column2: Cong hasn't allowed RS to function over K'taka issue: Javadekar
column3: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar accused the Congress of not allowing Rajya Sabha to function on the issue of the political crises in Karnataka. While the House was disrupted on Tuesday, Congress leaders staged a walkout on Wednesday over the Karnataka issue. Javadekar said, "The entire episode (Karnataka issue) is done by Congress and BJP has nothing to do with it."

column2: Kumaraswamy has no right to continue as K'taka CM: Yeddyurappa
column3: Karnataka BJP chief BS Yeddyurappa on Wednesday said he met Karnataka Governor Vajubhai Vala on Wednesday and conveyed to him that the Congress-JD(S) coalition does not have the required strength in the state Assembly. Yeddyurappa added, "Kumaraswamy has no moral right to continue as Chief Minister as they do not have the numbers."

column2: US' General Catalyst may invest in CRED's $120-million round
column3: Bengaluru-based credit card bill payment startup CRED is reportedly in talks with US-based venture capital fund General Catalyst to secure investment in its $120-million funding round.
