Reagan National Airport witnessed 8.4 cm of rain from 9-10 am and broke the previous record of 5.6 cm set in 1958 in one hour. Several areas were flooded in the US' capital and people were rescued from cars.

column2: We were told to leave today: B'luru employee fired by Deutsche Bank
column3: A day after Germany's Deutsche Bank announced 18,000 job cuts globally, some employees in Bengaluru were fired on Monday and were asked to vacate premises by today itself, an employee said. "The day started with a phone call and meeting with HR," he said. "We were informed our jobs have become redundant and given approximately a month's salary," he added.

column2: Rohit Sharma has been the best batsman: Kane Williamson
column3: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson praised Indian opener, Rohit Sharma, saying, "Rohit has been the standout batsman in this tournament so far. Without a doubt, he has been superb in this World Cup." "We need to be our best in the semi-final. The Indian team also has an outstanding attack," Williamson said ahead of the India-New Zealand World Cup semi-final.

column2: India need a sixth bowler against New Zealand: Ajit Agarkar
column3: Former Indian pacer Ajit Agarkar reckons that India need a sixth bowler for their World Cup 2019 semi-finals against New Zealand on Tuesday. "Without any disrespect to New Zealand, they [India] might feel like going with (5 bowlers) against them, because I think their batting is not doing as well but I don't think it's a good ploy," Agarkar added.

column2: Nadal defeats Sousa to reach Wimbledon last-8 stage
column3: Spanish tennis player Rafael Nadal beat Joao Sousa to reach the last-8 stage of the Wimbledon 2019 on Monday. Nadal, who will be making his 39th appearance in a Grand Slam quarter-final, beat Sousa 6-2, 6-2, 6-2. The Spaniard, who won the tournament in 2008 and 2010, will now face USA's Sam Querrey in the quarter-finals.

column2: Poonam Mahajan launches BJP's membership drive on JNU campus
column3: Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) President Poonam Mahajan on Monday launched the membership drive of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on the JNU campus in Delhi. Calling JNU the 'Ganga' of the country, she added, "The membership campaign is needed because we want to take along every common man." Mahajan said India's integrity is safe under PM Narendra Modi's leadership.

column2: Over 4,000 road accident black spots rectified in Himachal: CM
column3: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur said that over 4,000 road accident black spots have been rectified by constructing retaining walls, crash barriers and parapets in Himachal. He added that all new roads will be passed after a road safety audit by an independent agency. Recently, around 48 people were killed in two road accidents in Himachal Pradesh.

column2: CISF jawan gets 'doubtful voter' notice in Assam
column3: A Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) jawan on Sunday claimed that he has been issued a doubtful voter notice by a Foreigners' Tribunal in Assam's Kamrup district. The jawan, Mamud Ali, was forced to rush home from his posting in West Bengal. "After serving the nation...for 25 years, I don't know how I should prove my Indian citizenship," Ali said.

column2: Tamil Nadu govt removes Hindi stickers from state buses
column3: The Tamil Nadu Transport Department on Sunday removed the safety instruction stickers written in Hindi from government buses after a picture of the sticker led to outrage on social media. The department's press release stated that the buses were manufactured in other states. The release further stated that the Hindi words were replaced by Tamil words before public use.

column2: It's time B'wood stopped recreating old classic tracks: Baba Sehgal
column3: Rapper Baba Sehgal has said that it's time Bollywood stopped recreating or remixing old classic film soundtracks. "There's no harm in recreating a song but the quality, instrumentation and the output in doing so is sad," he added. "Please tap the right talent as we have it in abundance here and stop destroying and ruining the original," the rapper wrote.

column2: Rohit Sharma's batting is like poetry in motion: Sachin Tendulkar
column3: After India opener Rohit Sharma equalled his record for scoring most World Cup hundreds, former India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar said that Rohit is "fantastic". "Rohit's batting is poetry in motion because of the kind of bat-swing he has, not many players possess that. A class apart when it comes to the smooth swing... Rohit's swing's like a pendulum," he added.

column2: I can bowl anytime, I am lethal, jokes Kohli ahead of World Cup semi
column3: A day ahead of India-New Zealand 2019 World Cup semi-final match, Team India captain Virat Kohli joked that he can bowl anytime as he is quite lethal. "I can bowl...as long as I don't slip on the pitch," he added. His remark came after a journalist reminded him that he dismissed Kane Williamson in India-NZ 2008 U-19 World Cup semi-final.

column2: Dravid appointed as head of cricket at National Cricket Academy
column3: The BCCI on Monday appointed ex-India captain Rahul Dravid as Head Cricket, National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru. Dravid will oversee all cricket related activities at NCA and will be involved in mentoring, coaching, training and motivating players, coaches and support staff, the BCCI said. Dravid had been head coach of India A and Under-19 men's teams since 2015.

column2: Apple may allow users iCloud.com login with Face ID, Touch ID
column3: Apple may soon allow users to use Face ID or Touch ID for iCloud.com login. According to reports, on visiting the website, Apple will ask users to use their Apple ID to sign in to the website. The website will then use Face ID or Touch ID depending on the type of the device.

column2: Apple puts billboard in Canada to troll Google over privacy issues
column3: Apple has put up a billboard in Canada that reads, "We're in the business of staying out of yours. Privacy. That's iPhone," to troll Google over its privacy issues. Apple put the billboard right next to Sidewalk Labs' new headquarters in Toronto, which is Google's sister company. Recently, Sidewalk Labs clarified that it does not share its data with Google.

column2: Second independent MLA resigns from Karnataka council of ministers
column3: Another independent lawmaker R Shankar resigned on Monday from the Karnataka council of ministers. This comes after independent MLA H Nagesh's resignation earlier in the day. Notably, all Congress and JD(S) ministers also resigned on Monday to make way for the 13 rebel JD(S)-Congress MLAs who had resigned on Saturday, so that the coalition government in Karnataka can be saved.

column2: ITBP releases last footage of Nanda Devi climbers killed in avalanche
column3: The Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) on Monday released the last visuals of the mountaineers' team near the summit on an unnamed peak near the Nanda Devi east, who were killed in an avalanche. At least eight mountaineers died attempting to climb the Nanda Devi mountain in May. One of the victims shot the footage a day before the avalanche.

column2: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar takes oath as Rajya Sabha member
column3: Union Minister of External Affairs S Jaishankar took oath as a member of the Rajya Sabha on Monday. The former diplomat was elected to the Upper House of Parliament from Gujarat in the by-elections held for two seats on Friday. The other Rajya Sabha seat from Gujarat was won by BJP leader Jugal Thakor.

column2: Connect FB, Twitter, Instagram of all students to HRD Ministry: Govt
column3: The Human Resource Development Ministry (MHRD) has issued instructions to all Higher Educational Institutions (HEIs) to connect all the students' Twitter, Facebook and Instagram accounts with the HEIs' and MHRD's Twitter, Facebook and Instagram accounts. The ministry also said each institution is expected to appoint a Social Media Champion (SMC) to connect the institution with other institutions and the ministry.

column2: Man granted divorce 24 years after he separated from wife
column3: The Delhi HC last week granted divorce to a man, 24 years after he and his estranged wife separated. The court said it was unfortunate for them to litigate for so many years with the uncertainty of their marital status. However, it reportedly blamed them for the delay, saying it's the litigants who often pile up evidence and prolong cases.

column2: Incidents of rapes cannot be stopped: Ex-Rajasthan minister Saraf
column3: Former Rajasthan minister and BJP MLA Kalicharan Saraf has said that incidents of rapes cannot be stopped. "Under Congress rule in Rajasthan, there is an increase of about 87 per cent in the incidents of rapes and sexual assaults, which is worrisome," he added. Saraf's remarks come after a seven-year-old girl was allegedly raped in Jaipur's Shastri Nagar area.

column2: False & motivated narrative: India on UN rights body report on J&K
column3: The Ministry of External Affairs on Monday said that the UN rights office's report on Jammu and Kashmir was a continuation of a "false and motivated narrative". It added that India has registered a "strong protest" with the Office of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights over its report that criticised India for not taking concrete steps in Kashmir.

column2: Over 36% schools in India without electricity: HRD Minister
column3: Over 36% of schools across the country do not have electricity, Union HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal Nishank said on Monday. The information was shared by the minister in response to a written question in Lok Sabha. "As per Unified District Information System for Education (U-DISE) report, 2017-18, 63.14% schools have power supply," he said.

column2: We’ll whack the Aussies! Eng v India FINAL: Kevin Pietersen
column3: In regards to the upcoming World Cup 2019 semi-finals, former England captain Kevin Pietersen tweeted, "We'll whack the Aussies! Eng v India FINAL!" India will face New Zealand in the first semi-final on Tuesday, while England and Australia will face off in the second semi-final on Thursday. India hasn't beaten England or New Zealand at this World Cup so far.

column2: Messi needs to have more respect: Brazil coach Tite
column3: Reaction to Argentine forward Lionel Messi's 'fixing' allegation against Copa América organisers, Brazil coach Tite said, "The one I treated as extraordinary, as extraterrestrial, needs to have more respect and accept when he's beaten." "We were harmed [by referees] in several games. We played fair against Argentina the whole time...He put huge pressure [on] because of his reputation," Tite said.

column2: Kejriwal, Sisodia summoned by Delhi court in defamation case
column3: A Delhi court on Monday summoned Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and his deputy Manish Sisodia in a defamation case filed by BJP's Vijender Gupta. Gupta, who is the Leader of Opposition in Delhi Assembly, claimed that the duo maligned his image by accusing him of being part of a conspiracy to assassinate Kejriwal and has sought ₹1 crore in damages.

column2: 100-bed pediatric ICU to be set up in SKMCH: Centre tells SC
column3: The Centre on Monday filed a reply in the Supreme Court on the AES outbreak in Bihar saying, a 100-bedded pediatric ICU will be set up in Muzaffarpur's Sri Krishna Medical College and Hospital (SKMCH) within one year. Five virology labs and 10-bedded pediatric ICUs will also be established in different districts of the state, it said.

column2: Amartya Sen should stick to his subject: Meghalaya Governor
column3: Meghalaya Governor Tathagata Roy on Sunday criticised Nobel Laureate Amartya Sen's remarks on 'Jai Shri Ram', saying he should stick to his subject economics. "Are Ramrajatala and Serampore in West Bengal or somewhere else?" Roy was quoted as saying. Sen had said that 'Jai Shri Ram' has no association with Bengali culture and is now used to beat up people.

column2: Now I know how my wife felt when she was pregnant: Chris on 'fat' Thor
column3: Speaking about playing a 'fat' Thor in 'Avengers: Endgame', actor Chris Hemsworth jokingly said, "At any moment people would come up and rub my stomach. I know how my wife feels now when she was pregnant!" He added, the prosthetic suit weighed 40 kg. Chris further revealed he had weights in his wrists and ankles to make him move differently.

column2: Religion not a thing in my family: Hrithik on sister dating a Muslim
column3: Speaking about his sister Sunaina Roshan's allegations that her father slapped her as she loves a Muslim man, Hrithik Roshan said, "Religion is not even a thing in my family." "It has never been...given importance whatsoever in my entire life," he added. Sunaina's boyfriend Ruhail Amin had said it's an "irony" that even Hrithik was married to a Muslim.

column2: Kohli, Williamson were captains in India-NZ 2008 U-19 WC semi as well
column3: Virat Kohli-led India and Kane Williamson-led New Zealand will clash in 2019 World Cup semi-final on Tuesday. Interestingly, Virat Kohli-led India had defeated Kane Williamson-led New Zealand by three wickets (DLS method) in the semi-final of 2008 Under-19 World Cup. In that match, Kohli had dismissed Williamson for 37(80), while he himself scored 43 runs off 53 balls.

column2: World no. 55 Riske knocked world no. 1 Barty out of Wimbledon
column3: Unseeded American Alison Riske reached her first Wimbledon quarterfinal after beating world number one Ashleigh Barty in three sets on Monday. The 29-year-old beat the 23-year-old French Open defending champion 3-6, 6-2, 6-3 in one hour and 37 minutes. Riske will next face the winner of the match between former champion Serena Williams and Carla Suarez Navarro.

column2: Brazil defeat Peru 3-1 to win their 9th Copa América title
column3: Brazil defeated Peru 3-1 to win their ninth Copa América title and their first since 2007. Everton and Gabriel Jesus scored one goal each in the first half, while Richarlison converted a late penalty for Brazil. Brazil's veteran right-back Dani Alves was named player of the tournament, while Everton was named player of the final.

column2: Jordan bans PUBG citing 'negative effects' on the citizens
column3: Jordan has banned the hugely popular online game PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds (PUBG) and cited the game's "negative effects" on the citizens. Institutions in Jordan have also issued warnings to the employees not to play the game. The move follows similar bans in Iraq and Nepal on the game.

column2: Trend of resignations was started by Rahul Gandhi in Cong: Rajnath
column3: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, while speaking about the current Karnataka political crisis, said, "The trend of submitting resignations was started by Rahul Gandhi in Congress." "When he (Rahul) himself resigned from his post how can we (BJP) be blamed," he added. Notably, all Congress and JD(S) ministers in Karnataka government have submitted their resignations.

column2: 30-yr-old man set to be 1st black African in space dies in bike crash
column3: Mandla Maseko, a 30-year-old set to become the first black African in space, died in a bike crash. In a 2013 competition, he beat a million entrants to be one of 23 people to travel on an hour-long sub-orbital trip. Originally scheduled to fly in 2015, no plans of his trip were made public at the time of his death.

column2: ISRO Chief prays at Udupi, Kollur temples ahead of Chandrayaan 2 launch
column3: Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) Chairman K Sivan offered special prayers at the Udupi Sri Krishna Mutt along with family members in Karnataka on Sunday ahead of the 'Chandrayaan 2' launch. Sivan also visited the Sri Mookambika temple at Kollur and offered prayers. 'Chandrayaan 2', India's second Moon mission, will be launched on July 15 later this month.

column2: 'Harassed' by son & his wife, couple posts video on social media
column3: A couple in their 60s have posted a video on social media claiming that they are being "harassed" by their son and his wife. The Ghaziabad couple said that they are being "pressurised to leave their house", adding that their son and daughter-in-law are "not concerned whether they live or die". Police reached their home after the video surfaced online.

column2: Bill on voluntary use of Aadhaar as ID proof passed in Rajya Sabha
column3: The Aadhaar and Other Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2019 was passed in Rajya Sabha on Monday. It will allow voluntary use of Aadhaar card as proof of identity for opening bank accounts and getting mobile connections. The bill was passed in Lok Sabha last week. It was tabled in the Rajya Sabha by Information Technology Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad.

column2: Stop and reverse any action against 2015 nuclear deal: EU to Iran
column3: The European Union (EU) has called on Iran to "stop and reverse" any action that goes against the 2015 nuclear deal signed between the Middle East country and world powers. The EU also said that it is "extremely concerned" about Iran's announcement on enriching uranium above the limit set by the nuclear deal.

column2: Tata pays ₹50,000 cr to complete sale of mobile business to Airtel
column3: Tata Group has paid lenders and the government about ₹50,000 crore to help complete the sale of its mobile services business to Bharti Airtel. The deal was announced in 2017. Tata Sons, the group holding company, paid Department of Telecommunications ₹10,000 crore late last month, days after settling all pending loans worth ₹40,000 crore owed by unit Tata Teleservices (Maharashtra).

column2: Mortaza takes blame for B'desh's 'disappointing' WC campaign
column3: Bangladesh captain Mashrafe Mortaza took the blame for Bangladesh's 'disappointing' World Cup campaign. "As a captain, if I fail to lead the team to expected results, there will always be criticism... I take full responsibility as I should," Mortaza said. Mortaza managed to pick up just one wicket in eight matches at the 2019 World Cup.

column2: Indian batting does not rely heavily on Rohit-Virat: Bangar
column3: Indian team's batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said that the Indian team does not rely heavily on Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. "Of course the middle order hasn't got to bat for a longer period of time... But Hardik has done a role, Mahi has done a role and Rishabh has had a few good knocks," Bangar added.

column2: Mexico beat USA to win record 8th CONCACAF Gold Cup title
column3: Mexico defeated USA 1-0 to claim a record eighth CONCACAF Gold Cup title on Monday. Jonathan dos Santos scored the winning goal in the 73rd minute for Mexico. "There's a lot of guys playing in a game like this for the first time... This experience will help us moving forward," USA's coach Gregg Berhalter said after the loss.

column2: Kumaraswamy should resign immediately: BJP's Shobha Karandlaje
column3: Amid the ongoing political crises in Karnataka, BJP MP Shobha Karandlaje on Monday said that CM HD Kumaraswamy should "resign immediately as he has lost the majority". She added, "The Congress MLAs have already resigned and he should make way for another government in Karnataka." Earlier today, independent MLA H Nagesh also resigned and withdrew support to HD Kumaraswamy-led government.

column2: Posters surface in Bhopal urging Scindia to be Congress President
column3: Following Jyotiraditya Scindia resignation as Congress General Secretary, posters surfaced outside the party office in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal appealing to Rahul Gandhi to appoint Scindia as the party's President. Scindia's resignation was accepted on Sunday, days after Rahul Gandhi officially resigned from the post of party President taking responsibility for Congress' defeat in the recently concluded Lok Sabha elections.

column2: Edtech startup Board Infinity raises ₹2.2 crore from angel investors
column3: Mumbai-based edtech startup Board Infinity has raised ₹2.2 crore from angel investors including ex-CFO of Info Edge Ambarish Raghuvanshi, Careers360 Founder Maheshwer Peri and others. Individual investors from Microsoft, Flipkart, Xiaomi, and others also participated. Founded in 2017 by Abhay Gupta and Sumesh Nair, it provides short skill courses delivered by industry experts in live classes format.

column2: Doctors at 3 Delhi hospitals strike over assault on student
column3: Doctors at three Delhi government-run hospitals called a strike on Monday after an on-duty medical student was allegedly assaulted by a patient's relative in the emergency ward of LNJP hospital. Both regular and emergency services have been shut, the medical superintendent said. The doctors' main demand is augmenting of security, including having marshals in the emergency department.

column2: Over 30 students fall ill after consuming hostel food in Hyd
column3: Over 30 students from Telangana Minorities Residential School were admitted to a hospital on Monday after consuming hostel food. "The conditions of the students are stable and one student was discharged from the hospital," an official said. However, the exact reason for their illness has not been revealed but the symptoms reportedly showed a case of food poisoning.

column2: After Cong ministers, all JD(S) ministers in K'taka govt resign
column3: After resignations by 21 Congress ministers, all JD(S) ministers in the Karnataka government have resigned. The Cabinet will be restructured soon, Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy said. "I don't have any kind of anxiety about the present political development," he added. This comes after several MLAs of the Congress-JD(S) coalition government submitted their resignations to the Assembly Speaker.

column2: Sensex closes 793 points lower in its worst single-day fall of 2019
column3: The benchmark BSE index Sensex closed 792.82 points lower to close at 38,720.57 on Monday, registering its biggest single-day decline in 2019. Auto and banking shares were among the worst performers in today's session. This marks the second plunge in a row for Sensex after the newly-elected NDA government presented the Union Budget 2019.

column2: Man seen climbing 1,016-foot-tall skyscraper in London
column3: A man was seen scaling the glass exterior of the Shard skyscraper in London on Monday. Police confirmed that they managed to get him inside, adding that he was talking to officers and has not been arrested. Located close to the London Bridge, the Shard is 1,016-foot-tall and is home to offices, restaurants, a retail arcade and a hotel.

column2: What will happen if India-New Zealand semi-final gets washed out?
column3: India and New Zealand will clash in their 2019 World Cup semi-final match in Manchester on Tuesday. If it is washed out, it'll be played on Wednesday, which is the 'reserve day'. If the match is washed out on reserve day too, India will automatically qualify for the final as they have more points than New Zealand in league stage.

column2: The man who taught us how to win overseas: Harbhajan wishes Ganguly
column3: Wishing former India captain Sourav Ganguly on the occasion of his 47th birthday, off-spinner Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "Happy birthday, Tiger. My big brother." "Sourav Ganguly, the man who taught us how to win overseas. What a legend...Jeo dada jeo...love u always." Ganguly played 424 international matches from 1992 to 2008.

column2: Sony working on a foldable smartphone: Reports
column3: After Samsung, Huawei and Apple, now Sony is working on a foldable phone, reports said on Monday. According to device leaker Max J, Sony prototypes currently feature a 3,220mAh battery, an LG-supplied display, a 10x zoom camera and a Snapdragon SM7250 processor. The retail models may feature Snapdragon 855 SoC and Qualcomm X50 modem, he added.

column2: Google testing a video play/pause button for Chrome
column3: Google is testing a play/pause button for its Chrome browser to let users pause or play a video from any tab open on the browser. A play icon will appear next to the URL if a video is playing in any tab. By clicking on it, a larger control will let users control video without going to the video itself.

column2: BJP has nothing to do with K'taka crisis: Rajnath Singh in Lok Sabha
column3: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Karnataka, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that the BJP has nothing to do with what is happening in Karnataka. "Our party has never indulged in horse trading," he added. This comes after several MLAs of the Congress-JD(S) coalition government submitted their resignations last week and 21 Congress ministers resigned on Monday.

column2: Doesn't she know meaning of taking flag: BJP on Anju Bobby George
column3: After Olympian Anju Bobby George denied reports that she has joined BJP, Karnataka BJP media convenor S Shantharam said, "Doesn't she know the meaning of taking flag on stage from party president?" Shantharam added, "She came on stage, took the party flag and our state President BS Yeddyurappa announced that she joined BJP. Don't know why she changed her stand."

column2: Indonesia ride-hailing unicorn Go-Jek invests $5 mn in Rebel Foods
column3: Indonesian ride-hailing and logistics unicorn Go-Jek has invested $5 million in the ongoing Series D round of the Indian cloud kitchen company Rebel Foods. Go-Jek made this investment through its investment arm Go Ventures. Rebel Foods owns cloud kitchen brands including Faasos, Oven Story, Lunch Box, Behrouz, and The Good Bowl among others.

column2: OYO Founder could buy back $1.5 bn shares to get greater control
column3: OYO Founder Ritesh Agarwal is reportedly in talks with the company's investors Sequoia Capital and Lightspeed Venture Partners to buy back shares worth $1.5 billion and increase his ownership of the startup he founded. Another $500 million could come in the form of primary capital. Agarwal is looking to increase his ownership from the current 10% to 30%.

column2: Saravana Founder hospitalised, fails to surrender in murder case
column3: P Rajagopal, the Founder of Saravana Bhavan chain of restaurants, failed to surrender before the police on Sunday. According to reports, Rajagopal got himself admitted in a hospital on Thursday. Sentenced to life imprisonment for the abduction and murder of a man in 2001, Rajagopal was asked to surrender himself to the police by July 7 by the Supreme Court.

column2: Maruti Suzuki shares hit 2-year low after production cut
column3: The shares of Maruti Suzuki hit a two-year low and traded below ₹6,000 a share for the first time since March 30, 2017, on Monday. This comes after the company cut vehicle production for the fifth consecutive month in June. It slashed vehicle production by 15.6% last month to 1,11,917 units as compared to 1,32,616 units in the year-ago month.

column2: 2,200 Infosys employees outside India earning more than ₹1 cr: Report
column3: Infosys has over 2,200 employees outside India who earned over ₹1 crore during the last financial year, according to data accessed by The Economic Times. The data excludes over 1,700 people directly employed by the company's European branches. In the last fiscal, less than 30 India-based Infosys executives received salaries over ₹1.02 crore, which jumped to 64 in one year.

column2: Sensex falls 700 points, investors lose over ₹5 lakh crore in 2 days
column3: Sensex extended losses falling over 700 points at day's low and taking its two-day loss to over 1,100 points. Over ₹5 lakh crore of equity investor wealth got wiped out in last two sessions. On Friday, both the Sensex and Nifty fell nearly 1% after Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented the Budget.

column2: British Airways faces ₹1,500-crore fine over theft of customer data
column3: British Airways on Monday said the UK Information Commissioner's Office intends to impose a penalty of £183.4 million (over ₹1,500 crore) for the theft of customer data from the airline's website last year. The airline revealed last September that the credit card details of hundreds of thousands of its customers were stolen in an attack on its website and app.

column2: Delhi has a silent headphone bar like the one in 'Ae Dil Hai Mushkil'
column3: There is a silent headphone bar in Delhi just like the one shown in the film 'Ae Dil Hai Mushkil', which lets guests enjoy their own music. Located in Greater Kailash, 'Headphones Reloaded' hands over a set of neon LED headphones to guests on arrival. The guests can then choose between songs from categories including EDM, Sufi and Bollywood.

column2: Not an ideal situation: Ponting on Aus' injured players
column3: Australia's assistant coach Ricky Ponting rued the injuries suffered by the Australian players ahead of Australia's semi-final appearance, calling the situation 'not ideal'. "It's up to us coaches to make it as easy as possible for those guys coming in, talking through scenarios and situations and just trying to keep them as free in the mind as possible," Ponting said.

column2: There is a 16th-century tomb known as Bhool Bhulaiya in Mehrauli
column3: The tomb of Mughal emperor Akbar's general Adham Khan is an octagonal monument located in Mehrauli. The 16th-century monument is commonly known as Bhool Bhulaiya, or a place where one may get lost, because of its thick walls enclosing a maze of passageways. It is said that Adham Khan was executed by Akbar for murdering his favourite general Ataga Khan.

column2: BJP a poacher party: Cong's Adhir Chowdhury on K'taka crises
column3: Amid the ongoing political crises in Karnataka, Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Monday termed the BJP as a "poacher party". He further said, "We'll try to raise the Karnataka issue in Parliament but we won't reveal our weapons." On Monday, however, Karnataka Congress Legislature Party leader Siddaramaiah said 21 Congress ministers in the Congress-JD(S) coalition government have resigned.

column2: Shutdown in Srinagar on Burhan Wani's 3rd death anniversary
column3: All schools, colleges and shops are closed and public transport is off the roads in Srinagar due to a shutdown called to observe the third death anniversary of Hizbul Mujahideen militant Burhan Wani. Restrictions have been imposed in parts of Kashmir with heavy deployment of security forces. Wani was killed in a gunfight with the security forces in July 2016.

column2: Prez Kovind, PM condole loss of lives in Agra bus accident
column3: President Ram Nath Kovind and PM Narendra Modi conveyed condolences to families of the 29 people who were killed in a bus accident on Yamuna Expressway in Agra on Monday. While the PM prayed for the recovery of the injured, the President said, "State government taking all steps to help affected people." Around 50 people were travelling on the bus.

column2: Inspired by Hollywood film, 2 men try to rob bank in Delhi; held
column3: Delhi Police have arrested two men who attempted to rob a bank by firing into the air in Shahdara after getting inspired by Hollywood film 'Baby Driver'. As per reports, the main accused, identified as Prabhjot Singh, hatched the plan after suffering heavy losses in the cloth trade. The attempt was foiled by the bank security guard following a scuffle.

column2: Amarnath Yatra arrangements causing trouble to Kashmiris: Mufti
column3: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said that the arrangements for this year's Amarnath Yatra are causing trouble in local people's day-to-day lives. Urging Governor Satya Pal Malik to intervene, she added that locals cannot use the highways and even in an emergency they're forced to wait for pilgrims to pass. She said, "This is excesses against people by the Centre."

column2: Couple dies after their house gets buried in WB landslide
column3: A 60-year-old man and his wife were killed in a landslide caused by heavy rainfall in West Bengal's Darjeeling on Monday. The accident happened after their house in the area was hit by the landslide and got buried in mud. According to the Skymet weather forecast, the sub-Himalayan range in Bengal will continue to receive heavy rainfall on Monday.

column2: AHTU rescues 333 children since January 2019 in Delhi
column3: The Delhi Police Crime Branch has reported that the Anti Human Trafficking Unit (AHTU) in Delhi has rescued a total of 333 children since January 2019. Most of the children were rescued from various places like bus stands, railway stations and other places in Delhi. During the investigation, the AHTU also recovered 57 persons who were either abducted or missing.

column2: JetPrivilege lets you book any seat, any flight, across airlines
column3: JetPrivilege now allows you to book flight tickets across 7000+ airlines worldwide. You can now earn JPMiles across these airlines only if booked on jetprivilege.com. Limited period offer of 1000 Bonus JPMiles on your 1st flight booking today.

column2: 21 Congress ministers in Karnataka government resign
column3: Karnataka Congress Legislature Party leader Siddaramaiah on Monday said that 21 Congress ministers in the Congress-JD(S) coalition government have resigned. This has reportedly been done in a bid to accommodate the MLAs who last week submitted their resignations to the Assembly Speaker. Earlier, independent MLA H Nagesh resigned as minister and withdrew his support to the Congress-JD(S) government.

column2: Independent K'taka MLA withdraws support to Cong-JD(S) govt
column3: Karnataka minister and independent MLA H Nagesh has resigned and withdrawn support to HD Kumaraswamy-led government, saying he would support the BJP. This comes after several MLAs of the Congress-JD(S) coalition government submitted their resignations last week. If the resignations of the MLAs are accepted and not withdrawn, the Congress-JD(S) coalition would lose majority.

column2: 29 killed as Delhi-bound bus falls into canal in Agra
column3: At least 29 people were killed and several others injured when a Lucknow-Delhi sleeper coach bus fell into a canal off Yamuna Expressway in Agra on Monday morning. "It fell into the side fall about 15 feet deep," UP Police tweeted. An ex-gratia amount of ₹5 lakh has been announced for the kin of the deceased by UP roadways.

column2: I was misquoted: Sandeep on 'lovers slapping each other' remark
column3: 'Kabir Singh' director Sandeep Reddy Vanga has said he was misquoted in an interview in which he made the remark that if lovers can't slap or touch each other, he doesn't see any emotion there. "It's about the liberty of...expression between a couple. It works for [both the] woman [and] man. I spoke for both the sides," he added.

column2: This will be Tom Cruise's head: Bieber as he takes #BottleCapChallenge
column3: Singer Justin Bieber took to Instagram to share a video of himself attempting the viral #BottleCapChallenge. In the video, Justin can be heard saying 'This is gonna be Tom Cruise's head' before he kicks off the cap from the bottle. "I nominate Tom cruise and Hailey Bieber," the singer wrote in the video's caption.

column2: Kangana argues with journalist at song launch event, video surfaces
column3: A video of Kangana Ranaut arguing with a journalist at the launch event of 'Wakhra Swag' song from 'Judgemental Hai Kya' has surfaced online. As the journalist introduced himself, Kangana says, "You were bashing 'Manikarnika'. Have I done anything wrong by making a film on nationalism?" "You cannot intimidate a journalist because you're in a position of power," he replied.

column2: Kangana says journalist had lunch with her & texted her; he denies
column3: Kangana Ranaut got into an argument with a journalist at a song launch event and said he had "bashed" her film 'Manikarnika'. "You came to my van to interview me...spent at least three hours there and we had lunch together...You had messaged me also," she added. The journalist, however, denied that he texted Kangana or had lunch with her.

column2: Call them B'desh not Bengali or you'll be banned: Sarfaraz to journo
column3: After a reporter asked Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed why the team management did not give Shoaib Malik a farewell after the match against "Bengalis", Sarfaraz asked her to not use the word 'Bengali' for 'Bangladesh'. "You are using an objectionable word. Someone will make a video of you calling them 'Bengali' and you will get banned," he added.

column2: Banned by ICC, Jayasuriya spotted watching India-SL game from stands
column3: Banned by ICC for two years over corruption, ex-Sri Lanka captain Sanath Jayasuriya was spotted watching the 2019 World Cup match between India and Sri Lanka at Headingley Cricket Ground on Saturday. An ICC spokersperson said that the governing body has taken the note of the same and will ensure that he doesn't go anywhere near the players or officials.

column2: Woman commits suicide after fight with male friend in Delhi hotel
column3: A 22-year-old woman allegedly committed suicide at a hotel in Delhi's Paharganj on Sunday after a fight with her male friend who was staying with her. Her friend left the room after the fight and did not answer her calls. When he returned, he found the room's door locked from inside and his friend hanging from the ceiling fan.

column2: 16 men tied with rope, forced to chant 'Gau Mata Ki Jai' in MP
column3: At least 16 men, who were allegedly smuggling cows, were tied with a rope and forced to chant 'Gau Mata Ki Jai' while holding their ears in Madhya Pradesh on Sunday. A video of the incident, that happened in a village, has surfaced online. Police said they've booked the people ferrying the cattle without requisite permissions.

column2: 112 live bombs recovered, 399 arrested in simultaneous raids in WB
column3: West Bengal police on Saturday conducted simultaneous raids in Birbhum district and recovered 112 pieces of live bombs, six country-made weapons and arrested 399 people. Out of the 399 arrested, 65 persons were arrested in specific cases, 228 persons arrested in preventive sections and 106 persons arrested in pending cases, said Superintendent of Police Shyam Singh.

column2: We are not big fans of that man: Trump on UK envoy to US
column3: Reacting to a report that claimed Britain's ambassador in the US Kim Darroch had described his administration as "inept" and "uniquely dysfunctional", US President Donald Trump said, "We are not big fans of that man." "He has not served the UK well. So I can understand it, and I can say things about him but I won't bother," Trump added.

column2: Trump tells Iran 'be careful' after it vows to breach uranium cap
column3: US President Donald Trump on Sunday said Iran "better be careful", hours after the Middle East country announced it would boost its uranium enrichment above the limit set by the 2015 nuclear deal. "Iran is doing a lot of bad things," he further said, adding that Iran would never have a nuclear weapon.

column2: Criminals running government by proxy in UP: Samajwadi Party
column3: Samajwadi Party (SP) issued a note on Sunday mentioning that the "criminals are running the government by proxy" in Uttar Pradesh. Mentioning several incidents of crime, the party showed concern over law and order situation of the state in the note. The party further said that the review meetings of the Chief Minister and DGP have become "fruitless".

column2: K'taka coalition govt's downfall predicted when it was formed: Sena
column3: Amid the ongoing political turmoil in Karnataka, Shiv Sena on Monday said that the downfall of the Congress-JD(S) coalition government in Karnataka was predicted the day it was formed. In its mouthpiece 'Saamana', the Sena said CM Kumaraswamy-led government coming to power was "unnatural". This comes after 11 MLAs of the Karnataka coalition government submitted their resignation on Saturday.

column2: Amazon to launch specialised fulfilment centres in Patna, Guwahati
column3: Amazon India is adding two new highly-automated specialised warehouses in Patna and Guwahati. It is also expanding the capacity of its existing specialised fulfilment centres (FCs) in cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Bengaluru, Hyderabad and Kolkata, among other cities. Amazon India will now have a network of specialised fulfilment centres with close to 9 million cubic feet of storage space.

column2: Mills should produce ethanol instead of surplus sugar: Gadkari
column3: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Sunday said that surplus production of sugar has become a "big problem" in the country, and suggested the sugar mills should focus on ethanol production instead. Speaking at the 'Sugar Conference', he added there's no profitability in increasing sugar production. Gadkari further said the Centre has come out with a transparent policy related to ethanol.

column2: 26 exotic birds worth ₹28 lakh rescued in Mizoram, 8 arrested
column3: The Border Security Force (BSF) and the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) found and rescued 26 exotic birds, reportedly worth ₹28 lakh, in a joint operation in Mizoram on Saturday. Eight Indian nationals were also arrested in the case. According to reports, the exotic birds were smuggled from Myanmar and were being taken to Kerala.

column2: Gujarat man gets 10-yr jail, ₹1L fine for slaughtering calf
column3: A man was sentenced to 10 years in jail and was fined ₹1 lakh for slaughtering a calf in Gujarat's Rajkot. The complainant accused the man of slaughtering the calf and serving it at the wedding of the latter's daughter. He was sentenced under the Gujarat Animal Preservation (Amendment) Act, 2017 after witness testimonies and forensic reports confirmed the allegation.

column2: USA defeat Netherlands to win FIFA Women's World Cup for 4th time
column3: Midfielder Rose Lavelle and forward Megan Rapinoe scored a goal each as USA clinched the 2019 World Cup after defeating Netherlands 2-0 in the final today. This is USA's fourth Women's World Cup title after having won the 1991, 1999 and 2015 editions. England's Ellen White, USA's Alex Morgan and Rapinoe finished as 2019 edition's top-scorers with six goals each.

column2: Deutsche Bank plans to exit global equities business, cut 18,000 jobs
column3: Germany's Deutsche Bank on Sunday announced it plans to exit the equities sales and trading business and reduce approximately 18,000 full-time equivalent employees to around 74,000 employees by 2022. The move is part of a €7.4 billion overhaul plan to improve the bank's profitability. The bank expects to report a net loss of €2.8 billion in Q2 of 2019.

column2: Gaalis are born in my city, will teach some to trolls: Anubhav Sinha
column3: 'Article 15' director Anubhav Sinha, speaking about Twitter trolls abusing him over the film, said, "I'm from a city where gaalis are born." "Trolls don't know how to abuse. If I meet them offline, I'll teach them such abusive words that they'll write a poem with those words," he added. Several Twitter trolls had earlier called the film 'anti-Brahmin'.

column2: You will always be my captain: Kohli wishes Dhoni on his 38th b'day
column3: Team India captain Virat Kohli took to Twitter to wish former captain MS Dhoni on the occasion of his 38th birthday. "I am glad to have had the friendship I have with you for so many years. You've been a big brother to all of us and as I said before, you will always be my captain," Kohli wrote.

column2: Vaughan trolls Manjrekar over Jadeja remark, Manjrekar responds
column3: Trolling commentator Sanjay Manjrekar for including all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja while predicting Team India for World Cup semi-final, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan wrote, "I see you've picked that bits and pieces cricketer!" This comes after Manjrekar said he wasn't a fan of "bits and pieces" players like Jadeja. Responding to Vaughan, Manjrekar wrote, "'Predicted' my dear...not 'my' team."

column2: I am not here for records, I am here to lift World Cup: Rohit Sharma
column3: After becoming the first batsman to score five hundreds in a World Cup edition, Team India opener Rohit Sharma said, "I am not here for records. I am here to score runs and lift the World Cup." He further said he'd only rate hitting five centuries in the World Cup as his biggest feat if India win the World Cup.

column2: I can take Pak to next level, PCB to decide captaincy future: Sarfaraz
column3: Following Pakistan's exit from World Cup, captain Sarfaraz Ahmed said he won't step down as captain as he can take the current team to "next level". "It's not that I'm saying I refuse to resign. All I'm saying is the decision rests with PCB, the same way as the decision to appoint me captain was taken by them," he added.

column2: Who are the top run-scorers, wicket-takers in WC after league stage?
column3: With 647 runs in eight innings, India opener Rohit Sharma is the top run-scorer in 2019 World Cup after league stage. Rohit is followed by Australia opener David Warner (638) and Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan (606). Meanwhile, Australia pacer Mitchell Starc and Bangladesh's Mustafizur Rahman are top two wicket-takers with 26 and 20 wickets respectively.

column2: Only way Pak coach Arthur will leave is when he dies: Abdul Razzaq
column3: Ex-Pakistan all-rounder Abdul Razzaq has said that the only way Pakistan head coach Mickey Arthur will leave the post is when he passes away. The 39-year-old made the remark after Pakistan were eliminated from 2019 World Cup after finishing fifth on the points table. "Utterly shameful and totally unacceptable," a fan tweeted reacting to Razzaq's statement.

column2: I don't need to say sorry, we got 11 points not 2-4: Sarfaraz on WC
column3: During his first press conference on Pakistan soil after 2019 World Cup exit, Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed said there's no need for him to say sorry. "We worked hard and gave our best. We haven't returned with 2-4 points...but with 11," he added. He further said that Pakistan's performance wasn't as bad as people are making it out to be.

column2: All 13 together, no question of withdrawing resignations: K'taka MLA
column3: Rebel Karnataka MLA ST Somashekar, one of the 13 JD(S)-Congress MLAs who resigned on Saturday, has said, "We all are together. No question of going back to Bengaluru and withdrawing the resignations." Somashekar added they will not attend the Congress Legislature Party meeting called by former CM Siddaramaiah on Tuesday. Notably, 10 of the 13 rebel MLAs are in Mumbai.

column2: Zomato, hotel fined ₹55,000 for delivering chicken instead of paneer
column3: A Pune-based consumer court imposed a ₹55,000 fine on Zomato and a hotel for delivering butter chicken twice to a lawyer who ordered paneer butter masala to break his fast. The man didn't realise it was a chicken dish and reportedly ate it. While Zomato argued the restaurant delivered the wrong dish, the court considered Zomato to be equally guilty.

column2: Lawyer abuses co-flyer for exiting from business class, threatens police
column3: A Delhi-based lawyer, who was in an inebriated state, was booked on charges of criminal intimidation and insult after he allegedly abused a co-flyer and also threatened security personnel at Mumbai airport on Friday. He created a ruckus when an economy-class passenger tried to exit from the business-class gate, abusing him and accusing him of carrying a bomb and drugs.

column2: Science teacher & family pray naked, try to sacrifice 3-yr-old girl
column3: A science teacher and his family members reportedly performed naked prayers at their home in Assam's Udalguri on the directions of a self-styled godman on Saturday and tried to sacrifice a relative's three-year-old child with a sword. The neighbours informed police on seeing smoke emanating from their house, saving the girl's life. The teacher's son reportedly died in police firing.

column2: Hostel warden forced us to massage her body: Bihar KGBV students
column3: Two underage girls from the hostel of Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalaya (KGBV) in Bihar's Bhojpur alleged that warden Geeta Rani forced them to engage in personal work and even massage her body. Girls also disclosed that the local mukhia regularly visited the hostel at midnight. The investigation found that two inmates and two women illegally stayed in the premises.

column2: Adi Godrej's FY19 remuneration 114 times higher than firm's median pay
column3: Godrej Consumer Products Ltd (GCPL) Chairman Emeritus Adi Godrej's total remuneration in 2018-19 stood at ₹6.07 crore, 114.18 times higher than the median pay of the company's employees. However, his remuneration was down 20% from the previous year. GCPL MD and CEO Vivek Gambhir's remuneration stood at ₹13.1 crore, 311.26 times more than the median pay of the company's employees.

column2: Richard Illingworth, Richard Kettleborough to officiate Ind-NZ semi
column3: The English duo of Richard Illingworth and Richard Kettleborough are set to officiate in the upcoming India-New Zealand World Cup 2019 semi-final. The Australia-England semi-final will be officiated by Sri Lanka's Kumar Dharmasena and South Africa's Marais Erasmus. Australia's Rod Tucker will be the third umpire for the India-New Zealand encounter while Englishman Nigel Llong will be the fourth official.

column2: Don't wanna cry but can't help it, tweets user on Tahir, Duminy
column3: Reacting to Imran Tahir and JP Duminy's ODI retirement, a user tweeted, "I don't wanna cry but I can't help it. Goodbye boys, JP Duminy & Imran Tahir." Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "Congratulations @ImranTahirSA for letting us enjoy your skills. You were a breath of fresh air to our game and hopefully, you will keep bringing that to franchise cricket."

column2: 3 Dalit youths stripped, thrashed over alleged theft in UP
column3: Three Dalit youths were stripped naked and thrashed with sticks and belts for allegedly committing theft in Uttar Pradesh's Jaunpur. As per locals, two of them were caught breaking into a shop by the owner, while the third accused was picked up from his home on Saturday night. A video of the incident has gone viral on social media.

column2: Woman found hanging in well, husband booked for dowry death
column3: The body of a 21-year-old woman was found hanging inside a well in Rajasthan's Jhalawar district, police said on Sunday. As per the police complaint, the victim's husband, identified as Nanuram Tanwar, had been allegedly torturing her for dowry ever since they got married two years ago. Tanwar has been booked for dowry death and is yet to be arrested.

column2: BJP youth wing leader's wife shot dead, dowry death alleged
column3: A BJP youth wing leader's wife, identified as Snehlata, was shot dead in Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki district on Saturday, said police. The victim's father accused his son-in-law, Rahul Singh, of killing Snehlata for not fulfilling the dowry demand of a car. However, Singh claimed that they were stopped and looted by suspected robbers and Snehlata was fired at for resisting.

column2: Latest ODI rankings released, Rohit closes gap on first-placed Kohli
column3: India captain Virat Kohli retained the top position among batsmen after scoring five fifties in the league stage of 2019 World Cup. Kohli reached 891 rating points after gaining one point, while second-placed Rohit Sharma bridged the gap from 51 rating points to six after scoring five hundreds in World Cup. Pakistan's Babar Azam jumped four places to third position.

column2: Wouldn't have done it if I didn't trust crew: Amala Paul on nude scene
column3: Actress Amala Paul, while speaking about doing a nude scene for the film 'Aadai', said, "There were only 15 people on the sets. I wouldn't have done [it] if I didn't trust the crew." "I was anxious to know about what is happening on the sets, who were all going to be there, and if there was security," she added.

column2: Couple win 'wife carrying' competition, get wife's weight in beer
column3: Lithuania's Vytautas Kirkliauskas and his wife Neringa, won the World Wife-Carrying Championship for the second consecutive time in Sonkajärvi, Finland. The contest, the rules of which stipulate that the woman must weigh at least 49 kilograms, involves men completing an obstacle course with their partners slung over their shoulders. They won a prize consisting of the wife's weight in beer.

column2: One man, a billion emotions, a lifetime of memories: ICC on MS Dhoni
column3: Wishing MS Dhoni on the occasion of his 38th birthday, the ICC took to Twitter to share a collage of pictures of the former India captain from the 2019 World Cup. "One man. A billion emotions. A lifetime of memories," ICC captioned the picture. Notably, Dhoni is the only captain to have won all three major ICC tournaments.

column2: Startups can expect lesser tax compliance burden now: Kunal Bahl
column3: Snapdeal Co-founder and Nasscom's Executive Council Member Kunal Bahl said, "Doing away with the scrutiny of valuation of documentation on angel tax is an excellent step that'll help facilitate funding." "With this Budget, startups can expect lesser regulatory requirement, besides reducing their tax compliance burden," he added. He said it'll encourage newer startups, especially from tier II and III areas.

column2: Who made the red bag in which Finance Minister carried the budget?
column3: The red bag in which Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman carried the budget was stitched by her aunt, she told reporters. The bag was taken to Mumbai's Siddhivinayak and Mahalakshmi temples to seek blessings before Sitharaman presented the budget in the Parliament. Chief Economic Adviser K Subramanian had said that the bag symbolised "our departure from slavery of Western thought".

column2: US okays $2.25 bn SoftBank investment in GM-backed self-driving firm
column3: The Committee on Foreign Investment in the US (CFIUS) has approved SoftBank's $2.25 billion investment in General Motors-backed driverless technology company Cruise Automation. SoftBank will have a spot on Cruise's board as a result of the deal. Cruise has raised $7.25 billion in capital since last year, the company said.

column2: Xiaomi uses Apple's 'Memoji' ad to promote its 'Mimoji'
column3: Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi uploaded Apple's 'Memoji' advertisement to its own website as well as e-commerce websites like JD.com and Suning, to promote its new feature 'Mimoji', an augmented reality avatar set. Xiaomi's public relations general manager, Xu Jieyun, called this an "accident". He said that the company's staff "uploaded the wrong content" to the sites.

column2: Apple Co-founder Steve Jobs was an a*****e at times: Bill Gates
column3: World's second richest person and Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates said that Apple's late Co-founder Steve Jobs was an "a*****e" at times, adding that Jobs brought "some incredibly positive things along with toughness". Talking about his own company in the 1970s, Gates said, "Yes, we were pretty tough on each other." He added, "And I think sometimes that went too far."

column2: I didn't resign today, had submitted resignation 10 days ago: Scindia
column3: After resigning as Congress General Secretary (UP West), Jyotiraditya Scindia revealed he had submitted his resignation to Rahul Gandhi eight to ten days ago. "I am not a leader who gives orders to others. I think when there's a responsibility, there comes accountability as well. Even I'm responsible if performance isn't good & therefore, I resigned," he added.

column2: UP Police assault man who reported wife's gang-rape, 3 suspended
column3: Three Uttar Pradesh policemen were suspended for allegedly assaulting a man who called to report about his wife's kidnapping and gang-rape in Mainpuri district. The policemen accused the man of murdering his wife and calling them to lodge a false complaint. The police later filed a case of kidnapping and sexual assault after his wife managed to reach the station.

column2: National Law School students protest against over 25% hike in fees
column3: Students of National Law School of India University (NLSIU), Bangalore protested against more than 25% hike in college fees on Saturday. The students held placards that read, 'hike standards, not fees, education not a privilege, mental health matters, keep it affordable'. The tuition fee for various programmes has reportedly seen an increase ranging from ₹50,000 to ₹1 lakh annually.

column2: 2-year-old boy killed by father on suspicion of paternity in Mysuru
column3: A two-year-old boy was allegedly killed by his father on the suspicion that he was not his son in Karnataka's Mysuru. The accused man suspected that his wife was unfaithful to him during the time they were estranged after an argument between them. The accused reportedly tortured his son on a regular basis, before finally fatally assaulting him this week.

column2: SBI cashier used manager's key to steal money, gold worth ₹80L: Police
column3: A State Bank of India cashier named G Srinivas Rao was arrested on Saturday in Andhra Pradesh's Vijayawada for allegedly swindling the account holders' cash and gold amounting to ₹80 lakh, police said. He was close to a former branch manager, who let him keep the keys of the bank locker, which is against the norms, police added.

column2: Parents kill 16-yr-old daughter over relationship in WB, held
column3: West Bengal Police on Saturday arrested a couple for allegedly killing their 16-year-old daughter and dumping her body in the Ganga river in Malda district because they did not agree to her relationship with a 17-year-old boy from a neighbouring village. "The accused indicated that the boy belonged to a lower caste though he shared the same surname," said police.

column2: 49 die of Japanese encephalitis in Assam; Doctors' leaves cancelled
column3: Assam's Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Saturday said that 49 people have died in the state due to Japanese encephalitis (JE) this year. The government has cancelled the leaves of all doctors and paramedic staff till September 30. All districts of Assam except Kokrajhar are affected by Japanese encephalitis with 190 positive cases reported so far this year.

column2: Australia call up Wade, Marsh as World Cup cover
column3: Australia have called up Matthew Wade and Mitchell Marsh as cover players after captain Aaron Finch revealed about the injury setbacks to Usman Khawaja (hamstring issue) and Marcus Stoinis (side strain). Wade and Marsh are set to join the team in Birmingham, where Australia will face England in the semi-final on Thursday.

column2: Bopanna, Sharan out of Wimbledon mixed doubles event
column3: The Indian representation in the Wimbledon 2019 mixed doubles event ended with the second-round exits faced by Rohan Bopanna and Divij Sharan. The 13 seeded duo of Bopanna and Aryna Sabalenka lost 4-6, 4-6 to Artem Sitak from New Zealand and Laura Siegemund of Germany. Sharan and China's Yingying Duan lost to Britain's Eden Silva and Evan Hoyt.

column2: Sweden beat England to finish third at FIFA Women's World Cup
column3: Sweden defeated England 2-1 to finish at the third place in the FIFA Women's World Cup 2019. This was Sweden's third bronze medal finish at the event after their third-place finishes at the 1991 and 2011 editions. "We'll take this in. We'll process it and we'll learn from it," the England team's Twitter account posted.

column2: 12 held for illegal slaughterhouse, eat bananas on way to UP jail
column3: Uttar Pradesh Police on Saturday arrested 12 people after conducting a raid at an illegal slaughterhouse being run in a factory in Aligarh. Soon after, a video surfaced showing the accused led by two constables on the way to jail in handcuffs, eating bananas and throwing the peels on the road. Officials have been asked to probe the matter.

column2: Thane woman stabbed to death by bike-borne assailants; 1 held
column3: A 24-year-old woman was stabbed to death by two bike-borne assailants when she was waiting in the market area in Maharashtra's Thane on Friday. Based on CCTV footage from the premises, police registered a case and arrested one of the accused within an hour of the murder. The victim was rushed to a hospital where she was declared brought dead.

column2: UP man kills wife for refusing sex, cuts own private parts
column3: A 24-year-old man strangled his wife to death and cut off his own private parts after she refused to have sex with him in Uttar Pradesh on Saturday. Their neighbours informed police after they saw the victim lying on the floor and the accused drenched in blood. The victim's father said that she was being harassed for dowry, said police.

column2: 5 more arrested including 4 minors in Chandni Chowk violence
column3: Police on Saturday arrested five more people, including four minors, in connection with the vandalisation of a temple in Chandni Chowk's Hauz Qazi area in Delhi. A total of 17 people have been arrested in the case so far. As per reports, the temple was vandalised after clashes broke out between two groups from different communities over a parking issue.

column2: Kerala priest held for sexually abusing minor boys in a home
column3: A priest was arrested on Sunday for allegedly sexually abusing children who were inmates in a boys' home in Kerala's Kochi. As per the complaint, the accused, identified as Father George alias Jerry, has been abusing the children since December 2018. The incident came to light after one of the victims informed his parents, who filed the police complaint.

column2: Where do teams stand after the league stage of 2019 World Cup?
column3: Team India finished the league stage of 2019 World Cup on the top of the points table with 15 points, being the only team to lose just one match. Afghanistan were the only team to lose all their nine matches, while 2015 champions Australia finished second on the table with 14 points. Meanwhile, four-time semi-finalists South Africa finished seventh.

column2: Milind Deora resigns as Mumbai Congress chief
column3: Mumbai Congress chief Milind Deora resigned from the post on Sunday. Deora also proposed a three-member panel to lead Mumbai Congress for the upcoming Maharashtra Assembly elections. The 42-year-old had been appointed to the post on March 25 this year. He had replaced Sanjay Nirupam, who had held the post since March 2017.

column2: Jyotiraditya Scindia resigns as Congress general secretary
column3: Senior Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scindia on Sunday resigned as Congress General Secretary (Uttar Pradesh West) over party's defeat in Lok Sabha elections. Scindia's resignation comes after Rahul Gandhi stepped down as Congress President on July 3. "I thank Rahul Gandhi for entrusting me with this responsibility and for giving me the opportunity to serve our party," Scindia tweeted.

column2: What's the fault of the film? Super 30 actress on #MeToo controversy
column3: 'Super 30' actress Mrunal Thakur, while speaking about the controversy surrounding the sexual harassment allegations against the film's director Vikas Bahl, said, "I thought about it but I realised what's the fault of the film?" "I didn't want the film to be affected. I'm glad that after everything, things have been cleared and the film is releasing," she added.

column2: Tanushree to file protest petition against Nana Patekar's clean chit
column3: Tanushree Dutta has opposed the B-Summary report filed by the Oshiwara police station that had given Nana Patekar a clean chit in the sexual harassment case that she had lodged against him. The court has granted her time to file a protest petition against the B-Summary report. The case has been adjourned to September 7, 2019.

column2: Smuggling aspect assessed while raising gold import duty: Finance Secy
column3: The decision to raise the gold import duty was taken after assessing the smuggling dimension, Finance Secretary Subhash Chandra Garg has said. This comes after concerns were raised by certain trade associations on a further rise in gold smuggling due to the move. Import duty on gold and other precious metals in the Budget was hiked to 12.5% from 10%.

column2: Budget didn't allocate funds for seed fund as promised: Mohandas Pai
column3: Former Infosys CFO Mohandas Pai said the Budget didn't allocate ₹20,000 crore for a seed fund for startups as promised in BJP's manifesto. "There are more misses than hits. The marginal tinkering on taxes won't move the needle," Pai said. "We need a plan of action of accelerated growth in sectors of the economy which are labour intensive," he added.

column2: 4 drones spray-paint huge graffiti after flying for 12 hours
column3: An Italian design firm collected drawings from the art community and put them in a 46x39 feet mural painted for over 12 hours by four drones. The drawings were loaded into a central control computer and painting instructions were relayed to the drones equipped with paint cans. Multiple position monitoring systems made sure the drones didn't bump into one another.

column2: Yet to meet any person with design sense like Steve Jobs: Bill Gates
column3: Microsoft Co-founder and world's second richest person Bill Gates said he's "yet to meet any person who could rival Apple Co-founder Steve Jobs in having a sense of design of, 'Oh, this is good. This is not good'." He added that Jobs was really good at picking talent and hyper-motivating that talent. "Even when he failed, he succeeded," Gates added.

column2: Maruti Suzuki cuts production in June for 5th month in a row
column3: Maruti Suzuki India has cut vehicle production for the fifth consecutive month in June, according to a regulatory filing. The auto major's total vehicle production was slashed by 15.6% in June to 1,11,917 units as compared to 1,32,616 units in the year-ago month. In May, overall passenger vehicle wholesale in India witnessed the steepest decline in nearly 18 years.

column2: Drunk man stabs mother for not giving money to buy liquor in Delhi
column3: A drunk man allegedly stabbed his mother to death in Delhi's Model Town area on Saturday night after she refused to give him money to buy liquor, police said. The man himself walked into a police station in the morning and confessed to his crime. The police filed an FIR and took him into custody, while further investigation is underway.

column2: Patna Medical College doctors' strike for re-evaluation enters 3rd day
column3: Junior doctors' strike at Bihar's Patna Medical College for re-evaluation of exam results entered third day on Sunday. The postgraduate students alleged that some of their colleagues in the orthopaedic department were intentionally failed by the Head of Department Dr Vijay Kumar for not recommending the medicines of a particular pharmaceutical company. They also demanded Dr Kumar's transfer.

column2: Seized tanker wasn't headed to Syria: Iran Deputy Foreign Minister
column3: The Iranian oil tanker captured by Britain in Gibraltar was not headed to Syria, Iran's Deputy Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has said. The tanker has a capacity of up to two million barrels of oil and that's why it was travelling through the Strait of Gibraltar rather than the Suez Canal, Araghchi added. He didn't reveal the tanker's final destination.

column2: Aadhaar can be used for transactions above ₹50,000: Revenue Secy
column3: Aadhaar card can be quoted for cash transactions above ₹50,000 where PAN was a must, PTI quoting Revenue Secretary Ajay Bhushan Pandey said. Banks and other institutions will make back-end upgrades to allow acceptance of Aadhaar in all places where quoting PAN is mandatory, he added. This follows Budget announcement allowing interchangeability of PAN and Aadhaar for filing tax returns.

column2: Unsure about Khawaja and Stoinis: Australia captain Finch
column3: Speaking after his side's loss against South Africa, Australia captain Aaron Finch revealed that the fitness of Usman Khawaja and Marcus Stoinis are in doubt as they both suffered injuries in the match. Khawaja encountered a hamstring issue and was retired hurt before coming out to bat later in the Australian innings, while Stoinis required medical attention during his batting.

column2: Masvidal registers fastest ever UFC knock out win
column3: Jorge Masvidal registered the fastest knockout win in the UFC after hitting Ben Askren with a flying knee within five seconds from the start of the match. "That dude was talking wild, man, I have to show you there [are] consequences sometimes," Masvidal said after the match. Notably, Askren is a former Olympic wrestler.

column2: India would be very happy that we won today: Du Plessis
column3: After helping South Africa end their World Cup 2019 with a win over Australia, Proteas captain Faf du Plessis said, "I think India would be very happy that we won today." Du Plessis went on to predict an India-England final while also claiming that either India or Australia can go on to win the World Cup 2019.

column2: Karnataka crisis like rainy season: Cong's Mahendra Singhi
column3: Calling the ongoing political tension in Karnataka an "internal family matter", Congress leader Mahendra Singhi said that the tension is like a season of rain which comes and goes. He added, "Everything will be fine; there is nothing to worry about." This comes after 11 MLAs of the ruling Congress-JD(S) coalition government in Karnataka submitted their resignation on Saturday.

column2: Rise above ideologies for public welfare: Om Birla in Raj Assembly
column3: Addressing the Rajasthan Assembly, Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Sunday said that leaders should rise above ideologies for the welfare of the people. He added that a good leader is one who raises people's issues and contributes to debates in the Houses. Birla said, "Whenever we get a chance to learn something, we should take it."

column2: TN CM to hold all-party meet on July 8 to decide on EWS quota
column3: Tamil Nadu CM EK Palaniswami will chair an all-party meeting in Chennai on July 8 to decide on 10% reservation for the Economically Weaker Sections (EWS), state Minister RB Udhayakumar said. The Centre had in January cleared 10% quota in education and government jobs for the EWS. Udhayakumar also hailed the Union Budget, saying it's focused on the country's development.

column2: BJP trying to kill democracy: Kharge on K'taka political crises
column3: Senior Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Sunday claimed that the Centre is directly involved in Karnataka's political turmoil and that the BJP is trying to "kill democracy". He further added that the Congress will not "tolerate" this. His comment came after 11 MLAs of the ruling Congress-JD(S) alliance government submitted their resignation on Saturday.

column2: Karnataka Cong plotting drama to oust CM Kumaraswamy: BJP
column3: BJP leader Pralhad Joshi on Sunday said that the Karnataka Congress is plotting a drama to "throw out" CM Kumaraswamy and former CM Siddaramaiah is behind all this. He further called the ruling Congress-JD(S) alliance in the state as "unholy". On Congress blaming PM Narendra Modi for the resignations of 11 Congress-JD(S) MLAs, Joshi said it's "utter nonsense" of Congress.

column2: Won't tolerate mob lynching or any crime: Jharkhand CM Das
column3: Jharkhand CM Raghubar Das said mob lynching or other crimes won't be tolerated and there'll be no discrimination on the basis of caste or religion while dealing with such cases. His comment came after the recent lynching of Muslim youth, accused of stealing a motorcycle in Seraikela Kharsawan. Das also urged people to refrain from taking law in their hands.

column2: Doctors treat patients under flashlights in UP's Sambhal
column3: The doctors at a government-run hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal allegedly treated patients under flashlights due to power cuts in the area. The chief medical superintendent of the hospital, however, denied the claims, saying there was a power cut for an hour due to heavy rains on Friday. Meanwhile, the SDM warned the hospital of strict action if found guilty.

column2: Activist missing for 5 months detained by Andhra police
column3: Environmental activist T Mugilan, who went missing five months ago, was detained at Tirupati railway station by Andhra Pradesh police on Saturday. In February, Mugilan had alleged the involvement of top police officials in the violence during the anti-Sterlite protest. Soon after the arrest, a video of Mugilan raising slogans in police custody went viral on social media.

column2: Looking for new name to hide Muslim identity: MP bureaucrat
column3: Madhya Pradesh bureaucrat Niyaz Khan on Saturday took to Twitter to say that he wants to change his name to hide his Muslim identity over the mob lynching incidents in the country. He further said, "Bollywood actors of my community should also start finding a new name to protect their movies...even the top stars movies have started to flop."

column2: upGrad offers ML & AI Master's at 1/10th cost of on-campus program
column3: upGrad, with Liverpool John Moores University, launched a Master's Degree program in ML & AI in March'19 and has already seen over 200+ enrolments. The first-of-its-kind fully online Master's program, offered at just 1/10th the cost of LJMU's on-campus program, includes 7+ case studies and a dissertation project with 1-1 mentorship. Professionals earn dual credentials with complete alumni status.

column2: PNB detects fraud of ₹3,805.15 crore by Bhushan Power & Steel
column3: Punjab National Bank on Saturday said it has detected a fraud of ₹3,805.15 crore by Bhushan Power & Steel Ltd and has reported it to the RBI. PNB added that the steelmaker misappropriated bank funds and manipulated books to raise funds from consortium lender banks. The disclosure comes as PNB is recovering from a ₹14,000-crore fraud by diamantaire Nirav Modi.

column2: People laughed when I was on stage as I was 94 kg: Bhansali's niece
column3: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali's niece Sharmin Segal has revealed that during her college days, people used to laugh at her when she was on stage as she was 94 kg. "Wishing to become an actor was scary as in the glamour world appearance matters the most, besides talent," she added. Sharmin made her Bollywood debut with 'Malaal'.

column2: Haryanvi dancer Sapna Chaudhary joins BJP
column3: Haryanvi dancer Sapna Chaudhary joined Bharatiya Janata Party at the party's membership drive program in Delhi on Sunday. She had campaigned for BJP in the Lok Sabha elections in Delhi. The former Bigg Boss contestant joined the party in the presence of former Madhya Pradesh CM and BJP vice-president Shivraj Singh Chouhan and Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari among others.

column2: Sabyasachi apologises after criticism for post on 'overdressed' women
column3: Fashion designer Sabyasachi has apologised over criticism for a post calling "overdressed" women "wounded". "Although it was intended as a message of love and empathy and a call to look beyond exterior appearances, it wasn't articulated correctly," he wrote. "I understand that it does not convey the message appropriately at all...I would like to offer an unconditional apology," he added.

column2: Anushka says 'What is this signal for 4?' at Ind-SL match, video viral
column3: A video of actress and Team India captain Virat Kohli's wife Anushka Sharma telling a person sitting beside her "What is this signal for 4?" during India-Sri Lanka match has gone viral. In the video, she's seen making the gesture of the signal indicating 4 runs and laughing. Anushka made the gesture after Kohli smashed a four during the match.

column2: What do you tell someone on their birthday: Rohit to journo on Dhoni
column3: After a journalist asked Rohit Sharma to say something about MS Dhoni on his 38th birthday after India-Sri Lanka match, the opener jokingly said, "What do you tell someone on their birthday? Happy birthday only, right?" "We have our travel day...We will cut the cake during the bus drive and send you photos," he added.

column2: BCCI writes to ICC after anti-India banners fly over India-SL match
column3: The BCCI has filed a written complaint with the ICC, raising concerns about the security of India players after a plane with anti-India banners flew over the stadium during India-Sri Lanka match on Saturday. "This is completely unacceptable. Safety...of our players is paramount," a senior BCCI official said. One of the banners read, "India stop genocide and free Kashmir."

column2: 12 killed in Taliban attack on Afghanistan security compound
column3: At least 12 people, including eight members of the security forces and four civilians, were killed and several others were wounded in an attack in Afghanistan. The Taliban claimed responsibility for detonating the bomb near the National Directorate of Security (NDS) compound in Ghazni. Officials said those injured in the attack have been rushed to hospital.

column2: UK envoy to US says Trump admin 'inept' & 'dysfunctional': Report
column3: Britain's ambassador in the US Kim Darroch has described President Donald Trump's administration as "inept" and "uniquely dysfunctional", according to a Daily Mail report. Darroch reportedly said Trump's presidency could "crash and burn" and "end in disgrace". He also reportedly said that the "vicious infighting and chaos" inside the White House, dismissed by Trump as "fake news", was "mostly true".

column2: Senior Indian-origin UK policewoman sues Scotland Yard over racism
column3: Parm Sandhu, a senior Indian-origin British policewoman, has sued the Scotland Yard over racism and sexism, claiming she was denied promotion and work opportunities on the basis of her race and gender. This comes after Sandhu was cleared of misconduct allegations. She was accused of encouraging colleagues to support her nomination for a Queen's Police Medal.

column2: Latest peace talks with Taliban 'most productive' so far: US envoy
column3: US envoy Zalmay Khalilzad has said the latest round of discussions with Taliban to end the 18-year war in Afghanistan were the "most productive session" to date. The talks aimed at finalising a schedule for the withdrawal of foreign troops in exchange for Taliban guarantees that international militant groups will not use Afghanistan as a base for launching attacks.

column2: Andy Murray crashes out of the Wimbledon men's doubles event
column3: Former world number one Andy Murray crashed out of the men's doubles event at the Wimbledon 2019 after he and Pierre-Hugues Herbert lost to Nikola Mektic and Franko Skugor. Murray is still in contention in the mixed doubles event where he won his first-round match alongside partner and former singles world number one Serena Williams.

column2: Plane lands by itself without ground systems' help for 1st time
column3: Germany's Technical University of Munich researchers used a newly developed system to land a plane without relying on ground systems at all. The system uses both visible-light and infrared cameras on the nose of the plane to recognise and characterise a runway. However, the technology is still experimental and not ready to be distributed.

column2: Wikipedia Co-founder calls internet 'appalling'; slams FB & Twitter
column3: Wikipedia Co-founder Larry Sanger, in a recent interview, called the internet as "appalling". Criticising big internet firms like Facebook and Twitter, Sanger said, "The Internet wouldn't have been created by people like Zuckerberg, or any of the sort of corporate executives in Silicon Valley today." "They wouldn't be capable, they don't have the temperament, they're too controlling," he added.

column2: Congress still searching party chief: Rajnath Singh
column3: Union Minister Rajnath Singh took a dig at the Congress saying the party is still searching for a chief and "it's unclear whether there's going to be any president or not". Singh said BJP-NDA's win in general polls has neither changed "our gait nor our character". His comment came after Rahul Gandhi officially resigned as Congress President on July 3.
