column2: Not immediately but BJP sure to form govt in Karnataka: Shah
column3: After 11 Karnataka Congress-JD(S) MLAs submitted their resignation, BJP President and Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that if not immediately, the BJP will surely form the government in Karnataka soon. He added, the BJP is already Karnataka's single largest party. He said in future, the BJP has the potential to win in Telangana, Andhra Pradesh and Kerala as well.

column2: Youth Cong chief resigns, takes responsibility of LS polls' loss
column3: Indian Youth Congress President Keshav Chand Yadav on Saturday resigned from his post while taking "full responsibility" of the party's defeat in the Lok Sabha elections. He said, "I've always been and will continue to serve the party as a dedicated and responsible worker of the Congress." This comes after Rahul Gandhi officially resigned as Congress President on July 3.

column2: Forget about Angel Tax, focus on business: CBDT chief to startups
column3: Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) Chairman PC Mody on Saturday said the nation's startup community shouldn't worry about taxmen and concentrate on their businesses. Concerns related to 'Angel Tax' have been "sorted out", he said. All "legacy issues" related to startups would be resolved through a consultative process and under strict supervision of senior tax authority officers, Mody added.

column2: Army destroys NSCN (IM) hideout in Manipur, apprehended one
column3: Indian Army destroyed an NSCN (IM) hideout in Manipur's Kekru Naga Village and apprehended an active cadre of the insurgent group. Large quantities of arms and ammunition were recovered in a well-coordinated operation, Army's Eastern Command said in a tweet. M16 with 125 rounds, one SLR, 26 rounds of AK and other warlike stores were recovered from the spot.

column2: Fake currency notes worth ₹85 lakh seized in Surat, 2 held
column3: Fake currency notes with a face value of over ₹85 lakh were seized from an apartment flat in Gujarat's Surat, police said. The police arrested a man and a woman and another accused managed to flee from the spot. They were making the fake notes using colour scanner and printers and used green tape as security thread, the police added.

column2: Rising fake kidnapping cases due to girls' independence: MP DGP
column3: Madhya Pradesh DGP VK Singh said that cases of fake kidnapping in the state are on a rise because of girls becoming more independent. He added, due to independence, girls interact with boys, tend to leave homes, which later results in the filing of a kidnapping case. 6,016 kidnapping cases were reported in MP in 2016, the NCRB data revealed.

column2: 3 killed, 1 injured in car-truck collision in Pune
column3: At least three people were killed while another was injured after a car and a truck collided at Pune-Bengaluru highway on Sunday. The impact was such that only mangled remains of the car were left after the hit. On Saturday, two people died and three others were injured after a car fell into a gorge in Uttarakhand's Pauri Garhwal.

column2: India defeat Sri Lanka to go top of 2019 World Cup points table
column3: India defeated Sri Lanka by 7 wickets at Leeds today to go top of the 2019 World Cup points table with 15 points from nine matches. With the defeat, Sri Lanka ended their 2019 World Cup campaign at the sixth position with eight points from nine matches. India's final position will be confirmed after the result of South Africa-Australia match.

column2: KL Rahul smashes his second ODI hundred, first was on debut
column3: Team India opener KL Rahul smashed a 109-ball hundred against Sri Lanka in the 2019 World Cup on Saturday. The century is his second in ODI cricket, following his 115-ball 100* against Zimbabwe on his ODI debut on June 11, 2016. The 27-year-old has become the 14th Indian batsman to smash a hundred in World Cup cricket.

column2: SA beat Australia in WC after 27 years, India to face NZ in semis
column3: South Africa defeated Australia by 10 runs in Manchester on Saturday to register their first victory against them in a World Cup match since the 1992 edition. Australia ended the 2019 World Cup league stage at the second position and will face third-placed England in the semi-finals. Meanwhile, table-toppers India will clash against fourth-placed New Zealand in the semi-finals.

column2: Kriti responds after being criticised for sharing pics with cheetahs
column3: Actress Kriti Sanon was criticised for sharing pictures of herself with cheetahs during a holiday in Zambia. Several users claimed that the animals were sedated for the photos. Responding to the claim, Kriti said that the cheetahs were not sedated and that they were in their natural environment and are tied to a leash only for walks.

column2: Warner 3rd Australian batsman to score 3 hundreds in a World Cup
column3: David Warner on Saturday became the third Australian batsman after Mark Waugh and Matthew Hayden to score three hundreds in a World Cup. The 32-year-old, who had scored 107 against Pakistan and 166 against Bangladesh earlier in the 2019 World Cup, reached the three-figure mark off 100 balls against South Africa. Overall, it was Warner's 17th hundred in ODI cricket.

column2: Starc equals McGrath's record for most wickets in a World Cup
column3: Fast bowler Mitchell Starc on Saturday equalled former Australia fast bowler Glenn McGrath's record for taking most wickets in a World Cup edition. Starc picked up two wickets against South Africa to take his tally to 26 wickets in the 2019 World Cup. McGrath had taken 26 wickets in the 2007 edition.

column2: ICC should consider head-to-head instead of NRR: Pakistan coach
column3: Following Pakistan's final game of 2019 World Cup against Bangladesh, Pakistan coach Mickey Arthur said the ICC should give head-to-head record a higher priority than net run-rate (NRR). He added that Pakistan would've been in the semi-finals if head-to-head record was considered. Pakistan and New Zealand accumulated 11 points, but Pakistan finished fifth due to inferior net run-rate

column2: Govt expects ₹90,000 crore dividend from RBI this fiscal
column3: Economic Affairs Secretary SC Garg has said the government expects ₹90,000 crore as dividend from the RBI this fiscal. The central bank transferred ₹68,000 crore to the government including ₹28,000 crore as interim dividend last fiscal. The Union Budget has pegged dividend or surplus from the RBI, nationalised banks and financial institutions in 2019-20 at ₹1.06 lakh crore.

column2: Virat Kohli 3rd Indian to score 1,000 runs in World Cup history
column3: Team India captain Virat Kohli has become the third Indian batsman after Sachin Tendulkar and Sourav Ganguly to score 1,000 runs in World Cup history. Kohli achieved the feat after reaching the 5-run mark against Sri Lanka in the 2019 World Cup on Saturday. Sachin scored 2,278 runs across World Cups, while Sourav Ganguly aggregated 1,006 runs.

column2: Federer reaches Wimbledon 4th round with 350th Grand Slam match win
column3: Eight-time champion Roger Federer defeated world number 28 Lucas Pouille 7-5, 6-2, 7-6(7-4) to reach the Wimbledon fourth round for the 17th time. Federer also became the first player in history to win 350 Grand Slam singles' matches. In the next round, the 37-year-old will face Matteo Berrettini, who defeated Diego Schwartzman in a five-set thriller in the third round.

column2: Jeff Bezos officially divorced, MacKenzie to get $38 billion
column3: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos' divorce from his wife MacKenzie Bezos, was finalised by a judge on Friday. MacKenzie is now set to receive 4% of Amazon's outstanding stock worth $38.3 billion as per a divorce settlement, a stake that would make her the third-richest woman. He retains a 12% stake worth $114.8 billion and remains the world's richest person.

column2: Nadal beats Tsonga in 108 minutes to reach Wimbledon last 16
column3: World number two Rafael Nadal defeated France's Jo-Wilfried Tsonga in one hour and 48 minutes on Saturday to enter Wimbledon's round of 16 for the ninth time. The Spaniard, a two-time Wimbledon champion, beat Tsonga in their first meeting since 2015 with a scoreline of 6-3, 6-2, 6-3. Nadal will face world number 69 João Sousa in the next round.

column2: Want to expand Women's World Cup to 32 teams: FIFA President
column3: FIFA President Gianni Infantino on Friday said he wants to expand the size of Women's World Cup to 32 teams from 24 for the 2023 edition and double its prize money to $60 million. "If we're to increase it for 2023...we should reopen bidding process," Infantino added. He further proposed a Women's Club World Cup which can be played yearly.

column2: Want to make shooting sports affordable, accessible: Narang
column3: India's Olympic Games bronze medal-winning shooter Gagan Narang, who mentors shooters at the Gun For Glory Shooting Academy, said, "The idea is to make shooting as accessible and affordable as possible." "We are trying to explore innovative ways to help the aspiring shooters, like making everything as much subsidised as possible. More the subsidies, the better it is," Narang added.

column2: India denies Facebook a patent for category-wise e-content
column3: The Delhi patent office has rejected a patent application filed by social media giant Facebook for category-wise electronic content. The office cited Section 3(k) of the Indian Patent Act, which excludes mathematical or business methods or computer program per se or algorithms from being patented. Facebook has claimed its method can't be brought under the purview of Section 3(k).

column2: No action will be taken against MLA Akash by BJP: Digvijaya Singh
column3: Congress' Digvijaya Singh on Saturday said that no action would be taken by BJP against their MLA Akash Vijayvargiya for attacking a municipal corporation officer. "We saw this in the case of (BJP MP) Pragya Singh too. A notice was issued but then nothing happened," he added. "There is a huge difference between (BJP's) words and actions," Singh further said.

column2: Former Andhra Pradesh CM joins Bharatiya Janata Party
column3: Former Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Bhaskara Rao joined Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Saturday in the presence of party President and Union Home Minister Amit Shah in Telangana. Rao joined the party at the launch of BJP's nationwide membership campaign which was inaugurated by Shah. Another BJP membership campaign was launched today by PM Narendra Modi in UP's Varanasi.

column2: Might explore possibilities to form govt in K'taka: Yeddyurappa
column3: BJP leader BS Yeddyurappa on Saturday said his party would explore the Constitutional possibilities to form the next government in Karnataka if the situation arises. "Being a...responsible national political party, we have the responsibility to find a solution to present political problems," he added. This comes after 11 Congress-JD(S) MLAs tendered their resignations earlier today.

column2: Female arctic fox found to have travelled 3,500 km in 76 days
column3: Norwegian scientists at the Norwegian Polar Institute have found one young arctic female fox to have travelled from Norway to Canada in 76 days covering approximately 3,500 km. The scientists at the institute had fitted around 50 coastal or blue foxes with tracking collars. The fox was found to have travelled an average of about 45 km per day.

column2: Two drown in sea near Mumbai's Marine Drive
column3: Two unidentified people drowned in the Arabian Sea near Marine Drive in Mumbai on Saturday. A man had jumped into the sea to rescue an eight-year-old boy but both got carried away by the high tide, reported ANI. Rescue operations by divers of the Indian Navy, an Indian Navy helicopter and a fire brigade are underway to recover their bodies.

column2: Fines of up to ₹15,000 to be levied for illegal parking in Mumbai
column3: Mumbai civic body BMC will levy fines of up to ₹15,000 for parking vehicles in unauthorised spaces in the city from July 7. The fine could go up to ₹23,250 including late payment penalty and towing charges, an official said. The policy intends to get rid of illegal parking that blocks movements of emergency vehicles like ambulances and fire engines.

column2: Amethi elected me as their Didi, not as an MP: Smriti Irani
column3: Union Minister and Amethi MP Smriti Irani on Saturday said that people of the constituency have elected her as their 'Didi' (elder sister) and not an MP. "It's my home and I'll always safeguard its respect," she added while speaking at a programme in Amethi. Irani claimed that she has brought projects worth ₹50 crore for the development of Amethi.

column2: Drunk man makes hoax claims about bombs on flights; arrested
column3: A 24-year-old man was arrested on Saturday after allegedly making hoax claims about bombs on two Chennai-bound flights at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport. The claims were made hours before Home Minister Amit Shah's visit to the city. Upon investigation, the sales executive revealed that he gave the false tips to CISF personnel as he was "heartbroken and drunk".

column2: Rohit 1st batsman in history to smash 5 hundreds in a World Cup
column3: India opener Rohit Sharma reached the three-figure mark against Sri Lanka off 92 balls in 2019 World Cup on Saturday to become the first-ever batsman to smash five hundreds in a World Cup. Rohit overtook ex-Sri Lanka captain Kumar Sangakkara, who slammed four hundreds in the 2015 edition. Rohit also equalled Sachin Tendulkar's record for most World Cup hundreds (six).

column2: Rohit second Indian after Sachin to score 600 runs in a World Cup
column3: Opener Rohit Sharma has become the second Indian after Sachin Tendulkar to score 600 runs in a World Cup. The 32-year-old achieved the feat after touching 56-run mark against Sri Lanka in 2019 World Cup on Saturday. Ex-Australia batsman Matthew Hayden and Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan are the other two batsmen to score 600 runs in a World Cup.

column2: He was raping me with his eyes: Esha accuses hotelier of misconduct
column3: Esha Gupta has accused Rohit Vig, a hotelier, of sexually inappropriate behaviour at a restaurant where she was celebrating the release of her film 'One Day: Justice Delivered'. "He was...raping me with his eyes...He was requested to behave thrice and then leave...Eventually 2 guards had to be around me," she wrote. "Rohit Vig you molested me last night," Esha added.

column2: Plane flies over India-SL match with 'Justice for Kashmir' banner
column3: A plane carrying 'Justice for Kashmir' and 'India stop genocide and free Kashmir' banners flew over the Headingley stadium during India-Sri Lanka 2019 World Cup match on Saturday. "We are incredibly disappointed this has happened again. We do not condone any sort of political messages at the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup," the ICC said in a statement.

column2: Tea industry seeks exemption from TDS on cash withdrawal
column3: Indian Tea Association has sought exemption for the tea industry from 2% TDS on cash withdrawals exceeding ₹1 crore a year from a bank account. It said there are inadequate banking facilities in tea-growing areas, due to which workers are largely paid in cash. The government said the move is to discourage the practice of making business payments in cash.

column2: BCCI shares note Virat Kohli wrote for 87-year-old fan Charulata
column3: The BCCI took to Twitter to share a picture of 87-year-old fan Charulata Patel watching India-Sri Lanka World Cup match in Leeds and also shared the note India captain Virat Kohli wrote for her. "It's so inspiring to see your love and passion for our team," part of the note read. Kohli had promised tickets for Charulata after India-Bangladesh match.

column2: Size of the cake matters: PM Modi on $5 trillion economy
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said the aim of turning India into a $5-trillion economy will transform the lives of everyone. "There is a saying in English 'size of the cake matters', meaning, bigger the cake, bigger the slice people will get," he said. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Friday said India would become a $3-trillion economy this year.

column2: Govt planning to monitor internet via centralised system: Prasad
column3: Telecom Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad has informed the Rajya Sabha that the government has set up a Centralised Monitoring System (CMS) for lawful interception and monitoring of mobile phones, landlines and internet traffic through mobile network. The present Internet Monitoring System is under consideration for integration with CMS, he added. The hub of the CMS is located in Delhi.

column2: HIV eliminated from living animal cells with gene editing in a 1st
column3: America's Temple University and University of Nebraska Medical Center researchers claimed they eliminated HIV DNA from the genomes of living animals, in a first. Researchers combined gene editing system with a recently developed therapeutic strategy called long-acting slow-effective release (LASER) ART. Analyses showed complete elimination of HIV-1 DNA in about one-third of HIV-infected mice.

column2: Trump wrongly says revolutionary army 'took over airports' in 1770s
column3: Addressing a crowd on the US' Independence Day, President Donald Trump mistakenly said that the Continental Army "took over the airports" during the American Revolutionary War in the 1770s. Trump later said that the teleprompter he used to deliver his speech faced technical problems. Notably, the Wright brothers are credited with flying the world's first plane in 1903.

column2: N Korea says it deported Australian student Sigley as he was spying
column3: North Korea has said that Australian student Alek Sigley committed "spying acts" through his work with foreign media and was, therefore, expelled from the country. North Korea's state-run news agency KCNA said he spread propaganda against the reclusive regime in his articles published in foreign news outlets. North Korea deported him after he admitted that he'd been spying, KCNA added.

column2: Sri Lanka President rejects deal to give US access to its ports
column3: Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena has said that his government won't sign a military deal that'd give the US free access to its ports, claiming the deal is detrimental to Sri Lanka. "Some foreign forces want to make Sri Lanka one of their bases. I won't allow them to...challenge our sovereignty," Sirisena said in a veiled reference to the US.

column2: Yes Bank acquires 9.4% stake in Eveready after McLeod defaults
column3: Yes Bank has acquired a 9.47% stake in Eveready by invoking shares pledged by tea manufacturer McLeod Russel. This comes after McLeod, which belongs to the BM Khaitan Group, defaulted on repayment of credit facilities extended by the bank. Mcleod, which has a presence in India, Uganda, Vietnam and Rwanda, has been selling its tea estates to reduce its debt.

column2: Ashleigh Barty, Serena Williams reach Wimbledon last-16
column3: Current world number one Ashleigh Barty and former world number one Serena Williams reached the last-16 stage of the Wimbledon 2019. This is the first time Barty will make an appearance in the last-16 stage of the grass-court Grand Slam. Barty is looking to become the first Australian Wimbledon women's champion since Evonne Cawley won her second title in 1980.

column2: Australia have ‘learnt’ from ball-tampering row: Du Plessis
column3: Speaking about the ball-tampering row and the culture of Australian team since then, South Africa captain Faf du Plessis said, "[T]he Australian culture looks like it's really good, so they've learnt from that and they have made themselves stronger for it." "All of us make mistakes. It is about how you learn and how you move forward," Du Plessis added.

column2: Ex-world no. 1 Halep beats Azarenka to reach Wimbledon 4th Rd
column3: Former world number one Simona Halep thrashed former world number one Victoria Azarenka at the Wimbledon 2019 on Friday. Azarenka had earlier dispatched her second-round opponent by winning 12 consecutive games. "My coach is going to watch this match. I will recover my body and just chill," Halep said about her upcoming opponent 15-year-old Cori Gauff's match.

column2: Morata completes permanent move to Atletico Madrid
column3: Spanish forward Alvaro Morata has completed a permanent move to Atletico Madrid after Chelsea agreed to a deal reportedly worth £50 million. Morata had spent a part of the last season on loan at the Spanish club. The Spanish striker scored six goals in 17 games since January for Atletico Madrid. Morata used to play for Atletico rivals Real Madrid.

column2: Quick Heal 1st India firm to get US patent for anti-ransomware tech
column3: Pune-based cybersecurity firm Quick Heal Technologies has become the first Indian firm to be granted a US patent for an anti-ransomware technology. The artificial intelligence and machine learning-powered technology detects and blocks known and unknown ransomware on a real-time basis, Quick Heal said. Quick Heal Annual Threat Report 2018 stated 23% of 973 million malware attacks were ransomware.

column2: Membership drive launched from UP is a matter of pride: Yogi
column3: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Saturday said it is a matter of pride for the state that the nationwide membership drive for BJP is being launched in Varanasi. Earlier today, Adityanath welcomed PM Narendra Modi on his day-long visit to Varanasi for the launch. The PM unveiled a statue of Lal Bahadur Shastri before launching the membership drive.

column2: Not influenced by Operation Kamala: JD(S) leader on resignation
column3: JD(S) leader H Vishwanath on Saturday said that he along with 10 other MLAs of the party have resigned voluntarily and weren't influenced by 'Operation Kamala'. "Coalition government didn't meet the expectations of the people of Karnataka," he added. "In the Congress-JD(S) government, 14 MLAs have resigned...till now...We wrote to the Speaker to accept our resignation," he further said.

column2: Digital membership made BJP world's largest party: JP Nadda
column3: BJP Working President JP Nadda on Saturday said that party President Amit Shah's push for digital membership made BJP world's largest party. "The party has become stronger in 8,63,971 booths in the country after the digital membership drive," he further said. Nadda added that Shah launched the membership drive through digital medium around five years ago in 2014.

column2: BMW's 4-year CEO quits months after weakest earnings in 10 years
column3: German automaker BMW has announced that Harald Krüger has decided to not seek a second term as the CEO, after serving at the role for about four years. Krüger, a 27-year company veteran, served at the luxury carmaker's board for 10 years. This comes months after BMW posted its weakest quarterly earnings in about a decade for the first quarter.

column2: 75% student attendance; 7-hr duty for teachers in Odisha colleges
column3: Odisha's higher education department on Friday issued a notification making 75% attendance mandatory for all students of government and aided non-government colleges, failing which they will not be allowed to appear for the end-term examinations. The notification further directed all teachers of the colleges to be on duty for at least seven hours for all working days.

column2: Naxals set fire to 2 trucks, beat up drivers in Jharkhand
column3: Around twelve armed members of a Naxal outfit set two empty trucks on fire and beat up their drivers in Jharkhand's Garhwa district on Thursday night, said police. They belonged to the banned outfit Jharkhand Jan Mukti Parishad (JJMP), police added. Police officials went to the place upon receiving information, but the Naxals fled the spot after torching the vehicles.

column2: Scholarship promise for 1 cr Muslim students not fulfilled: Owaisi
column3: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Friday criticised the 2019 Union Budget for not including scholarships for one crore Muslim students. "Minority Affairs Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi had promised to give scholarship...every year," he said. Owaisi further accused BJP of creating a rift between Hindus and Muslims, adding that the Centre should make laws to put a halt to mob lynching.

column2: 3 men allegedly forced to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' in Jharkhand
column3: A mob allegedly attacked and forced three men to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' after asking their names in Jharkhand's Ranchi on Friday. The victims said that they had gone to the airport area to click photographs when the attack took place. In June, a 24-year-old Muslim man was forced to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' and mob lynched in the state.

column2: 11 MLAs of JD(S)-Cong coalition govt in K'taka submit resignation
column3: Eleven MLAs of the JD(S)-Congress coalition government in Karnataka on Saturday submitted their resignation. Out of the eleven, eight MLAs are from the Congress and three are from the JD(S). The JD(S)-Congress coalition government would lose majority if the resignations are accepted. The MLAs reportedly met Governor Vajubhai Vala and called for a floor test in the Assembly.

column2: If lovers can't slap each other, I see nothing there: Kabir Singh maker
column3: Talking about allegations of toxic masculinity in 'Kabir Singh', director Sandeep Reddy Vanga said, "When you're deeply in love and...you don't have the liberty of slapping each other, then I don't see anything there." Referring to film critic Rajeev Masand as "some fat guy who reviewed my film", Vanga said, "He gave two (stars) and audience gave ₹200 crore."

column2: CSK troll Manjrekar as Jadeja takes wkt in his 1st over of 2019 WC
column3: Chennai Super Kings trolled commentator Sanjay Manjrekar after all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja took a wicket in his first over of 2019 World Cup against Sri Lanka on Saturday. "Thala dislodged those bails, in bits and pieces! #SirJadduIsBack," CSK wrote on Twitter. Manjrekar had earlier said that he is not a fan of "bits and pieces" players like Jadeja.

column2: Gold import duty hike will encourage smuggling: Trade associations
column3: Government's decision to increase customs duty on gold to 12.5% from 10% is going to encourage a lot of smuggling, All India Gem and Jewellery Domestic Council's Chairman Anantha Padmanaban said. "This is a shocking move. We were expecting a reduction in customs duty," Padmanaban added. Meanwhile, World Gold Council said the hike "will dilute efforts to reduce cash transactions".

column2: Bumrah becomes 2nd fastest Indian to take 100 wickets in ODI cricket
column3: Pacer Jasprit Bumrah has become the second-fastest Indian bowler to take 100 wickets in ODI cricket, achieving the feat by dismissing Sri Lanka captain Dimuth Karunaratne in 2019 World Cup on Saturday. Bumrah reached the milestone in his 57th match, taking one match more than record-holder Mohammad Shami. Overall, Bumrah is the 21st Indian bowler to take 100 ODI wickets.

column2: India to sell bonds overseas for 1st time to finance budget deficit
column3: The government on Friday said it will sell sovereign bonds overseas for the first time to finance the fiscal deficit. Ex-RBI Governor C Rangarajan opposed the plan saying India will have to bear the exchange-rate risk if it borrows in foreign currency. The government set the fiscal deficit target at 3.3% of GDP for FY20, from 3.4% set in February.

column2: Jaya Prada teaches wrong spelling of 'country' to students in Rampur
column3: Actress-turned-politician and BJP leader Jaya Prada visited a government school in Rampur where she met children and taught them English and Hindi. In a video showing her teaching the students, she could be seen writing 'India is my contry' on the board, instead of 'country'. Even though some teachers were present in the classroom, no one pointed out the mistake.

column2: Punjab sisters write letter with blood to Prez Kovind, seek help
column3: Two sisters from Punjab's Moga have written a letter with blood to President Ram Nath Kovind seeking his help in allegedly false cases of Kabutarbaazi and cheating and fraud filed against them. They claimed that police is also not helping them in the matter. "We've demanded euthanasia for the whole family if we do not receive justice," the sisters said.

column2: Jaipur declared World Heritage Site by UNESCO
column3: Jaipur was declared as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO today during the 43rd meeting of World Heritage Committee in Azerbaijan's Baku. The historic walled city of Jaipur in Rajasthan, was founded in 1727 AD. "Jaipur is a city associated with culture and valour. Elegant and energetic, Jaipur’s hospitality draws people from all over," PM Narendra Modi tweeted.

column2: Wrong man taken off life support by family as police misidentify him
column3: A man was wrongly taken off life support in Chicago, US, after a family mistakenly thought he was their relative and gave its consent, a lawsuit claimed. The man, who was found injured and unconscious underneath a car, was wrongly identified by the police as Alfonso Bennett. The mistake emerged when the real Alfonso Bennett showed up at a barbecue.

column2: 1,000 killed in 3 months of clashes to seize Libya's capital: WHO
column3: Nearly 1,000 people have been killed in Libya since General Haftar-led Libyan National Army (LNA) launched an offensive to seize capital Tripoli, the World Health Organisation (WHO) said. The LNA, which holds eastern Libya and much of the country's south, launched an offensive in April to seize Tripoli from forces loyal to the United Nations-recognised Government of National Accord (GNA).

column2: Indonesia's top court jails woman who reported sexual harassment
column3: Indonesia's Supreme Court has jailed a woman, who accused her employer of sexual harassment, for 6 months. Baiq Nuril Maknun had complained of getting lewd phone calls from the principal of the school where she worked. She had recorded some of the phone calls and distributed one of the recordings. The court found Maknun guilty of spreading "indecent" material.

column2: Botswana seeks to overturn ruling that legalised gay sex
column3: Botswana's government will appeal against a high court ruling that decriminalised homosexuality. In June, a panel of three judges ruled that sections of the penal code banning gay sex were unconstitutional as they violate privacy, liberty, and dignity. It also found the ban to be discriminatory and to not serve the public interest.

column2: Poor batting against Windies cost us the World Cup: Sarfaraz
column3: Pakistani captain Sarfaraz Ahmed said that his side's batting performance against the Windies cost them the World Cup. Pakistan registered their fourth consecutive win in the tournament on Friday. "It's very unfortunate. We played good cricket but haven't qualified... Boys responded well after the India game," Sarfaraz added about his team's run at the World Cup 2019.

column2: Novak Djokovic reaches Wimbledon round of 16 for 12th time
column3: Four-time champion Novak Djokovic defeated Poland's Hubert Hurkacz 7-5, 6-7(5-7), 6-1, 6-4 in three hours on Friday to enter Wimbledon's round of 16 for the 12th time. The defending champion will next face Frenchman Ugo Humbert, who beat Canada's 18-year-old Felix Aliassime 6-4, 7-5, 6-3. "Hurkacz pushed me...He gave it all and played a great quality match," Djokovic said after the match.

column2: Amazon denies reports of shutting grocery delivery app in India
column3: E-commerce giant Amazon has denied reports that it is shutting down its two-hour grocery and household items delivery app Prime Now in India. "Prime Now...is currently the fastest growing channel with the highest customer shopping frequency," Amazon said. Launched as Amazon Now in India in 2016 for all customers, Prime Now was restricted to Amazon Prime subscribers last year.

column2: US seeks dismissal of Huawei's lawsuit over 'illegal' blacklisting
column3: The US government on Wednesday filed a motion seeking dismissal of a lawsuit filed by Chinese telecoms equipment maker Huawei that claimed the country had acted illegally when it blacklisted Huawei's products. Huawei had sued the US government in early March alleging the law that limited its American business was "unconstitutional". The US had done so over alleged espionage concerns.

column2: Only a youth leader could revive Congress party: Punjab CM
column3: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Saturday said a young leader should replace Rahul Gandhi as the Congress president, asserting that it would help the party bounce back. "Any change in the...leadership must reflect India's societal reality, with 65% of its population under 35," he added. "Congress needs young blood to...once again make it India's preferred...choice," Singh further said.

column2: 2 BJP workers injured in clash with TMC in West Bengal
column3: Two BJP workers were injured in a clash with the Trinamool Congress (TMC) supporters on Friday in West Bengal's Burdwan. The BJP workers have alleged that they were beaten up by TMC supporters, while the TMC workers have claimed that BJP supporters threw bombs at them. Police have recovered around 10 crude bombs from the spot.

column2: SoftBank planning to invest up to $4 bn in India over next 2 yrs
column3: Japanese multinational conglomerate SoftBank is planning to invest $2-4 billion in India over the next two years, SoftBank Vision Fund head Rajeev Misra said. SoftBank would be bringing over 20 companies in its portfolio into India by setting up joint ventures with local businesses, he added. Notably, SoftBank has invested over $10 billion in India in the past decade.

column2: BJP MP's guards thrash toll plaza employees, fire in air in Agra
column3: The bodyguards of BJP MP Ram Shankar Katheria allegedly thrashed toll plaza employees and fired in the air after an argument in Agra in the early hours of Saturday. Katheria, who is also the chairman of the National Commission for Scheduled Castes, was present on the spot with his wife. The assault was caught on the toll plaza's CCTV camera.

column2: 3 women among 4 Naxals killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh
column3: Four Naxals, including three women, were neutralised in an encounter with security forces in Chhattisgarh's Dhamtari district on Saturday. The encounter took place when a team of the Special Task Force was out on an anti-Naxal operation in the forests between Khallari and Mechka villages, police said. Along with the four bodies, police also recovered seven firearms from the spot.

column2: PM unveils Lal Bahadur Shastri's statue at Varanasi airport
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday unveiled a statue of former Prime Minister Lal Bahadur Shastri at Varanasi airport in the presence of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath, BJP Working President JP Nadda and other ministers. On a day-long visit to Varanasi, the PM also launched BJP's membership drive. After unveiling the statue, PM Modi launched a tree plantation drive.

column2: Delhi CM announces ₹10 lakh aid for 6-yr-old rape victim's family
column3: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and his deputy Manish Sisodia visited a six-year-old girl in the hospital who was raped earlier this week and announced financial aid of ₹10 lakh for the family. Kejriwal also promised to provide a good lawyer to represent the case in court. The victim has undergone various surgeries and is still in a critical condition.

column2: 19-year-old Shaheen Afridi breaks multiple records in 1 WC match
column3: Pakistan's 19-year-old pacer Shaheen Afridi on Friday became the youngest bowler to take a five-wicket haul in World Cups. He registered the best figures (6/35) by a Pakistani in World Cups and recorded most wickets (16) by a teenager in World Cups. He also became the second teenager after Sachin Tendulkar to win Man of the Match in World Cups.

column2: Patna court gives bail to Rahul in case over 'all Modi thieves' remark
column3: Rahul Gandhi has been granted bail by a Patna court in connection with a defamation case filed by Bihar Deputy CM Sushil Modi over his 'why all thieves have Modi surname?' remark. Ahead of the hearing, Rahul had tweeted that the case has been filed against him by his political opponents in the RSS/BJP to harass and intimidate him.

column2: Disney removes casting couch 'blooper' scene from Toy Story 2
column3: A fake blooper scene from 1999 Toy Story 2 featuring a "casting couch" scenario has been deleted by Disney-Pixar from the latest home releases. It featured the character Stinky Pete, who's caught talking salaciously to two Barbie dolls while stroking their hands. Notably, the film's director John Lasseter had quit Disney in 2018 after allegations against him under #MeToo movement.

column2: Actress Rakul Preet gets mobbed by beggars in Mumbai
column3: A video has surfaced online, showing actress Rakul Preet Singh being mobbed by a group of beggars after she got out of a restaurant in Mumbai. The video shows the beggars surrounding the actress, pestering her for money and not letting her enter her car. Later, a member of her team helps her to get inside her car.

column2: Rappers like Honey Singh should be banned, punished: Jasbir Jassi
column3: After Punjab women panel sought action against Honey Singh over vulgar lyrics in his song 'Makhna', singer Jasbir Jassi said, "To avoid vulgarity created by these rappers, you should not only ban them but punish them too." The panel stated they've asked police to file a criminal case against Singh for using lyrics like "Mein hoon womaniser (I'm a womaniser)".

column2: Pakistani news anchor confuses Apple company with fruit, gets trolled
column3: A Pakistani news anchor is getting trolled online after she confused technology giant Apple with the apple fruit during a live show. A panelist on the show said, "Apple's business is so much more than even Pakistan's budget." In response, the anchor said, "Yes, I've heard that apple's (fruit) business is thriving and there are various varieties of it."

column2: People want me to retire before Sri Lanka match: MS Dhoni
column3: Ex-India captain MS Dhoni has said a lot of people want him to retire before India's 2019 World Cup match against Sri Lanka. "I don't know when I'll retire," he added. The 37-year-old has scored 223 runs in the tournament so far. Earlier, a BCCI official said it's unlikely Dhoni will continue to play for India after 2019 World Cup.

column2: Every ending is a new beginning: Sania as Malik retires from ODIs
column3: Indian tennis player Sania Mirza dedicated a post on Twitter to her husband and Pakistani all-rounder Shoaib Malik, who retired from ODIs on Friday. "'Every story has an end, but in life every ending is a new beginning.' You...have proudly played for your country for 20 years and...continue to do so with so much honour and humility," she wrote.

column2: Only professional pessimists question $5 trillion economy goal: PM
column3: Taking a dig at those criticising the Union Budget, PM Narendra Modi said, "Only professional pessimists question $5-trillion economy goal." "These are the people to whom if you go to seek a solution for a problem, they confuse you even more," he added. He asserted that together we can prove those wrong who think the $5-trillion economy target is unattainable.

column2: Don't like people shouting 'Wall', I'd rather be called Rahul: Dravid
column3: Talking about his nickname 'The Wall', former India captain Rahul Dravid said that he doesn't like people shouting 'Wall, Wall' and that he'd rather be called 'Rahul'. "I am not comfortable or uncomfortable being called 'The Wall'," he added. He further said that 'The Wall' nickname probably came from a clever editor or reporter in a newspaper.

column2: Will appear in court over case filed by RSS/BJP to harass me: Rahul
column3: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said he will appear in a Patna civil court for another case filed by his "political opponents in the RSS/BJP" to "harass and intimidate" him. "Satyameva Jayate," he tweeted. This comes days after Rahul appeared in a Mumbai court over a defamation lawsuit filed against him by an RSS worker.

column2: Do not accept gifts, bouquets or dowry: Madras HC to policemen
column3: Madras High Court on Friday directed the Director General of Police to issue a circular to all police officers in Tamil Nadu, reminding them to not accept gifts, bouquets or dowry. "A government servant must have a clean record of service," the court reportedly said. The behaviour of public servants inside and outside office must be good, the court added.

column2: Wasn't allowed in Shatabdi for dressing differently: 82-yr-old seer
column3: An 82-year-old dhoti-clad seer, Ram Awadh Das, has accused railway police of denying him entry into Kanpur-Delhi Shatabdi Express, despite having a valid ticket because he was dressed "differently". "It seems as if we're still living in the British era," he said. However, an official said the seer wrongly boarded the power car and was told to board another coach.

column2: BJP responds as Amartya Sen links Jai Shri Ram to beating people
column3: The Bharatiya Janata Party's West Bengal President Dilip Ghosh has responded after Nobel laureate Amartya Sen linked 'Jai Shri Ram' to beating people. Ghosh said, "Amartya Sen probably doesn't know Bengal...'Jai Shri Ram' is chanted in [every] village. Now entire Bengal says it." "I think 'Jai Shri Ram' has no association with Bengali culture," Sen had said.

column2: Journalist booked for sexually harassing domestic help in Gurugram
column3: A 53-year-old journalist with a national daily was booked for allegedly sexually harassing his 25-year-old domestic help in Gurugram, police said on Friday. The woman, who had been working as full-time help for the accused for four years, alleged that her employer molested her when they were alone, but she managed to escape and took shelter at her friend's house.

column2: News anchor hides under desk on live TV as quake shakes studio
column3: A video showing a news anchor hiding under desk on live TV during a 7.1-magnitude earthquake that hit California has surfaced online. "We're making sure nothing is going to come down...We're experiencing very strong shaking…I think we need to get under the desk," the news anchor was heard saying. The quake followed a 6.4-magnitude earthquake that hit California on Thursday.

column2: Chainsaw artisan carves Melania Trump's statue out of tree trunk
column3: A life-size wooden sculpture of US First Lady Melania Trump has been unveiled near her hometown of Sevnica in Slovenia. US artist Brad Downey hired a local chainsaw artisan, Ales Zupevc, to carve the statue out of a tree trunk. The statue is shown clothed in pale blue wraparound coat that Melania wore at Donald Trump's inauguration as US President.

column2: US seeks ₹86,000 crore from Mexican drug lord 'El Chapo'
column3: US authorities said on Friday they were seeking a court order requiring Mexican drug lord Joaquin 'El Chapo' Guzman to forfeit $12.7 billion (over ₹86,000 crore) following his conviction for racketeering and drug trafficking crimes. The 62-year-old was convicted on February 12 on all 10 counts he faced. Guzman faces life in prison at his scheduled July 17 sentencing.

column2: California hit by 7.1-magnitude earthquake, strongest in 20 years
column3: California was hit by its strongest earthquake in two decades on Friday, a 7.1-magnitude tremor that shook buildings and cut power supplies in parts of Los Angeles but did not cause any deaths. The quake struck near the city of Ridgecrest, US seismologists said, and follows a 6.4-magnitude quake that hit the same area the day before.

column2: Ancient city of Babylon declared UNESCO World Heritage Site
column3: The UN Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation (UNESCO) designated the ancient city of Babylon as a World Heritage Site. The designation recognises the civilisations of Mesopotamia and their contributions to humanity, the Iraqi government said. Babylon suffered damages during dictator Saddam Hussein's reign and when it was used as a military base during the US-led invasion of Iraq.

column2: No mention of funds for UDAN disappointing: MMT Founder on Budget
column3: MakeMyTrip Founder and Group CEO Deep Kalra, reacting to Union Budget 2019, said that no specific mention of fund allocation for regional connectivity scheme UDAN was "disappointing". "While we're pleased to hear of the focus on infrastructure-related spends, with investment of ₹100 lakh crore over five years, it's critical...to build better connectivity for key tourist destinations," he added.

column2: Former Paytm execs' foodtech startup Daalchini gets ₹3.5 cr
column3: Delhi-NCR based foodtech startup Daalchini has raised ₹3.5 crore in a seed round of funding led by Artha Venture Fund. Everest Flavours MD Anand Ladsariya also participated in the investment, among others. Founded by former Paytm executives Prerna Kalra and Vidya Bhushan, Daalchini lets customers order food via mobile app and pick them up from the nearest kiosk.

column2: Shoaib Malik retires from ODI cricket 20 years after his debut
column3: All-rounder Shoaib Malik announced his retirement from ODI cricket after Pakistan's last 2019 World Cup match against Bangladesh on Friday. The 37-year-old, who made his ODI debut on October 14, 1999, represented Pakistan in 287 ODIs, scoring 7,534 runs and taking 158 wickets. Malik had retired from Test cricket in 2015 and would continue playing T20Is.

column2: Great Learning alum launches career in Data Science at OYO
column3: Gurdeep, alumnus of Great Learning's PG Program in Data Science and Engineering has transitioned to a Data Science career as a Business Analyst at OYO Rooms. The program provides industry-relevant curriculum, experience-based learning and dedicated placement assistance for freshers and early-career professionals looking to switch to Data Science. Alumni have received an average salary hike of 65%.

column2: Shakib 3rd cricketer in history to score 600+ runs in a World Cup
column3: Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan has become the third cricketer after Sachin Tendulkar and Matthew Hayden to score 600-plus runs in a World Cup. The 32-year-old, who scored 64 runs against Pakistan today, aggregated 606 runs and took 11 wickets in eight 2019 World Cup matches. Shakib also equalled Sachin's record of scoring seven 50-plus scores in a World Cup.

column2: Chhavi Hussein resumes shoot, takes 2-month-old son with her on sets
column3: Actress Chhavi Hussein, who gave birth to son Arham after 10 months of pregnancy, has announced that she is returning to work, adding that her two-month-old son is also accompanying her on sets. Sharing a picture with her co-star Karan V Grover on Instagram, Chhavi wrote, "It's the first time there's a baby on our sets."

column2: Good to see the impetus given to startups: Flipkart's CEO on Budget
column3: Reacting to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's maiden Budget, Flipkart CEO Kalyan Krishnamurthy said, "It's good to see the impetus given to startups, MSMEs and FPOs - which form the backbone of our economy." Lauding government's commitment to boost 'Digital India', Krishnamurthy said bridging the rural-urban divide with internet penetration will be pivotal in transforming India into a $5 trillion economy.

column2: Govt focus on electric mobility and EVs inspiring: Ola CEO on Budget
column3: Reacting to Union Budget 2019, Ola Co-founder and CEO Bhavish Aggarwal said, "The government's focus on electric mobility and electric vehicles is inspiring." He said, "Lower GST rate, interest subvention for EV loans, and the commitment of ₹10,000 crore towards FAME II are encouraging." He added that startup-friendly measures will encourage India's youth to create value, wealth and livelihood opportunities.

column2: Babar breaks record for most runs by a Pakistani in a single WC
column3: Pakistan batsman Babar Azam has set the record for scoring most runs by a Pakistan batsman in a single World Cup campaign. The 24-year-old scored 96(98) against Bangladesh to take his tally of runs in 2019 World Cup to 465. The previous record was held by Javed Miandad, who had scored 437 runs in the 1992 World Cup.

column2: Pak beat B'desh as Shaheen becomes youngest to take WC 5-wicket haul
column3: Pakistan defeated Bangladesh by 94 runs to end their 2019 World Cup campaign at fifth position with 11 points. The match witnessed Pakistan pacer Shaheen Afridi become the youngest-ever bowler (19 years and 90 days) to take a five-wicket haul in World Cup history. Notably, Shakib Al Hasan became the first cricketer to score 600 runs in 2019 World Cup.

column2: Shoaib Malik should get farewell dinner, not match: Wasim Akram
column3: Ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram has said that veteran all-rounder Shoaib Malik, who'll retire after ongoing 2019 World Cup, should be given a farewell dinner, not a farewell match. "He didn't play many matches in World Cup. He got out twice on duck, but this can happen...We should always remember his services as he has won Pakistan many matches," he added.

column2: I wanted to hit Nadal square in the chest: Nick Kyrgios
column3: On being asked about the baseline forehand he thrashed at world number two Rafael Nadal in third set of his Wimbledon second-round defeat, world number 43 Nick Kyrgios said he wanted to hit Nadal square in chest. "I mean...the dude has got how many slams, how much money in the bank...he can take a ball to the chest," he added.

column2: Mamata wants to remove party leaders in touch with BJP: TMC leader
column3: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Friday told TMC leaders to "pinpoint those in the party who are keeping in touch with leaders in the BJP", a TMC leader has revealed. During a meeting, Mamata called for the removal of such TMC leaders. Notably, several TMC MLAs and councillors have joined BJP since the Lok Sabha results were declared.

column2: OYO restricts SoftBank's shareholding limit at 49.99%
column3: Gurugram-based budget hospitality startup OYO has restricted its largest shareholder SoftBank from directly or indirectly acquiring over 49.99% of its shares without its Founder Ritesh Agarwal and investors' approval, TechCircle revealed. SoftBank currently holds about 46% stake in OYO. Notably, Ola also executed a similar clause in 2017, requiring SoftBank to seek approval to purchase its shares.

column2: Scientists to trap themselves in Arctic ice for $158-mn 1 yr study
column3: Scientists from 17 countries are preparing for a $158-million one-year-long, "largest Central Arctic expedition" where a ship will be trapped in a large piece of ice. The MOSAiC mission is aimed to study climate change as the ice drifts towards the North Pole. "So far we have always been locked out of that region...we're going to change that," researchers said.

column2: Hong Kong approves ₹6 crore for Cyclone Fani-hit Odisha
column3: The Hong Kong government has approved over $900,000 (over ₹6 crore) for relief and rehabilitation work in cyclone-hit Odisha, Chinese state media reported on Friday. A total of three grants, which are expected to benefit over 45,000 people affected by Cyclone Fani, will be used to provide hygiene kits, kitchen kits, water kits, education kits, household items, and shelter kits.

column2: 'Jai Shri Ram' is now used to beat up people: Amartya Sen
column3: Speaking at a Jadavpur University programme, Nobel laureate Amartya Sen said, "I [hadn't] heard 'Jai Shri Ram' before (in this way). It's now used to beat up people. I think it has no association with Bengali culture." Adding that Ram Navami is being celebrated more in Kolkata nowadays, Sen asserted, "These are recent imports to wage a war."

column2: Iran threatens to seize British oil tanker if its ship not released
column3: An Iranian official has threatened to seize a British oil tanker if a detained Iranian ship is not released. Mohsen Rezaee, a member of a council that advises Iran Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khamenei, said that Iran would respond to bullies "without hesitation". Britain seized the Iranian oil tanker for trying to take oil to Syria in violation of EU sanctions.

column2: Man eats 71 hot dogs to win 12th hot dog-eating contest
column3: California's Joey Chestnut won his 12th Nathan's Famous July Fourth men's hot dog eating contest by eating 71 hot dogs on Thursday. Miki Sudo won her sixth consecutive women's title on Thursday by eating 31 hot dogs in 10 minutes. Reports claim that 71 hot dogs contain 20,590 calories, 1,172 grams fat, and 2,130 milligrams of cholesterol.

column2: Union Budget is completely visionless: Mamata Banerjee
column3: Trinamool Congress (TMC) supremo and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Friday called the Union Budget 'completely visionless' which will increase the sufferings of the common people. She said that not only have the Centre imposed cess but also increased special additional excise duty leading to an increase in fuel prices. "The total vision is derailed...Commoners are suffering," she tweeted.

column2: Budget offers nothing to any section of society: Punjab CM
column3: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Friday said that the budget had nothing to offer to any section of the society, ignoring even critical sectors like Defence. "Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman wrapped up the budget speech without mentioning fiscal deficit and important sectors such as defence," he added. Singh claimed that the budget contained no roadmap for the nation's growth.

column2: Many pro-poor schemes in Union Budget: Manohar Lal Khattar
column3: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Friday said the Union Budget has 'many pro-poor schemes'. "While it's true that the tax liability on people who are well off will increase a little but there are special schemes which will benefit the poor people of the country," he added. This was Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's first budget.

column2: Swiggy launching own logistics service Swiggy Go: Report
column3: Bengaluru-based Swiggy is launching its own logistics service Swiggy Go, focussed on moving parcels like documents and performing several other errands, Entrackr reported. "The new vertical is slated to begin in Gurugram from mid-August. It has already hired over 30 key and mid-level employees," Entrackr quoted its sources. Swiggy Go will reportedly be launched in Bengaluru after Gurugram pilot.

column2: 5 arrested, over ₹2 lakh seized in 2 separate raids in Goa
column3: Police on Thursday arrested five people and seized over ₹2 lakh in two separate gambling-related raids in Goa. The first raid was conducted near Industrial Estate Karaswada Mapusa, where four people were caught accepting bids and cash worth ₹1 lakh was recovered. In the second raid near Calangute, one person was nabbed along with gambling articles and ₹1.14 lakh.

column2: SC notice to Delhi govt, police in 1984 anti-Sikh riots case
column3: The Supreme Court on Friday issued a notice to the Delhi government and police after the pleas filed by 33 convicts in the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. The convicts were sentenced to a five-year jail term by Delhi High Court for rioting, burning houses and violation of curfew in Delhi's Trilokpuri area following the assassination of then-Prime Minister Indira Gandhi.

column2: Pak officially knocked out of 2019 World Cup as B'desh cross 7 runs
column3: Pakistan have officially been knocked out of the 2019 World Cup after Bangladesh crossed seven runs while chasing the target of 316. Pakistan needed to win the match by at least 308 runs to advance to the semi-finals. With this, New Zealand became the fourth team after India, Australia and England to qualify for the semi-finals.

column2: India may see $57 billion share sales on new public holding rules
column3: If government's proposal to raise minimum public shareholding in listed companies from 25% to 35% is implemented, it may result in equity sales of ₹3.9 lakh crore ($57 billion), analysts said. There are over 40 state-run companies with public holding lower than 35%. Wipro, DMart and Hindustan Unilever are some of the large companies that may have to sell shares.

column2: TCS loses ₹30,400 crore in market value after Union Budget
column3: TCS lost nearly ₹30,400 crore in market value after Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman proposed to increase the minimum public shareholding level for listed companies from 25% to 35%. The IT services company currently has a public float of 28%, with Tata Sons holding the rest. If the proposal is implemented, Tata Sons would need to sell shares worth ₹57,000 crore.

column2: Will consider opening up FDI in aviation, media: FM Sitharaman
column3: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government would consider further opening up of foreign direct investment (FDI) in aviation and media including animation, visual effects, gaming, and comics in her Budget speech. She added the government will permit 100% FDI for insurance intermediaries. She also said the government would ease local sourcing norms for single-brand retail sector.

column2: Congress' Finance Minister will bring Budget in an iPad: Chidambaram
column3: Reacting to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman bringing the Budget papers to the Parliament in a red cloth, former Finance Minister P Chidambaram said that Congress' Finance Minister will in future bring the Budget in an iPad. "One of the most opaque speeches we've come across. This is unfair to people of the country," he further said reacting to the Budget.

column2: Government raises foreign aid to Nepal by 40% to ₹1,050 crore
column3: The government has raised the foreign aid to Nepal from ₹750 crore last year to ₹1,050 crore in the 2019-20 Budget, an increase of 40%. For the Maldives, the allocation was raised to ₹576 crore, from ₹440 crores in 2018-2019. The aid to African countries saw an increase from ₹330 crore last year to ₹450 crore this year.

column2: Google apologises 7 months after revealing NZ murder accused's name
column3: Google on Friday apologised for violating New Zealand's name suppression rules in December 2018 after it unintentionally disclosed the name of a 27-year-old man accused of murder. It added it has disabled the Trends feature in New Zealand, which was responsible for the disclosure. The accused has pleaded not guilty to the murder of a 22-year-old British tourist, Grace Millane.

column2: Alipay adds beauty filters to its face recognition payment system
column3: Alibaba's e-wallet affiliate Alipay has added beauty filters to its facial recognition system for payments made using its app. This comes after a recent Chinese news portal Sina Technology's poll revealed that 60% of respondents think next-gen payment systems make them look ugly. "We are going to make you look even prettier than with a beauty camera," Alipay said.

column2: Nageshwar Rao removed as CBI additional chief, made DG Fire Services
column3: CBI additional director Nageshwar Rao, who was twice appointed as acting CBI director, has been removed from his position. Rao has been ordered to join as Director General of Fire Services, Civil Defence and Home Guard. Rao was convicted by Supreme Court in contempt of court case relating to the transfer of supervisory officer in Muzaffarpur shelter home case.

column2: 4 policemen injured in clashes between police and rally in Gujarat
column3: At least four policemen were injured after clashes broke out between the police and people participating in a rally in Surat, Gujarat on Friday. The police reportedly tried to stop the rally as the organisers did not have the necessary permission. According to reports, the crowd started pelting stones after which the police fired tear gas to disperse them.

column2: Mindtree CEO, Chairman, and COO resign days after L&T takeover
column3: Mindtree Co-Founders Rostow Ravanan, Krishnakumar Natarajan and NS Parthasarathy have resigned from the mid-sized IT company following the hostile takeover by engineering major Larsen & Toubro (L&T). The three serve as CEO, Executive Chairman, and Executive Vice Chairman and Chief Operating Officer (COO) respectively. All of them have also asked Mindtree to declassify them as promoters.

column2: Budget long on talk, likely to be short on delivery: Punjab FM
column3: Punjab Finance Minister Manpreet Singh Badal on Friday said the Union Budget 2019-20 is long on talk but likely to be short on delivery. "Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman didn't mention anything about growth deficit...There was no mention of farmers' benefits as well," he added. "There was no mention of water problems...job creation, and job availability," Badal further said.

column2: Italy legend Buffon returns to Juventus 1yr after PSG transfer
column3: Italian veteran Gianluigi Buffon has returned to his former club Juventus a year after having left the club to join French champions PSG. Buffon, who has returned on a one-year contract, had played for the Turin-based side for 17 years. Buffon played for PSG 25 times in all competitions and won the Ligue 1 title.

column2: Kohli, Kane play cricket at Lord's, talk about cricket
column3: Indian cricket team captain Virat Kohli and England's football team captain Harry Kane played cricket at Lord's and talked about cricket and football. The duo joked about how cricket players play football as a warm-up routine ahead of their matches but the footballers never play cricket as a warm-up. "Was fun catching up with you Harry," read Kohli's caption.

column2: Jadeja a lusty batsman, should be tried vs SL: Azharuddin
column3: Speaking about Ravindra Jadeja, former Indian captain Mohammad Azharuddin said, "Jadeja on these (English) wickets... will be a force to reckon with. He is also a good fielder and a lusty batsman. They should try him against Sri Lanka." "You need to have a re-look at the players who are going to play in the semi-finals," Azharuddin added.

column2: BMW, Mercedes to co-develop Level 4 self-driving systems by 2024
column3: German luxury automakers BMW and Mercedes-parent Daimler have entered into a long-term partnership to develop Level 4 self-driving cars systems with a launch planned for 2024. The cars would be able to handle freeway driving chores without human intervention, including driver assist and automated parking systems. BMW said it plans to launch a Level 3 self-driving car in 2021.

column2: PayU buys Singapore e-payments startup, enters Southeast Asia
column3: South Africa's most valuable public firm Naspers' fintech arm PayU has acquired Singapore-based e-payments startup Red Dot Payment, marking its entry into Southeast Asian market. While the financial terms of the acquisition weren't disclosed, the deal valued the eight-year-old startup at $65 million. Notably, PayU has spent over $700 million over the last three years in funding, merger and acquisitions.

column2: Ola gets operator licence in London, may launch services by Sept
column3: Bengaluru-based ride-hailing giant Ola has secured the Private Hire Vehicle (PHV) operator licence to offer its cab services in London. Ola said it plans to start its services in London two months from now, in September. The Bhavish Aggarwal-led unicorn had first expanded to the UK in August 2018 with Cardiff and now operates in five regions covering several cities.

column2: Solar sailing spacecraft LightSail 2 sends 1st signals to Earth
column3: American non-governmental, non-profit foundation The Planetary Society revealed its crowdfunded spacecraft LightSail 2 sent its first signals to Earth on July 2. LightSail 2 CubeSat, about the size of a loaf of bread and weighing 5 kilograms, is powered just by the physical force exerted by solar photons. It was launched on June 25 aboard SpaceX's triple-booster Falcon Heavy rocket.

column2: India's longest electrified railway tunnel commissioned in Andhra
column3: The South Central Railway commissioned India's longest electrified tunnel between Cherlopalli and Rapuru railway stations in Andhra Pradesh. The 6.6 km tunnel has been built in a record 43 months at the cost of ₹460 crore. The tunnel reduced the distance between Krishnapatnam Port and hinterland areas by 60 km and the travel time from 10 hours to 5 hours.

column2: Cousin sisters marry each other in UP's Varanasi: Report
column3: Two cousin sisters married each other in a temple against their family's wishes in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi, as per reports. The girls, who are residents of Rohaniya, reached a Shiva temple on Wednesday and asked the priest to perform their marriage. The priest initially refused but the girls kept sitting inside the temple until he relented.

column2: Pakistan can never do another Kargil: Army chief Bipin Rawat
column3: Indian Army chief General Bipin Rawat on Friday said Pakistan won't 'dare' attempt to infiltrate India like it did Kargil in 1999 because it has 'seen the consequences'. "There is no such area that we have left unguarded," he asserted. Rawat said this during an event to celebrate 20 years of Operation Vijay, India's limited war against Pakistan in Kargil.

column2: Telangana boy stabbed to death by family friend over dispute
column3: A teenage boy was allegedly stabbed to death by a family friend over a dispute between the families in the early hours of Friday in Telangana, said police. Police said that their families were very close but had recently grown apart over some issue. After the victim's death, his father lodged a complaint with the police.

column2: S*it happens: Philippine Senator as 3-yr-old killed in drug raid
column3: Ronald dela Rosa, a Philippine Senator who once led the country's war on drugs, has dismissed the killing of a three-year-old girl in a drugs raid, saying "s*it happens" during operations. Police said that the girl was used as a human shield by her father, a suspected drug dealer who opened fire on them when they tried to arrest him.

column2: What are the effective income tax rates for the rich after Budget?
column3: The government introduced 25% surcharge for those with a taxable income of ₹2-5 crore and 37% surcharge on taxable income exceeding ₹5 crore. Currently, the government imposes 10% surcharge where total income is between ₹50 lakh and ₹1 crore, and 15% on income above ₹1 crore. Individuals with income over ₹10 lakh fall under the highest tax slab of 30%.

column2: Felt only Tiger had the power to stand in front of me, jokes Hrithik
column3: Speaking about his upcoming film with Tiger Shroff, Hrithik Roshan jokingly said, "I felt only Tiger had the power to stand in front of me and make me look like a piece of sh*t." "I needed a force that would drive me to be my best. I was getting too complacent," he added. They'll be seen together in an action-drama.

column2: FM delivered over 2-hour-long Budget speech, didn't pause for water
column3: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman delivered her maiden Union Budget speech on Friday that lasted for over two hours and she did not pause to have a sip of water. It was one of the longest Budget speeches and included couplets in Urdu, Hindi and Tamil. Speaker Om Birla lauded Sitharaman after her presentation of the Budget.

column2: Govt raises disinvestment target to ₹1,05,000 crore in 2019-20
column3: The government has set the disinvestment target at ₹1,05,000 crore for 2019-20, higher than the ₹90,000-crore target set during the interim Budget. In 2018-19, the government had set a disinvestment target of ₹80,000 crore. However, it exceeded that for the second straight year, with disinvestment receipts touching ₹85,000 crore by March-end.

column2: Budget presented with 10-year vision in mind: FM Sitharaman
column3: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Friday said the 2019 Union Budget was presented with a 10-year vision in mind. She also said startups were given a whole set of tax benefits in the Budget. PM Narendra Modi said that the 2019 Budget was for a New India and it has a roadmap to transform the agriculture sector of the country.

column2: Congress' Finance Minister will bring Budget in an iPad: Chidambaram
column3: Reacting to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman bringing the Budget papers to the Parliament in a red cloth, former Finance Minister P Chidambaram said that Congress' Finance Minister will in future bring the Budget in an iPad. "One of the most opaque speeches we've come across. This is unfair to people of the country," he further said reacting to the Budget.

column2: Ashwin jokingly suggests Pak to mankad all Bangladeshi batsmen
column3: Off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has jokingly suggested Pakistan should mankad all Bangladesh batsmen to qualify for 2019 World Cup semi-finals. Responding to a fan who said that even mankading wouldn't help Pakistan, Ashwin wrote, "Yes...make about 350 and 10 run-outs at the bowlers end." Pakistan need to win against Bangladesh by over 308 runs to advance.

column2: What are the key income tax changes announced in Budget?
column3: The government announced additional income tax deduction of ₹1.5 lakh on interest paid on home loans taken for affordable housing. It also announced ₹1.5 lakh income tax deduction on interest paid on loans for the purchase of electric vehicles. Finance Minister also proposed to levy TDS of 2% on cash withdrawal exceeding ₹1 crore a year from a bank account.

column2: It's a manifesto rather than a Budget: Congress' Ahmed Patel
column3: Congress leader Ahmed Patel, while reacting to the Union Budget presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Friday, tweeted, "It was manifesto rather than a Union Budget." He also wrote, "Rs 70,000 cr to bail out bank defaulters but Zero assistance and Zero recognition for farmers." Sitharaman announced the government will infuse ₹70,000 crore capital into public sector banks.

column2: Akhtar becomes father for 2nd time, asks fans to suggest son's name
column3: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar and wife Rubab Khan became parents for the second time after the birth of their second son. Akhtar asked his fans to suggest names and added it should start with 'M'. He further said he isn't making his son's pictures public as he doesn't want him to be in limelight like Saif Ali Khan's son Taimur.

column2: Amazon admits it saves Alexa data even if audio deleted by users
column3: Amazon, in a letter to a US Democrat, has admitted that it saves some user conversations with its digital assistant Alexa even if the users remove the audio, CNET revealed. Amazon said it may retain records of customers' Alexa interactions, including actions Alexa took in response to customers' request. It added Alexa skills' developers may also retain the same.

column2: Court frames charges against Kejriwal for dharna outside Rail Bhavan
column3: A Delhi court framed charges against CM Arvind Kejriwal, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and AAP leaders Rakhi Birla and Somnath Bharti over a 2014 dharna outside Rail Bhavan demanding action against police officials for refusing a raid. They allegedly violated prohibitory orders in the national capital and obstructed public servants during the agitation. The court discharged Ashutosh and Sanjay Singh.

column2: Shiv Sena corporator assaults chicken traders over parking issue
column3: Former Mayor and current Shiv Sena corporator Milind Vaidya allegedly assaulted chicken traders near Machhimar colony in Mumbai on Friday for parking their vehicles near the Mahim railway station area. "I have been raising this parking issue with Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation for last two years but no action has been taken. So I had to take this action," said Vaidya.

column2: Pics of missing suicide note recovered from Mumbai doctor's phone
column3: The pictures of the suicide note left behind by Dr Payal Tadvi, who killed herself allegedly due to caste discrimination she faced at her hospital, have been recovered from her mobile phone. In the note, Tadvi named three doctors who used casteist slurs against her. The note also included the slurs they used to isolate her at work.

column2: SC convicts all acquitted earlier in ex-Guj Home Minister's murder
column3: The Supreme Court on Friday restored conviction and sentence imposed by a trial court on all the 12 accused in the 2003 murder of former Gujarat Home Minister Haren Pandya. Their sentences range from five years to life imprisonment. Gujarat High Court had acquitted the 12 accused of murder charges in 2011 and slammed the CBI for a "botched-up" probe.

column2: Coal billionaire Cline dies in helicopter crash a day before b'day
column3: American coal billionaire Christopher Cline died in a helicopter crash in the Bahamas on Thursday, a day before his 61st birthday, West Virginia Governor Jim Justice said. Six other people, including Cline's daughter, were also killed in the crash, according to his lawyer. Cline began his career in the coal industry in 1980 and founded the Cline Group in 1990.

column2: Ex-Barclays banker jailed in S'pore for cheating clients of ₹68 cr
column3: Kale Jagdish Purushottam, an Indian-origin banker has been jailed for 13 years in Singapore for cheating his clients at Barclays Bank of over ₹68 crore. Purushottam had forged signatures of his Barclays clients to pay back his former clients at UBS Singapore. He pleaded guilty to 20 forgery and cheating-related charges, and another 30 charges under the Computer Misuse Act.

column2: Budget perfectly fits PM's vision of New India: Piyush Goyal
column3: After Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented the Union Budget on Friday, Railway Minister Piyush Goyal said, "The budget perfectly encapsulates PM Narendra Modi's vision of New India." "The Finance Minister has been very benign to the Railways," he added. "She has laid out a vision of investment of nearly ₹50 lakh crore over the next 10 years," Goyal further said.

column2: This budget represents all sections of society: JP Nadda
column3: BJP Working President JP Nadda on Friday congratulated Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on the Union Budget and said this budget is dedicated to all the sections of the society. "This budget is dedicated to the poor people, to the Dalits, to the farmers, to the youth and women of the country," he added. This was Nirmala Sitharaman's maiden budget.

column2: Budget 2019 is path-breaking, comprehensive: NITI Aayog CEO
column3: After the Union Budget was presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Friday, NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant called it path-breaking and comprehensive. "We are particularly delighted as the Finance Minister has acknowledged the role of NITI Aayog. But more important is the road map that she has set for laying down a vision for $5 trillion economy," Kant said.

column2: This budget serves larger interest of all sectors: Arun Jaitley
column3: Former Finance Minister Arun Jaitley on Friday congratulated PM Narendra Modi and Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman for the Union Budget. "The budget, besides being a policy document for boosting growth, serves the larger interest of all sectors of the Economy," Jaitley wrote. PM Modi also lauded Sitharaman and said the budget 'will boost India's development in the 21st Century'.

column2: Not worried about South Africa team's future: Imran Tahir
column3: Spinner Imran Tahir, who is set to end his ODI career after the World Cup 2019, said he is not worried about South Africa's future. Tahir said that there are a lot of youngsters and that he strongly believes there is a lot of talent but they just need experience. "I'm pretty sure things will be fine," Tahir added.

column2: Manchester City sign Spain's Rodri for club record fee
column3: English Premier League champions Manchester City on Thursday announced the signing of Spanish international midfielder Rodri on a five-year deal from Atletico Madrid for a club record fee. It has been revealed that City had triggered Rodri's almost £63 million release clause. Rodri's fee eclipses the reported £60 million City paid Leicester for Riyad Mahrez last year.

column2: MS Dhoni's thumb injury not serious, is fit for SL clash
column3: The Indian team management has revealed that wicket-keeper MS Dhoni's thumb injury is not serious and that he is fit to play in India's match against Sri Lanka at the World Cup 2019 on Saturday. Dhoni suffered an injury while keeping wickets and then later it was reported that he had batted against England in pain.

column2: 3 doctors arrested for death of 24-year-old man in Thane
column3: Police on Thursday arrested three doctors in Maharashtra's Thane over the death of a 24-year-old man in April. While one was arrested for taking the wrong line of treatment, the other two were arrested for issuing fake additional degree certificates to him, said police. The victim was treated at the accused's clinic for over an hour before his condition worsened.

column2: Russia scrambles fighter jet to intercept US surveillance plane
column3: Russia sent a Sukhoi Su-27 fighter aircraft to intercept a US P-8A Poseidon reconnaissance plane as it was heading towards Russian airspace over the Black Sea, Russia's Defence Ministry said on Friday. The Russian flight was carried out in line with international rules and the jet returned to its home base after completing the mission, the ministry added.

column2: What becomes costlier after Union Budget 2019?
column3: Petrol and diesel prices have been increased by ₹2/litre under the Union Budget 2019. Customs duty on gold and other precious metals has been hiked from 10% to 12.5%. Customs duty on CCTV cameras, split ACs, loudspeakers, cashew kernels, ceramic roofing tiles and stainless steel products has also been hiked. Excise duty on tobacco and cigarettes has been increased.

column2: Fire at DGHS office in Delhi's Karkardooma, 22 fire tenders at spot
column3: A fire broke out at the Directorate General of Health Services (DGHS) office, Karkardooma in Delhi on Friday. A total of 22 fire tenders were rushed to the spot. "More than 60 fire personnel have been deployed in the fire fighting operation. No casualty has been reported," Chief Fire Officer Atul Garg said.

column2: This budget will achieve the expectations of 21st century India: PM
column3: After Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented her maiden budget, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that it will help achieve the expectations of 21st century India. "The middle class will progress with this budget, development work will expedite even more. The tax structure will simplify and infrastructure will modernise," he added.

column2: Life convict in Rajiv Gandhi assassination case gets 1 month parole
column3: The Madras High Court on Friday granted one month parole to Nalini Sriharan, one of the seven life convicts in former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case. Nalini had requested for parole to make arrangements for her daughter's marriage. Her daughter, who was born in jail, has completed her higher studies and lives with her grandparents in the UK.
